name: Show Business: Head Hunter
description:
Head Hunter is a set of four Head Hunter expansion cards for the base game Show Business. The cards should be shuffled into the original deck and played together.

Head Hunter cards apply all original rules from the basic game. As a special skill Head Hunter can be played as one of 10 other professions like Groupie, DJ, Trend Expert etc. Simply, it is a sort of a joker.

Head Hunter cannot perform the action "Trend". It cannot manipulate any of 4 trend dice.

Head Hunter expansion is free and will be available on publisher stand during Essen fair 2011.

---

Edit: The Head Hunter card turned out to be a misprint that was done in the wrong size, so it couldn't be shuffled into the deck. There never was a correct version of this expansion at all.
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: 9 Kingdoms
description:
9 Kingdoms is a miniatures adventure game that combines elements of roleplaying and wargaming. It provides a unique interpretation of the common fantasy races and monsters for game play. The game can be scaled from a small handful of figures up to several dozen. Players can customize their own figures, individualizing them with skills and building them up with experience both within a single game and from game to game. The rulebook provides a variety of scenarios, including everything from straight up battles to dungeon crawls to an assault on a wizard's stronghold.

Unlike other miniatures games, a figure is not killed with 1 or 2 wounds. Each figure is given a specific set of points sources that represent both its health and effectiveness. As a figure is wounded, it becomes less effective throughout the course of the game. The combat system is simultaneous and figures make opposed rolls for both offense and defense to determine combat results.

In addition to the point sources, figures can be "trained" in different skills including weapons, armor, magic, and many other types of special abilities. Figures with different skills can be combined in an endless variety of ways to create effective combat and adventuring squads. Each of the 10 major species in the 9 Kingdoms has its own special racial abilities which makes the different teams original and dynamic.

All scenarios also incorporate an element of exploration in the form of encounter tokens on the board. These tokens can be flipped during the game to uncover treasures, traps, powerful artifacts and even wandering monsters. This adds an element of risk and unpredictability to the game as an encounter could turn out to be either be dangerous or profitable.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Starturn
description:
Card game with two packs of cards, a red pack and a black pack.
The black pack is shuffled and both players are dealt half of them. This deck must stay face-down and is called your Store. Now the red cards are shuffled and placed face down in the centre of the table after each player has been dealt five cards.
The object is to complete a set of 15 cards by playing cards in order from 1 upwards. The top black card from your Store is revealed and should be used as the next number required. Just collecting a set is not the main objective, but using all your Store cards wins the game.
Essentially for two player, but there are rules for three players and a 4 player game with two partnerships.

name: Take Cover!! The Tactical Approach to WWII
description:
Company to Divisional level wargame rules for use with 20mm miniature figures. Each soldier represents approximately 10 men. Vehicles and support weapons represent 3 real-life equivalents. The aim of the game is to recreate World War 2 battles. A players wins when one side is forced to retire from the battlefield, caused by morale checks and losses. It uses a set of mechanisms to create a fast-play set that reflects the realistic experience of a WW2 soldier. All the equipment available to the soldier in WW2 is included, such as support weapons, vehicles, artillery and aircraft. The rules reward players that use the equipment tactically rather than the simple "see the enemy and charge".

The game lasts up to 15 turns. Each turn has a number of phases - move, spot, aircraft, fire, morale and orders. The winner of the initiative for each turn determines which side goes first in each phase. A single 6-sided die is used for almost all mechanisms. Vehicles, if hit, require a further roll to determine damage. Morale is checked once a unit has received a number of casualties which varies with nationality. Once a number of base units has received adverse morale checks, the overall morale of the army is checked each turn until one side eventually pulls backs or routs..

name: Joyas
description: Joyas is a game of elections, a game of a jewels market. In this game, every player have 4 stocks of jewels, and try to sell of their stock. The election of the type of stone is made is secret, and only the players who elect the same type will can sell. The game have ten rounds.

name: Advanced Fighter Combat
description:
A supplement to the Basic Fighter Combat rules, Advanced Fighter Combat gives gamers nine more fighters and fifteen additional performance logs as well as more bombers, greater realism, math elimination tables and a campaign game system. The equipment in this set can be used with the basic game by players who prefer simple games, or the basic game equipment can be used with these rules for more realism and challenge. Ideal for use with 1/133 and 1/72 scale models.

Ownership of the Basic Fighter Combat Rules is required to play the game.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Set-up

name: Gulp
description:
Take on the role of a village in an ancient River Boggle civilization, a people who grew food in their mouth while standing in water for months on end!

Compete with other villages as you harvest and store crops for winter, but avoid being seen by your gods as too greedy!

The center of your world is a five-card, poker-like river. There are simple tools at your disposal, but as Boggles had no need to develop complicated industrial agriculture, those tools are limited to what can be done with the people of your village--like redirecting the River by linking together to form a Boggle blockade, or changing the contents of the River by having a bunch of Boggles slurp it up while another group spit in new elements.

Water crops. Yum!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Adventure, Card Game, Farming, Humor
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Hand Management, Pattern Recognition, Simulation, Stock Holding, Storytelling, Trick-taking

name: The Gruffalo's Child: The Big Bad Mouse Board Game
description:
From the publisher:

The Gruffalo's Child is feeling brave so she tiptoes out of the gruffalo cave...Race around the board with the Gruffalo's child using colour recognition and counting. This Big Bad Mouse board game is based on the popular book series The Gruffalo's Child. Discover what happens when the Gruffalo's Child visits Snake, Owl, Fox and Mouse. The idea of the game is to make it back to the safety of the gruffalo cave, but beware, there is a Big Bad Mouse lurking in these woods who enjoys nothing more than a slice of Gruffalo pie! Spin the spinner and turn over the top card from the centre of the board that matches the colour on the spinner. If the card selected has footprints on it, move your Gruffalo's Child playing piece forward. The card may have 1, 2 or 3 footprints. This game has strong educational components and helps children learn through social interaction as well as taking turns and co-operation, all whilst having great fun.

name: Uncensored, The Party Game of Shouting Obscenities
description:
"I've compiled the most obscene words and embellished each one with politically correct artwork for your own enjoyment. In this game each player is stamped with one of these improper words which would be totally inappropriate in almost any other situation, however I've created a game that generates an environment that turns vulgarity into a socially acceptable fun time. Win by cussing out your friends and family. The game has three intensifying rounds of play so hilarious you'll swear you never had so much fun."

"Everyone draws a card from the obscene word deck. After everyone has shares their new lable, players take turns flipping their cards in front of them. When the card onto of your pile matches someone elses , shout their lable before they shout yours. The loser collects both piles of cards. The first one to get of their cards is the winner. "

Game description on kickstarter page.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Memory, Move Through Deck, Speed Matching

name: DÃ¼-KO
description:
From the Kickstarter entry.

The World's 1st Multiplayer Sudoku Game

"Dü-KO is like Sudoku, but only funner! Many efforts have been made to turn Sudoku into a board game, but the integrity of the puzzle always ended up being compromised. It was always a pain to setup and the truth be told not a real fun board game - with no real advantage for you the player.

So here comes Du-KO taking the concept of Sudoku to a whole new level, allowing for multi-players but still respecting the integrity of the solitaire player too. From 1- 9 players of all ages from 8 to 88 can easily and happily play Du-KO for a guaranteed good time.

The object of the game is to finish your section of the Sudoku grid first before your opponent(s). Each player takes their turn placing a peg in an open space within their designated portion of the puzzle. You'll go from clueless to competent your first game, and by your second game you'll have advanced from competent to competitive. Here's where it gets cut-throat and smokin' hot! You've been warned.

The amazing part about Du-KO is that it is self-checking! When you play, the game will tell you instantly that whether you’re wrong or right. If the peg is correct it will set all the way down, if incorrect it will remain slightly elevated and then must be removed and replayed on your next turn."

name: Pussy
description: Action game. The cat board has two holes, one worth 2 points, the other 4 points. Players take turns in trying to throw a ball into the cat's mouth. If you are successful, you score the points depending on which hole the ball comes out from. The one who scores the most points, wins.

name: Word Scramble
description:
Word Scramble bills itself as a "phonological awareness and word-building game". Tiles are used to make words in the middle of playing board.

Based on the squares on which their pawns land, players either blindly draw a tile, move a tile already on the board or read all the words on the board. Five board spaces direct the player to draw a tile give them the choice between the word beginning or ending piles. Nineteen spaces specify from which pile the player should draw. Those spaces also direct the player to define the word played, rhyme it, use it in a sentence or use it in a question. Four spaces direct the player to read all the words already on the board, awarding four points for doing so. Landing on one of the four corners allows the player to move a tile already on the board.

Tiles drawn or moved are placed on one of 61 spaces in the middle of the board which have either word beginnings or endings. Harder-to-match tiles or spaces are worth more points than easy ones. Points values range from one to six. Play ends after one player reaches a predetermined number of points.

name: The Pioneer Card Game
description: In the mid-nineteenth century, the players lead their families into a new world, using a hand of cards to explore, develop, moderate the climate, and conduct other activities. In The Pioneer Card Game: Chapter resources, each player receives his own hand of cards, places them all in an order that he speculates will lead to good results, then executes these cards sequentially. Compete with opponents for resources and incentives, and lead your family to a new world...
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement

name: Moustaches
description:
The Gentleman's Game of Facial Hair-Raising Thrills!

Grow and maintain the facial furniture of you most fertile fantasies! However, be sure to prevent your most gentlemanly of growths from evolving into an ungainly beard!

Be the first to score a 'Gentleman's Dozen' and win the most riviting card game of the era!

Accumilate the desired number of points by strategically laying 'Moustache' cards (each with their own, justified, density ratings) whilst blocking your opponent's moves with 'Beard' cards.

Take full control of the playing field by harnessing the use of 'Grooming' cards such as the 'Wet Shave' and 'Open Flame'.

A quick fire, point accumilation game with its tongue set firmly in the the cheeks of the 19th century!
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Pocket Quiz: Wien
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The questions are all about the Austrian city of Vienna.

name: Lucky Lead
description:
In a future where casinos run the US government, people flock to casinos nightly, betting their lives for the big jackpot. The most played game on the floor: Lucky Lead.

Played a bit like Blackjack (but with mechanics somewhat reminiscent of Russian Roulette), Lucky Lead involves 2-3 players and a dealer*. At each hand, the dealer chooses six Chamber Cards; each one is either Loaded or Unloaded. At each player's turn, the player is dealt one Chamber Card. Before he plays it, he has to choose whether he's going to play it against himself, another player or the dealer. Each action has a different consequence. It's a game of strategy and, most importantly, luck.

Do you have enough skill to hang onto all of your Life Cards, or will Lady Luck cash you out...eternally?


Dealer is recommended, not required; the game can be played with only two players. Review the rules for details.

name: Totality
description:
Description of the game. Totality is a unique board game that combines the features of a card game with the mechanisms of a board game; it plays in the current era and simulates the total range of the human condition. The heart of the game is the deck of 64 unique and intriguing cards. There are 4 suits of 16 cards. These suits represent the 4 planes of existence - physical, biological, cognitive, and social. Each plane (suit) has 4 unique elements and a color. Each card in the suit is composed of a combination of those four elements. Cards have a number of elements from zero to four. The mix of elements is shown on each card. Each card has a game action line. The game area (world) consists of a 4X4 array of cards laid face up and a space in front of each player to keep sets and action cards. Players move through the world to gather cards. Each player is represented by a marker or token.

Object of the game: to build the character with the most experience by gathering sets of cards while moving around the board (world).

Setup. 1) Shuffle the deck; 2) Deal one card to each player. The player with the highest card number goes first. Players keep this card as part of their hand; 3) Then deal the 4X4 world face down. Before play begins, each player, starting with the first, places his token in the world on a different location. After the tokens are played, the location cards are turned face up; 4) Deal 2 more cards to each player for a total of 3. The rest of the deck is placed face down as the draw deck (DD); place it so that the longer side of the cards is next to the world; 5) A discard (recycle) heap (DH) will be created during play; place it so that the shorter side of the cards is next to the world. Cards are discarded face down.

Play. Each turn consists of just one of the following actions unless there are effects in play that allow more: 1) Activate or remove a special effect. The game line of most cards can create effects that change the play. 2) Move. Movement is in a vertical or horizontal direction only (like a rook in chess). At the beginning of the game, players can move one location per turn. 3) Gather a card from the world. Players may gather the card under their token. 4) Build or dismantle a set. This is the heart of the game. A player grows by playing sets in his character area. Sets consist of one or more cards that satisfy specific criteria from set theory. 5. Combat. Combat may occur when a player (attacker) tries to move to or through a site occupied by other players (defenders), or attacks players at his current location. Combat involves betting; outcomes are governed by a simple table. 6) Open a trading session. Any player may open a trading session his turn. Anything may be traded: token locations, sets, cards, seats, drinks. There are two ways to end the game. A player may end the game when he has sets with all 16 elements of the deck present. Otherwise, the game ends instantly when the draw deck is depleted for the first time.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Civilization, Memory
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection, Simulation

name: Knights & Glory
description:
Nobles from across the land have been called to compete in grand tournaments as the King is looking for a new champion of the realm. This champion will be determined by the Noble who gains the most glory in these grand tournaments.

Knights from across the realm gather to serve these nobles and gain the rewards of riches and glory in their service.

Can you take on the role of one of these Nobles and use the knights that decide to serve you in order to gain the glory needed to be champion of the realm?

The challenge is to collect Knights from the 6 different Event Types included in the game to create a team that will compete against the other Nobles team of knights for glory in the different tournament seasons. Knights cost money and the Nobles only collect a certain amount each tournament season to pay for their knights. The Tournaments are played by Nobles secretly deciding in which order their knights will compete and then by simply turning their cards face down in their hand to create a small deck they begin drawing their cards one at a time off the top of these decks to play against another Noble's knights in individual competition. Points are scored for the Noble with the highest value knight played (six cards will be played against one another in this way) - and 1 glory is gained by the Noble with the most points at the end of that competition.

A Tournament is made up of each Noble in the game plying each other once in a competition like the one described above.

Once the tournament season is over players have to return some knights to their season decks / hire other knights / collect gold / and try to gain more glory in the next Tournament.

The Game ends when one Noble gains enough glory to win the Kings favor, and become champion of the realm.

name: Colonial Wars
description:
Sci-fi miniature wargame set in a cruent XII century universe. Players engage in battles on planet surfaces commanding armies belonging to several warring parties, such as Terrax (humans), Torek and Sarmath.

The game is designed for quick matches which usually does not exceed one hour in duration. Battle resolutions are calculated using just 6-sided dice. Victory is achieved by fulfilling randomly-selected objectives which are defined at the start of the game (one main objective and several secondary ones). During a game players alternate in activating one unit each until all of them have moved and a game turn is completed. Each unit can execute up to 2 orders with an activation, while elite units can execute up to three actions with a single activation.

Colonial Wars is played using 20 mm custom miniatures (unpainted), available in thematic blisters.

name: Pendulum Curve Bowl
description:
The Pendulum Curve Bowl game from Aurora is very, very large in the spirit of Aurora's more famous Skittle games.

Each player uses a cue to shoot a ball at the skittles at the other end of the long board. The board is curved so that you have to allow for the camber to make a successful shot.

Score is kept in exactly the same form as Ten Pin Bowling.

Like the Skittle games, this toy was hawked by a comedian, not Don Adams but Buddy Hackett.

name: Spanish Gold
description:
Contents
1 Three - Dimensional Playing Field.
2 Galleon's.
4 Blue Buccaneer's.
4 Red Pirates.
4 Gold Bars.
Palm Trees.
2 Dice.
1 Dice Shaker.
Rules Are Printed on Inner Box Lid.

Players are either Buccaneers or Pirates

Gold Bars are placed at the summit on the island and crews Start/Finish at their respective galleons. The routes have hazards such as 'Drop Your Gold' and these must be obeyed. These are marked on the board and full instructions for their use are inside the game lid.

The object is to get each crew member to the summit, pick up a Gold Bar and race back to the Galleons.

name: CastleControl
description:
Players take turns rolling to move around the board where they can buy properties, gain permanent upgrades, defeat monsters and avoid traps, and duel each other for dominance.

Monsters and Traps are on High and Low Level Dungeon cards which players can choose from when they land on a Dungeon tile. After a successful roll (and associated modifiers), you can win gold pieces. Unsuccessful rolls reduce your hit points.

Properties can be purchased and upgraded with housing, affecting the amount of rent opponents must pay when they land on your property. If you collect enough properties of certain types, you can gain control of the castle in that territory. The right to own properties can also be dueled over by rolling against each other using various modifiers.

To win the game, you must be the first player to complete two objectives: gain control of a castle and defeat the dragon.

The game strives to make the 'opoly style genre more fun and engaging. RPG elements, easy to learn mechanics and fast paced gameplay make it simply superior to it's predecessors. It was updated in 2023 for a smoother gameplay experience, and streamlined to be playable in 90 minutes.

The game can found as print-on-demand on The Game Crafter.
https://www.thegamecrafter.com/games/castlecontrol

It is also available for playtesting using TableTop Simulator on the Steam Workshop.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Graey
description:
An abstract strategy game for 2 players that adds a twist to the classic black vs. white setup: grey pieces that belong equally to both players.

The game mechanism revolves around enclosure (either partial or full) of other, single pieces on a square grid board. Surrounded pieces can be either removed from play, replaced with upgraded pieces, or can cause extra turns or even a win, depending on the degree of enclosure (i.e. being surrounded by either 6, 7, or 8 pieces belonging to the player) and also the color of central piece being enclosed.

A turn consists of a player either placing or moving a piece, and then acting out consequences if their move results in one or more enclosure situations. In standard game play, the color of the piece to be played (either the player's own color or grey) is decided by the flip of a fair coin, but the game can also be played without that element of chance by simply alternating between the two.

The game ends either when a player causes a piece to be entirely enclosed with pieces belonging to them filling all 8 surrounding squares (in which case they are the winner), or in the event that no open spaces remain on the board (in which case the player with the most pieces of their specific color is the winner.)

The game is both fun for beginners and yet dynamic enough to also engage experienced strategists.
mechanics: Enclosure, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Matrix Runners
description:
Players take the role of MATRIX RUNNERS (2-4 players) characters with unique advantages, disadvantages & specialty RIGS which they use to hack into the Cybernet.

Players take missions, complete them, hack into systems, enter battle arenas, invest in upgrading, or purchasing programs, and taking on more & more difficult challenges, all the while dodging traces, system guardians, & other players who may be trying to collect a bounty on them.

It's always risky engaging with other players in the net.
this provides them with the ability to trade or sell each other programs, or reveal information (for a price). But you never know if the mission they're on is to catch you & destroy you.
if you get caught, you can get fined, you programs can become corrupted, or you could face a serious virus is infecting your rig, or worse, eliminated!
It is a game of covert operations, espionage, and power. The more you earn the better the hardware & software you can buy, and become better equipped to move on to bigger and better things, but you never know who could be after you & who can be your ally.

The Year is 2055
The world is run by 3 major corporations,

GLOBE-E-TRON, E-Vision, and NOVA CORPS.
Sovereignty of Countries, and Governments have become obsolete.
The once known Internet has evolved into a vast Virtual Cybernet, where millions of people live out their
fantasy in virtual entertainment. The WORLD has become solely dependent on this Cybernet.
Corporations that virtually govern the world have reputation to uphold,
so they hire MATRIX RUNNERS to do their dirty work.
Sometimes these RUNS, include:
Hacking Important information on a new product,
Retrieve info on corporate activity,
Eliminate the competition by destroying their system.
Other jobs include hunting down other hackers as well,
Because of this vast underground employment market, a secret organization has developed an agency to facilitate
these jobs, keeping both the employer, and runner safe and anonymous.
This AGENCY also provides illegal programs to registered RUNNERS & provides them with jobs.
They are simply referred to as THE AGENCY.
It is a dangerous world of Intrigue, Deception, Skill, and Subterfuge. Noone is truly safe, and anyone can be traced and Eliminated. Tread carefully, young Runner...
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: The Game of International Rummy
description:
Not Rummy at all. This game owes more to the British game of Newmarket than it does to Rummy.

The board is interesting, as it opens out to form a cross shape and folds back after play so that it fits into the box.

Players get chips to bet with. They are betting on which card they will play last when they use up all the cards in their hand. The first to do so wins the hand and wins chips from other players, one for each card still in their hands

name: Kuskalla
description:
"UNITED" is the goal, a pure strategy game for 2 or 3 people.

It is a game that opens the mind, as they play the games is achieved more quickly display the wide variety of possible moves for each piece.

In a hexagonal board, further divided into "rings", each chip has the potential to move in 14 different ways.

Try to connect the pieces themselves go while seeking to block and separate the adversaries.

It comes in three exciting game modes.

"UNIDOS" es el objetivo, un juego de pura estrategia para 2 o 3 personas.

Es un juego que abre la mente, a medida que se juegan las partidas se logra visualizar más rápidamente la amplia variedad de posibilidades de movimientos para cada pieza.

En un tablero exagonal, dividido además en "anillos", cada una de las fichas tiene el potencial de moverse en 14 sentidos diversos.

Hay que tratar de ir conectando las piezas propias mientras se busca bloquear y separar las adversarias.

Se presenta con tres interesantes modalidades de juego.

name: FREE-O Card Game
description:
Play Hide-and-Seek on your living room table!

This card game is based on an old-fashioned game called "Free the Box" that was played outside by friends many years ago. It's a table-top version of Hide-and-Seek with a twist, where you play cards to try and capture your opponents or those childhood friends you just could never find! They have to match the same card or play a "Capture" card or a "Wild" card to avoid being found or captured. Each game has several rounds or hands and when one player finishes theirs all other players add points for any left-over cards. The game ends when one player reaches 60 points but the lowest score wins the game.
This card game is quick to setup, learn and play and has a few hidden surprises waiting for you around the corner!

name: Casino Vegas
description: A roll and move styled game, where the object is to accumulate the most money by playing Black Jack, Poker, Roulette, Craps and slot machines. You play each casino styled game for one round when you land on the gambling spot for it. Player's play against the "house" with another player performing the house position for the turn. The other players may perform side bets on the outcome while the gambling game progresses. The rules for each gambling game are abbreviated somewhat, but there is an entire Roulette layout with a spinner for the wheel along with the other layouts on the board. One space is a bank space where more money may be obtained.

name: Red State/ Blue State
description: Red State/ Blue State is a new family board game that has political overtones. The goal is to win 270 electoral votes before your opponent so that you can send your candidate to the White House. You do this by answering question about all things concerning the United States. The game board features a map of the United States with the American flag superimposed over it and shows the states' boundaries. Let's say that you grabbed a Georgia card. You would place your token, either Daniel David Donkey- Democrat, or Edward Elephant-Republican, on Georgia and answer the question. If you are correct, you win the electoral votes for Georgia. Then, you would place a Georgia-shaped piece that is either red(Republican) or blue(Democrat) on Georgia to show that you won Georgia's electoral votes. Your opponent would take a turn and you continue this until one of you reaches 270 electoral votes. The questions range from American history to pop culture. It's a fast-paced American trivia game.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: KolimaÃ§on
description:
Players place the cards on the game board following the spiral from inside to outside provided that the background color of the card matches with color on the board, and the illustration is not already horizontally or vertically on the same row.

Player who has the fewer cards in hand at the end of the game, when the deck is exhausted is the winner.

name: Heist: The Solitaire Card Game
description:
Heist is a solitaire card game in which the player uses his/her con artist to infiltrate companies, houses, banks, etc to complete the given missions.

Players must combine the skills of con men wisely and should be ready for the great heist (last mission of the game)

There are 4 types of cards in the game.

Event Cards: These cards have random events on them and they also have a map piece illustration, which represent the game board. Players draw event cards to create the rooms explained in the plan cards and they also try to resolve the events.

Plan Cards: These are cards with missions on them. Players need to complete at least 3 missions to run the great heist. Every mission needs some skills to be completed.

Con Cards: These are character cards with different skills. Players combine them to complete missions.

Item Cards: These are cards representing various items, helping players to complete missions.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Exploration, Print & Play, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Puss In Boots
description:
The game consists of 31 cards. There are 15 "duets" of 2 cards each and a lucky puss in boots cards. Each side of the duet has pictures and words that go with the other half, and each duet is numbered.

All cards are dealt out. On your turn, you pull a card from the hand of the player on your left. After this, if you have a completed duet of 2 cards, you can lay down one duet per turn. Play continues counterclockwise.

The game ends when all duets are played and the winner is the person who holds the lucky puss in boots card. The winner gathers the duets in numerical order, then reads the fairytale segments on the duets as they receive them.

name: Walking the Dragon
description:
From the rules:

Players each start the game with a "child" card placed face up in his or her own play area.

On a player's turn, he or she draws one card from the face-down draw pile. If the card is a dragon's tail, the player may place it next to the child card; if not, the card is discarded. Once a tail card has been placed, future draws of a dragon's body or dragon's head are allowed to be (and must be) played next to the tile, whereas future draws of a tail are then discarded. Drawing a dragon's head completes a dragon.

After completing a dragon, the player, on his or her next turn, make take another child card, if any remain, and begin anew the process of attempting to create the longest dragon.

If the draw pile is exhausted, the discard pile is shuffled to form a new draw pile.

The game ends when sufficient cards have been drawn and placed such that no further legal plays can be made. The winner is the player who created the longest dragon.

name: Bankir
description: In this Swedish trivia game players take turns being the "Bankir". The "bankir" is selling question cards to the other players with three headlines. Then the "bankir" is drawing a letter and every player has two minutes to fins out a words that match the headlines on their card. If you finish your cards you can buy more from the bankir. If you answer correclty you get money from the bank and the one with the most money in the end wins.

name: Le Rouge et le Noir
description:
The game includes 5000 questions on French/foreign literature and the French language. It plays like 'snake and ladders', without shortcuts, though.

The board consists of several squares with different topics like: works, authors, expression, citations, parenthesis etc.
Also some special square like:

Bomb Box: Opponents choose the theme. If the player answers correctly, he continues, otherwise it returns to the starting point.
Boom Box: The player chooses the theme. If he answers correctly, he continues, otherwise it returns to the starting point.
Box blank page: Player advances with as many questions indicated on card if he answered said questions correctly.


The winner is the first to be arriving on the "Red and Black" final square and who has also responded right to three questions from a single trivia card.

name: Versability
description:
Versability 'the poetry game' is a parlour game inspired by the Dictionary Game, where players complete a verse of poetry with missing line(s). The players' attempts and the genuine version are read aloud and then the players vote on which is the genuine verse.

Rather than using cards, pieces and a board, Versability is published as a book. Players need to provide paper and writing implements. Randomness is achieved by closing one's eyes and pointing at a page of options.
categories: Bluffing, Book, Deduction, Party Game, Word Game

name: Spin-Golf
description: An early C20th golf board game, made in England. The game has 5 cast metal teetotum spinning tops which represent 5 different golf clubs and which are spun to obtain the result of each stroke. Naturally the idea of the game is to complete the 9-hole course in as few shots as possible. The golf course (complete with clubhouse, tees, fairways, bunkers and greens) is represented on the board and there are small numbered metal playing pieces (4) to chart the progress.

name: Dark Age: Essence
description:
Publisher Blurb:

The definitive collection of the core Dark Age rules, scenarios and sample forces. In this book you will also find counters and templates that are used by all the forces of Samaria.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Enchanters of Legamoria
description:
Enchanters of Legamoria is a free print-and-play fantasy game that combines the strategic aspects of chess with the dynamics of magic the gathering. Designed for 2, 4 or 6 players, the game is played on a grid where opponents take turns summoning pieces, modifiers, lands and spells to the battleground. Pieces have various attacks, abilities and effects that, when used in concert with each other, produce infinite variations of duels. Each player may summon up to 4 lands in his/her summoning ground. The game ends when a player or team has no more remaining lands on the board.

The game files are located at legamoria.com. Enjoy!
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management

name: DWARFâ¢KNUCKLE
description:
This is a game about dwarfs knocking each other into pits and collecting gold. Dwarfs are natural fighters, and this game naturally contains a lot of fighting. It also contains forest elves to kick.

Players take turns moving their dwarfs around the board and use item cards to trip up the other dwarfs. Depending on what game mode is in play GOLD could be waiting at the end of a race, ready to be dug up, or even in the hands of a GNOME IN A MECHANIZED POWER SUIT. It's up to the players to use their dwarfs special skills to out maneuver the competition.

name: Rails to the South Pole
description:
Minigame using the Empire Builder system included in Train Gamers Gazette 2(1). The cards had to be photocopied onto cardstock, and the board had to be photocopied and laminated.

Players start with enough money to build short lengths of track, and by running their trains and delivering loads to various cities acquire more cash to expand their networks. Game had three Major Stations, no Medium Stations, fifteen Minor Stationsn; and six types of Loads (Fuel, Imports, Penguins, Research Equipment, Tourists and Dinosaurs).

Terrain costs are higher than in other games of this system: 2 for "Clear" and 3 for Mountain mileposts due to the snow and ice. Game is to $150 million.

Like all games in this system, game length depends on the number of players, roughly 20 minutes per player.
mechanics: Crayon Rail System, Hexagon Grid, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Transatlantic Rails
description:
An expansion combining both Empire Builder and Eurorails. Players start with a Freight train on each board as well as a Freighter to transport Commodities from one continent to the other.

Trains and Freighters must be in the same Port at the same time to transfer a Commodity, unless a Warehouse is built to store Commodities, ($10 in a Port).

Like the Trains, the Freighter can be upgraded to a Heavy Freighter to increase its load capacity from two Commodities to three.

Freighters take three turns to cross the ocean. Transatlantic deliveries pay double.

This variant is included in Train Gamers Gazette 2(1). Warehouses, Freighters and Port cards need to be photocopied onto cardstock and cut out before playing.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Crayon Rail System, Hexagon Grid, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: RoShamBo
description:
From the game publisher's web site:

"RoShamBo (aka Rock Paper Scissors) is a board game that takes an age-old concept and transforms it into a game like no other on the market — ever. Ro Sham Bo is simple yet complex — an entertaining game that makes play fast, intense, and sometimes personal, but most of all fun.

It's pretty simple (but for those of you who have been living under a rock — no pun intended…) Rock beats scissors, scissors beats paper, paper beats rock. Got it so far?

Players advance toward the winner's level by rolling the dice or by winning challenges.

However, more is at stake than just winning the game (on the board) — challenges can go beyond traditional game play.

Along the way players land on spaces that call for challenges that range from moving ahead a few spaces and changing places with the winner, to being everyone's butler for the rest of the game, or doing a crazy stunt or challenge of the cardholder's choice.

name: Cocorico
description:
Game of speed and observation.
Players draw cards in front of them and when two identical cards are stacked, the first player to cry as an animal of those cards wins all the cards drawn. There are rooster, duck, donkey, cow, pig, turkey etc. in this game. Last player in game is the winner.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Real-time

name: Mathul8
description:
This is a Scrabble like math game where you use your tiles to form valid math equations. Players follow basic order of operations when playing their equations. The first player to play all of their tiles wins and is declared the "Math Whiz".

Integrates with:

Fracul8

name: RoboRiot
description:
RoboRiot is a light, family-friendly card game.

In RoboRiot you are competing with the other players in the Worldwide RoboRiot Tournament, in which Robot Engineers such as yourself are tossed into an arena full of mismatched Robot pieces. Your job is to scramble to put together the best bot you can, as quickly as you can, and hope it is strong enough to beat all of the others. If you win, you gain Medals. If you lose, you forfeit medals. Be the player with the most medals when one or more players runs out of them to claim victory!

name: De Bellis Civile v. 2, 1644-1645
description:
This is volume 2 of a collection of miniatures scenarios for battles of the English Civil War. While designed for the miniatures rules set "De Bellis Renationis" (DBR) rules, the scenarios are sufficiently generalized that they can be converted to other rules sets.

Scenarios included are:

Nantwich
Cotes Bridge
Newark
Cheriton
Selby
Cropredy Bridge
Marston Moor
Newbury 2
Pontefract
Ledbury
Islip
Naseby
Langport
Milner's Heath
Rowton Heath
Denbigh Green
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Modern Equipment Handbook
description: This 92 page handbook provides the most comprehensive coverage of all armoured vehicles, artillery, helicoptes and missiles which are in service or have been in service since the 1950s. The data is laid out for Tabeltop Games Challenger II rules and WRG's Armoured Warfare 1950 to 1985, but is also detailed enough to be of interest to other armoured vehicle enthusiasts.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: WWII Battlezones
description:
Scenarios for WWII 1/300th or 1/200th scale wargames. It can also operate with the Challenger II rules system (1988).

Includes both historical and fictional battles.

All scenarios are laid out in common format:
1. Background
2. Game Size
3. Conditions
4. Force Lists
5. Reinforcements
6. Notes

Also, each scenario has a map included

name: -(Mathul8)^2
description: The first expansion to Mathul8. Addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division not enough for you? Well now you can play the same great game with negatives, parenthesis, and exponents.
categories: Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Math, Number

name: Fracul8
description:
Want to increase your math skills even more? Or you're just crazy because you like fractions? This is the expansion for you. Oh wait this is a stand alone expansion playable alone, with Mathul8 or any of its expansions.

Integrates with:

Mathul8

name: Vari8
description: Another expansion of the awesome game Mathul8. Need more practice with variables? Not only do you play variables but you can also change their value before using them.
categories: Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Math, Number

name: Radic8
description: Another expansion to the classic game Mathul8. This expansion lets you add in those nasty radicals and logarithms. Some people actually think it is fun to play with radicals and logarithms. The exciting thing is that you get those choose your index number on your radicals or the base number on your logarithms.
categories: Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Math, Number

name: Olympic Archery
description:
Statistical replay game on olympic archery, probably the only one available on the market, it a simple dice and charts game, with data for replaying all individual archery events from 1972 to 2008.
The game works around three different tables, on which the player roll two dice to get a score for each arrow shot (or 12/18 arrows round).
It is strictly a solitare replay game

name: Spiel des Wissens 2. ErgÃ¤nzungspackung
description:
Second expansion set for Spiel des Wissens/I.Q. 2000

Categories are general knowledge, fairy tales and stories, heroes and villains, word and language games, cartoons and television, animals, sports and games. Correct answers get the players from planet to planet to planet Galaxia,
Player who first reach the target wins the game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Space Exploration, Trivia

name: The Immigration Game
description:
The Immigration game is an adaptation of John Conway's abstract zero-player game of Life to a two-player game. It was first described in Lifeline, a newsletter dedicated to Conway's Life, in 1971.

In the Immigration game, players setup the game by taking turns and placing 5 pieces each of their color on a 25x25 rectangular grid. Each position in the 25x25 grid can be either alive or dead, the living positions (or “cells”) are those that have a counter placed in them. Once setup is complete, the pieces are not moved and board positions evolve without player intervention according to the rules of Conway’s Game of Life, as listed below:

At each turn (or “generation”) the state of a cell is determined by the following rules:

1. If a live cell has less than two neighbors in the eight neighboring cells, it dies in the next generation (“loneliness”)

2. If a live cell has at two or three neighbors in the eight neighboring cells, it stays alive in the next generation.

3. If a live cell has more than three neighbors in the eight neighboring cells, it dies in the next generation (“overcrowding”).

4. If a dead cell has exactly three neighbors in the eight neighboring cells, it becomes alive in the next generation (“reproduction”).

New living cells, which come into being by having exactly 3 neighbors, take on the color of the majority of those three neighbors. Note that all cells in the 25 x 25 board have 8 neighbors each as the board is considered to wrap around the edges to each opposite side.

After the 10th generation, the player with the most living cells is allowed to place a counter thus adding an additional live cell of his or her color, followed by a turn by the other player. If both players have the same amount of live cells, generations continue to develop until one player has a majority, at which time the generations stop so players can place their new live cells and the process begins again.

Play continues this way until one of the players has no live cells left and the winning player is the only one with live cells on the board.

name: Afterworld: Earth Reborn
description:
Afterworld: Earth Reborn captures the earth's apocalyptic fall into darkness slightly after a decade-long golden period in which people lived longer, explored their minds both intellectually and spiritually more than ever, created grandiose machines and robots, and lived in relative peace.

The actual game takes place in an opportunity-deprived environment (making nods to the steampunk genre) that is dominated by several characters--both good and evil in nature. There's grown and spliced creatures; sinister, calculated robots; demented magical incantations; and fervent warriors/scholars from assorted historical and fantasy sources.

The goal of the game is to acquire victory points, which are gained through several different types of actions. Gameplay involves several cards that create a gameboard; are drawn and played by players; and dictate what players do (through an avatar). Players take turns gaining resources, playing cards, and fighting creatures as they interact with the board and opponents.

name: Quick Picks Password & Password Junior
description:
As in the family version of Password Card Game, teams of two compete to see who can guess the secret password first. What one-word clue could get your partner to respond with the password? But you've got to be clever when you communicate because players can give only one-word clues, your opponents can hear the clues, and the fewer clues given the higher the score. The Junior version uses simpler words. The team that guesses the most words with the fewest clues wins.

originally seen in Endless Games 2008 catalog for which was never released.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Word Game

name: Godzilla Rampage
description:
Play as your favorite Kaiju from the popular Godzilla franchise in this classic style board game of dice rolling.

Roll the die and move your Kaiju around the game board fighting the other player's Kaiju. Use special abilities on your Kaiju's game card to perform range or melee attacks when in battles or defensive attacks against Kaiju.

Game objective; defeat the other player's Kaiju to win. Each player (in a standard game; 2 players) picks 4 Kaiju to play as. In a 3+ player game, players only choose 3 Kaiju.

Game features 12 Kaiju from Godzilla series;
-Anguirus
-Burning Godzilla
-King Ghidorah
-Godzilla
-Little Godzilla
-Mecha-Gigan
-Mecha-Godzilla
-Mothra
-Gigan
-Zilla
-Mothra Larva
-Rodan
categories: Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play

name: Duell der Formen
description:
Duell der Formen / Duel of Forms is a 2 player abstract strategy game. The aim of the game is to position six tokens to make a line, triangle or hexagon. The player who manages to do this first wins the game.

Each player gets 12 tokens and takes it in turns to place one of their tokens on the empty board.

Each player attempts to use 6 of the tokens of their colour to make an unbroken line, a hexagon with six equal edges or a triangle with three even edges (including placing a token in the middle of each of edges of the triangle).

If all the tokens have been set out and neither player has won, the players take it in turns to move their tokens to empty spaces. Players can only move one space and cannot jump. Each player must move a token to an empty space during their go and cannot choose to wait.

Variant: Once all the tokens have been set out, players cannot only move but also jump to any place.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Point to Point Movement

name: The Big Bang Theory: For Your Consideration
description:
Object: The object of the game is to travel from Pasedena, through the many challenges of life as a genius, and ultimately arrive in the Nomination Zone, where you might just win as Emmy.

To Begin: Play "Rock, paper Scissors, Lizard, Spock" to determine who goes first (scissors cut paper, paper covers rock, rock crushes lizard, lizard poisons spock, spock vaporizes rock, rock crushes scissors). Each player takes a turnspinning the wheel and moving forward the number of spaces the spinner lands on.

Winning The Game: The first player to reach the Emmy nomination zone wins the game and has bragging rights for one year. They must attend all parties and pose for red-carpet photos. There are no guarantees that the funniest player will win the game, or that the winner will win again next time.

name: Monopoly: Bad Homburg
description:
Monopoly set of Bad Homburg, a German city - north of Frankfurt.
All the traditional elements of rolling, moving, purchasing, earning, and spending.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Sons of the Great Elephant: The Anglo-Zulu War of 1879
description:
Sons of the Great Elephant: The Anglo-Zulu War of 1879 is a low-complexity solitaire wargame on the 1879 Zulu War. The game uses point-to-point movement and a chit pull mechanic to simulate events and enemy army formations.

The player commands British forces and native allies. On each turn, the player will select a British Leader and build forts, move, draw event chit, or reorganize. Actions are limited by the Leader's Action Points. Enemy actions are determined by event chits, which are drawn when entering hostile territory. Combat is based on unit strength with units rolling dice equal in number to their combat strength. British eliminate a unit on a roll of 5 or 6 and Zulu eliminate a unit on a roll of 6.

The goal is capture Chief Cetewayo and subdue as many hostile Zulu areas as possible. The player must manage both the Zulu forces and the British political will to stay in the war. The game ends after 8 turns and victory points are measured on a scale of Total British Defeat to Total British Victory.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), White Dog Games

name: Mines of the Sacred Dragon: Tile Exp Set #1
description: MOSD Tile Expansion Set #1 comes with 10 unique hexagon tiles. Each tile has two connected gray (wild) sides plus unique colors on other four sides.

name: Mines of the Sacred Dragon: Tile Exp Set #2
description: MOSD Tile Expansion Set #2 comes with 10 unique hexagon tiles. Each tile has two connected gray (wild) sides, one color on opposing side plus two unique colors on other two sides.

name: Mines of the Sacred Dragon: Tile Exp Set #3
description: MOSD Tile Expansion Set #3 comes with 10 unique hexagon tiles. Each tile has two colors and each color is on three connected sides.

name: The Xmas game
description:
A game for the whole family from 5 years and older. There are two games in the box, one on each side, Gift Race and Sledge Race.
In Gift Race, players assist Santa to deliver x mas gifts. you follow a path, deliver gift tokens to houses ans try to be the first to reach the finish line. But sometimes you land on a slide and move backwards or get shot forwards with a rocket. The first player to reach the finish line wins.
In Sledge race players follow a crocked path to try to be the first to reach the finish line. But which path will you follow?
The Xmas game take 10-30 minutes to play, for 2-4 players.

name: Twin Kins
description:
You score points — for pairing twins, for going out first, for holding the Wide World card.

THE DEAL: All the cards, one at a time. Some may have an extra card.

THE PLAY: First everyone pairs his twins, putting them face up, in his own stack. The player at dealer's left then draws a card from the player at his left, if he makes a pair, he shows it and puts it down in his stack, and draws from any other player. When no pair is made the next person to the left plays. In each turn, you draw first from the left, and then keep on drawing from anyone as long as you make pairs. Play continues until all twins are paired. If you have the Wide World card when you pair your last card, you keep it.

THE WINNER: Scoring: 1 point for each card paired; 5 points to the first player to go out (pairing all the cards in his hand); 10 points for the Wide World card. The highest score wins.

name: Gyles Brandreth's 300 Jokes Series: Knock Knock!
description:
Game One for two players. The winning player is (he first to win an agreed number of cards by correctly giving the punchline to one of the jokes on the card.

Shuffle the cards and place them joke side up in the centre. Player one is the Joke Teller and asks player two one of the jokes from the top card. The card is won by giving the correct punchline, If the correct punchline is not given the card is placed to the bottom of the pack. Player two is then the Joke Teller and asks player one a joke on the next card.
Play continues like this until one player wins the agreed number of cards.

Game Two: FIVE CARD TRICK for two or more players plus a Joke Teller.
The winning player is the first to win five cards.
The Joke Teller shuffles the pack and draws the top card. The player seated on the left of the Joke Teller goes first and begins by choosing any number between one and six. The Joke Teller then reads out that joke. If the first player can supply the correct purchline he wins the card. If he cannot supply the punchline or offers an incorrect punchline, the player to his left is given the chance to answer. If that player gives the correct punchline he wins the card. If he fails then the player to his left is given a chance and so on round the group. When the correct punchline has been given, the player who gave it is awarded the card, or when no correct punchline has been given, the card is placed at the bottom of the pack. It is then the second player's turn. He chooses any number between one and six and the Joke Teller reads out the joke. The process is repeated until one player has won five cards. That player is the winner.

Game Three: JOKERS WILD for three to six players.
The winner is the player with most cards at the end of the game.
The cards are shuffled and placed in the middle of the players. Player No 1 picks the top card and reads out a joke on the card. If one of the other players thinks he knows the punchline,that player shouts out “Joker!” and gives the punchline. If the punchline given is correct that player wins the card. If it is incorrect the card is placed at the bottom of the pack and the player who gave the wrong punchline misses one round which means that he cannot give the punchline to the next joke even if he knows it. It is then the turn of Player No 2 to pick a card from the pack and read out a Joke. The process is repeated round and round the group until all the cards have been won, and the player with most cards is the winner. A player cannot offer a punchline to a joke he is reading out himself. If two players shout “Joker!” at exactly the same moment the younger of the players gets to offer the punchline.

For a variation on the three games try the following: even if a player gives an incorrect punchline, the Joke Teller may award that player the card if they decide that the alternative punchline given is clever or funny enough.

name: Gloop
description:
A meteor crashed down upon the world releasing a primordial slime upon the world. The slime showed signs of limited intelligence like that of a K9. So you have taken it upon yourself to protect and raise the little creature.

Gloop is a 1-3 player game where you fight off Hostile slime eating monsters, while tending to the needs that Gloop may have, to complete a hidden goal that will come up later. You accomplish this by accomplishing each event that turns out over the course of the game. They range from hostiles that want to eat Gloop to satisfying Gloops current mood by doing what the card asks of you. The goal must be accomplished before the event deck runs out for you to be victorious.

name: One Stormy Night
description:
One stormy night... you were walking home. But you were not alone. Your companions are more than a little odd, and it's up to you to use your social deduction skills (and some well-placed bluffs) to make it home safely.


One Stormy Night is fast, light, social deduction game for 2-10 players. Like most social deduction games, every player has a secret role. Figuring out everyone's secret roles (and knowing when to keep yours secret) helps you gather the votes you need to win the game. In a small group, it can be a thoughtful and strategic game. In a large group, One Stormy Night fill the role of a party game!

Gameplay
Every player has a secret role: Vampire, Werewolf, or Human. Each role has a corresponding deck on the table (a Vampire Deck, a Werewolf Deck, and a Human Deck), but players do not know which deck is which.

During each turn, the players will vote to reveal a card from one deck. When a deck runs out of cards, the game is over. If the Vampire Deck runs out first, the Vampires win. If the Werewolf Deck runs out first, the Werewolves win. And the same goes for the Human Deck.

Each card has a special effect when it is revealed: some of these effects shrink decks or swap them around, others let players peek at cards, and still others kill off pesky Vampires and Werewolves!

name: Dox
description:
To start the game of Dox, red rings are placed on each of 24 circles on the game board. These circles are arranged in a 5 x 5 grid, the center space being empty. Player one starts by removing however many rings from any one straight line he chooses, horizontal or vertical, not diagonal. He or she may remove one ring, all rings, or any number so long as they are on that straight line. Player two then removes however many rings he chooses from any straight line. Players continue taking turns until only one ring is left; the player who takes this ring loses the game.

The game is short so continued matches are expected, with losing players starting the next game and points being awarded as follows: five points for winning a game, ten points for winning a second game in succession, fifteen for winning a third in succession, and so on.

name: America's Crown Stakes
description:
"Enjoy the thrills and excitement of horse racing, wagering, buying horses, winning races and the thrill of victory. Everyone races to win the most money."

Game play is basically roll 2 dice and move the total. Although horses move in order from post 1 -10, they do not get blocked due to the parking rule. That is, if your are behind another horse, you push the line forward until unblocked. Another version lets you buy historical horses plus a tote board to be filled out.

Deluxe version contains 10 metal horses and triple crown history book.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling

name: Cassette Juego: Persecusion Policiaca
description:
Cassette Juego was a very popular late 80´s spin and move series of portatile boardgames that were created in spain by CASA CHICO, but later was very popular in Venezuela and Peru,among other southamerican countries.(produced by Loklinka and Maxi S.A.)

The game itself was portable with shape of a 80´s old audio cassette, that come with it cassette box.The cassette was displayed in three sections. One is located in what was the function of the die, which was replaced by a rotating wheel with various numbers printed on it. The other two panels formed the board cassette. It was made ââof metal, for small magnetic chips (usually four, but this varied depending on the game) could adhere securely and not dropped or lost. When not being used, the chips were placed in a small metal plate located on the upper right of the board.

PERSECUSION POLICIACA (Police chase) was about police car chasing thieves car through the gameboard, finely detailed with a train rails dividing, crossing bridges and turning in city blocks.
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Free the Box Game
description: This game is a fun, family board game based upon an outside game played on a neighborhood street by friends many years ago. Pictured on the board is this neighborhood where you move around hiding from and seeking your opponents among places like a house, mailbox, or a fence, to try and capture them or to avoid being captured. If another player lands on the same hiding space that you occupy, then you are captured and have to move to your capture box. If you move all the way around the neighborhood you can try to jump to the center and free all of your captured tokens! There are two ways to win this game, either be the first to capture all of your opponent’s tokens before they capture yours or be the first to jump all your tokens to the center. A very easy game to learn and also very addictive for younger players who it is designed for.

name: The Miniverse: Battle Card Game
description:
If you're looking for a new TableTop game, "The Miniverse: Battle Card Game" is a great option. Get ready for hours of fun with this Combat & Strategy based card game. Experience your toughest battle ever as you and your friends face off against each other in an epic battle. Though many Challengers shall rise, only one will become Champion of The Miniverse!

OBJECTIVE:

You have 10 Challengers that you will randomly select from and begin your Journey. Your Objective is to deplete the Life of the other Challengers by using the various Specials and Abilities of your Challenger card as well as any Ability and Fortune Cards you acquire. Be careful, as Misfortune can befall anyone, at any time.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Variable Player Powers

name: Outbreak Zombie
description:
An Art of War D10 game. In Outbreak Zombie the goal is to survive a Zombie apocalypse. The game is for 1-8 players ages 12 and up. With 5 game types the replay value is high. With loot dice the items are completely random. Can you survive the Outbreak?
Throughout the game players must work together to gather items and secure buildings as needed. There is no monetary or buy section. All Items are found by looting the abandoned buildings of the town. Player cooperation is therefore put at a premium. Scarce ammo or better items can be traded between players. Unless of course you are playing the No Friends Scenario, In No Friends no help is allowed and you can attack other players.
The Ultimate goal is securing your hometown. This is done by killing off all the zombies in your town. Get Out of Dodge is different as you and your fellow survivors attempt to escape.

Combat is One die roll and is streamlined for fun interactive battles. Action Points dictate how much players can accomplish per turn. Character development is present allowing for different breeds of characters based off player discretion.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Wer kennt Bremen?
description:
"Who knows Bremen - The Original City Quiz"

Do You know Yor city or region? With over 500 questions about Bremen.

The Quizmaster draws a card and asks a question. Plyayers bets correct answer with A/B/C/D-cards face-down or use their joker card. Correct answer scores points and player may continue answering. Wrong answer eliminates player from the session.
Game last until there are no players or the session is over.

Player with the most points is the winner.

name: Pega LadrÃ£o
description:
From the box:

"Astúcia e malícia num jogo de polícia e ladrão!"

Pega Ladrão is a brazilian game from the early 80's with a Cops and Robbers theme, where players take turns trying to scoring points. It was published by Grow and there's no info on a re-release of it.

The game starts with the "Jail" card on the table. The Cop and the Robber player take turns, placing cards on the table, that shows a maze of streets. The Robber player must lay his cards in a way to form a free passageway as far as the jail as possible, while the Cop player must put him on a dead end.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Linus the Lionhearted Game
description: An 'UPROARIOUS' spin & move game based on the General Mills Cereal mascot as seen on TV during the 1960's

name: PrisonBall 2072
description:
In a futurist universe controlled by the New World Order, extraterrestrial prisoners and other outcasts from society have become superstars of a bloody and violent sport in the image of its time : PrisonBall.

Leading one of these prisoners teams, the player will try to qualify himself through PrisonBall play-offs and cups for the very coveted Christmas Cup, a bloody family entertainment for the celebration season .

PrisonBall is played 7 versus 7 on an ice rink and players have to get points in order to win the victory.

Goals, bumpers, timers and Ko are different means to win. Tactic Cards, corruption cards, low blows, the audience and bonuses are also indirect means to glean a few points or to get rid of your adversary.

Go through a whole season thanks to championship rules that will lead you to the Christmas Cup or simply play a match between one of the major teams of the league or one of your teams created with creation rules.
Follow the three great classifications of players, strikers, pitchers or the greatest psychopath, with the charts won with 'xp and become one of the stars.

Inspired by the movie "RollerBall", or the video game "Speedball", Prison Ball throws us into a gloomy future where shed blood has become a family attraction.

Solo rules to simulate matches, the complete set of figurines from Infinity (the game), Greebo, Neomics, Willy miniatures, Pedro Ramos...) can be used with the game. Figurine profiles are available on the site.

You’ve got to win if you want to be free!
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Area Movement, Simulation

name: The Aerial Derby
description:
Pre-WW1 game, featuring the relatively new world of aviation where players traveled the globe on Wright Fliers, Bleriots and Bristol Box-Kites.

The game is not very 'new' in the sense that it is a Goose-type race game. Move according to the die, obey instructions of every special square and the first to 'fly' around the world from London to Windsor Castle, wins.

As a side observation, space 20 foretold events that would happen 100 years later "New York, collides with a skyscraper, back to 8".

A different version of The Aerial Derby game came as one of a trio of games from Chad Valley's Kompactum Edition. The game probably came boxed with two other Chad Valley games being 'Rescue' and 'Loco' as the long narrow board dimension in the Kompactum Edition is identical to the Rescue game and exactly half that of Loco. The other two games are listed separate.

name: Quizball
description:
Trivia meets football.

The board represents a football pitch with coloured circles. When you answer a question correctly, you throw the die and move forward. The nearer you get to your opponent's goal, the harder the questions.

After 90 minutes of play, the player or team with the most goals, wins.

name: The Creature
description:
THEME You and your friends are researchers working at an undisclosed facility operated and owned by the shadowy pharmaceutical company PharmaDyn. There you and your fellow lab workers have been tasked with studying a parasitic alien organism found frozen deep in the Arctic ice. To everyone's horror, the specimen turns up missing and anyone could be the infectious Creature's host! As a Human, try to reveal the Creature's identity before it infects everyone and escapes the quarantine.

GOAL The Humans, represented by the Immune, must identify and eliminate the Creature before the Creature and his Infected outnumber them.

GAMEPLAY The game is meant to be played over a weeks time, or roughly one day for every one person playing the game.

On the first day each person is dealt an Identity card from the deck, two of which must be the Creature and the Immune. The person who draws the Immune must immediately reveal their Identity to the group, whereas everyone else keeps their Identity a secret.

Once the Identities have been established, and the Immune has revealed themselves to the group, the game officially begins. At this point everyone is free to go about their business. Now the Creature begins his mission. Once a day, including the first, the Creature may approach one of the other players, shake their hand, and state "You have been Infected" to convert them to the Creature's side. The Creature may only do this once per day, but doing so will increase their numbers, and ultimately bring the Infected closer to victory.

On each day following the first, the group will get back together for a few moments to discuss what has happened since they last met. After everyone has had an opportunity to speak, they will collectively vote on who they think the Creature is. The person with the most votes against them must reveal their Identity and are eliminated from the game. The Creature and any of his Infected are still part of the voting process, because as far as anyone else knows they are Human.

The Humans win if the can eliminate the Creature during the vote. If the Immune is eliminated however, the Creature and his Infected are victorious.

FINAL The Creature should be played with at least 8 people, and playing with more people is almost always a better experience. The game includes other unique Identities, in addition to the Immune and Creature, that may be added to the game for more fun and chaos.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Real-time
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Peril
description:
A pseudo co-op game that secretly places one player against all their friends.

Much like fabled assassins of old, one player must bide time and patiently wait for the opportune moment to strike. But should your strike fail, or you wait too long, beware the others may notice and your life be now in danger. For the others, however, a perilous fight for survival while the assassin stalks the shadows and his identity remain unknown.

In PERIL, players play cards from their hand to either save or damage the turn player, secretly attempting to identify the assassin and destroy him before he destroys them. But be weary, who you destroy could be one of your own.

name: El Rey de la Piel
description:
Experience the legendary leather industry of Ubrique. Play as one of the main leather manufacturing companies and grow from a simple workshop to a leading factory.

Each player begins the game by selecting one of Ubrique's most famous factories. All players begin as modest workshops with a limited workforce. At the start of each turn, two 'market' cards are placed on the board. You may find either an 'order' or an 'event'. Events happen automatically and you will have to follow the instructions on them. As for orders, you may pick one out and begin manufacturing for top international fashion brands. On order cards you'll find how many handbags and wallets need to be made and how much you'll be getting paid when delivered. The bigger the order, the more workforce you'll need. The solution is hiring external workshops. But be careful! There's only a limited amount of workshops in Ubrique, so make sure they're not manufacturing for other players!

Also, in order to manufacture handbags and wallets you'll be purchasing real leather tokens! The more packages you buy, the lower the cost. It's up to you to decide how much you're willing to invest.

Given your limited starting funds and factory size, it's always a good idea to start off with small orders. As the game goes on you'll be able to expand your factory and increase your workforce, requiring less external workshops to complete small orders and making it possible to pick up bigger orders.

In the advanced rules, players may negotiate with each other, trade leather, and share orders - just like in real life.

'El Rey de la Piel' is an educational game that faithfully reflects the leather goods industry, where victory depends mostly on business strategy than luck.

The goal of the game is to expand your factory to the highest level and become the leading factory in Ubrique.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Pick-up and Deliver, Simulation, Worker Placement

name: Sudden Death: Ninja Attack
description:
A game for 2 players, simulating two ninjas dueling to the death in a bamboo forest. Players use attack cards, action cards and withdrawal cards as they fight and withdraw until there is only one ninja left standing... or none.

The deck consists of 25 unique cards. Attacks are played in a rock-paper-scissors fashion, with Melee attacks countering Ranged, Ranged attacks countering Traps, and Traps countering Melee attacks. Attacks continue until either one player cannot counter (they die) or an appropriate withdraw card has been played. Play continues until at least one player is dead.

name: Dust Tactics: "Nightwatch" Elite Premium
description:
This is a special premium-painted version of Koshka and her Grand'Ma walker that come in the Operation Zverograd expansion. Because it includes its own reference cards, this is playable with or without the Zverograd expansion. It is available for purchase by Elite members of Paolo Parente's Dust website.

From the website description:

We are very proud to introduce our first Elite Exclusive item: Koshka and her own walker Grand'Ma. They are both presented here in their “Night Ops” version, used during many special operations in all parts of the world where the SSU is present. Koshka is the most active and successful SMERSH operative ever. Many of the SSU bold operations have been made possible thanks to her and the skills she has piloting her very own war machine.

As you can see this “Elite Version” comes with a special diorama base that can also serve as a playing base for Grand'Ma (it takes one space on the field). The walker can also be placed on a regular grey round base that we have magnetized: you can swap Grand'Ma from one base to another with ease.
We also magnetized Koshka: she can be played independently, the rock under her feet is the same size as a regular base. And thanks to the magnet she can be placed back on the large base with her robot with instantly. In an instant Koshka and Grand'Ma can go from a Collector Item to being fully playable. And of course, as usual, everything is already painted and you can enjoy it as soon as you open the box.

This particular pose of the KV47, on which Grand'Ma is based on, has been specifically created by a good friend of Dust Studio: Italian modeler Livio Emanueli. He has taken the time to help Vincent create this unique model for you during his last visit in our production facility in China.

Of course these two models come with their very own unit cards, but these are stat and skill wise identical to the regular Dust Tactics version.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Throw in a Row
description:
Objective of the game is to be the first player to get all of his/her color balls in a row; up and down, up and down or diagonally in the open and visible columns. You do this by throwing balls directly the chutes and by hitting the "targets" to release balls and change pattern within the columns.

Includes 6 balls of two colors. Throw In... Knock Out Action Game. Whether your playing offense or defense, this action game's a knocking out!

name: Solar
description: Solar will attempt to usher in a new style of card games with its almost unheard of game mechanics. The game will start with both players choosing who picks the first character, that person starts on defense, the other play, on offense. Then, they both take turns choosing characters until they both have 12 card decks to play with.
