Each character shall feature its own art work and class, as well as one, two, or three attacks to use while on offense,and one or two defense moves while on defense. At the beginning of each turn, both players draw 3 characters from the top of the deck, and put one on the battlefield, and the other two on the bottom of his/her deck. Then, the player on offense may use his characters attack skills on his/her opponent's characters. If the hit lands successfully, the character is defeated. The game is over,and the winner decided, when one player has lost all of his characters and is labeled the loser.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck

name: Dust Tactics: Schwerer PanzerspÃ¤hwagen Sd.Kfz.234/1 â "Nordwind"
description:
Description from publisher:

Even as the war continues some “older” vehicles have managed to stay on top. Or have not been destroyed yet. It's not the case for the very efficient “Nordwind”, officially know as Sd.Kfz 234/1. Its missions have remained the same for a few years now: recon and engage light armored targets. This vehicle does these two jobs superbly.

With the “Nordwind” Dust Studio is proud to introduce its new line: DUSTIFIED KITS. As usual with our Premium line these are carefully assembled and painted, and everything you see is there: the weathering, the pilot, etc. These new vehicles will add an amazing historical touch to your armies.

The Premium Edition models are not just “pre-painted”. What we offer is the exact replica of Vincent Fontaine’s work, Dust Studio's Master Painter.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, World War II

name: Hitta
description:
Simple print and play two player battle card game.
Each attack in Hitta consists of an initiation followed by a decreasing sequence of cards (each card being of a lower value than the preceding card) ending with a dice roll to finish the attack which needs to be higher than the lowest (last) card played in the sequence. The points removed from your opponent are equal to the number of cards in your sequence.
The defender will get several opportunities to block the attack by trying to guess the next card the attacker will use or to try to match one of the dice with one of their own cards.

name: Snake Clash
description:
Snake Clash is a simple and fast Print & Play board game inspired by the game in the Tron movie (1982). The rules of this game are very simple, it can be learned in 1-2 minutes.

Snake Clash is a line-drawing game. The goal is to create the longest snakes. The winner is who has the highest total length of his/her 4 snakes at the end of the game. Each player can start one snake from each side of the play-field (from one of the four larger circles). One snake from left, one snake from above, one snake from right and one snake from below (4 snakes in total.)

Player's turn comes after each other. Player rolls a die, that determines the allowed direction(s) of his/her next line-segment. (There is a compass on the play-field that shows the directions associated to die-roll.) He/she can extend one of their snakes by a new line-segment. (Or start a new one, if he/she doesn't started 4 snakes yet.)
Snakes can't cross each other and can't touch the same point on the play-field.

When each player have least one finished snake (When the further lengthening is impossible.), the game changes. No more die-rolls, players can freely draw a 1-segment line to any adjacent point from the end of any of their snakes.
When nobody can draw lines anymore, the game is ended. The player wins, who has the largest total line-segment number.

name: Raid: The Caribbean Word Game
description:
From the Back Cover:

During the period of 1600 to 1800 infamous pirates including Blackbeard, Captain Kidd, Anne Booney and Henry Morgan RAIDed ships and coastal towns in the Caribbean. Speed, cunning, surprise, determination, stalking one's prey, ambush, counter attack, fearlessness and ruthlessness characterized the RAIDs of these buccaneers.

The new Caribbean word game - RAID - recaptures the excitement, thrills, and anticaption of those bygone days.

RAID is a game for 2 - 6 players or teams. Play consists of forming words from the exposured blocks. Triple bonus points are earned by forming the name of any Caribbean country (a list is provided).

For example, Player one forms the word "cub" from the exposed blocks. Player two adds an A to form a new word "cuba". This is a RAID. Player two has formed the name of a Caribbean country Cuba, and so is awarded triple bonus points.

name: Cliffhanger
description:
Cliffhanger is basically two teams making up a story each - play passes around in a circle from one person to the next with the previous person ending on a "cliffhanger" so the story can continue. There is a spinner and category cards with the following round information:

Lightning Round
ABC Round
Same Word Round
One Syllable Round
Normal Round

There are also story introduction cards to help get a person started. If you don't follow the rules and make mistakes, it will cause your team to get closer to the cliff edge and fall off.

name: 5 Pillars Fun Box
description:
Do you like Trivia with an Islamic twist? Do you jiggle and wobble? Can you draw with your eyes closed? How long can you jabber without a stammer? How many teasers can your brain hammer? Could you do all of this before time runs out? If so, this fun family game was made just for you! With 500 cards full of Islamic Trivia and Challenge activities you can expect to engage in plenty of teamwork that will have you rolling in laughter! This game can be played alone or together with the 5Pillars Board Game.

Components included: 1 game box, 1 sand-timer, 1 activity coin, 1 vacuum tray, 500 cards, 1 instruction manual
categories: Educational, Humor, Religious, Trivia, Word Game

name: Mountain Pass Chess
description:
Mountain Pass Chess uses all sixteen chess pieces per side, but they are used on a 5 square X 7 square board, with three pawns, one bishop, one knight and one rook held in reserve to be brought in on the first row as space is available. Chess rules apply with some exceptions: Castling is allowed but only on the King side; the placement of a reserve piece to a first row space constitutes a move, and an opponents piece can be captured if it happens to occupy that space; as in Backgammon, a doubling cube can be used for side wagers, but is not necessary for playing the game;

From the box: MOUNTAIN PASS CHESS has been discribed as incorporating the most revolutionary change in the rules for regular chess since the change that allowed castling. The game provides the opportunity for new study in openings, middle game and end game pley. As stated on the cover of this box...
THE ULTIMATE CHESS CHALLENGE."

name: Retro Rampage Trivia Quest
description: Retro Rampage Trivia Quest is a table top trivia game focusing on classic games and consoles, ranging from the Nintendo Entertainment System and Sega Master System, up until the Super Nintendo, Sega Genesis, and even the Turbografx-16 and the PC Engine.

name: Pantheon Kingdoms Demo
description:
This is a free Print and Play Demo of a continuing project. This Demo is complete and playable.

Theme
The theme of the game revolves around Deities, and their involvement in the epic conflict amongst civilizations over the course of centuries. The theme of the provided Demo Map is fantastical, but any map or setting that players wish to design may be played. A generic-universal rules system invites you to create or recreate the Theme as your game group likes, be it historical, mythological, or fantastical, or any mix thereof.

Gameplay
Turn-based strategy on region-based map. Actions use a point allocation system and are resolved by dice rolls using d4/d6/d8/d10/d12/d20-type dice.

Players take the roles of Deities who can use Powers to influence gameplay while also directing their Follower Units and more powerful Summoned Units on the World Map in a variety of possible actions such as battling, converting or assassinating enemy Units. Each player's Units have unique stats which are derived from those of their Deity and which control what type of dice to roll in each situation.

This Demo version includes 5 pre-designed Deities for playtesting; the full game permits players to design Deities of any kind, again, historical, mythological or fantastical, or any mix thereof.

Goal
To have more friendly Follower Units on the board at the end of the game than any other player. This goal can be pursued through a variety of means, primarily those of warfare and subterfuge (reducing enemy Followers), expansion and development (increasing friendly Followers) or politics and conversion (affecting the allegiance of Followers.
categories: Ancient, Book, Civilization, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy, Farming, Medieval, Miniatures, Mythology, Print & Play, Religious, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Set Collection, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: War Haven
description:
A fixed set Deckbuilding Game based on the upcoming iOS Card Game of the same name. War Command blends traditional elements of collectible card games with the gameplay of a tabletop strategy game. The game plays out similar to chess, with each player maneuvering their six character cards to attempt to attack and kill the enemy commander character.
Players can use three actions each turn to move characters, attack with characters, or play support cards from their hand, like a spell or upgrade card. When attacking or being attacked, players can also play attack or defense cards which only affect that instance.
Gameplay and Deckbuilding are both quick and easy to learn, but deep and open for exploration. The game storyline revolves around three races (the reptilian G'harrana, the technologically advanced Delylians, and the war-hardened Humans) who have fled to the same remote planet to avoid a wave of radiation that is wiping out all life in the galaxy. Their fragile civilizations, crumbling from the expense of the migration effort, are unable to maintain communications due to the planetwide frequency of magnetic storms. The units on the ground are soon isolated, and must make new allies to stay alive. This is reflected in game in that you can mix races in your decks ;)
The storyline is brought to life on each and every card through the spectacular artwork of established artists like Keith Thompson and Shaun Mitchell, as well as younger talents like Austen Mengler, Ven Locklear, and more!
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Open Drafting

name: ATS TT: Battle of the Bracchi Hills
description:
An Advanced Tobruk System (ATS) game featuring squad level battles between American and German forces near Santa Maria Infante, Italia, 1944. The rugged terrain, with several hills and a high ridge dominating the area was challenging enough for the US 88th Infantry Division, but the tenacious German 71st "Cloverleaf" Division made matters tougher still.

This game features a collection of scenarios depicting small unit action on a colourful map, along with all-new combat unit counters with new division-specific art. Also included are the Battlefield Walkaround insert and ATS TT variant rules.
Ownership of standard ATS rules, play aids and informational counters is required.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, World War II

name: Space Exodus
description:
In Space Exodus, every player is the captain of their own ship, traveling space together with the human space fleet. You must upgrade your ship, recruit new crewmembers to man your shields and weapons and ultimately battle the hardest foes to achieve victory.

Your spaceship consists of different rooms, each represented by a single card. The rooms will grant advantages such as income, shields and better weapons, but you will also need to hire crewmembers for them to work.

Each turn, there is an auction for a few randomly drawn cards that will allow the players to gain new crewmembers or/and damaging their opponents in some way. After the auction an encounter card will be drawn, and each player will choose which (if any) enemy to fight. The harder the enemy, the higher the reward!

name: Das Opiz'sche Kriegsspiel
description:
Das Opiz'sche Kriegsspiel is a wargame about napolenoic warfare.
Even though the rules were printed in 1806, according to the designer, the game was invented in 1760.

Unlike other wargames or war-themed games at this time, which were dominated by chess or chess-like mechanics, the Opiz Wargame tries to increase the simulation value by introducing random elements, through dice rolls for conducting combat etc.

In the Opiz Wargame one unit represents a battalion of infantry, cavalry, artillery and other strategic units. Each unit has different strengths and weaknesses.

It is played on a map or board of 48 x 48 squares, depicting different kind of terrain like towns, mountains, woods, waters and fortresses.
One square represents an area of about 170 m².

name: Dragon Chess: Arcane Battles
description:
Take control of your mystic armies and fight for victory! With three ways to win, customization of armies, and supporting up to 4 players, the replay value is beyond compare!

Players control custom-built armies and square off to attempt to control arcane circles, wipe out the other side, or prevent the other side from taking their turn.

Players move their pieces, according to assigned movement types, ground, burrowing, flight, or teleportation. Players battle to control spaces, rolling dice based on assigned attack and defense values.

Certain creatures possess special abilities that can be used outside of combat, including spellcasting. Spellcasters choose spells from a spell list and enact them upon the game!

Game includes board, over 100 unit markers, creature cards, spell cards, and customized dice.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Fantasy, Medieval, Mythology, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: Double Up
description:
In the card and dice game Double Up, you set the challenge. Do you play it safe and choose a challenge that’s easy for both you and your opponents? Or do you raise the bar and pick a tough one, betting your friends will fail where you’ll succeed?

The starting player attempts to match a pattern on a card using a specified number of dice and a hand of roll modifying cards. The player has a fixed number of attempts and dice, as indicated on the card, to successfully complete the challenge. If successful, the rest of the players must attempt the same challenge card and beat it in as many or fewer attempts than the original player. If the player fails to beat the challenge, whoever set the challenge gains a point; if the challenge is a Double Up card, however, they gain two points. The challenge is over once each player has made an attempt. The next player starts a new challenge and the game continues until one person reaches an agreed upon number of points. Double Up your opponents often to win!

name: American Uncivil War
description:
From the publisher's website:

Architects of War is proud to present the American Uncivil War, straight out of the pages of History AND the silver screens of Hollywood! Inspired by the films of John Ford and classics like Gone with the Wind, The Horse Soldiers, The Great Locomotive Chase, and Shenandoah, American Uncivil War captures the spirit of these films with miniature games staged on the fringes of the American Civil War. Spies, raiders, foraging parties, missions behind enemy lines, bushwhackers, deserters and a host of other scenarios can be played out. Its a role-playing skirmish game with figures overflowing with character and it puts a whole new spin on gaming this period.

The rules utilize a card activation system for initiative, command and control. Unit size ranges from single character models to platoons and even larger companies. Characters have special attributes like Influential, Dead-eye shot, Heroic, and Despicable, all of which bring to life the untold story of the American Uncivil War of both history and Hollywood myth.

So choose your side, raise your flag, and prepare for action and adventure in the War Between the States!

The Rulebook is 128 pages and comes with a 68 card activation deck. Full color throughout with 76 model scene pictures, actual civil war photos from the National Archive, 12 table/scenario maps, 12 scenarios including seven that can be linked and four historical stand alone scenarios.

The Rulebook includes Basic rules, advanced rules, pages of attributes for your characters, a complete guide to narrated games, and more.

name: Thunder Gods: Kamikazes Over Okinawa (Second Edition)
description:
Thunder Gods: Kamikazes at Okinawa portrays the massive Kikusui offensive by waves of hundreds of suicide attacks against the Allied invasion fleet off of Okinawa. The game is composed of three mini-games, one on the US destroyer “picket line”, another on the carrier fleet, and a third on the invasion support fleet, that can be played separately or combined. Players use a standard deck of playing cards to activate their aircraft and ships’ Anti-aircraft batteries as well as resolve combats.

Rules include Operation Ten Go, the Japanese fleet’s final mission of the battleship Yamato and her escorts in a one-way sortie to attack the American invasion fleet, Kaityn suicide submarine attacks, as well as variable deployments of ships and CAP (combat air patrol). Each copy of Thunder Gods has three maps, 51 double-sided, un-mounted counters, 5 pages of rules, and 4 pages of historical commentary and bibliography. The game is designed by Paul Rohrbaugh with graphics by Bruce Yearian.

Part 1 of the game was originally published in issue #5 of Panzer Digest. This edition features the other two unpublished modules/games, new graphics by Bruce Yearian, linking "campaign game" rules and 4 pages of historical commentary/designer notes.

name: Castle Defenders
description:
Description:
Castle Defenders combines the strategy elements of chess with a spell system like Magic: the Gathering™. It was inspired by the brilliant video game Hero Academy™ for iOS and contains similar gameplay mechanics. The combat system has been simplified to better fit the physical board game format.

Goal:
Players send units to attack enemy castles and defend their own. You win by destroying all enemy castles OR units.

Gameplay:
-The game board resembles a rectangular chess board. Players agree on a layout and arrange their castles and bonus tiles (extra attack, shields, or bonus castle damage).
-Players maintain a 6-card hand from their personal deck containing units (mage, healer, knight, etc.), spells, and equipment.
-On their turn, players choose 5 actions to perform (cast a spell, move a unit, attack, heal, etc...).
-Part of the game is trying out different moves to find the best plan, so you decide when your move is final.
-Players receive bonus spell cards when two of their units are destroyed (this balances gameplay and allows you to counter an opponent's momentum).

Strategy elements:
-Units have strengths/weaknesses and must work as a team.
-Formations help reinforce attack/defense effectiveness.
-Board location and unit placement is key (e.g. "Is my Knight far enough away to avoid being knocked out?" "Is my Archer close enough to knock out the enemy Healer?").
-Unit trading: killing enemy units can leave yours exposed...is it worth the risk?

name: Racing Simulator
description:
THE GREATEST RACING GAME SYSTEM NEVER DONE.

Racing Simulator is a racing car game for 1 to 9 players.

The system of game is simple but sophisticated, cars follow each other in single tail (1 car by space), simultaneously all the players reveal 1 speed card.
From the last car we are going to look by comparing speeds and place on the track if a car can overtake, decrease or increase the gap with the car which precedes it, and so on up to the lead car.

Every player possesses potentially the same Speed cards as his opponents, but does not know what are going to make for every turn, cars forward and behind him.

Add Bonus/malus dependings on the tyres type/condition, and the Action cards played.

The game is excellent because the player finds himsef with exactly the same management problems of his tyres and his pitstops that the driver in the reality. According to the quality of tyres supplied by the manufacturer, and the course of the race, what is the best ? 1, 2, 3 or 4 pitstops (Hard or soft tyres) !!!

Cars not attributed to a player are managed by the system.

The races are governed by the real F1 rules.
Qualifications, start in grid, launched start, change of tyres (1 to 4 pitstop opportunities dependings the tyres delivered by the manufacturer), quality and wear of tyres, rain, track humidity level, incidents, accidents, penalties, safety car, everything is simulated with simple rules easy to implement.

1 party lasts approximately 1 hours 30 (40 minutes for the Family game).

name: 1001 Tuesday Knights
description:
The ultimate evolving party game, inspired by games like We Didn't Playtest This, Risk Legacy, and 1000 Blank Cards.

On your turn, you simply play a card from your hand of five in front of another player and they do what the card says. If this is your first game, however, no cards have any text on them. It's up to the players to provide text on the cards, based on one of eight possible symbols printed onto the cards. For instance, the Judge symbol requires players write something that everyone must do and then be judged by the player playing the card. Whoever is judged best is given the card, and the corresponding points value also printed on the card.

The game ends when any one player has 5 cards in front of them, or the draw deck (comprised of 25 cards drawn randomly from all of the cards included in the game) has run out. The player with the most points wins!

name: Prisoner's Dilemma: Camp 16
description:
You remember the outside world and you remember liking it. But by now, you’ve been in Camp 16 so long, you’re forgetting what it looked and felt like. Inside the camp you face certain death, outside the camp you face starvation, sickness, bitter cold, enemy territory, and even death at the hands of your own comrades. Struggle is life. In Prisoner’s Dilemma: Camp 16 you play as either Prisoner #75044 or Prisoner #44233, two prisoners unaware of their crime, and hungry for freedom.

In this two player game, each player has a prisoner, and chooses one of three possible win conditions (Martyr/Survivalist/Comrade). Players will take turns reading a scenario, then bargaining with their fellow prisoner to come to a conclusion about whether to choose a selfless [o] path or a selfish [x] path. Based on the combination of the two player’s choices, players will take or gain damage according to the Results table beneath the scenario. If the players survive and meet their individual win conditions, they win. If they die, they lose. You must make good decisions to keep yourself alive, though sometimes that may mean making personal sacrifices in order to stay alive in the long run.

name: Sexism
description:
Your goal in Sexism is to move from the doll house to the White House, with the first player to cross the finish line winning. What you win, however, depends on your gender and whether you proceed to the "Man's Goal" or the "Woman's Goal". If you win as a woman, the game instructs others that "You are now a person and must be treated as such for 24 hours"; if a man, you receive a cartoon of a large thumb pushing a woman down and a declaration that "Congratulations, you've won — or have you?"

Gameplay consists mostly of drawing cards, reading the text on them (e.g., "You're all for women's liberation, but nobody's going to catch YOU going to a woman doctor. Go back one step."), then moving forward or backward as dictated. Some cards require the active player to act out a role, then others guess who or what the player was trying to be.

The game rules suggest playing as the opposite gender "because this can cause some hilarious role-playing situations".
categories: Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Political
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Role Playing, Voting

name: Fox & Chicken Rooster Pack #1: Barn Wars
description:
A Star Wars themed five card bonus pack for Fox & Chicken

Contains:

Hen Solo
Obi Wan Henobi
Chewbocka
Darth Vixen
Emperor Vulpatine
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Player Elimination, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Fox & Chicken Rooster Pack #2: The Geek Pack
description:
A five card bonus pack for Fox & Chicken

Contains:

The Illusionist
Wesley Clucker
Cultist
El Pollo Loco
The Doctor
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Player Elimination, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Fox & Chicken Rooster Pack #3: Awesomification
description:
A five card bonus pack for Fox & Chicken

Contains:

Furlicia
Weighted Companion Egg
The Old Gypsy Woman
Jammer
Pivot
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Player Elimination, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Divvy: The Pirate Loot Game
description:
Being a pirate is dangerous, filled with adventure and wonders to be seen. However all of that is not why we do what we do. We do it for the loot, the gold gems that sparkle and drive us insane. All the bloodthirsty pillaging, all the cannon fire, it's all to get the loot. Once the voyage is over, it's what we wait for, the Divvying of the loot!

In Divvy, you take the role of pirates on a voyage. Each round is a voyage to obtain loot for the crew. On your turn, you pick a mission for the crew to go on, and attempt to complete the mission. Completed missions give you infamy among the crew and places money through the hold of the ship. At the end of the voyage pirates take their share of the loot, and voyage once more.

The first pirate to have enough gold to retire from the violent lifestyle wins!
categories: Card Game, Dice, Educational, Nautical, Pirates

name: Monster Hunter Hunting Card
description:
Monster Hunter Hunting Card is a trading card game based on the Monster Hunter video game franchise. In it, players compete to fulfill quests by hunting specific monsters using teams of hunters and other resources at their disposal. The first player to reach 2000 Guild Points is the winner.

There are six card types: Hunter, Otomo, Event, Quest, Target Monsters, and Guild Monsters.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Elementary: The Chemistry Card Game
description:
Welcome to Elementary!. You have less than 48 hours to craft the most potent compounds before your lab burns down! Can you avoid the flames and beat the clock? Through skillful use of Lab Techniques, Element management and clever Time Track play, opponents gather the right combination of Elements and Bonds to score their chemical creation! But beware! Your esteemed colleagues are doing the same! Will they sabotage your best efforts? Or will you both end up in smoke?

Game Goal:
Complete compounds and collect glassware sets to score the most victory points before your lab burns down.

For 1 to 4 players. A two player game is about 30 minutes. Solo play is 15 minutes.

Game Turn info:

1. Add one Starter Element by flipping over card and sliding Element / Bond trackers on your lab.

2. Do a time action (Element, Compound or Fire Extinguisher) and move your scientist that many hours in the Lab.

Move your scientist tracker on the time track when performing a time action. Whoever is behind on the time track gets to work in the lab.
Tie goes to the active scientist. When you reach or pass a Research / Development space, add one to your Lab.

When you land on a fire hazard, add 1 fire strip to your lab. Either cover common or uncommon elements.

After you have used all Starting Elements, pick them up again to use for your next turn.

When 2 of the Element stacks are depleted on the Time Track, remove all remaining Element cards and refill all four spots with
new Elements as in the setup.

Game Components:

4 Laboratory Player Boards
1 Time Track Lab
62 Element cards
32 Starter Element cards
58 Lab Technique cards
60 Compound cards
4 Player Action / End of Game
Bonus Scoring Reference cards
8 Player tokens
4 Research / Development charts
16 Research / Development markers
6 Dual Fire Extinguisher cards
12 Uncommon Element fire strips
12 Common Element fire strips
28 Element/Bond trackers
(4) White - Hydrogen
(4) Red - Oxygen
(4) Black- Carbon
(4) Yellow - Sulfur
(4) Blue - Nitrogen
(4) Orange - Phosphorus
(4) Cloudy - Bonds
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Dust Tactics: Dust-48 "Mickey ARV"
description:
The Medium Armored Recovery Vehicle M2-B "Mickey ARV" is a front-line walker capable of handling critical tasks such as destroying heavy fortifications or helping another damaged robot. It's powerful crane can lift even the heaviest vehicles on the battlefield and can also crush almost anything on its path....

The Deluxe Edition models are not just “pre-painted”. What we offer is the exact replica of Vincent Fontaine’s work, Dust Studio’s Master Painter.

CRANE
A vehicle with this equipment can lift very heavy objects: it can enter a space with an anti-tank trap. By spending 1 ACTION it can lift this obstacle and move it in an adjacent square.

ENGINEER VEHICLE
A vehicle with this skill has many special properties, thanks to its specialized crew and equipments:
- if it's in contact with a Bunker, it can destroy it by spending 2 ACTIONS to do so: the vehicle needs a full activation. At the end of it, the Bunker is destroyed and all units inside are destroyed as well.
- the vehicle can freely enter a Minefield. When inside a minefield, it can chooses to spend 1 ACTION to clear the space it's in from any Mines. The space can then be crossed by any unit without harm.

RECOVERY VEHICLE
A vehicle with this skill has many special properties, thanks to its specialized crew and equipment:
- the vehicle gains the SELF REPAIR skill.
- the vehicle can gather a friendly destroyed vehicle and bring it back to the rear: it can then be salvaged. When you play with a RECOVER VEHICLE, place a marker on the gameboard for any ground vehicle you loose (flying or naval vehicles don't count). If the RECOVERY VEHICLE can manage to go in the space with this marker, it can load the destroyed vehicle (this costs 1 ACTION). The destroyed vehicle has now been salvaged: its parts will be used in another battle. Count only half the destroyed vehicle AP cost when figuring Victory Points at the end of the game.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Garage Sale: The Game
description:
Note: This game page is only for the "Garage Sale: The Game" game by Edge Wood Works, with felt components. It is not for other games about garage sales with similar names from other publishers.

From the instructions: "The Object is to buy the items needed to win the game, spending as little money as possible, and have fun doing it! The winner is the first player who buys, and keeps, at least six items in one row of their bargain card."

This game is played on a felt board, with felt bargaining cards that resemble bingo cards with numbered rows and various items that would be found at a garage sale, listed in the squares of the row.

Players can own businesses, and sell them to the bank if in need of cash. Buy & sell items and businesses, pay taxes, and have picnics in the park. Pick up garage sale items at the various businesses around the board.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: What's Cookin'
description: What's Cookin' is a family game from the heyday of Scratch 'n' Sniff. Players roll a die with the Chef dice tower and move around the board, visiting as many as five different restaurants over the course of the game. Upon arriving at a restaurant, the player selects a card, scratches, sniffs, and announces to the table what he suspects the food to be. The player then opens the card, revealing it only to himself. If correct, he keeps it and earns a point toward winning the game. If incorrect, he closes his eyes and the player to his left swaps it with a card from another restaurant. Play rotates and continues until all of the cards have been correctly identified. Whoever has identified the most foods wins!

name: Cartalis
description:
Cartalis is a casual card game for 2-6 players.
The goal of the game is to win 10 points before any other player does.

There are 3 types of cards: NUMBERS, PRIZES and EVENTS.
- NUMBERS range is from 1 to 7.
- PRIZES cards indicates when the players must play highest or lower NUMBERS in order to win the prize indicated. That prize could be POINTS or EVENT cards.
- EVENT cards represent special habilities (draw extra cards, steal points,etc..) that help players to take advantage in game.

Game is sequenced on rounds. For X players, on each rounds, X+1 PRIZE cards are revealed. The active player chooses PRIZES betting order. Each player can only bet for two prizes, so it's important to decide for which PRIZES bet each round.
When a PRIZE is decided, the players that want to bet for it, say "CAR-TA-LIS" and place a number from their hands on the table. Winner player takes the prize indicated on PRIZE card, and the active player selects a new PRIZE to bet.
The POINTS are added to the winning player, and if a player gets an EVENT card, can use it to take advantage.
The game ends when a player reaches 10 points.

name: Angry Birds: Star Wars â Jenga Bespin Battle Game
description:
This is another game based on the popular angry birds app. This is a Target exclusive game that includes a Han Solo bird, Boba Fett pig, Stormtrooper pig, Millennium Falcon launcher, 8 full jenga blocks, and 3 half blocks.

This is designed for 1-2 players age 8 and up.

One player builds the structure and the other player launches his bird attempting to knock down the pigs and the entire structure. This player keeps count of the number of shots taken. Once the entire structure has been knocked down the roles are reversed.

The winner is the player that required the fewest number of shots to destroy the structure.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Video Game Theme

name: The Transvaal Ablaze: A Solitaire Game of the Boer Wars in South Africa
description:
This game is a semi-historical simulation of the Boer Rebellions in South Africa during the later part of the Victorian Era. The Game begins shortly after the Boers declare independence from Great Britain. The Boers have gathered Forces and are poised to launch assaults on several British Settlements in order to drive them out or force them into capitulation. It is the Player's task, as Commander of forces in South Africa, to squash these annoying rebellions and teach these uppity farmers a lesson.

OBJECTIVE: As the Commander of British Forces in South Africa, you must protect the British Settlements put down this rebellion by capturing their Capital of Pretoria before the Campaign Deck runs out.

GAME FEATURES: The game features a fun and simplistic method for resolving solitaire combat tactically, rules for Heroes that can make an impact on the outcome of battles, and lots of colorful game counters. It even includes rules for a potential Zulu uprising.

The Transvaal Ablaze can be found at http://www.berserkergames.net/.

name: The Sudan Ablaze: Rebellions and Uprisings in the Sudan
description:
THE SUDAN ABLAZE is semi-historical simulation of the Mahdi Uprisings in the Sudan during the later stage of the Victorian Era. As the Commander of British Forces in the Egypt and the Sudan, you must protect the British Settlements and squash the swelling fanatical Sudanese forces.

OBJECTIVE: As the Commander of British Forces in the Egypt and the Sudan, the Player must use his forces to protect the British Settlements and squash the Forces of the Mahdi by capturing their Capital at El Obeid in South-Western Sudan before the Campaign Deck runs out.

GAME FEATURES: The game features a fun and simplistic method for resolving solitaire combat tactically, rules for Heroes that can make an impact on the outcome of battles, and lots of colorful game counters. If you enjoy movies like "The Four Feathers", "Khartoum" or "The Light that Failed", you will enjoy this game.

name: Asrus: Zodiac
description:
The stars have not been seen in the night sky for some time. Hereupon brave explorers sought the stars disappeared. You need to compete with other explorers and seek more constellations than them. Let’s go to seek quickly~ But, be careful not to collide with other spaceships!

[Goal]
Gather as many constellation cards as you can. The player who gets highest score wins.

[Game Play]
ASRUS: Zodiac is a ‘simultaneous action’ game, so there is no order to play. In each turn, every players play a card from hands. You should play face down not to show to others. After all players have played, open the cards at the same time.
1. Make the closest distance!
Only one player can get stars(cards = points). For this, you need to approach to the destination as close as possible. Basically who makes the closest distance will get stars - ‘Distance’ means the
gap(absolute value) between the number of your card and the destination.
2. Avoid collisions!
But notice, you should avoid the collision with other spaceships! Even though the closest distance, if several players have made same distances, they all collide.

[Game Ends & Scoring]
After several turns, when you used up all cards in hands, the game ends. Scoring is as below, and the player who gets highest score wins.
1. 1 point per a constellation card you acquired.

+ 1 bonus point per a set of 4 colors (red, blue, green, and brown)

2. 2 points to the player who has the most energy (if tie, 1 point to each.)
3. Bonus points to the player who has the great explorer prize
But! The player whose spaceship has no energy cannot return from the exploration. 0 points!


This game is second edition of ASRUS, it has the same basic system with ASRUS but there are spaceships and no glass stones - a little more strategic.

name: Kumite: King of the Dojo
description:
In this fast-paced training and combat game you can choose your character, choose your moves, then battle to become the King of the Dojo! Kumite: King of the Dojo provides excitement for up to 6 players.

You start off as a lowly white belt, knowing only basic punches and blocks. Each turn you unlock more and more advanced Martial Arts techniques. You can customize your knowledge, pick the techniques that work for your strategy, and combine different Martial Arts! When you think you're the strongest, declare yourself King of the Dojo! Can you hold on to the throne in this exciting king of the hill style card game?

This edition includes 6 different Martial Arts styles:
Karate Boxing Crane Taekwondo Judo Muay Thai

Box contains 288 cards, two 6-sided dice, over 100 tokens for tracking, and Instructions.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Monopoly: U.S. Navy
description:
The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the U.S. Navy

Overview of Monopoly
Players take the part of land owners, attempting to buy and then develop their land. Income is gained by other players visiting their properties and money is spent when they visit properties belonging to other players. When times get tough, players may have to mortgage their properties to raise cash for fines, taxes and other misfortunes.

Game play
On his turn, a player rolls two dice and moves that number of spaces around the board. If the player lands on an as-yet-unowned property, he has the opportunity to buy it and add it to his portfolio or allow the bank to auction it to the highest bidder. If a player owns all the spaces within a color group, he may then build houses and hotels on these spaces, generating even more income from opponents who land there. If he lands on a property owned by another player, he must pay that player rent according to the value of the land and any buildings on it. There are other places on the board which can not be bought, but instead require the player to draw a card and perform the action on the card, pay taxes, collect income, or even go to jail.

Goal
The goal of the game is to be the last player remaining with any money.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Refuge
description:
In the apocalypse, you are your own worst enemy.
This is a lighthearted game about THE END OF THE WORLD RUN FOR YOUR LIVES IT'S DINOSAURS EVERYWHERE.

WHEN IT'S YOUR TURN:
1. Play a disaster.
2. Move some cubes around.
3. Draw a new card.

WHEN IT'S NOT YOUR TURN:
1. Sit patiently and weep for a dying world.
2. OR INTERRUPT THE APOCALYPSE WITH A HERO.

WHEN IT'S OVER:
For each card in your hand:
1. Score 1 point for each Normal Cube in the city shown
2. Score 2 points for each Special Cube in the city shown
3. Score 3 points for every Hero Card you're still holding onto.

There, now you can run around trying to dodge the apocalypse. You're fully prepared. Don't get your hopes up. We're all dead.

...Oh, you're still reading. Okay, look. You'll always have five cards; each card has a city on it. Each turn, you're going to play one of those cards--which destroys that city's population. At the end of the game, however, your score will be based on the populations in the cities shown on the cards in your hand at that point.

In other words, you're moving populations towards the same cities you might destroy. The solution? Pick a few cards in your hand and try your best not to play them; move populations to those cities (we could call them...um...refuge cities) and try to avoid destroying them.

The only problem is, sometimes you can't help but play those cards. If you're not careful, you'll wind up sacking one of your own refuge cities. Pay close attention to what your opponents are doing and try to avoid their disastrous card plays. Or better yet, try to secretly benefit from the moves they make: figure out their refuge cities, and save those cards in your own hand!

The deck also includes six Hero cards, which are shuffled throughout; you can play them on an opponent's turn to prevent the disaster they were trying to deploy. When the third Hero appears, the game is over and you score your points. It sounds cool, but the Heroes may actually just enslave us all--because isn't that the inevitable flow of power evolving in a post-apocalyptic wasteland anyway? ISN'T IT ALL POINTLESS?
categories: American West, Deduction, Horror, Humor, Party Game, Territory Building, Travel, Zombies
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Stock Holding, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Hounds of War
description:
Hounds of War Mk. II is a update to the original standardized skirmishing miniatures rules system which allows the players (with maximum flexibility during the CREATION phase) to be able to take ANY 25-30mm figures, assign them the game values the players WANT, and be able to bring them into play. With Hounds of War Mk. II you will be able to pit World War II Nazi Storm Troopers against your favorite Goblin Hoards, or even Star Wars© Storm Troopers!

This is a stand-alone set of rules, so no other rules are necessary for play. In addition, you WILL need your own miniatures, a LOT of 10-sided dice (d10), marking chits, 3D terrain, rulers marked in inches, and your imagination to play this game.

Instead of being a "you-go-I-go" turn sequence, an initiative deck is used and cards assigned to individual units to determine when units perform actions are performed in a turn. This creates a fast paced game in which players are constantly active.

Hounds of War Mk. II is the culmination of many post convention evaluations, fan suggestions, and clarifications. Inside you will find many clarified and expanded rules, as well as prebuilt armies, a campaign system suggestion, a victory point system, counter sheets, and much more. We thank all of you who have taken an active part in the growth of this system.

name: Mutology
description:
Mutology is a brand new strategy card game that transforms players into Mutologists, bioengineers obsessed with creating extraordinary creatures in their laboratories. Players will fire Radiation cards at their Specimens, and depending on what combinations of Radiation they're exposed to, Specimens will turn into one of two unique Mutants. Some Mutants are hyper aggressive, others have defense mechanisms, and some manipulate the way you or your opponent can play the game! You collect Research Points at the start of each turn for every Mutant you have in play, and the first player to 5 points wins.

Players mutate their Specimens by firing one of three kinds of Radiation, (Alpha, Beta, and Gamma Rays) at their Specimen cards. Each Specimen card comes with a unique ingredient list called "mutation requirements." Alone, Radiation cards give perks to the Specimen such as boosting their Power or Stability. Whenever a Specimen has met one of its mutation requirements, they would mutate into the corresponding Mutant card, which would wait outside of play until this moment.

Apart from Specimens and Mutants, player can build Devices like the Electric Coil and the Transmogrifier, or use Procedures like Brainstorm and Devolution. Lab Assistants like the Medic, Technician, and Researcher can lend their talents to you throughout the game as well. There are two zones of play in which cards can be placed: the Field Zone and the Lab Zone. These cards behave differently in each zone, so Mutology games always have a bit of tactical placement strategy involved.
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Tile Placement

name: Impact: VelkÃ¡ Morava â 1500 let kÅesÅ¥anstvÃ­ ve stÅedu Evropy
description:
Expansion set of archaeological card game Impact (2014). Dedicated to the archaeological exposition called "Great Moravia - 1500 Years of Christianity in Central Europe".

The expansion adds a new set of playing cards (18 new cards) including a new card type called written sources.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game

name: Doraemon Bingo Pop
description:
Doraemon Bingo POP is a different kind of bingo game. This game can be played in two versions: The easy version: Doraemon Bingo, or the strategic version: Doraemon Bingo POP.

The Differences are the following:

In Doraemon Bingo, each player takes his/her own board. In Doraemon Bingo POP put all game boards together and all players share the board.

In Doraemon Bingo, only yellow cards are used and each player takes 2 cards in his hands during the game. In Doraemon Bingo POP, all the cards are used and each player takes 3 cards in his hands during the game.

In Doraemon Bingo, all players place a ring on their own board when a player plays a card. In Doraemon Bingo POP only the player who played the card places the ring.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: Wild-West
description: The goal of the game is to capture the opponent miniatures (cowboys or indians). The players start with 6 figures from their camp. They can set up barriers on certain marked spaces to hinder the movement of their opponents. Figures are captured, if an opponent figure gets on the same space. Captured figures are imprisoned in the camp of the capturer. They may be freed if a figure of their color reaches this camp. The winner is the player who has captured the most opponents when when the first player has lost all his figures (short version) or the player who captures the last remaining opponent (long version).
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: F$HSPIES?PWRPANIC!Z
description:
You are in control of a country’s secret service agency. Your task is to use intelligence to influence your government to take wise decisions. The trouble is, enemy spies have infiltrated and are influencing your government into taking less wise decisions!

There are four possible decisions a government can take, each represented by a development track with 10 spaces. The tracks are:

• Economy: Increases income of coins.

• Military: Increases number of spies you have.

• Science: Makes more cards available.

• Culture: Means capturing enemy spies is easier.

The game is won by being the ï¬rst government to reach the end of any of the four development tracks.

2-4 players, 20mins per player.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Worker Placement

name: Imperium Chronicles: Fleets at War â Fighter Wing
description:
Fleets at War: Fighter Wing is a spin-off of the tactical combat game Fleets at War! While F@W! featured battles between giant capital ships, Fighter Wing focuses on fighters and other small craft as they engage in dogfights among the stars.

Note: You do NOT need to own Fleets at War! to play Fighter Wing.

The IMP System
Fleets at War: Fighter Wing uses the IMP System to reduce the number of die rolls necessary during play. All other calculations are done by referencing a chart of two opposing attributes (ex. Damage vs. Armor) to find a result. The goal of this system is to speed up play and allow for large-scale battles.
categories: Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Anti-Social
description:
Anti-Social: The Anti-Pawn Placement Game

The Anti-Social, pro social game about playing with your friends, more then they play with you.

In a world of games where it’s easy to win, and victory is all about claiming as much space on a board as possible, In Anti-Social, the point is to do just the opposite. Occupy as little space on the board as you can. Develop negative personality disorders, or force others to play against themselves, but keep yourself off the board.

In this game you do not want to place, or have your pawns placed on the board. Each turn players may play up to two cards (Anti-Social Behavior), and must place one pawns on the board.

Once the board is filled, the game is over. Player with the least amount of pawns on the board wins.

name: Kamara
description:
Kamara is code-matching strategy game for two to eight players. You play the role of a spirit, or diwa, attempting to influence someone within the chamber of their mind. Each diwa has a different color that evokes a different emotion.

The object of the game is to alter the game tiles to match the yellow kamara card you possess. Each time you do so, you gain that card. The first player to match three yellow kamara cards wins.

name: The Case
description: A memory bluffing deck-building game. You are a detective using your memory to solve a cold case. Other detectives are observing you closely and are possibly tampering with evidence. Can you present the best case amongst your peers and catch the serial killer?

name: RingWyrm
description: Players take turns appeasing the local dragon by offering sacrifices for it to eat in RingWyrm, a trick-taking card game with room for negotiation. Players attempt to predict how may "tricks" they are going to win by placing bids. However, players can mess with other player's bids, changing them by playing certain cards. This ability to "prick" a players bid adds a social element to the game. Players might beg or attempt to broker deals with other players to prevent their bids from getting tampered. When it comes to RingWyrm, it isn't enough to be good at trick-taking. You also have to be a charismatic.

name: Total Control Racing
description:
A fast paced action packed motor racing board game based on the Australian V8 Supercar series.

Simulating all the realism of V8 Supercar racing, players will need to manage all aspects of their car, know when to use fuel, push hard and jostle for position risking damage to the car. Successful management of fuel, engine condition, tyre wear and brakes is necessary to win the race.

Players must first setup their car correctly. A wise choice is needed, because once the car is setup, it cannot be changed! Each setup will determine how fast the car can move around the circuit for each gear. Careful analysis of the circuit will help decide the correct setup.

Drivers then qualify for pole position and then race begins.

During the race each driver decides what gear the car should be in for their turn moves as per their chosen setup while making some important race winning (or losing) decisions:

Should I use extra fuel now and push hard?
Should take this corner faster than recommended and wear my tyre quicker?
Will I be able the slow down in time to take the next corner?
How confident is my driver right now, do I have enough confidence to avoid any nasty instances?
Do I need to pit this lap or can make it around one more time?

name: Mighty Armies: The Dark Elves
description:
Mighty Armies: The Dark Elves is an army book supplement for the fantasy game Mighty Armies by Rebel Minis. This book contains army lists, scenarios, and campaigns to play the dreaded Dark Elves in the world of Zatariel. You will also need a copy of the core rulebook, Mighty Armies. The Mighty Armies core rulebook contains everything you need to know to play Mighty Armies fantasy battles and to play any of the armies in this book.

So enter the darkness... adventure awaits!

name: Labyrintheus
description:
The King is looking for adventurers to fill his ranks of champions, an elite fighting force charged with protecting the King and doing his more “hands on” work.
In an attempt to weed out the weak from the application pool, the King conscripted the Royal Academy of Magi to construct a magical labyrinth. Loaded with deadly traps, vicious monsters and other contestants, you must live long enough to escape in order to become one of the chosen few. One of the Kings Champions!

Labyrintheus is a brand new dungeon survival card game that introduces a unique Persona Card System where you compete against you fellow party members to defeat Monsters and Avoid Traps while collecting Gate Stones. Gate Stones are used to activate the portal to the outside world.

One of the things that makes Labyrintheus unique is the persona card system. When you chose a character to play, you will have their persona card. More of a tile than a card, you use this for your inventory system and to track your health. Treasure cards collected in Labyrintheus are equipped by placing them along the appropriate edges of the persona card. And once you die, flip the persona card over to reveal your stats and abilities as an undead servant of the King. If you can't win, why should anyone else?!?

name: Celebrity: Race to the A-List Board Game
description:
The ultimate celebrity board game.
Race your family and friends around the celebrity board, collecting fan club members along the way. The first person to finish with at least one million fans wins.

Sing, dance and act tasks with celebrity trivia, impersonations and fun celebrity challenges.

Pink squares are celebrity trivia.
Blue squares are Which Celebrity am I? questions.
Green squares are celebrity impersonations.
Orange squares are various celebrity tasks and rewards.
Sing / Dance / Act / Media and Talk Show circles are performing tasks.
All cards are either winning or sometimes losing fan club members. First person to the finish with at least one million fans is the winner.

Further information is on the website www.giveitagogames.com.au
categories: Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Singing

name: Cold Infinity
description:
Cold Infinity is a tabletop ship-to-ship space combat game, focusing on small engagements at the tactical level.The Main Rulebook and the Ship Systems Book (abbreviated SSB) provide all the rules and tables required
to create and play in virtually any space-faring science fiction universe you can imagine.

name: Battle of Capua
description:
Part of the Roman Empire and home to many of the infamous Gladiators of the age, Capua became hotly contested in 212 BCE. In this quick card driven game for 2 to 4 players, you take on the role of a General trying to grab control of the city. In order to win, you will need to build a strong army and best your opponents through six battles.

The game is played over three phases. First, you draft cards to build you army and amass gold. Then, you use the gold to purchase battle upgrades via an auction. Finally, you pit your army against the armies of your opponents, trying to gain control of the six different districts of Capua. Each district you control makes your army that much stronger. In the end, the player who controls the most, and the most powerful districts will reign supreme over the city.

name: Cartrollen
description:
You are going to cry!

Cartrollen is a fast paced racing game where the players compete aggressively to be the first to finish a racing adventure that takes place all across the world, thus composed of different road types, where events and attacks occur and objects might be used.

The adventure track consists of 10 randomly selected road segments with different characteristics, like jungle, swamp or highway, and the players need to race to see who is the first one to get to the end.

A player, in his turn, throws 2d6 to get Action Points that can be spent in either buying or playing cards, travelling to the next road segment, repairing their car or refuelling. When travelling, fuel is spent. Cards can either be objects that you can update your car with, attacks to other players, special cards like "counterattacks" or general events that can be thrown to other players (or yourself) so they happen to them, either good or bad.

name: Mortal Portal: D.A.V.E.
description:
A wacky game of semi-controlled movement. Play cards to gain goods, but watch out that may send you into a teleportation wall! Teleport too many times and you might be found outside the ship.

You are Dur Mur a problem solving Astronaut ready to "ready the ship". D.A.V.E. the evil acronym computer is shutting down the human support systems. Stuff like... Air... and the equal Librium gravity are shut down. D.A.V.E. is now abusing the gravity system to throw you around the ship in order to stop you from doing anything productive.
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Tiny Stellar Empires
description:
Stars are born and die. Great empires rise and fall. Does your civilization have what it takes to stand the test of time?

Tiny Little Empires is a fast card game, easy to pick up and have fun with friends.

The game is played over a series of turns in which each player lays down cards in front of them. These cards have special abilities, bonuses and victory points that make the game unique each time.

The goal of the game is to have the most victory points at the end of the game.

name: Thieves of coins
description:
Chance and Strategy for the whole family!

This game is about trying to place more money in your bank than your opponents!

Rules are simple and the game is easy to play. At the same time, game is fun to play over and over.


The Thief steal from one's bank.
The Banker steal cards from one's hand.
Exchange hands if you dare!
If you have the King in your hand, stop your attacker! Unless he has a King too!


Strategically play your Action Cards or your Coin Cards! Make sure to be the last player to play!

name: botNET
description:
bot·net - "A network of private computers infected with malicious software and controlled as a group without the owners' knowledge."
In botNET, Hackers compete for notoriety and power by building the largest and most powerful network of computers. Mastering botNET requires careful planning, strategy, and a touch of game theory.

The game is broken into five actions where Hackers:

Scan the Internet (draw deck) to download new Nodes (cards),
Connect the nodes to the network on the table
Mine encryption keys that can unlock new Nodes
Hack nodes by moving an Avatar to the node and using the keys.
Recruit ‘whitehat’ or ‘blackhat’ hackers to your side.


Each Node has a Type which determines what it does as well as a security level that shows how hard it is to hack and where in the network it is allowed to go.

Each node type is associated with a shape:

Miners (Triangle) - Computers that crunch numbers to generate encryption keys.
Storage (Square) - Databases that store nodes or encryption keys.
Applications (Circle) - Programs that enhance specific actions.
Botnets (Hexagon)- Hackers earn street cred by connecting new nodes to these networks.


The color of a Node determines its Security Level:

Home (Blue) nodes are small systems owned by individuals.
Commercial (Green) nodes belong to small and medium businesses.
Cloud (Orange) nodes are located in the data centers of giant multinational corporations.
Government (Red) nodes belong to a national Government and are very difficult to hack.


Cards in the network must respect the security levels. For instance, Home nodes may never be directly connected to Cloud or Government Nodes without a Commercial Node in between.

A hidden war is being waged between two hacker groups: the Freedom Foundation, whose membership includes altruistic Whitehat hackers, and the Cracker Coalition, which is made up of ruthless Blackhat Hackers.

Street credit, or “Cred” is a crucial currency in the Hacker world. In botNET it is represented by White or Black glass tokens that indicate if the Cred is ‘Whitehat’ or ‘Blackhat’. Connecting nodes to Botnets earn Cred from one of the two hacker groups. One earned, Cred can be used to the Hackers advantage by acquiring contacts and issuing exploits.
Contacts are shadowy individuals that will assist you but may switch allegiances at the drop of a hat. Contacts have secret knowledge that can make hacks easier and will pay you if you can gain control over the Nodes they desire. Unscrupulous rivals may turn informant and report Contacts to the police. Who will keep their mouth shut and who will rat?
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Zombie: Shambling and Hungry
description:
Zombies. Mindless, shambling, and existing only to feed. Much like you and your friends. It’s a 56 card game which is actually two games in one.

Zombies: Shambling and Hungry: Use these zombie cards to simulate a zombie outbreak at your next party or family gathering! Sit yourself down for a fast and furious game of zombie dominance!

In this game each player takes the role of a shambling and hungry zombie, trying their best to get to the front of the zombie horde where they’ll have the best chance at a juicy bite from one of those still living. Each zombie player will do their best to rid themselves of other nearby zombies (game cards) by pushing them back or foisting them onto other zombie players.

The first player to break away from the horde by discarding all of their cards wins! Play begins with the player to the left of the dealer. That player must play one card into a central pile. This card will be one of four suits: Hearts, Splatters, Biohazards or Palms. This card determines which suit will be the active suit. The first player ends their turn by drawing cards from their draw pile until they have 5 cards in their hand.

If a player cannot play a card of the same suit as the active suit, they must pick up all of the cards in the central pile and place them on the bottom of their draw pile, ending their turn.

Each card has also has a number on it. If a player has 2, 3 or 4 of a kind, which includes a card with the active suite, they may play all of these cards. The card with the active suit must be played last so that the active suit is still the top card on the central pile.

If a player ever has all 5 cards in their hand with the same suit (i.e. all biohazard), on their turn they may place all five cards on the central pile and then draw five cards (if possible) into their hand.

The first player to discard all of their cards in their draw pile and hand has successfully outdistanced the horde and wins! Watch out for Infected cards though, they're hard to get rid of!

Zombies: Infection: Each deck of Zombies: Shambling and Hungry comes with 20 Infected cards. They are used to infect your friends, who in turn can and should infect other friends! Use as many Infected cards as there are players. One person becomes Patient Zero, and starts off with 8 Infected cards. They then try to infect others! A the start of the game, only Patient Zero can infect other players. All players should agree on a time limit for the game – it can be an hour or until the end of an event

name: Rallye Monte Carlo
description: The players have to get from their starting point (Berlin, Madrid, London or Rom) to Monte Carlo. The first player to arrive in Monte Carlo wins the game. Movement ist determined by cards (F.X. Schmidt "Super Mini Rallye-Autos Trumpfquartett). Each player gets 5 Cards. At his turn the player reads the data on his first card, indicated on the space his meeple stands on, and compares it's value with the other players. The player with the highest value moves 4 spaces, the second 3 spaces, the third 2 spaces and the fourth 1 space on the game board. When player gets on a red space hes has to change the car and uses the next card.

name: CIA: Sniper
description:
In CIA Sniper, you are a newly trained agent specializing in sniper ops. Your new job is to work with foreign
agencies and travel the globe tracking down International Terrorists, Drug leaders, Dictators, Assassins, and
all-around bad people. You are given a steady stream of contracts to develop your skills and earn money. In
the beginning you will travel the globe accepting the easier contracts for quick cash and skill development.
As your skills increase you can accept more difficult contracts which will earn you even more money and skill
points. Each contract provides specific locations and target parameters that will take you across the globe
into different cities, earning huge payoffs for success and more aggressive tactics from Enemy agents. Don't
stay in a specific city too long or these enemy agents will track you down and try to capture you.
Each new contract will confront you with many decisions: what type of weather will you have to deal with,
how long do you have to complete the contract, what location will the shot take place at and how much will
you earn when the contract is completed.
With the completion of each contract, you will earn money and valuable skill points which you can apply to
the six skill sets to help increase your abilities to become a proficient sniper. As you fulfill contracts you
become more of a threat and more enemy agents seek you out. If you stay alive long enough and don’t get
caught, you will eventually complete enough contracts and earn enough money to become the greatest sniper
in the CIA
categories: Card Game, Dice, Political, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Trapped
description: Place crates (dice) on the board, slide your marker and kick crates horizontally or vertically to block your opponent from moving before you yourself end up trapped by a wall of crates.

name: Football
description: You get 4 attempts to score before possession goes to the opposing team. Roll multiple dice secretly against your opponent to run, punt or tackle. Score a touchdown and try for the extra point or 2-point conversion. Strategically use your re-roll points to gain an edge with bad rolls. Score points to win. Game ends when you run out of re-roll points.

name: Tennis
description: Tennis is played on 2 boards (included). Roll 1-3 dice to serve and try to land on your opponent's board. Sum the points but watch out - fault by missing the board and roll to return the ball after your opponent serves. Play doubles for big group fun!

name: Dodgeball
description: Roll to move your players around the board and to defend. Then pass and throw the ball to eliminate members of the opposing team. You'll be pleasantly surprised by how well the mechanics of this game emulate a real game of dodgeball!

name: The Turkey Run
description:
It’s a race against the hunter. Your turkey must reach the house before it gets caught. To win, your turkey must also be the biggest one.

How to play
A game is composed of 3 runs of 6 turns or less. A turn is played by having each player rolling the dices and try to obtain a sequence.

Turkey
To make your turkey advance or gain weight, you must throw the dice and get specific sequences.

The most difficult sequence will grant you with more bonus to advance or fatten your turkey. However, the more your turkey fattened more difficult it is to move forward.

How to roll the dice
To advance or fatten your turkey, you must play one of the 6 following sequence:

Six even numbers (ex : 2,2,4,4,6,6)*Six odd numbers (ex : 1,3,3,3,5,5)
Total ≥30 (ex : 4,5,5,6,6,6)
Total ≤12 (ex : 1,1,1,2.3,3)
Straight (1,2,3,4,5,6)
Six of a kind (ex : 5,5,5,5,5,5)


To play a sequence:

Roll the 6 dices
Reroll one or more dices (optional)
Reroll one or more dices a second time (optional)


How to advance or fatten your turkey
If you don’t succeed in rolling a sequence, your turkey doesn’t move.

If you have played a sequence successfully, you can move and/or fatten your turkey.

If you pickup a crystal, you gain bonus weight or movement.

End of a run
The run ends if one of the following happens:

The hunter reaches the house (6 turns completed).
All turkeys have been caught by the hunter.


At that time, points are calculated by each player (even the ones that were caught by the hunter) as follow:

Turkey’s weight: 1 points per dot.
Crystal: 1 point per bonus (+1 to +4).
Turkey safe in the house: 3 points.
Biggest Turkey in the house: 3 points.


Note that the finish order does not matter.

End of the game
The game ends after 3 runs. The winner is the player with the most points.

name: ShadowSea: The Stygian Depths
description:
From the publisher:

Our group was not prepared for the horrors of the Stygian Depths, as we have named the accursed lands below. Naught else but the world of the damned did we find, with creatures that defied all laws of nature, adn where the very earth seemed to tear at our souls. THe catacombs penetrated deep below, twisting and turning until emerging into a nightmare city of demons, a place long forgotten by the civilizations of man an donly whispered of by decrepit sages searching through the crumbling ruins of the underlands. . .
Journal entry-Johan Kurtz, 1681

Expansion rules for the ShadowSea miniatures game allowing for dungeon crawls.
mechanics: Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: QuestFour
description:
A 3 dimensional board game with a twist.

Components
• 32 pieces (16 red & 16 black) 4 pieces of concentric telescoping tubes that are 4 elevations
• 4 tiles
• 1 instruction booklet

Object
Get four of your pieces in a row - vertically or horizontally

Set Up
Place four tiles into a square & choose which color pieces you want.

Starting the Game
Black goes first then alternate turns

Winning the Game
To win players must get four of their pieces in a row at the end of a turn as described below:

a) the same size in a row - there are 4 size but all must be the same size.
b) graduated from smallest to largest in a row
c) A pyramid
Stalemate:
If all piece have been placed and there are no winners

Tie:
If at then end of a turn both players have 4 in a row

BASIC PLAY - learning the mechanics
Player 1
Place a piece in any available square.
• Both players may use any square when placing pieces but pieces of the same size may not occupy the same square.
• Each square may hold up to 4 pieces and may include both colors.
• Pieces may not be moved or removed after being placed in a square
At the end of player 1's turn they must turn a tile clockwise or counter clockwise 90 degrees.

Player 2
Place a piece in any available space. At the end of player 2's turn they must turn a tile clockwise or counter clockwise 900.

A players wins when 4 of their pieces of the same color are in a row as shown above at the end of a turn

Once you are comfortable with this level of play then move up to Intermediate level to build strategy & spatial skills.

INTERMEDIATE PLAY– Thinking ahead
Player 1
Place a piece in any available square.
• Both players may use any square when placing pieces but pieces of the same size may not occupy the same square.
• Each square may hold up to 4 pieces and may include both colors.
• Pieces may not be moved or removed after being placed in a square
At the end of player 1's turn they must turn any tile clockwise 90 degrees.

Player 2
Place a piece in any available space. At the end of player 2's turn they must turn a tile clockwise 900.

A players wins when 4 of their pieces of the same color are in a row as shown above at the end of a turn

Once you are comfortable with this Intermediate play move up to Advanced to really challenge your strategy & spatial skills.

ADVANCED PLAY– pulling it all together
Arrange tiles into a square with letters in clockwise alphabetical order.

Player 1
Place a piece in any available square.
• Both players may use any square when placing pieces but pieces of the same size may not occupy the same square.
• Each square may hold up to 4 pieces and may include both colors.
• Pieces may not be moved or removed after being placed in a square
At the end of player 1's turn they must turn a tile A clockwise 90 degrees.

Player 2
Place a piece in any available space. At the end of player 2's turn they must turn a tile B clockwise 900.

Play continues placing pieces and turning tiles in alphabetical order (A, B, C, D) until a player wins; there is a tie or a draw. A players wins when 4 of their pieces of the same color are in a row as shown above at the end of a turn. You can use Quest Notation to record the game for analyses and replay later.

INDIVIDUAL / COOPERATIVE PLAY
A deck of cards provides the patterns you are to recreate
Level of difficulty is show like these cards.
player or group tries to match the reference card.
You place a piece in any available square.
• You may use any square when placing pieces but pieces of the same size may not occupy the same square.
• Each square may hold up to 4 pieces and may include both colors.
• Pieces may not be moved or removed after being placed in a square
After placing the piece you must turn a tile clockwise 900. in alphabetical order (A, B, C, D). Place a piece and turn tile a, place a piece and turn tile b etc…
Continue until you match the card.

name: Reindeer Races: The Lone Reindeer
description: Reindeer Races: The Lone Reindeer is an expansion that adds special abilities to each of the teams of reindeer. It also makes the game playable for 2-5 players by adding a fifth "team" composed of a single pawn that is played differently from the other teams.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play

name: Hoodrats
description:
A game of inner city crime, drug dealing, and gang violence.

Hoodrats is a hybrid Euro-Trash game containing 44 meeples, 15 dice, 88 tokens, 36 cards, a fat wad of paper money, and a bag of oregano (fake weed) which is the first player marker.

Players begin with 5 "Hustlers" and a special gang ability available only to their gang, and place them on the 4 locations to buy drugs of 4 different kinds, 14 spaces to sell drugs on, the Funeral Home, where they can recruit the family members of killed gang members, the bail bondsman where they can purchase a bond to release incarcerated gang members, the gun store where they buy guns, or their 'Hood, where they can initiate drive-by shootings against enemy Hustlers who are on corners to sell drugs.

Hustlers are placed in turn, where players may place up to three Hustlers at once on most locations. Once all of the players' Hustlers are placed, each player, in turn, then activates one space and performs the actions which that space allows. Each corner allows players to sell one drug based on the icon shown, and may roll the Dope Dice (3 custom dice) in which depict a different drug on 4 faces (Weed, Meth, Coke, Heroin), a wild card on the fifth face, and finally, an arrest warrant on the sixth. For each face rolled players may sell one matching drug token.

If 2 gangs occupy a corner, the person who activates the corner initiates a robbery. No matter who wins, someone's going to the Emergency room, with one Beat Down token for each opposing Hustler that robbed him.

At the beginning of each round, a card is drawn and has either a persistent effect which lasts the entire round or a one time effect, as well as that night's prices to buy and sell drugs.

At the end of a set amount of rounds, the richest gang wins.
categories: Mature / Adult, Print & Play, Territory Building
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Plotypus
description:
Plotypus is a collaborative storytelling card game; it enables any group to tell an epic story with a riveting plot. Players draw setting and character cards for inspiration and narrate the story through eight pivotal chapters.

During the Story phase, players advance the plot a few sentences before rotating narrator. The Storybook cards help focus the plot.

At the start of the game, the hero is stuck in their normal routine. As the story continues, the players explore the hero's adventure and clash with the villain. The game ends when players have completed the storybook deck and described the hero in their new routine, having triumphed over their antagonist.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Kovas
description:
Kovas is a competitive medieval strategy and tactics board game inspired by the Lithuanian legend of the Iron Wolf.

In Kovas you'll lead your armies using an innovative fog-of-war mechanic and turn system. The units start off rested (face down & hidden from your opponents) and stacked into armies of three units (small, medium, & large). They can be revealed to activate abilities, surprise with counter effects, and to gain additional movement points via force marching. Each round consists of players taking turns commanding their units and armies with a limited number of command tokens. At the end of the round all units that have not been commanded are flipped face down and are considered rested again. Play continues until one player captures a majority of an opponent’s units or captures their king.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Medieval, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Survivors
description:
That inevitable zombie apocalypse has finally come, and you find yourself holed up the city with a ragtag group of survivors.
