You've heard rumors of a safe house out in the countryside, but you need to find a vehicle capable of getting you there and chances are not all of you will make it. Work with the other members of your group to survive and collect vehicle components, but when the time comes you may have to make a choice: do you run away and leave them for dead, or do you stay true to your word and risk being betrayed yourself?

Survivors is a semi-cooperative card game in which players search for vehicles they can use to escape while dodging ravenous zombie hordes. On each round, players are secretly dealt 2 zombie cards each and must choose the best action card in their hand to deal with them. This is where you are faced with an interesting choice: do you help the other players and risk betrayal, or do you betray them yourself and leave them to die?

At the end of each round you will get to search the city for items that help you survive and escape, but even if you find a way out, you may not be able to take everyone with you...
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Rails of Kered
description:
Rails of Kered is a card game in which the players battle for railway supremacy! Collect engines, build railway lines, and run the rainbow express to gain points, but be careful! Your opponents will send breakdown trains and steal your engines to stop you from succeeding. Defend your railway lines, and steam your way to victory on the Isle. Get the most points and become the Head Station master of the Isle!

NEW Instructions, NEW lightened artwork, NEW Tokens! Just released April 2016!

• Game design by Heather Michel - https://www.thegamecrafter.com/games/rails-of-kered
• Art by Rebecca Norman - http://rnormanmt.com
• Special Thanks to Derek and Miriam Michel, for game development and box text and Douglas Michel for Instructions write up.

Rails of Kered © 2014 Michel Home Publishing

Website: https://heather7086.wixsite.com/railsofkered

name: Pursue and Plunder
description:
Avast Ye, Matey! The song has been sung! The Pirate lord has called for a gathering at his stronghold to elect a successor. It could be you. All that is needed is for you to answer the calling and bring your ships and crew to the stronghold. But beware, there are pirates everywhere. And what pirate can resist an easy treasure, even if it is already on your ship? There are merchant ships to raid but be watchful of the Royal Navy. Be the pirate with the most prestige at the end and you are unanimously elected the pirate king. That is the pirate rule. He who has the most gold makes the rules.

Overview:
Pursue and Plunder is a strategy game for 2 to 4 players. Each player controls 4 pirate ships in an alcove of 9 islands which each hold various artifacts, items and gold. The players will plunder the islands, establish strongholds and attack merchant ships and each other in order to gain the most prestige. Players also have to avoid the Royal Navy that is patrolling the alcove. The game is played in rounds and at the start of each round each player distributes 7 crew tokens (4 regular crew, 2 drunken sailors, 1 captain) on their game mat secretly behind a player screen. Once all players are ready the screens are removed. Each player then takes 2 actions to move, attack opponents or plunder islands. The success of the actions depend on how the player distributed their crew tokens for the round. Artifact items and experience tokens provide additional flexibility to the actions being performed. At the end of the round, players may upgrade
their cannons and sails, establish strongholds, and train crew to improve their chance of success in future rounds. Players are competing to be the first player to earn a set number of prestige points depending on the number of players. Prestige points are earned by finding artifacts, collecting gold, establishing strongholds and defeating merchants and the Royal Navy.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Set Collection

name: Ingress: The Relic
description:
A turn-based board game for 2-6 players based on the video game Ingress.

Theme:
In the middle of the 19th Century, a trade ship named Niantic departed Connecticut and set sail on a voyage to the Orient coast. Some say the Niantic was smuggling Opium out of China and Indonesia but while that may have been a side deal worked out for its journey home, the merchant vessel Niantic docked in Whampoa Harbor and unloaded a precious cargo.

A relic, uncovered during an archeological dig hundreds of years earlier, was transported to Whampoa Harbor and buried there.

The relic laid buried in the area that later became known as Whampoa Garden until approximately 150 years later, when in 1999, Liu Fan excavated it and working in combination with a group of international researchers, went to work unlocking its secrets.

Ingress: The Relic casts up to six researchers in roles to unlock the undiscovered power of exotic matter. Researchers take turns placing portal tiles on the relic board and activating them with resonator tokens. Connecting three fully activated portal tiles can lead to an even greater power by creating a control field.

Gameplay:
The game plays out on a grid-based board with tiles in a manner somewhat reminiscent of Go or Chinese Checkers. Winners use a combination of action cards and tile placement to earn action points. The player to first reach 50 action points or the player with the most action points at the end of 10 rounds wins.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Print & Play, Territory Building, Video Game Theme

name: Warring Kingdom: Eastern Men
description: First expansion to Warring Kingdom; adds many cards that focus on advanced gameplay options.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Secret Unit Deployment, Set Collection

name: Ardor
description:
Have you ever wanted to build from scratch, fine tune and then live your most erotic, intimate and romantic desires?

Ardor is an unique strategy sex card game that enables you to do it.

Compete to collect cards which will be the building blocks for your fantasy.

Win the first part of the game to decide which fantasy will come true.

Mix and match the collected cards for an experience filled with Ardor!

Enhance the cards for activities to take a naughty twist which you control at all times. You have complete freedom on enhancing the cards and you can even level up each card differently every time you play the game for a highly customizable experience.

There are thousands of possible combinations allowing you to craft unique and unforgettable experiences!

Ardor has two parts:
Win Your Fantasy is a card game in which you win points and cards.
Live Your Fantasy Create your fantasy using what you've won to control all the details of what will happen next.
mechanics: Acting, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Trick-taking

name: Warlord: Saga of the Storm â The Temple of Eternal Flame
description: This Adventure Path Set (#3) contains 110 cards in two different pre-constructed decks; one is Free Kingdoms and the other is Deverenian.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Tiki Challenge
description:
"Get ready for adventure as you cross a deep chasm on rickety swinging bridges! The trail to the tiki is easy to follow if you know how to use blends and digraphs--but watch out for broken boards!"

Tiki Challenge is an educational game to teach children words using blends and digraphs. Players have a series of tiles displaying blends and digraphs. Each player spins a spinner, moves along a track to a space with a partial word, and must use a tile from his/her hand to complete the word. A player who is unable to complete a word must return to the start. The first player to reach the tiki at the end of the track wins.

name: Archer: Fast and Loose
description:
Archer: Fast and Loose is a free print-and-play card game of insults, getting the upper hand, unfortunate phrasing and "sploosh" based on the hit TV show Archer.

Each game round is comprised of two phases: the ISIS Phase and the Missions Phase. In the ISIS Phase, players secretly choose a room in the ISIS intelligence agency building to move to, with each room conferring a different bonus to the players located there. During the Missions Phase, players vie to get placed on and then succeed at their preferred mission, with each mission requiring different skill sets, such as Smarts, Guns, Booze and even Sex!

Each player also has a deck of Agent cards characterising one of the main personalities from the show, with different wacky and zany take-that effects for each: have players shout "woo-hoo!" when they join a mission due to Cheryl's "Boarding Party", or have the Sterling player play with his fingers in his ears thanks to his cruel mistress, Tinnitus.

Through succeeding at missions and playing cards, players can gain Sploosh, and the player with the most Sploosh at the end of the game wins!
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Formula Freeway
description:
Out run your formula rivals on the city freeway!

The excitement of the arcade racer comes to the table top. 2-6 players compete in open wheel racing on the city freeway. Reach top speed, dodge traffic, pass junctions and turbo in a battle to tame the Formula Freeway!

Infinite rolling freeway with switching double-sided boards.
Moving freeway traffic vehicles ready for overtaking!
Card strategy racing with no dice!

GAMEPLAY
Race by selecting High or Low gear followed by drawing one of two movement cards from the race deck. Decide to play this card or to move another racer in the hope that the second card will be better strategically. Win by driving through all freeways of the race distance and crossing the finishing line first.

FEATURES
Switchable double-sided boards creating an infinite rolling freeway and randomly closed junctions with traffic cones. Selectable gears, turbos and moving traffic vehicles. Choose to race less junctions or tackle the full distance of all five freeway junctions.

INCLUDES
Two double-sided boards, six race cars with turbos, ten traffic cars and two cones. Race deck of 40 movement, 6 gear, 5 distance & 3 result cards.
mechanics: Modular Board, Point to Point Movement

name: Cannibal Squares
description:
A Fight or Flight game where you fight to survive, build an SOS sign and try to live till rescue. Be careful, night brings Cannibals.

Collect food, resources, weapons and tools while you fight (or flee) for your life in the Cooperative (or Solo) Survival Game.

In this epic survival game you play the role of a crash survivor who washed up on a beautiful island. Without food or water you need to collect food, build tools, craft weapons and gather stones for an SOS sign. I mean, how else is rescue going to find you?

While wondering the island you learn a few things, food is scarce, resources and equipment are hard to come by and nothing is what it seems.

As night falls and a breathtaking sunset fills the sky, a weird mist seems to roll in off the coast. From the mist you see these things emerge. Human like figures stagger, crawl and sprint towards you. You don't know what you are about to face, do you fight or flee?

Game Play

Players take turns moving their pawns around the island and using action points. They use these points to collect food and resources. Using a crafting system you can make weapons and tools to help you survive.

The game is played over the course of a Day and Night rounds. In the day rounds, You can wonder freely, but when night comes around, your actions are limited as well as your movement. With the setting sun, you will also start spawning numerous Cannibals around the island on specifically designated spawning locations.

You can either fight Cannibals by rolling die, or run around them. By day break, cannibals will disappear into the forests until next night fall. As you finish your SOS sign, the island and cannibals will become more aggressive. Get off the island quick, but don't leave yourself vulnerable.

The goal of the game is to get off the island alive and with as many people as possible. It is possible to be left behind, but the game is easier if you work together.

name: Deck of the Dead
description:
When Hell is Full, the Cards will Walk the Earth...

Deck of the Dead is a Zombie Survival card game for one, two, or four players.

The object of the game is to put five different types of "survivors" into play, and to get them to survive up to five scenes that represent encounters with different types of zombies.

In order to do this, players must get the typical tools of survival into play, in order to bolster their survivors' chances to defeating the zombies.

The first player whose survives make it through five scenes wins the game.

name: Election
description:
Election is a game of campaign strategy for the whole family. Plan your campaign, win votes and battle for victory in each State. Win enough Electoral College votes to become the next President of the United States. Careful campaign planning and management of campaign funds is required to defeat your opponent. Conduct polls to discover which candidate each state favors. Be sure to read the Daily News card and watch out for the "Dark Horse" candidate that can steal your Volunteers.

To play Election, players first decide on how many “days” there are to the election, with each round of play being one turn. On each turn players can either Fundraise or Campaign. When campaigning, players can spend money to recruit volunteers, hire consultants, buy ads, travel, or conduct a poll. Volunteers, consultants and ads can be traded in for Votes, which are then placed on individual states. Each state also has a “poll”, which determines which party the state favors (e.g. Republicans +3). Players can pay to conduct polls to see the polling information. On Election Day, the outcome in each state is determined by the votes placed on the state plus the polling. The winner of each state is awarded all of the Electoral College Votes for that state. The winner of the election is the player with the most Electoral College Votes.

Election is fun for the whole family and will have your children jumping up and down thrilled to have just become the next President of the United States.

name: AEROSTAR
description:
Do you have what it takes to build an airline empire? Find out with AEROSTAR.

This fun filled game will keep you coming back for more. AEROSTAR is an easy to learn yet dynamic game. Do you have what it takes to hire, invest, and build the best airline? If so you will be crowned the next AEROSTAR. Let the bidding begin!!!

Players start a round of play by bidding to hire an executive for their airline. All Executives are not made equal so choose accordingly. Then each player has an opportunity to invest in airline tech stocks, fuel stocks, or several other money making opportunities. This segment is also bidding based so budget wisely or your opponents might outbid you and steal your investment opportunity.

Next Players buy their Airplane Fleets. This segment is Auction/Bidding based also. There are 4 airline tech companies providing 30 different fleet types, all with different money making abilities and fuel efficiencies. After this, Players must buy fleet fuel from the market in order for their fleets to operate. This market price is constantly changing so be careful when building your airline fleet or you might lose money.

Players then have the opportunity to buy Terminals in Major and Minor Cities in a start to creating their Airline Empire. By creating connections players earn money if their fleet can fulfill the connections and have the fuel to do so. Each round ends with connection and investment profits being paid.

A yearly market card is drawn that effects the next rounds game play. In AEROSTAR there are market fuel increases, Union Strikes, and many more global impacts. You never know what might happen in the adventure of becoming the next AEROSTAR.

name: Reindeer Races: Super Reindeer
description:
Reindeer Races: Super Reindeer Expansion adds a new reindeer with super powers. The Super Reindeer races as a single deer (instead of a team) and has special tokens which increase his thump power. He is not afraid of the Yeti and does not leave the track when landing on a Yeti space.

This is the second expansion for Reindeer Races. When combined with the Reindeer Races: The Lone Reindeer, the game can be played by up to 6 people.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Five Armies
description:
5 player pvp free print & play generic fantasy wargame by Neontek. In Five Armies, five kings compete to dominate the battlefield during twelve rounds of dice rolling combat. Uploaded to BGG as a 2014 Christmas gift for the community. (Includes original game map, 18 cards, and rulebook in the files section.)

Gameplay summary: Player versus player, so alliances are possible, but not mandatory. The game ends after 12 rounds. Each round, someone draws the event card. This card influences gameplay and turn order. Players move their orc, goblin, dwarf, elf, or human army across the map to attack opponents. Players win victory points by dominating the most terrain per round.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid

name: Legends and Lies: Promo Pack 2
description: This is the second Promo Pack for Legends and Lies. It consists of one additional Anomaly card, Ace Reporter, plus three additional Expedition cards, Devil Bird Identified! which is the promo for the Mysterious Locations Expansion and the two card Jackalope Expedition set which is the promo for Cryptid Hunters. Beside the game cards, the Promo Pack comes with a Credits/Expansions card.

name: Battle Skies
description:
For thousands of years the Dragons have ruled the world of Erien, but their domain has become infested by other races - Elves, Dwarves, Fae, and worst of all, humankind. The dragons have done what they can to slow the process but the humans bred like rabbits and the other races weren’t much better. It didn’t take long for the inevitable conflict over resources to begin and the dragons soon realized that they didn’t stand a chance against the combined strength of the new races. Those dragons that survived are now forced to fight amongst themselves for food, a home, breeding grounds and anything else they want. They have taken to the skies to battle it out with others of their kind, knowing only the strongest amongst them will survive to become the lords of the skies.

Players take on the role of Dragons as they battle against one another in the skies over Erien. Their old sense of pride and self-importance mean that they must have the best feeding grounds available even if it means fighting other dragons to get it.

The game uses a system where at the start of each turn the players plot out their dragon’s movement for the turn. Movement is truly 3D allowing the dragons to fly up, down, left, right or any combination of directions. Elevation is tracked with stacking tiles and turns are shown with angled tilt blocks. Then with a bit of luck as their plans unfold on the game map their plans will have put them in to a better position to strike either with breath weapon or claw.

name: Follow the Yellow Brick Road
description:
Let’s go see the Wizard of Oz

Based on the public domain book The Wonderful Wizard of Oz is a children’s novel written by L. Frank Baum and illustrated by W. W. Denslow.

Follow the Yellow Brick Road is a tabletop game. It is a bit like Candyland but with some strategy.

Help Dorothy, the Lion, the Scarecrow and the Tin Man in their quest to find the Wonderful Wizard of Oz. Follow a path with many challenges and stunning surprises in this fun game for 2 to 4 players aged between 9 and 99 year old (more or less).

Play a game in 15 to 30 minutes with a balance mix of chance and strategy. Will you be the first to reach the Emerald Castle? Will the Good Witch of the North help you with Silver Shoes? Beware of the Wicked Witch of the West and her Winged Monkeys. The Wonderful Wizard of Oz will bring more surprises.

name: Steam Spy: Shadows and Circuits
description:
Imagine an intricately mechanized clash of spy against spy, introducing corporate espionage to a Steampunk world of industrial revolution; filled with all of the plot twists and thrills of both genres. That's the world of Steam Spy, a Steampunk themed role playing card game for 2 players. Steam Spy unites the character development and narrative of a traditional role playing game with the intimacy and spontaneity of a card game.

Players create a unique secret agent character who works for one of the organizations designated to protect and serve one of the world’s largest corporations. Then they face off against an operative from an opposing secret industrial organization in a one on one battle of wits, luck and exotic steampunk gadgets. One player instigates some kind of espionage mission while the other does their best to stop them.

Players collect, play and draw cards that help create a series of exciting encounters that ultimately determine if the instigating antagonists succeeds at their mission, or the determined protagonist chases them down and defeats them; players then advance their spy character, or create a group of secret agent specialists in preparation for the next face off against operatives from opposing agencies and corporation.

Steam Spy: Shadows and Circuits allows you to investigate the mysterious as an agent of the Shadow Bureau, the Eastern European agency that helps protect the lines of transportation developed by the Transylvanian Transportation Company. Or you can join the Dragon Sect and take advantage of the marvelous technology developed by its parent company Orisaku Artificials.

name: Take care of Polar Bears
description:
Take Care of Polar Bears is an environment friendly serious game. It offers an opportunity to experience the ecological crisis of Polar Bears indirectly. It gives you the educational values as well, which means that can help to not only understand the causes of climate change problems better, but also know how to deal with them by role-playing in this game.

This board game is played by using cards, not dices basically and the board can be made up with 17 glaciers tiles arbitrarily. There are 54 cards including moving cards, recharging cards, and hunter cards, etc. Players can have three cards in their hands and they use one of their cards in each turn. By using these cards efficiently, the player who reaches the finish tile at first will be a winner. This board game can be used in anywhere, for example, schools, cultural organizations, business training, when someone needs an education about environments or ecological values.
publishers: Vision Works Publishing, Vision Works S.Korea

name: Steam Spy: Action and Adventure
description:
Imagine an intricately mechanized clash of spy against spy, introducing corporate espionage to a Steampunk world of industrial revolution; filled with all of the plot twists and thrills of both genres. That's the world of Steam Spy, a Steampunk themed role playing card game for 2 players. Steam Spy unites the character development and narrative of a traditional role playing game with the intimacy and spontaneity of a card game.

Players create a unique secret agent character who works for one of the organizations designated to protect and serve one of the world’s largest corporations. Then they face off against an operative from an opposing secret industrial organization in a one on one battle of wits, luck and exotic steampunk gadgets. One player instigates some kind of espionage mission while the other does their best to stop them.

Players collect, play and draw cards that help create a series of exciting encounters that ultimately determine if the instigating antagonists succeeds at their mission, or the determined protagonist chases them down and defeats them; players then advance their spy character, or create a group of secret agent specialists in preparation for the next face off against operatives from opposing agencies and corporation.

Steam Spy: Action and Adventure gives you the opportunity to leap into action as a Federal Agency agent, a straight shooting provocateur using the advanced weaponry of North America’s
Renningson and Sons Firearms. Or you can join the Unified Alliance and use the resources of Navidad Pharmaceuticals to keep you and your team safe in the most thrilling adventures in the wildest environments in the world.

name: Legends and Lies: Headlines and Hoaxes
description:
The world of cryptozoological creatures, strange phenomenon and mysterious locations seem hopelessly entangled with the world of the tabloid press. This expansion introduces the tabloid headlines that can work for or against cryptozoologists' expeditions for various unknown creatures.

This expansion adds a third draw option to Legends and Lies which is to draw from the Tabloid Headlines which is made up of four face up cards. When cards are drawn from the headlines they are immediately replaced. At the end of each round any cards left in the headlines are added to the Tabloid pile. Headlines and Hoaxes expands Legends and Lies to up to five players.

name: Steam Spy: Intelligence and Propaganda
description:
Imagine an intricately mechanized clash of spy against spy, introducing corporate espionage to a Steampunk world of industrial revolution; filled with all of the plot twists and thrills of both genres. That's the world of Steam Spy, a Steampunk themed role playing card game for 2 players. Steam Spy unites the character development and narrative of a traditional role playing game with the intimacy and spontaneity of a card game.

Players create a unique secret agent character who works for one of the organizations designated to protect and serve one of the world’s largest corporations. Then they face off against an operative from an opposing secret industrial organization in a one on one battle of wits, luck and exotic steampunk gadgets. One player instigates some kind of espionage mission while the other does their best to stop them.

Players collect, play and draw cards that help create a series of exciting encounters that ultimately determine if the instigating antagonists succeeds at their mission, or the determined protagonist chases them down and defeats them; players then advance their spy character, or create a group of secret agent specialists in preparation for the next face off against operatives from opposing agencies and corporation.

Steam Spy: Intelligence and Propaganda includes allows you to become one of the top spies for M5, the Western European agency that works to collect and protect information for the massive Encyclopedia Englandia Corporation. Or you can join Das Wort, one of the original “reality defining” news organizations. In order to present the world as they want it to be seen (in addition to selling papers), their mysterious organization, the Diamond Club, is often accused of creating events of world significance.

name: Medieval Arms Dealer
description:
War can be profitable. Five medieval factions are at war. It's your job to keep them supplied. Visit the Medieval underground and acquire weapon contracts. Use your wagons, actions and gold wisely. Be quick to finish the contracts before your enemies do!

The medieval underground contain contracts of items to purchase. These contracts will contain 3, 4 or 5 items. There are 10 different weapons to shop for. Your playing hand starts with five items that you need to match to the contracts in the dungeon market. Don't worry if you are missing an item, you can always trade in the market if the item is available. Purchase new wagons to hold more items to complete more contracts. Watch out for the events that will destroy the market and steal your weapons! Plan your 2 actions per turn well and you will profit from war! End of game bonuses await you if you are clever enough to sell to the same faction or to all of them.

The game works very well with 1, 2, 3 or 4 players. A 2 player game is about 20 minutes.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: Sergeants D-Day: US Glider Assault bundle
description:
The US Paratroops had a heavy infantry component in the form of Glider Troops. They are armed differently from the Parachute Soldiers. Contains: 12 soldiers, 288 cards and 11 panels.

2 US Paratrooper Sergeants trained as specialist Assault Leaders armed with M1 Garand and M1A1 Thompson. Each Sergeant comes with 32 cards, and 1 - marker set.

2 US Paratrooper BAR Assault sections each with 2 trained specialist Assault Gunners armed with one BAR and 1 M1A1 Thompson. Each section comes with 32 cards, and 2 - marker sets.

2 US Paratrooper Grenadiers sections each with 2 trained specialist Assault Grenadiers armed with one M1 Rifle Grenade and one M2 Carbine with Rifle Grenade. Each section has 32 cards, and 2 - marker sets.

1 US Paratrooper Scouts section with 2 trained specialist Scouts armed with one M1 Rifle and one M1A1 Thompson. The section has 32 cards, and 2 - marker sets.

1 Glider Assault Tactics module

1 Paratrooper Infiltration Tactics module

name: Go Bananas!
description:
A print and play variant of the classic game Pit! Designed to be used for 4 or 5 small groups as a warm up activity for an event promoting fair trade.

The game is played in four or five small teams of 3-5 members.
Jigsaw-style pieces of bananas with pictures of banana producers around the world plus letters spelling out the word FairTrade are shuffled and distributed evenly. Teams then have to swap pieces with other teams (always one for one, two for two etc) to collect all the pieces with the same picture. However, trading is done by shouting the number of pieces you want to swap. You only know how many pieces you are getting, not what picture is on them. Teams then have to assemble the pieces into a complete banana. Whichever team does this first wins.

name: WWII Assault: Tactical Skirmish Combat
description:
WWII Assault is a miniatures based war game for two or more players that recreates the gritty man-to-man combat of WWII. This game focuses on the small unit tactics used by fire teams and infantry squads emphasizing their differing weapons, training and determination. The unique mechanics in WWII Assault make it an intense action oriented game in which the battle can change in an instant.

Each player typically controls a squad or several squads of infantry. Each figure in WWII Assault is individually based and represents a single soldier that can perform independent actions from the rest of the squad.

WWII Assault is designed to allow players to recreate any small scale engagements from the first battles in Poland, throughout the European Theatre and into the last days of Berlin.

The WWII Assault Field Kit is a digest sized tri-fold rules booklet with an interior pocket that is packed with all the rules, weapon sheets, squad cards and more that you need to get started playing the game. There are two scenarios included in the Field Kit and more will be added to our website along with squad creation rules.

Players may use any scale of figures (suggested figure sizes range from: 15mm to 54mm) in their collection.

With the basic rules kept to under 5 pages, WWII Assault is quick and easy to learn and yet it offers:


A unique card-based initiative system that changes each turn.
A game system where higher skilled soldiers fire better than lesser skilled soldiers.
A game system where the differences between weapons not only exist but they are integral to the game.
A game system that can be realistically and enjoyably used in any squad level scenario from WWII.
A game system that tracks multiple levels of wounds, morale, suppression and other unit impairing conditions on the battlefield.


All this and more in an intense action oriented game where a single soldier can bring you total victory or drive you towards defeat.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Å umska slagalica
description:
Šumska slagalica (Forest puzzle) is game for younger players. On the board is presented forest with many paths. Along the paths are parts of 5 different mini puzzles. Players roll the dice and move figurines along the paths. When figurine comes to marked field that is next to piece of puzzle - player takes the part. The player needs to bring figurine to the place on board where puzzle is assembled. After that, the player moves the figurine to another part of puzzle ... The winner is the player who first successfully compile puzzle.

The game can be played on way that is not competitive. Here all the players help each other in assembling the puzzle.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Wizard's Mansion
description:
Wizard's Mansion is a game of search of objects, missions and deduction. It is played on a mobile board of 36 tiles that moves and turn. The tiles are drawn in his two faces. Every face represents a floor of the Mansion.
The players will have to enter the Mansion to look for magic objects and to go out with then for one of four doors. But in the Mansion it has soldiers that will prevent your mission and the Wizard who will be able to turn you into a ghost.

Descripción en Español:
Wizard's Mansion es un juego de búsqueda de objetos, misiones y deducción. Se juega sobre un tablero móvil de 36 baldosas que se mueve y giran. Las baldosas están dibujadas en sus dos caras. Cada cara representa un piso de la mansión.
Los jugadores deberán entrar en la mansión para buscar objetos mágicos y salir con ellos por una de las cuatro puertas. Pero en la mansión hay soldados que impedirán tu misión y el Hechicero que te podrá convertir en un espectro.

name: Pasaporte Ecuador
description:
The best mix of Trivia with multiple choise answers, mimic, sounds, challenges and more fun stuff about Ecuador with unique handcrafted tokens made with tagua "vegetal ivory".

The goal is to become the Embassador of Ecuador by being the first to seal the passport.

It´s a unique way to gather again with your family and friends while you travel around your country.
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Singing

name: Zone Of Action
description:
Zone Of Action is a fast-paced dice and card-based close combat strategy board game for two to four players ages 14+ which can be played in any of four available game modes (One basic and three advanced). Your intelligence, agility and resourcefulness will all be tested in this urban close combat environment game.

You are the commander of a six-man elite combat force team, and you have been sent to an undisclosed "Zone Of Action" in the Middle East to control the evolving threat by insurgent groups who have seized important territory during the last past months.

Complete special urban close-combat missions, while killing opponents and avoiding being killed by bullets, grenades, landmines or airstrikes. Accumulate kill-streaks and obtain advanced weapons to eliminate your opponents.

A combination of dice, perk cards, kill-streak attacks and strategic thinking are used to move your team members within a small remote middle east village map where obstacles such as buildings, walls, military vehicles, antipersonnel landmines and others add complexity to the terrain you will move in to complete your missions.

name: Bitten: An Erotic Game for Couples
description:
Do you love sexy vampires? Then this board game is for you! The board game is designed to be easily printed on 8.5”x11” paper or cardstock (or A4, for those not in the USA). You will need two regular decks of cards and dice (which you can find at almost any dollar store) for a night of sexy vampire fun with your partner. Fangs optional.

There are two major aspects to gameplay. The first aspect to the gameplay are the individual rooms (setup something like Clue). There are six rooms, each with a different theme. Within the rooms, players perform sexual or erotic tasks in order to earn poker cards. At the end of the game, the player with the best poker hand wins (although, if played correctly, both players really win ;) )

The second aspect of gameplay is the movement from one room to another. Players don't just move, they must perform various foreplay acts in order to successfully move their game piece.
mechanics: Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Gunship Platoon: A Solitaire Game of Helicopter Gunship Combat in Vietnam (1965-1973).
description:
GUNSHIP PLATOON is a Game where you are a Commander of Platoon of Helicopter Gunships (the Gun Platoon) in a Helicopter Assault Company in Vietnam. Your Goal is to manage your aircraft and Complete a Campaign consisting of a series of Missions and score as many Victory Points (VP) as possible to assist the war efforts. Campaigns can be Short (8 Missions), Moderate (12 Missions), or Long (16 Missions). Combat is based on an innovated Initiative system that allows a single player to manage many units and gives the feeling of lining up a strafing run.

GAME FEATURES: GUNSHIP PLATOON features many colorful game counters of a large variety of Units including UH-1D and UH-B Hueys, OH-6 Cayuse and AH-1 Cobras, US Aero-Rifle Squads, VC and NVA infantry, M-113s, M-48s, T-54s, PT-76s and others.

GUNSHIP PLATOON can be found at the following URL:
http://www.berserkergames.net/

name: One-Legged Zombie Chicken
description:
A necromantic ritual in a chicken farm marks the beginning of a horror night full of dreary cackles. In ONE-LEGGED ZOMBIE CHICKEN, players try to use the resources of a trapped population to escape from hungry zombie chicken. Use the characters' powers, get rid of the chicken cards and be the survivor of this gallinaceous apocalypse.

In each turn, a player must make three actions in sequence: 1) replace their hand until acquiring 6 cards; 2) throw out a card on the discard pile; 3) play a character card and activate its power. It's important to highlight that chicken cards can NEVER be discarded. Each character activates a special power setting the gaming dynamics.
categories: Card Game, Horror, Humor, Party Game, Print & Play, Zombies

name: Striptease
description:
Spanish Trivial clone with striptease theme.
2-6 players.
Cheap materials.

name: Shapes & Stuff
description: Shapes & Stuff is a tile laying game for two players. The aim of the game is to build shapes by connecting your colour’s dots using two or more tiles in the effort to beat your opponent in a “tug-o-war” of points.

name: Godzilla Rampage: Invasion of Gamera Supplement
description:
Expansion 3 X Invasion of Gamera for Godzilla Rampage board game. Includes NEW and updated Kaiju cards, 2 NEW Scenarios and Special Ability Cards for Kaiju.
Free print and play just like base game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play

name: Superfy
description:
Superfy is a fun-filled, fast-paced, action-packed card/dice table-top hybrid game of heroic proportions.

Become a hero (or villain), gain unique super powers, lay down some super moves and then roll it out to see who will emerge victorious and win the Event (first to 3 wins the game).

Simple to learn and quick to master, Superfy holds that perfect balance of strategy and luck to keep things interesting, but still give the underdog a fighting chance.

It's simplicity and super-powered theme lends itself well to family gaming - even teaching kids in a relaxed way both counting and assessing probabilities.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Humor
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: DICE Football
description: DICE Football uses 4 10-sided dice and can be played with 1 or 2 players. Each player chooses a team and the two players decide who will be the home team and who will be the away team. DICE Football combines team match ups and individual match ups to give you the authentic feel of real football. In DICE Football you will get to choose how much control over play calling you want or how little. DICE Football offers three unique different gaming experiences. You can jump right in with the basic version of the game, you can use all of the additional advance rules, or you can pick and choose which optional rules you would like to use.

name: Escape Plan 9
description:
All The Cheese of 80's B-movies converges into one alien zombie infested town. And you must survive!
Its time for a survival game that doesn't take it self so seriously! You are a mercenary dropped into the overrun town of Wellsville. Your only ticket out is by retrieving survivors, the antidote, murdering Zombies and Alien Enforcers (or your fellow players)and GETTING TO THE CHOPPA!!.
categories: Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Zombies
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Anarcade Deck Building Game: Raster Red
description:
Travel back to when the arcade was a dark, smoky den of iniquity.  Fame and respect can be bought for only a quarter if you have the skill.  Once you fill up the high score table on a game then you are the king!  Put a quarter on the glass and challenge the champ if you think you've got what it takes! 

Anarcade is a deck building game of stack control. Players play starter cards to earn Coins and buy better cards from the Game stacks. They can also use Coins to Score on the Games. Each player attempts to fill up a High Score table to take control of that game before an opponent can do the same. Once a player takes control of a stack, other players can't touch it. The winner is the first player to control 3 games.

The Raster Red set is tuned for fast action and features pixel based, raster screen, retro arcade goodness! Combine with any other Anarcade set to expand the game to up to 4 players.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Las Ovejas y el DragÃ³n
description:
La ovejas y el Dragón ("The sheep and the Dragon") is a game for children.

In a fantasy world, where many sheep escaped the castle, shepherds have the mission to find them and bring them back home. In the adventure they will find objects that help and enemies with which to fight. In turn, the great and almost invincible dragon roams throughout the kingdom seeking to steal sheep and take them to their cave.

The aim of the players is to recover the sheep, bring them back and avoid at all costs the dragon, though, if some brave shepherd manages to defeat the dragon in combat, it will be consecrated the great savior and win the game immediately.
If no defeat the dragon, the pastor with more points (for accumulation of sheep) has wins.

The game mechanics are simple, each turn pastors must perform two actions, move and look. To move roll a die (1d4), after completing its movement they can search the area where it is located and there, stealing a card from the appropriate deck as the area will reveal your search. The areas investigated can not be investigated in the future. In his search you will find objects, events, enemies and sheep. Every sheep has a value in coins (VPs), the pastor must take the sheep back to the castle to win the reward.

As a bonus action, if a pastor result is an 1 in movement (as in the Talisman), after completing their actions must "activate" the dragon.
When the exploration markers are finished, or when the dragon is defeated, the game ends.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Paragon Tactics Arena
description:
Paragon Tactics Arena is a turn-based tactical board game, created by G. Scary T., where 2 to 4 players lead characters in an arena fight to determine who the best tactician is. Between so many enemies and obstacles, your characters cannot move freely. You must command them through action cards you draw during the combat, making the card management even more challenging than the battle itself. Each player must control his/her party strategically to better use each character’s powers and abilities and defeat all enemies. Do you think you have what it takes to lead your characters alive through this deadly skirmish?

Game Aspects:
- Easy Learning
- Tactics and Strategy
- Card Management
- Changeable and Customizable Board
- Replayability
- Easily House Ruled
- Expandable (more characters on the way!)
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Steamer Wars
description:
“It is both the duty and the tradition of the Royal Navy to engage the enemy wherever there is water to float a ship”

A “fast play” game covering primarily the naval engagements on Lake Tanganyika during the First World War, and also any number of real and hypothetical small craft actions during the period 1910-1920. Written with 1/600 scale models in mind, their inspiration being the models designed by North Head Miniatures of New Zealand.

As well as the tactical rules, a set of mini campaign rules is included. Actions fought using the tactical rules tend to be short and sharp, and so the campaign is easily playable in a few evenings, or as a club project for a day.
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War I

name: Ãrets Grek
description:
You've waited, you've struggled , finally , you have been nominated for the Grek of the year. You may be one of the 36 nominees , but the odds are still on your side, you are still you !

In the game, players take turns to draw a card and read aloud and announce who is the Grek of the year till a player has been named the Grek of the year.

Swedish description:
Som du har väntat, som du har slitit, äntligen har du blivit nominerad till årets grek.Du må vara 1 av 36 nominerade, men oddsen är ändå på din sida, du är ändå du!

I spelet turas spelarna om med att dra ett kort och läsa tillkänna årets grek till att någon spelare har blivit utsedd till årets grek.

name: Zonga: The Epic Zombie Conga Line Showdown of Ultimate Destiny of the Apocalypse
description:
In a post-apocalyptic world where Zombies are bored, two teams of Zombies face off for the annual Epic Conga Line Showdown of Ultimate Destiny.

Two teams of Zombies will be positioning themselves to create a conga line...the zombies will need to move wisely as their opponents line may cut them off, and they'll need to address their hunger for brains by picking up some while they conga!

Each turn, players place one of their Zombies onto a 6x7 board starting from the bottom row. Each slot on the 6x7 board either gives brains, or takes away brains. The first time a player places their Zombie into a new row, it costs them brains. The first player to have four Zombies in a row, wins. The board changes every game.

name: GameFactory
description:
In GameFactory, players lead successful computer game companies that try to create the next big hit. They must build rooms in their offices, hire staff and decide which project will be the next one to bring to market.

GameFactory is a worker placement game with a twist: players start with a small office and only a few options for their workers. They use funds to build new rooms with new capabilities and add them to their office, enabling new placement positions and new options. Players then use staff to build games or spend their work on creating other useful things that help them becoming the next computer game legend.

Game Factory is a game for gamers with over 150 cards, a market board, 45 wooden pieces and more than 100 cardboard markers. Two to four players compete in 90-120 minutes about who wins the most cash in the ever-changing computer gaming market.

name: Street Empire
description:
Players are drug dealers, hustling on the mean street corners to get enough cash to become above the law. Drug crews must manage many different resources, such as drug packages, money, reputation cards, and wanted level. Real estate is everything, so drug crews have to battle it out over who gets to sling on any given corner.

Street Empire is a worker placement game where each player has three workers, or Crew pawns, to place across any of eight different spaces, or Corners. Acting one at a time, each player places one Crew pawn on one Corner. When all Crew pawns have been placed, if two or more players place their Crew pawns on the same Corner, a turf war breaks out. Players also have a hand of cards, or Rep cards, which are used to win turf wars. Rep cards have a rating and an effect, both of which affect the outcome of a turf war.

All the while, the police are watching. They are keeping an eye on how many drugs the players are selling. When a player gains a Wanted chit, he or she must now pay an additional package or money chit when buying Immunity or selling packages (to pay off the dirty cops).

Players must plan carefully to coordinate their Crew pawns, their Rep cards, drug packages, wanted level, and money to gain just enough of an edge to win. The first player to acquire three Immunity points wins the game. The only way to gain Immunity is through a Corner, which costs money.
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Worker Placement

name: Storm Of Steel
description:
A centuries long interstellar war leaves survivors of the two factions stranded on a planet, fighting each other as well as internal foes and the two indigenous people of the planet.

Storm of Steel is a sci fi skirmish miniatures game derived from Shieldbash. Each trooper has a simple profile but they fight quite differently from one another. The activation system used in Shieldbash and Shieldwall gives fast turns with unpredictable swings of initiative. Leaders, cavalry, skirmishers, medics, comms, area affect weapons, exotic melee weapons and more are included. The Shieldbash system means figures don't simply trade die rolls until someone runs out of hit points; instead troopers move around the battlefield as they are pushed back or dodge of weapons fire, and infiltrators appear seemingly out of nowhere.

Four included scenarios give a variety of tactical objectives to fight over, and a campaign system allows linking scenarios into Tales, with fighter progression between them.

name: Tropes: The Horror Story Edition
description:
Tropes: Horror Story Edition the ever-changing party game of improvised storytelling and horror movie clichés. Tropes will quickly get the whole room laughing as you and your friends and family use the cards to tell a story using stereotypes from classic horror movies.

Will the Jock make it out of the Cabin in the Woods? What will the Camp Counselor find in the Wood Chipper? And what horrors are in store for the Prom Queen at the Abandoned Motel?

Tropes - Horror Show Edition is a cooperative story telling game. 2-6 players use story cards to create a hilarious horror story. When a player sets down a finale card, one of 12 characters meets their untimely demise. The player then claims that character card as a point, the player with the most character cards wins!"

"Tropes is for ages 13+ and can be played in about an hour. The great thing is that story cards can be played an infinite amount of ways, leading to stories that are always different

name: 8-Bit Gangster
description:
Step into the role of a mafia don in the midst of a brutal mob war. Employing an army of wiseguys and shady tricks, you must eliminate all the other mob bosses. The prize? Absolute control of the criminal underworld.

The game is played utilizing dice rolls and cards. Each player draws action and unit cards. The unit cards are used to take over property cards, where they can then attack other players' unit cards by rolling dice. Each unit has bonuses and detriments that will alter the roll. Each player can also play action cards to aid their attack or impede the other players. Well balanced between chance and skill, players can often come back from the brink of losing to win the game.

http://www.8-bitgangster.com/
https://www.facebook.com/eightbitgangster
categories: Card Game, Dice, Mafia, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That

name: Little Scrappers
description: The object of the Little Scrappers is to win tricks in order to collect Robot pieces, the person with the most powerful robot at the end of the game wins! Simple.

name: Formula Freeway: 4 Player Edition
description:
Outrun your formula rivals on the city freeway!

The excitement of the arcade racer comes to the table top. 2-4 players compete in open wheel racing on the city freeway. Reach top speed, dodge traffic, pass junctions and turbo in a battle to tame the Formula Freeway!

GAMEPLAY
Race by selecting High or Low gear followed by drawing one of two movement cards from the race deck. Decide to play this card or to move another racer in the hope that the second card will be better strategically. Win by driving through all freeways of the race distance and crossing the finishing line first.

FEATURES
Switchable double-sided mats creating an infinite rolling freeway and randomly closed junctions with traffic cones. Selectable gears, turbos and moving traffic vehicles. Choose to race less junctions or tackle the full distance of all five freeway junctions.

INCLUDES
Two double-sided mats, four race cars with turbos, ten traffic cars, two cones, gear & movement cards and rules.
mechanics: Modular Board, Point to Point Movement

name: Mountain Rummy
description:
Mountain Rummy is based on classic draw and discard Rummy style play which melds elements of Rummy 500 and Gin Rummy, along with many fresh play elements to create a game that strives to be more skill based and less luck based than other Rummy based games. Players will find that it's a poor idea to form a static strategy, since an opponent will undermine any one strategy if performed too often, creating a need for constantly adjusting strategy incorporating math, gambits, psychology and many other elements. Created by the strategy board game loving couple Keith and Luci Medlock, Mountain Rummy was designed to replace more complex strategy games while mountaineering with only a single pack of cards, a laminated instruction sheet and dry erase marker!

Here are the official rules:

MOUNTAIN RUMMY (2 Players & Standard Deck)

Deadwood: Non-melded cards in hand.

Card Values: A=1 or 14 (Deadwood=14), 2-10=Face Value, Jack=11, Q=12, K=13, & Joker=Wild (Deadwood=15). Suits rank in alphabetical order, Spades high.

Deal: Jr player shuffles, Sr cuts & Jr deals 1 card to Sr, then self. High card deals. Dealer shuffles, non-dealer cuts & 13 cards are dealt from top of deck in alternating fashion to form hands, starting w/ non-dealer. 1 card is dealt face up from top of deck to form discard pile & rest of deck is placed face down to form stock pile.

Set: 3 or 4 same value cards.

Run: ≥3 same suit cards w/ sequential value.

Meld: Set or Run placed face up in your play area. Joker can’t make run w/ duplicate cards & melded value can’t be changed.

Layoff: Placing card that adds to either player’s existing meld face up in your play area. If laying off on opponent’s melds, their melds may be reorganized.

Draw: Taking top card of stock pile or any card from discard pile. If discard pile card is drawn, it may not be discarded the same turn. If discard pile card other than topmost is drawn, any cards above it must be taken & it must be melded/laid off that turn.
Discard: Placing 1 card face up on top of discard pile, ensuring each lower card’s value is visible.

Knock: Discarding face down w/ Deadwood ≤ 10. Opponent may meld/layoff before scoring.

Base Camp: Discarding face down w/ 0 Deadwood (10 pt bonus).

High Camp: Melding/laying off all cards in hand (20 pt bonus).

Play: Non-dealer plays first. Turn begins w/ a draw, then melding/laying off (optional) & ends with a discard. You may end hand by Knocking, Base/High Camp.

Undercut: Non-knocking player’s Deadwood ≤ knocking player’s & value of melds/layoffs ≥ knocking player’s (30 pt bonus).

Summit: Ending hand w/ Base/High Camp w/o melding/laying off on previous turns (40 pt bonus).

Scoring: Standard pts awarded to players for value of cards in their melds/layoffs, less Deadwood. Player w/ most standard pts wins hand & deals next. Bonus points transfer to winner. Add all pts for each player to their previous total. Game won by hand winner w/ final score of ≥1000.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Math, Memory

name: Scourge of the Seven Seas
description:
Treachery on the high seas!

Weigh anchor and set sail in this strategic pirate game that puts you at the helm as you race to bring home the most treasure.

The Golden Age of piracy was no time for a weak captain. Pirates needed fast ships, strong enough to withstand a barrage of cannon fire. Tradeoffs between strength and speed, often times, weighed heavily in the outcome of battles. In the quest for riches, pirates would seek to plunder hidden treasures and the ill-gotten gains of other captains. Treachery, betrayal, and danger beset even the most cunning captain. Do you have what it takes to command your ship and pillage enough doubloons to claim victory?

Scourge of the Seven Seas is a competitive or cooperative game for one to six players, each commanding a pirate ship on the high seas. Captains travel in search of hidden treasure and ship upgrades while fending off attacks and bribery attempts. The first captain to claim twenty points of treasure wins!

The object of Scourge of the Seven Seas is to be the first player to deliver twenty points or more of treasure to their home port. You score points by taking turns moving your pawn between home port and an island full of buried treasures. At the start of the game you are dealt five cards which you use to determine the initial speed and strength of your ship.

On your turn you may search for treasure, deliver treasure to your home port, draw cards at a trade port, attack other ships, or attempt to bribe dock workers. As the game progresses, players may visit trading ports to draw additional cards to increase their ship stats. You can attack other player’s ships to plunder their riches or discard cards to bribe disloyal dock workers and steal the treasures at their home port. Attacking can be risky as you might become the victim; whereas sneaking into a home port and bribing would best be done with a fast ship for your escape.

There are many different strategies to win competitively. The goal in team or single player mode is for at least one player to gain twenty or more points of treasure before Davy Jones releases the Kraken. Each player chooses a ship from a fleet of six different ships (Galleon, Frigate, Man O’ War, Schooner, Corvette, or Sloop) with varying abilities. In cooperative mode, you and your team must do battle with Davy Jones as he tries to block you from delivering treasures. All the while, a doom clock counts down to Davy Jones becoming strong enough to release the Kraken on your team.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Duel of Iron: The Battle of Hampton Roads, March 8th and 9th, 1862
description:
Duel of Iron details the battle of Hampton Roads fought on March 8th and 9th, 1862. Union General George B. McClellan’s steady advance up the James Peninsula threatened the Confederate capital of Richmond, and a Union victory here had the potential of ending the war. A massive fleet of powerful Union warships anchored the northern army’s flank and protected their water-borne supply line.

On March 8th a strange looking Confederate steam ship, one that looked like a floating barn roof to a Union sailor who witnessed it, accompanied by other more conventional Confederate warships, sallied forth to do battle. The CSS Virginia, an ironclad warship built on the hull of the captured USS Merrimac, proved impervious to cannon balls fired from the Union warships and nearby land artillery batteries. Victory seemed within the Confederate’s grasp when action ended on March 8th, leaving two Union warships sinking and another badly damaged, with only slight damage to the Confederate vessels.

The fighting resumed on March 9th, but the Union ironclad USS Monitor had arrived during the night and its commander intercepted the CSS Virginia when it steamed out for battle. The battle between these two ironclad warships was violent, but ended in stalemate, and the Confederate’s ambitions were thwarted.
Although inconclusive in military terms, this first fight between ironclad warships marked a decisive turning point in naval warfare.

name: Escape Plan 9: Deluxe Edition
description:
All The cheese of 80's B-movies converges into one alien zombie infested town. And you must survive!

SO what makes this so 'Deluxe'?

Well its because it also includes the first expansion IT'S A TRAP!!! before its released separately. 40 more cards plus the New Trapping Dynamic AND ALIENS!

It’s time for a survival game that doesn't take it self so seriously! You are a mercenary dropped into the overrun town of Wellsville. Your only ticket out is by retrieving survivors, searching for the antidote and murdering the undead (or your fellow players).

Travel through the overrun town, gain access to buildings by drawing door cards, and collect Loot cards to find rewards. Use looted weapons to increase your attack rolls, defend against zombies, Alien Bio-weapons, Idiot Strippers and your fellow players.

Beware the Event cards as they change the dynamics of the whole board, and either help or screw everyone. Amass 10 survivor points by any means necessary and get to the choppa to win.

Gameplay involves rolling dice for movement and battle, and card pulls for reward, door opening and mass events. So much variety you'll never get bored.


Easy battle mechanics that allow you to collect zombies, or pick off other players,



Play as a zombie when you die and wipe out the other players to win alternately.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Zombies
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Pyrami-dÃ©s
description:
The goal of the game is to filled all the values on a pyramide using dice compbinations.

By throwing 3 die, choose 2 and add them up or multiply them up. Find the result on the pyramid and put a token on it. You must start by the bottom of the pyramid and climb up.

You get 3 wild values that you can use during a game to place a additional token on a vlaue of your choice (it must be a valid choice from the bottom to the top).

You get 3 chances to pick an unused dice from an opponent during the game.

name: In Your Teeth
description:
This is a simple game base on the "Take That" mechanic. The goal is to be the last player with at least 1 tooth.

It can be played by 2 to 4 players. A typical game will last 15 to 20 minutes. Players age recommanded is 8 and up. Younger players can play too!

How to play:
Use a d8 to attack one or more opponent by placing 1 to 8 small bacteria on their teeth. Use a d6 to try to clean your teeth. 1 point to remove a small bacteria. 2 points to remove a large bacteria. 3 points to clean a decayed tooth.

If you cannot remove a small bacteria, flip the card and it becomes large. If you cannot remove a small bacteria, flip the card and it becomes large. If you cannot remove a large bacteria, remove all bacteria and flip the tooth card and it becomes decayed. If you cannot clean a decayed tooh, remove the card from the game.

You get lucky if you get a crowned tooth. Opponents must the attack with 6 points to remove it.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Medical, Party Game

name: Nafetel: Merchants
description:
Nafetel: Merchants is a unique game where players will compete against each other to fill quotas from shipmasters eager to get back out on the sea.

In Nafetel: Merchants each player will play through a set of rounds in which they trade, bid, invest, gain victory points, and more. Each player has four sets of these rounds to fill however many quotas they possibly can then the shipmasters will leave with what they have or empty. This is called the ticking time bomb, where Shipmasters and Merchants alike both want the best deals in the quickest time possible.

Players will draw 4 Investment cards to begin the game, after that a specific number of quota cards will be placed in the middle of the players. Each player will play their rounds separate from the other players. They will decide if they wish to invest, bid, and/or trade their investments for new ones or invest them on quotas. The first player to fill a quota through either monopolising it, out bidding it, or quickly snagging it off the market will gain a victory point for that quota the filled.

name: Vegetable Race
description:
Vegetable Race is a racing game with varying point values given for finishing. Your primary goal is to manipulate your neighbors to finish based on your secret objective. Vegetable Race is played over multiple rounds and is anyone's game until the final round.

Game Play:
Each player selects a vegetable from the eight available (Carrot, Tomato, Bean, Pepper, Eggplant, Onion, Corn, and Lettuce) and takes the appropriate vegetable card and player pieces.
At the start of each race, each player is given a secret objective and dealt 2 playing cards. The secret objectives relate to yourself or your neighbors finishing, i.e.: "Finish any time after the person to your right. 3 pts", or "Finish Last. 4 pts."

On a players turn they draw a card then play a card. Or, they can use their vegetables ability. Cards move themselves or other players. Cards also allow you to play from another players hand, swap places, and more.
There is a single "Finish First" card that gives a player 7 points if they finish first with it in their hand and causes their opponents to lose 1 point.

Points for finishing in each race are awarded as follows:
First: 0pts
Second: 4pts
Last: 3pts
Other: 2pts

So, in the span of each race, you go from not wanting to finish, wanting to finish, then not wanting to finish again.

The race is run on a 10 space racetrack. After all players have finished, points are tallied on a separate score track. Play continues until a predetermined score has been met (20 or 30 points) or number of races have been run (3 is usually a good number to determine the top vegetable). Each race runs 5-10 minutes, more or less depending on the number of players.

When playing with 6-8 players additional rules and objectives are added to help speed the game along.

Vegetable Race Consists of: (subject to change prior to release)
54 Standard poker sized playing cards (10 Secret Objective, 42 playing cards, 2 rules quick reference cards)
10 Large playing cards (8 Vegetable Player cards, Race Track, and Score track)
18 Molded plastic pieces (2 of each Vegetable and two additional pieces for tracking starting player with 6-8 players)

The vegetables used in Vegetable Race are vegetables in the culinary sense. The designer is aware that some vegetables used are botanically fruits. Since a lot of different colored vegetables are the same color (Onion, Leek, Bok Choy, etc.) and/or look similar (radish, turnip, beet, etc.) the designer just went with what he thought would be the most amusing (and the name Vegetable Race had a good ring to it).

Vegetable Race is scheduled to be released on Kickstarter right now!!! Pledge now! Running now until August 26th.

name: BowTilz!
description:
BowTilz! is a fun new tile-matching game. Players nest tiles along 4 curved edges by matching colors.

Quick and easy to play with a nice challenge curve as players become more strategic in their game play.

BowTilz! can be played 18, 72 or 136 tiles, the more tiles the more strategy advance players can employ. Players are rewarded by receiving extra points and turns for matches tiles on multiple edges.

Great game for 2 players, also great for more - 2 players with the 18 tile set, up to 10 players with the 72 tile set, and up to 19 players with the 136 tile set.

name: Karma Crystals: Block Master
description:
Karma Crystals - Block Master - (KC01)
Dice-To-Card Matches Get You Through Your Karma Travels!

You can travel through life with good deeds or bad deeds, but karma will follow you either way. In Block Master, your best tactic is to collect that bad karma now and give it to your opponents to get the win. Use your Karma Crystal to block other players from moving through the positive karma path and win!

This 1st entry into the Karma Crystals game collection introduces many of the mechanics we use in all our games, including the Roll Off, Karma Crystals to share bad karma, monster elemental cards and dice matching, game end triggers and completion of the round prior to determining a win, playoffs using game win shards, and auto players. This game features the use of karma move and Block Trophy shards and FOUR monster elemental cards to start your collector’s deck!

Roll dice to work with the various monster elemental cards - monsters are the good guys and help you win! Determine how many karma moves you score per roll and collect your karma move shards, or pass on your no-match karma to another player by attempting to block one of three possible move scores to get a blocking trophy! If you get 11 or more karma moves, that triggers the end the game and a winner is determined at the end of that round!

In addition to the unique dice matching game mechanic, a unique auto player system is also used to facilitate up to EIGHT total players per game. The game also provides an easy way to track multiple game wins for playoffs in case you have more than 15 to 20 minutes to play. No paper score cards and pencil needed - just move and block trophy shards to track and build your scores, and of course, Karma Crystal to track your block attempts!

name: Filthy Mime
description:
It’s like charades if charades made a lot of questionable choices, got hooked on meth, and became sexually insatiable. One player draws a card and silently acts out the dirty word or phrase. Every one else tries to guess while trying not to shit themselves laughing. There are also wild cards with special missions and side games that will embarrass and delight.

There are games that cross the line, this game screws the line and give it the herp.

In the beginning, the oldest player in the group is named The Warden of Filth. The Warden draws a card and silently acts out the dirty word or phrase. The first player to correctly guess wins the round and holds onto the card. After each round, a new player becomes Warden following a clockwise or counter-clockwise direction.

Some cards have special missions and side games that will have you sharing your darkest secrets, arm wrestling on someone's back, yelling "penis," and learning more about your friends than you ever wanted to know.

name: Black Sands
description:
Black Sands is a Fantasy themed Tactical Skirmish Game. Players each control a class based hero, and the game comes with 4 prearranged and unique class decks though a draft mode is also available.

Gameplay:
The game is played on a modular hex grid map, and players use their deck of cards as their hero's abilities. Cards are used to defend your hero or to attack others, as well as special abilities.

The goal of the Black Sands is to be the last player or team left standing. It can be played as a free-for-all of 2-4 players, or as two teams of 2 players. Two games used together could expand the maximum amount of players up to 8, with teams allowed in any even combination (I.E. pairs, or 4v4).

Using a pool of "energy," each round players take turns maneuvering their characters. The character pieces have hexagonal bases labeled with the characters Front, Left, and Right sides. Cards can have active effects and/or prepared effects. Players can play active effects from their hand on their turn. An example of an active effect would be "The next attack you make this turn gets +2 damage." To use a card's prepared effect, a player places the card face down in one of three piles marked for their character's Front, Left, and Right sides. Prepared cards are used as interrupts for opponents actions, and will take place before the completion of the action they are responding to. A prepared effect might read something like "Block the next attack against the prepared side."

name: Operation Iron Fist
description:
Operation Iron Fist is the introductory scenario of Board Wargame Magazine #11 Iron Guards: Battle of Shanghai. It is a P&P game with 4 page rule, 1 A4 map, and 26 counters.

Players play the commander of National Revolutionary Army (NRA) 9th Army Group and Imperial Japanese Navy (IJN) Shanghai Special Naval Landing Forces respectively. Every hex is 3-4km across and every turn is 7-8 days. Every units represents battalion to division. Players roll a dice to get operation points to activate ground units to fight each other. Player occupied the IJN HQ wins the game after 3 turns.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Fire Team Vietnam
description:
FIRE TEAM VIETNAM : a game for team / squad / platoon level during the Vietnam War ( Rules, counters (US, NVA 1965 ), and Geomorphic Boards )

- the maps ( geomorphic ) will contain the various types of grounds of Vietnam

- the counters represents teams ( 1 to 3 men ), leaders, fire team,...in the first module, and after modules : vehicles, armor, helicopters, ....of US ARMY and, NVA.

With expansions : the Counters for USMC, ANZAC, VIETCONG and others geomorphic Boards

Scales :
- 1 inch = 5 meters
- A turn = 1 minute :

--- Orders Phase : Hidden ( Company, Platoons, Squads Leader, Teams)

--- Actions Phase Teams ( Fire, Movements, .....simultaneous )

Available on battlesprojectmaps.e-monsite.com

-----> Les Règles sont disponibles en Français
mechanics: Action Queue, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: ÎÎ£Î¤Î¥ÎÎÎÎÎÎÎ£ ÎÎ£Î¤ÎÎ¡ÎÎÎ£
description:
Charlie's Angels Police Stories Game from Greece (ΑΣΤΥΝΟΜΙΚΕΣ ΙΣΤΟΡΙΕΣ) - Based on the TV Series. Players try to track down & capture the suspect.

Comes with 4 playing people pieces, 2 cars, colorful paper board, spinner & instructions.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Karma Crystals: Pass The Karma
description:
When Bad Karma Strikes, Pass It On To Other Players!

You can travel down life through good deeds or bad deeds, but karma will follow you either way. In Pass The Karma, your best tactic is to collect that bad karma now and pass it on to your opponents to get the win.

This 2nd entry into the Karma Crystals game collection adds a set of elemental shards and a new way to pass on your bad karma to other players. This game also introduces a Karma Crystal scoring system to track all that bad Karma going around. Last but not least, you get 12 new monster elemental cards for your collector’s deck!

Collect up to elemental elemental shards (up to TWO per type) to represent your forward movement through your karma travels. If you get too many per type, you get Karma Crystals and get a chance to pass their reverse-move effect on your score to other players.

Roll dice to work with the various monster elemental cards - monsters are the good guys and help you win! Determine how many karma moves you score per roll and collect your elemental shards for the match, or pass on your no-match karma to another player! When you get elemental shards of FOUR types, that triggers the end of the game and scores are tallied at the end of the round.

In addition to the unique dice matching game mechanic, a unique auto player system is used to facilitate up to EIGHT total players per game. The game also provides an easy way to track multiple game wins for playoffs in case you have more than 15 to 20 minutes to play. No paper score cards and pencil needed - just Karma Crystals, crystal cubes and elemental shards to track and build your score.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Take That

name: Karma Crystals: Move Master
description:
Focus On Your Karma Path And Collect Elemental Matches!

You can travel down life through good deeds or bad deeds, but karma will follow you either way. In Move Master, your best tactic is to collect that bad karma now and give it to your opponents to get the win.

This 3rd entry into the Karma Crystals game collection adds the use of elemental shards with move shards to gain movement and 12 new monster elemental cards for your collector’s deck!

Your mission is to gain as many moves forward down the karma path, collect elemental shards and be nice to other opponents so they don’t pass their Karma Crystals to you.

Roll dice to work with the various monster elemental cards - monsters are the good guys and help you win! Determine how many karma moves you score per roll and collect your karma move shards. Your move match also earns you an elemental shard, but if you get more of one type, you get to pass a Karma Crystal to another player. Your opponents also get Karma Crystals through a no-match roll, and you will get those too! When you get 11 or more karma moves, that triggers the end the game and the winner is determined at the end of that round!

In addition to the unique dice matching game mechanic, a unique auto player system is also used to facilitate up to EIGHT total players per game. The game also provides an easy way to track multiple game wins for playoffs in case you have more than 15 to 20 minutes to play. No paper score cards and pencil needed - just move and elemental shards, and of course, Karma Crystals to track and build your score!

name: Yura Yura Cafe
description:
This game is actually a game collection. It hosts 4 games and 2 additional variants for one of them.

1.Yura Yura Balance Café
This is the main game the components can be played with. You have a stack of cards that represent coffee orders, several coffee “ingredients” and a playing area, which is a tablet on a dome shaped foot. The name part “balance” comes from the way it’s played. You draw a card from the deck which tells you, if you need to place a straight coffee, a coffee-to-go, a Milk Coffee or one of the 2 Macchiato versions on the tablet. There is a grid on said tablet to determine the places where you can, but on a coffee to go you can stack another coffee if you like. Whoever tips the tablet over loses. Besides the usual red cards, there are also green ones in the deck. These give you the opportunity to order somebody else to place the coffee (with a green cup), of course on their own risk.

2.Speed Order Café
This speed game needs at least 2 baristas and 1 customer. The customer shuffles the deck of cards and pulls 5 into her hand. She than reads them aloud to the baristas. After all 5 orders are read the customer gives the start sign, and all baristas start to assemble the coffees in order. Whoever is fastest stops the game. If she is correct on all coffees she wins, otherwise the win goes to the next most complete and errorless contender.

3.Black and Milk Reversi
This is just Othello played with the components of the game.

4.Coffee Cup Tower
