This is a stacking game were 2 or more players (Variant A/B) are stacking Black Coffee cups and Coffee-To-Go’s as high as possible. The variants are differentiated by the footprint of the initial layer. First Player to tip the tower loses.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Party Game

name: The Primordium Wars
description:
Far in the future, humanity makes contact with a distant, dying alien race, the Sectridians, whose survival depends upon a constant influx of a rare substance known as primordium, found only in a remote section of an asteroid field close to the Sectridian home world. Unfortunately the Sectridians lose the ability to acquire the primordium for themselves, because the asteroids become infested with another hostile alien species, the monstrous Raptezoids and their horrific mother, the Hive Queen.

Encounters with the Raptezoids prove deadly to the feeble Sectridians. Thus, they are forced to abandon their primordium rich asteroids and, consequently, begin to die off. In a final desperate act, the Sectridians send a distress signal throughout the galaxy, hoping another benevolent alien race might come to their rescue. When their demise seems all but certain, a few rag-tag human factions receive the Sectridian cry for help, and, greedily sensing an opportunity to cash in on their plight, agree, for a handsome fee, to mine the Primordium for the Sectridians, battling the Raptezoid scourge in the process. These human factions also learn that, by gathering and selling specimens of the Raptezoids to a few curious members of an enigmatic scientific community sprinkled among them, they can earn a small, yet not insignificant, additional profit.

It is not long before the lust for wealth sends these mining factions into conflict with one another, as they each seek to claim more and more asteroids for themselves. Ordinary space miners, most often equipped with nothing more than their trusty pick-axes, have to quickly learn to become soldiers as they are sent headlong into bloody battle against the armies of other mining factions. These conflicts become known as the Primoridum Wars, and rage for several years before the Sectridians suddenly, and mysteriously, disappear.

You will play the leader of one these human factions. You will expand your primordium mining operations throughout the asteroid field, wage war against your opponents, fight the terrible Raptezoids, and gather Raptezoid specimens. At the end of five rounds, the player with the most wealth wins the game.

The Primordium Wars is a quasi 4x, tile placement, resource gathering, and worker displacement game where players place tiles representing various structures onto their asteroids in order to increase their primordium mining operations. It is also a game in which combat plays a significant, though secondary role, where players attack each other in order to claim more resource producing asteroids, or to disrupt their opponents' operations. The game takes place on a modular board where, in each round, players slowly shift the asteroids around on the game board, subtly, or often drastically, changing the strategic situation.

In each round, players will first acquire, in a bidding phase, tiles that represent the items needed to expand their mining empires such as: Various asteroid modules to build on the asteroids (mining facilities, orbital turrets, pulse cannons, science laboratories, etc), various starship upgrades (warp drives, sniping lasers, stealth devices, etc), miner and mercenary reinforcements, build points for building new starships, and grav technology for tethering asteroids together into clusters (a core mechanism that greatly increases mining production, and expands the functionality of most modules built on the asteroids).
Players will then deploy their newly acquired items onto their asteroids and starships, take turns moving their pieces deeper into the asteroid field in order to expand their mining empire, and battle other players, Raptezoids, and the dreaded Hive Queen.
At the end of each round players will collect their income from their mining operations and Raptezoid specimens, and a new round will begin.

name: Super Dude Bros
description:
A dice rolling, platforming, race to the finish game.
Use a myriad of items to alter your bros turn, or boost your rolls, use your cheat code to level the playing field or get ahead of the competition.
Be the first to get to the flag pole to claim your victory and ultimate bragging rights.

name: Thief & Policeman
description: A wonderfull two player game. One player gets to be the thief and one the policeman. Each player moves and then places coloured pieces on the board, in order to block his opponent. When the policeman or the thief is completely blocked, the game ends!

name: FractoDingo
description:
A fun game to learn about fractions!. Master representations of fractions and their additions.
A playful tool organised into 3 levels of difficulty.
Play the battle, Rummy and the Mistigri to help pirates to share their treasure.

name: Sylladingo
description:
Two inspectors must rebuild 700 vocabulary words from 96 letters and syllables.

Play the battle, Rummy and the Caterpillar to help reconstruct the words.

Sylladingo is a fun tool to enrich the vocabulary of the CP to the CM1. The game includes 2 packs of different cards (easy and hard levels).

name: King Cat: Feline Feuds
description:
Cat and Medieval and Contemporary Household Themed. The cats are divided into royalty designations/strength ranking and are attempting to exert control over locations in a Kingdom i.e. a bedroom for the purposes of napping.

The gameplay consists of a drawing card then taking 1 or 2 actions of the following: placing cats in territories, placing Battle Cards of various types from the player's 4 card hand to give cats battle strength and scoring potential, battling opponent cats for control, and restoring cats after a battle. Drawing territories out of the deck and certain event cards add variety to gameplay/strategy.

The goal of the game is to have the most victory points at the end of the 3rd draw deck. the victory points are gained by dominating territory based on the cat's size, faction, and royal stack relative to opponents. A second way to earn victory points is to have a valid quirk or bonus VP stack by the game's end. There are penalties to VP for holding certain cards and for cats being defeated in battle.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Politair
description:
There are 37 holes and ecah player has 18 pieces. Everybody places their pieces on the board so that only one hole is free.

Each player tries to take out more pieces than his opponent.

To take out one of his pieces he has to jump over one of his pieces provided there is an open hole on the other side. He can jump over an opponents piece but without taking it out.

At the end of the game the player with less pieces wins!

name: Karma Crystals: Elemental Battle
description:
Use The New Rock, Paper, Scissors Mechanic To Score!

You can travel down life through good deeds or bad deeds, but karma will follow you either way. In Elemental Battle, your best tactic is to collect that bad karma now and give it to your opponents to get the win.

This 4th entry into the Karma Crystals game collection adds a rock, paper, scissors mechanic that works with SIX elemental icons for a whole new dimension to the game. You also get 11 new monster elemental cards for your collector’s deck!

Collect elemental battle shards into your ACTIVE area, then use them to battle your opponents through ONE of THREE battle actions. You can CAPTURE their ACTIVE battle shards into your SCORE area, MOVE their ACTIVE battle shards to your ACTIVE area, or TRANSFER battle shards from their SCORE areas to the general SUPPLY area, accessible to all players. Don’t worry… you can still pass your bad karma to other players. It wouldn’t be Karma Crystals without Karma Crystals!

You will either roll or battle on each turn. Roll dice to match with a monster elemental card and collect elemental battle shards that match your dice into you ACTIVE area, or battle to score shards. If you score 11 or more elemental battle shards, that triggers the end the game and a winner is determined at the end of that round!

In addition to the unique dice matching game mechanic, a unique auto player system is also used to facilitate up to EIGHT total players per game. The game also provides an easy way to track multiple game wins for playoffs in case you have more than 15 to 20 minutes to play. No paper score cards and pencil needed - the 96 elemental battle shards are all you need to battle your opponents and build your score.

name: Karma Crystals: Swarm
description:
Score Game Points As The Swarm Surrounds You, Or Escape!

You can travel down life through good deeds or bad deeds, but karma will follow you either way. In Swarm, your bestactic is to collect that bad karma now and swarm your opponents with karma crystals to get the win.

This 5th entry into the Karma Crystals game collection adds a zombie swarm type of game mechanic and a set of boards used to maneuver it against other players to win. You also get 10 new monster elemental cards for your collector’s deck!

Collect elemental shards and karma crystals from the swarm, but be careful. You are limited on attacks against them. Use the swarm for your benefit, but don’t be caught by it as other players use it against you!

As you build your collection of elemental shards and karma crystals, you can trigger the end of the game, but be careful not to do this before you are sure of the win.

In addition to the unique dice matching game mechanic, a unique auto player system is also used to facilitate up to EIGHT total players per game. The game also provides an easy way to track multiple game wins for playoffs in case you have more than 15 to 45 minutes to play depending on the number of players. No paper score cards and pencil needed. Your game score is determined by the number of elemental shards and karma crystals you score.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Take That

name: You've Been Hacked
description:
The game can be played in two different modes. The "Training Operation" mode is a free-for-all where players try to prove they are the most qualified hacker for the secret agent position. The "Special Operation" mode is a team mode (all vs. one) where one player takes on the role of a rogue agent trying to protect secret information. The other players try to recover all of the critical data before security shuts the whole system down.

In both modes gameplay proceeds in turns. During a player's turn he will move his pawn from one tile to another (which represents accessing different computer systems) across connection points, revealing facedown tiles in the process. Each revealed tile will indicate how many data tokens are to be placed on the tile facedown. A player on that tile can choose to take the data tokens which each indicate a value on their face which is kept hidden from the other players. Collected data tokens can be saved by a player by returning to his start tile. A player can also leave firewall and virus tokens on a tile which will slow other players down. In addition to finding data on revealed tiles, players can also find antivirus tokens and firewall access tokens which will allow them to move to a tile containing a virus or firewall. If two players' pawns are on the same tile one of them may initiate a hack attack, which involves rolling dice. The victor may steal a data token from the loser.

The game continues for 11-15 rounds after which the player who has saved the most data is the winner (in "Training Operation" mode).

In "Special Operation" mode the rogue agent must prevent the other agents from retrieving all of the data tokens before time runs out.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Take That

name: Anarcade Deck Building Game: Vector Blue
description:
Travel back to when the arcade was a dark, smoky den of iniquity. Fame and respect can be bought for only a quarter if you have the skill. Once you fill up the high score table on a game then you are the king! Put a quarter on the glass and challenge the champ if you think you've got what it takes!

Anarcade is a deck building game of stack control. Players play starter cards to earn Coins and buy better cards from the Game stacks. They can also use Coins to Score on the Games. Each player attempts to fill up a High Score table to take control of that game before an opponent can do the same. Once a player takes control of a stack, other players can't touch it. The winner is the first player to control 3 games.

The Vector Blue set is tuned for deep strategy and features vector based retro arcade goodness! Combine with any other Anarcade set to expand the game to up to 4 players.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Hip Hop
description: A game of strategy and chance. The winner is the player who completes a square or a circle. Roll the dice and place the tiles where indicated on the board. If you pay more attention than your opponents you are sure to beat them.

name: Gale Sayers Football
description:
A professional football game licensed by Gale Sayers post-NFL career. A standard set of playing cards (with specially designed Gale Sayers card backs) is used. Players call out their play, pull a card, then check the play sheet to see what result the playing card provides. For instance, if you call a screen pass, then pull a red 10 out of the deck, that's a touchdown. A black 10 results in 0 yards gained.

Comes with board of football field, score board with two leg stands, Gale Sayers cardboard cutout figure and stand, ten-yard distance marker, two play results sheets, and deck of cards with two jokers.

Cover is marked Gale Sayers Football, but instructions always refer to game as Gale Sayers' Action Packed Football.

Of special note is the comment on the designer printed on the inside of the box: "This game was created by Don Kingston, with assistance on its refinement by his son, Kevin. Kevin Kingston perished, along with the entire University of Evansville Basketball Team on December 13, 1977. To his memory this game is dedicated."

name: Fourth Grade Confidential
description:
Danger lurks in the halls of Northfield Elementary. The school yard is no place for the meek. Only one man can protect the innocent children from bullies, cheaters, and thiefs. But unfortunately Principal Jones is usually too tied up with PTA meetings, in-service days, and keeping his office chair warm. That leaves Adin Simon, private eye, gumshoe, and sleuth to clean up after the fact. Fourth grade may not be safe, but with a bit of grit and determination he'll solve your case and bring your culprit to justice...or get wedgied trying.

Fourth Grade Confidential is a microgame of deduction, bluffing, and cunning, based on Neal Simon's comic book project called Fourth Grade Confidential. The premise is that a fourth grader named Adin is a private eye at his school, working to solve the great mysteries of elementary school, like who stole his sister's stuffed pink bunny.

In Fourth Grade Confidential one player is the Sleuth while 2-4 other players are the Characters. Each round the Sleuth is trying to solve a different mystery. The Sleuth has six Sleuth Cards and the other 12 cards are dealt evenly to the Characters. The Sleuth has six turns to try to figure out which Character has the Target Item for that round by calling out various attributes and seeing who has items with matching attributes. Through careful deduction and use of actions the Sleuth and Characters all try to be the player to end up with the Target Item.

The Sleuth: Each round a new player will take on the roll of the Sleuth. The Sleuth will be questioning the Characters and following up clues. If the Sleuth catches Characters lying about the items they have he'll get to perform additional actions to help him narrow down where the Target Item is.

The Characters: All other players are Characters in the current mystery. One Character will have the Target Item that the Sleuth is looking for. As the Sleuth questions Characters they will begin to reveal items they have to prove their innocence, or to throw the Sleuth off the track. Can you be cunning enough to keep the Target Item hidden from the Sleuth? Are you going to help the Sleuth figure out who is the Culprit? Maybe you're just out for yourself. Characters get to take actions if they reveal items the Sleuth is looking for, without giving up the Target Item. But if they are caught lying the Sleuth gets extra actions to help him find the Culprit.

The round ends when the Sleuth runs out of Actions or when he finds the Target Item. Scoring can be totaled for each round and then scores totaled after everyone has had a chance to be the Sleuth an equal number of times.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Print & Play

name: Doctor Who: Companions
description:
Doctor Who: Companions is a challenging cooperative boardgame based on the well-known BBC TV Show. Each player will assume the role of one of the 13 last companions of the Doctor and try to protect 4 regions from famous Doctor Enemies such as the Daleks, the Cybermen, or any of the 9 types of enemies you might encounter.

During the game, players will draw cards and use symbols on theirs cards to perform various actions such as move across the boards, travel through time, fight, meet famous characters, rest, train population, search special sites for items,call the Doctor for help... They'll have to watch for the enemies moves and special plan, and time their actions to counter them.

Players win the game if they manage to clean the board from enemies before the activation deck is depleted for the second time. If not, the world will be submitted to an hostile alien race...
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Modular Board

name: Puss In Boots: Danger Is My Game
description: Originally offered as a Carl's Jr./Hardee's Cool Kids meal toy, this game is based on the Puss In Boots movie by DreamWorks Animation. Once assembled, the game is played by rolling a die and moving along a track until one player reaches the end.

name: OperaciÃ³n: Zombies PerÃº
description:
In Operación: Zombies Perú, each player plays the role of a Chief of Operations who must deal with what he has to rescue as many Civil Groups crammed and hidden throughout the city. Players must work as fast as they can because once all the needed helicopters arrive, the city will be abandoned and only the civil groups on the Rescue Zone will be saved. You can hinder your opponents' rescue missions by sending zombies to slow their work.

On each turn you draw a card and you play a card, taking into account that you can't have less the one card on your hand at the end of your turn. You play cards against your opponents or to help yourself keep safe your Civil Groups.

Operación: Zombies Perú finishes when a certain amount of helicopters are placed in different Rescue Zones.

This game is filled with laughter as you try to remain untouched and hinder your opponents at the same time.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Party Game, Zombies
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Reisen Penguin
description:
User summary:
å·æ¦ãã³ã®ã³ (Reisen Penguin) means Cold War Penguin in English.

Cold War Penguin is a battle game between East and West spy penguins during the Cold War era in the world of penguins. Steal the enemy's secret or shoot them dead. It's a short and sharp game, for 4 players only playing as two partnerships.

Publisher's summary:
ãã³ã®ã³ä¸çã®å·æ¦æä»£ã«æ´»èºããæ±è¥¿ã®ã¹ãã¤ãã³ã®ã³éã®æ¦ãã

name: Conquest and Carnage
description:
The realm is strife with conflict as armies of Humans and Dwarves battle against the swarms of Goblins and Undead. The Barbarian Horde, a neutral 5th army may also enter the fray to fight for either side.

Player's will build large armies, multiple cities, and infrastructure which will help boost their economy and fuel their war machine. Also, each army has four heroes that can be used to explore dungeons, fight monsters, gain valuable treasure and ultimately advance levels in an attempt to lead their armies to victory. Each faction has unique units, spells, heroes, and upgrades at their disposal. It is only through the careful balance of limited resources that can win the day. There are many paths to victory. The struggle is real. The carnage is devastating. The conquest has begun!

Conquest and Carnage are the next in the line of the Warparty series. Lock'n Load Publishing will not be publishing this game. You can find the first game Warparty series at the link below.

https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/94255/warparty
categories: Adventure, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Hero Flix
description:
In Hero Flix, you take on the role of a movie director. Your task is to complete a production and earn Production Points toward a winning score of 10 points. More complex productions have a higher Production Point value but also take longer to complete.

While working towards Completing a Production, there are opportunities to increase the value of your production or impact the production of other players. Some examples include:


Joining in their success (joining them as a Co-Producer),
Lowering the Production Point value (through a Smear Campaign), or
Preventing them from Completing the Production this turn (via an Injunction).


Hero Flix enables you to change the level of interaction by removing some cards from the game. We break these styles into three “Budget Levels”:


"B Movie" - there is a low chance of influencing another player,
"Major Motion Picture" - you have some chance for influencing another player, and
"Summer Blockbuster" - another player production will get influenced unless you are doing it wrong. This is how the game was designed to be played.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Hunter's Island
description:
Hunter's Island is a last man standing card game. Each turn the players will search the Island for better cards, equip the cards they find or attack the other players. While the player searches the island animals are also there to attack.

Can you out hunt the other players?


For 2-4 players, this card game pits players on a lonely island against the island's dangers and also each other to the last Hunter standing.

Starting with the ability to escape and attack, players take turns searching the island to gather equipment or encounter animals and other dangers. Found cards are placed in the player's Storage, where they can be picked up rather than searching the Island or Attacking.

Players must decide which of three areas to search, either safely by camp, the deep island, or crossing the ocean water to another dangerous island while the island's dangers whittle away their life points and equipment. Soon, the opportunity to be the lone Hunter will arise.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Player Elimination

name: Hunter's Island: Thieves
description:
Hunter's Island Thieves is a last man standing card game. Each turn the players will search the island for better gear, equip the gear or attack the other players. While the players search the island animals will attack the players. Be the last man standing to win.

This game is a stand alone expansion of the game Hunter's Island. Combining the games will allow for more players and more situations.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Player Elimination

name: Hunter's Island: Zombies
description:
Hunter's Island Zombies is a last man standing card game. Each turn the players will search the island for better gear, equip the gear or attack the other players. While the players search the island Zombies will attack the players and if they kill the player, the player becomes a zombie and for rest of the game is attack the other players to make them zombies as well.

This game is a stand alone expansion of the game Hunter's Island. there is also Hunter's Island Thieves expansion, combining the sets will allow for more players and more situations during the game.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Adventure, Card Game, Zombies
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Player Elimination

name: Henceforth
description:
Henceforth is a cooperative, campaign-driven card game where you and your fellow players take on the roles of characters trying to survive after a deadly virus known as "Blue Ruin" wiped out 3/4 of the population, turning ordinary people into insane, howling monsters known colloquially as "Blues". While stand-alone rules exist, Henceforth is best played in a campaign format which can take place up to (and sometimes over) 15 game sessions or “stays.” Over the course of these stays players will earn experience to exchange for new skills and discover useful gear and weapons to aid them as they begin to unravel the game’s overarching mystery.

Each stay sees your characters holing up in a somewhat safe location lovingly dubbed the “home base.” Here your characters will spend action points to attack the Blues, build defenses, search for supplies, and more.

A stay ends when there are either no characters left to take actions, either because they have all evacuated or (worse) been killed, or a story trigger occurs. Story triggers are special events tied to the game’s campaign adventure book. This book consists of a series of scenarios which will help guide your characters to their next point in the campaign, eventually leading the group to one of Henceforth: The Living and the Dead’s many story endings.

The game is driven by an element of push-your-luck that greatly rewards players that take risks but can seriously endanger the entire group if those same risk-takers get too greedy (or desperate). It is very easy to draw attention to your home base in Henceforth; one wrong move, and a herd of insane, blue-skinned monsters will quickly surround your characters making it impossible to escape unscathed.

Warning: Henceforth is excruciatingly unforgiving.

For starters, each character only has six hit points. With each point of damage your character takes, the chances of that character suffering a long-term injury increases. Next, food and ammunition are both extremely limited and only become harder to find the longer you all stay in one place. So you gotta keep moving. Finally, you must keep track of your character’s sanity in the game as suffering too much or seeing too many horrible things can drive them mad, making them easy targets for the blues.

name: Primordial 10
description:
A game played with a Duelo Primigenio deck. It is a changing puzzle where players will have to find the best position to place a card in the card matrix.

Players will place one of their cards ortogonally to other card on the table, forming a matrix of cards with a limit of 4x4 cards.

After playing a card, the player will check the column and row where his card is placed, then he will take to his side every card in that row and column that have the same color and suit of the card played.

The objective of the game is to have the least amount of cards, and with the lower numbers in the side of the player.

Spanish:
Consiste en un puzzle cambiante donde los jugadores deberán encontrar la mejor posición para colocar cada carta en el tapiz de cartas, para así llevarse las cartas que más les convenga para ganar la partida.

name: Malifaux: Guild Riflemen
description:
Pass through the Breach and you will step off the train at Malifaux Station, deep in the heart of Guild territory. People might greet you warmly, or they might ignore you, but no one is about to cast a spell at you or raise an undead minion to steal your soul. At least not in broad daylight. You are under the Guild's protection.

The Guild Rifleman is a ranged attack Minion who deals more damage when in proximity to other Guardsman models that have already Activated
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Variable Player Powers

name: SEISHIN
description:
From the publisher:

SEISHIN is a conquer-and-control board game set in feudal Japan, designed and developed by Rogue Artist Creations Ltd. It is a well-balanced mix of area-control, resource-management and strategy that has enough to interest lots of different types of gamers. You can find yourself in a furious battle to control Niigata or engaged in making desperate alliances to save-guard your borders... only for your allies to turn around and betray you several turns later!

You (Yes, YOU!) are a noble Daimyo of Japan. Your role is to expand and conquer provinces, then set them to produce resources and score Victory Points. However, do you do what the Emperor wishes you to do or follow your own path? (That is what the concept of SEISHIN is all about!) Every year, the Emperor's wishes change and different resources are plentiful or scarce, so the game is constantly changing!

Roll dice, play Action Cards, attack and defend, produce and score. Expand your influence and take over regions. However, Japan is only so large and can take only so much political upheaval before all heck breaks loose and Civil WAR! is declared! Now the Emperor's own provinces come under attack and everyone's loyalty wavers in the red tide of War!

Who will be left in first place when all the final points have been totaled and the last Victory Points added? Who will be crowned the new Emperor or Empress? Only time will tell. So put on your armour, draw your katana and take battle to Japan, as the fires of War and beckoning and you will never take Osakaaaaaa!!!
categories: Civil War, Economic, Fighting, Medieval, Negotiation, Pirates, Political, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: The Colony 2174
description:
The Colony 2174 - Mine Resources, Survive the Planet, Build your Colony

The year is 2174. Novinium, the rarest of minerals, drives every economy in the Union of Federated Planets. A rich vein of it has just been discovered on the infamous Fury 1228 – a barren and inhospitable planet with the most unforgiving of environments.

Even under these conditions, hundreds of colonists are flooding to the place, so your work as a Colony Director for the United Corporations is cut out for you. Use your Novinium wisely, keep a steady supply flowing or you’ll soon find yourself unable to build or even re-supply.

Are you ready to build... The Colony?

The game is currently available via The Game Crafter.

The Colony is an engine building game where you have to settle a new planet by building your four Colony structures using the rare resource Novinium.

The game is intended to be played by 2 to 4 players and a game normally takes between 45 and 60 minutes to complete.

The game is won by the first player who builds their 4 Colony structures: Reactor, Biodome, Portal, and Orbital Station.

You can lose the game by not building your structures or ending up with no more structures of your own due to events that are triggered during the game.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Omaha Blitz Football
description:
OBF: Omaha Blitz Football: ages 8+, 2-4 p., strategy deck-builder board game

OBF is the thrill of victory and the agony of defeat at your fingertips. Bring your best playbook to the gridiron coach.

GAME PARTS:

- Dice are used minimally so players can choose their favorite game mechanics and affect the odds with play cards. Each team rolls dice 1 to 2 times per turn.

- The triangular foam Kicker is used to kick field-goals. Kickers allow players to kick field goals safely indoors. Field goal regulations give a small advantage to small players. making OBF a hit for families and friends.

- The Deflated Ball game piece topples down the gridiron to determine punt and kick yardage. The Deflated Ball limits kicking distance to increase the difficulty of getting beneficial out of bounds penalties and to even the playing field for children and adults alike.

GAME RULES:

Football rules apply so pre-game preparation includes agreeing on which division's rules you'll be using during the game. Also, choose which variation of OBF to play.

You can play with a teammate, in a draft tournament or duo-draft, play right out of the box head-to-head, add fantasy football players to your All-Star Team or ditch the footballs and play cards. It's just a game and you should have fun playing with it.

OBF rules include everything you need to apply the Tournament Set play cards to football scenarios and penalties. Game mechanics apply to on-field conditions and the game actions involved in play steps.

Determination, grit, aggression and heart are needed to win Omaha Blitz Football. Brains help too! If you've got game it's up to you how to play OBF: Omaha Blitz Football.

name: Zombies Forever
description:
In this game of strategy and control for 2 to 6 players, move your pieces and protect your king to attack and defeat other creatures to win.

Based with triangular tiles on an hexagonal board, the game mechanic is as simple as move and attack. The opponent may retreat unless he is blocked by other pieces or the outside rim. The dead creature is placed in the attacker's pantry. it will be eaten later to increase movement or number of attacks.

name: Chefs: the card game
description:
With a master jumbo card, each player choose 2 menus each turn.
On this card, you will use counters to track your points, stars and available menus.

The game mechanics is based on card drawings which randomly brings customers with different tastes and preferences. If they match, you earn points (dice rolled). Then, you can spend points to invite food critics by drawing food critics cards, if your menu matches, you earn a star.

You win when your restaurant reaches 3 stars.

name: Battaglia Spaziale
description:
Battaglia Spaziale "simulates" a tactical "man-to-alien" scale fight beween Space Monsters and Human Space Legion troops, using a checker-like mechanism. The player pieces can eliminate the adversary figures by moving on their squares to capture them.
The game uses 32 soft plastic 2" figures form the "Gli Spaziali" toy soldiers series produced by the same Atlantic.

name: Rough-and-Tumble
description:
Rough-and-Tumble is a boardgame with a new and unique game mechanic: it's a chess game with hexagonal boxes and a little innovation that will make the game unique and intriguing, ideal for one on one challenges to discover who's the best strategist!

You will choose between two teams: orcs or dwarves, each faction will offer different powers and mechanics, what faction you are going to use and which one is the best, is exclusively up to you!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Fantasy, Miniatures, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Player Elimination

name: The Barn: The Board Game
description:
The classic game of trick or treat fun, rock n roll and fright!

Object: Be the first player to travel through the town of Wheary Falls by defeating all three monsters and arriving to the concert in one piece!

Gameplay: The Player whose birthday is closest to Halloween (October 31st) goes first, and then play continues clockwise around the table.

On your turn, roll the die and move your Character Pawn as directed. Then pick up one Fate Card from the CARDS pile and follow its direction. Now your turn is over. Place all used Fate Cards in a discard pile. Once all cards have been used, shuffle discard pile and begin using again.

Movement: Each Player should roll the six-sided die and then pick up a Fate Card on each turn, unless stated by a previous card.
Always move in the direction of the candy corn square pieces (the white tips point forward), unless a card directs you otherwise.

How To Win The Game: If you are the first Player to reach the concert ticket (FINISH), you've reached the Demon Inferno show and have won the game!

Optional Rules: Once you've mastered this classic game try a slightly more challenging version. Use the additional rules of either Easier Play, Choose Your Fate or Hard to Kill.
categories: Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: PlataPorma
description:
Political Story Telling Game. Free Print-to-Play. Designed by Ronald Villaver. CC Attribution-NonCommercial (CC BY-NC) Are you sure about your bets this coming election? What makes your candidates better than the rest? Use showmanship, quick wits, and satirical selling skills to convince the voting public that your team has what it takes to solve our nation’s current issues.

DISCLAIMER:
This is a work of fiction. Names, characters, businesses, places, events, locales, and incidents are either the products of the designer’s imagination or used in a fictitious manner. Any resemblance to actual persons, living or dead, or actual events is purely coincidental.

Setup:
Shuffle the Political Issues and Candidate Cards into their respective piles. Give each player a starting hand of three Candidate cards. First player goes to whoever recently tried to weasel their way out of a violation and got away with it.

Basic Game: 3 – 5 Players
Plataporma is played in a series of rounds where players try to get the vote of the Voter player to earn points. The first to 3 points wins!

Step 1 : Reveal the Issue
The Voter chooses a card in their hand that will be the Current Issue for the round. They then read it aloud and put it on the table for everyone to see.

Step 2 : Promote Candidates
Each other player (starting from the player to the Voter’s left) chooses 2 cards from their hand to play as their candidates (President and Vice-President pairing). They must explain to the Voter why their candidates are the best to address the Current Issue. Once per round, if a player doesn’t like the candidates in their cards, they may discard as many cards from their hand to draw that many new cards.

Step 3 : Vote for favorite Candidate
After each player has taken their turn to promote their candidates, the Voter chooses which pair they liked the most. The player whose pair was picked wins the round and gets a point! They put the Current Issue card face down in front of them to track their points.

Step 4 : Prepare for the next round
Everyone discards all used cards and then draws back up to 4 cards. If there are no more cards in the draw deck, shuffle the discarded cards back into the draw deck.

Step 5 : Start the next round
Start a new round with the player that won the last round as the new Voter for the round. The first player to get 3 points wins!

Debate Variant: 6 – 10 Players

The round begins with the Leader also known as the Chairman, drawing a Political Issue and reads out loud.

The players to the Chairman’s right and left are now debate opponents and selects their respective electoral match up. The rest of the players are called voters. The opponents have 2 minutes to explain why their pair is better than the other in addressing the political issue.
The chairman counts to 3; voters simultaneously raises their right or left hand to indicate their preferred pair in reference to the chairman’s right or left. The Opponent with the most votes wins a point. Chairman breaks ties.

Players shuffle back played candidate cards and draws up to their beginning hand. Player to the chairman’s left is the new leader for the next round. Play continues until a player reaches 3 points, that player is the winner.
Party Variant: 10+ Players

It plays the same as the basic game except for a few things: The voter draws 3 political issue cards and chooses to play 2. Players must address both issues.` The rest of the players only chose one candidate card and must declare to the other players their selection. Next they must convince someone else to be their running mate. If they are unable to get a partner, they are forced to use just one candidate. Players must do this selection as quick as possible.
Play goes as normal, except they now have 2 minutes per team, and both are making their presentation in tandem. Speaking and acting in character is highly recommended.
The voter chooses the winning pair, both players get a point each by giving them their Political Issue card. If a player was forced to use one candidate, they only get 1 point, represented by the Political Issue Card.

This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License. To view a copy of this license, visit http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/4.0/. All characters appearing in this work are fictitious. Any resemblance to real persons, living or dead, is purely coincidental. Opinions expressed by players playing this game are solely of their own and do not express the views or opinions of anyone else.

If you liked this game, please check out my other designs at http://www.scripturedyou.com

For updates and print-to-play files, always check the repository at https://github.com/rvillaver/PlataPorma

name: OBTINEO
description:
OBTINEO is a 2-6 player, abstract strategy game, with a modular terrain field (so the game is always different), three dimensions of play, resource-driven expansion, and several ways to play and win.

OBTINEO has 3 phases of play: Build, Expand, and Conquer.

In the Build phase each player places one of their hex tiles per turn until the OBTINEO island is complete. Once the island is complete during the Expand & Conquer phases (which will run together)each player turn will go as follows.

1 Player Collects Resources according to where pawns are at beginning of turn, 2 Player purchase new units, 3 player moves pawns, and 4 if Player has captured enemy units by moving into diamonds they occupy and collecting resource cards, player can purchase and move onto the island additional troops.

OBTINEO is won by conquering each enemy by either capturing all of their troops or by holding and blocking their ports.

name: Thirty Six: 36 Stratagems
description:
Strategy and conquest in Ming Dynasty China

36 stratagems is a game for 2-3 players, which is set in the Ming Dynasty era in China and neighbouring states. You are the leader of one of several rival families aspiring to become emperor of the entire region. You start the game in a capital city, with just an aspiring emperor, a scout and a small army. The aim of the game is to become the dominant dynasty by conquering and maintaining control of capitals, temples and prefectures. Each of these actions will help you in gaining the victory points needed to be the undisputed emperor and win the game. To be successful you will need to manage your budding empire carefully. Manage your economy through taxation and expanding your population, secure stability by maintaining cohesion among the political elite, maintain a strong military through recruitment of units supported by powerful generals and avoid rebellion by gaining popularity with your subjects. You face an uncertain destiny and will encounter many challenges during your reign including plague, piracy and looting. However, you are not alone in your quest, as to help you gain the power you so richly deserve and to undermine your pitiful and unworthy enemies, you can call upon the ancient Chinese wisdom enshrined in the 36 stratagems.
categories: Card Game, Civilization, Medieval, Territory Building, Wargame

name: Merchants of Medieval Europe
description:
Introduction
Gamble your family’s coin in search of emerging riches! Buy and sell goods at the whim of a wild market that will keep you guessing and laughing with wonder! Will you make your fortune on one big deal or diversify your goods and strike smartly?
Carry silk, wine, spice, and more on your wagon throughout medieval Europe. Borrow funds from the Merchant Bank and accept contracts from wealthy nobles to afford and deliver these prized crates for extra rewards.
By the end of the year, will you return home as a wealthy winner or a penniless peasant?
Merchants of Medieval Europe is a 3-6 player game designed for casual gamers and families.â


Winning the Game
At the end of the last round, the player with the most coin wins. Subtract from scores if players have uncompleted contracts and/or debt.

Length of Game
The standard game lasts 12 rounds. Exhaust the Market Deck once for one standard game. Lengthen the game in 12 round increments if you
prefer a longer experience.

Setup
1. Place the market good tracker discs on the numbers located around the board’s Perimeter Market matching the Initial Value chart above.
2. Shuffle the contract cards and make the contract deck. Shuffle the market cards and create the Market deck by drawing 12 cards. Place the remaining market cards back in the game box.
3. Separate the 8 colored good cards and create the Resource Supply by placing all of them next to the board along with all the coin and Banknotes. This is the Merchant Bank of Europe.
4. Each player takes 1 horse mat (one horse side face up), one color matching pawn, and 15 coin.
5. Each player draws 4 Contract cards, chooses 1, and places their pawn on the Contract’s delivery location. Return the Contract cards to the deck and shuffle the deck.
6. The player who traveled the farthest away in the last week is the first player. Play continues clockwise from the first player.

Gameplay
1. Market Phase

i. The first player flips a market card and places it on top of a market discard deck.
ii. Players adjust the Perimeter Market good trackers to their new values dictated by the drawn market card.


2. Accounting Phase

i. Players can upgrade their wagon to two horses.
ii. Players can take 1 debt banknote.
iii. Players can pay back any amount of debt banknotes.


3. Action Phase

i. The first player begins their turn and takes up to 4 actions.

a. End their turn by adjusting the Perimeter Market based on their buys/sells, +1 for buys and -1 for sells.



ii. The Action Phase continues clockwise until every player takes up to 4 actions and ends their turn.


4. Round Ends

Action Phase
Take up to 4 actions per turn in any order and you can repeat any particular action any number of times until you run out of actions.
A. Move- Earn movement points from your wagon and move your pawn. 1 movement point allows movement from one region into an adjacent region.
B. Buy- Buy as many goods as you can afford from the resources stockpile, so long as you are in a region that sells the desired good, the good is in stock, and you have room in your wagon.
C. Trade- Buy, sell, or trade goods with another player in the same colored territory as your pawn.
D. Sell- From any region, you can sell any number of goods back to the stockpile for the current market value as dictated by the Perimeter Market.
E. Contracts- Accept a contract by drawing 4 contract cards, choosing 1, and discarding the remaining cards. Alternatively, complete a contract at the written destination with the required goods.
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Commodity Speculation, Stock Holding

name: Colonial Space Wars: Invasion
description:
Colonial Space Wars: Invasion (CSW) is a sci-fi tactical wargame with 18mm scale miniatures that recreates battles between armies called Combat Swords. Each one is formed by a group of soldiers, drones or other creatures, represented in the game by metal or resin miniatures. These models move across a tabletop with scenery elements that emulate open battlefields, military complexes, the interior of buildings or spacecrafts.

CSW battles are resolved by Turns, in which each player acts alternatively. At the beginning of his Turn, one player will add to his pool the COMMAND points given by his LEADER or NODE units. COMMAND points available can be used then to activate units, and each unit requires a number of COMMAND points to be used.

A typical game is a Sudden Death match, where the winner is the player that eliminates their opponent’s ability to activate units. However, in addition to this a description of advanced rules and missions for more experienced players is given.

name: Thunder Bridge
description:
Be the first to cross Thunder Bridge before it collapses into the chasm below, with you on it!

You decide how to arrange the bridge tiles. Do you desire an easy escape or maybe you seek a death-defying challenge.

Thunder Bridge is a fast paced game that keeps you on the edge of your seat with three styles of play. Game setup and play can be seconds or a few minutes. Everyone wants a turn setting up the bridge and declaring which style will be played with their design.

I dare you to play it only once... heck, I dare you to play it only half a dozen times!

After fleeing old Hallux in 1906 a wall of trees sprung up to separate it from the new town of Hallux Rigidus 8 miles south. During the spring of 1910 there was an earthquake that swallowed the wall of trees leaving a huge chasm between the towns instead. A few months later a bridge was discovered spanning the chasm. No one knows who put it there. It was soon titled Thunder Bridge for the obnoxiously loud thunderous noises it makes when you traverse it.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Adventure, Dice, Horror, Racing
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: 8 Seconds
description:
8 Seconds is a press-your-luck dice and card game with some strategic decisions for 1-6 players. There are also three optional expansion modules that can be played with the main game individually or together. 8 Seconds is about the action and excitement of bull riding in a rodeo. Roll your dice and match your moves to the moves of the Bulls. But beware the rodeo clowns! There are only two on staff, so if you roll a third Rodeo Clown you’ll have to fill in and you won’t score your Bull!
Features:
• Fast Paced
• Press-Your-Luck with Strategy
• Player Interaction
• Unique Theme
• No Downtime (w/ Vegas Showdown option)
Overview: In 8 Seconds the eight dice have one of five different values on each face: Turn, Buck, Kick, Blank, or Rodeo Clown. Rodeo Clowns are kept, Blanks are rerolled, and everything else can either be kept or rerolled. At the start of your turn you’ll draw three Bull cards and then roll the dice. You must match your dice rolls to the moves indicated on the cards (turns, kicks, and bucks) in order to successfully ride the Bull. You can reroll dice as needed, but the cost is discard one of your Bull cards, until you are left with just one Bull to ride. If you successfully ride a Bull you’ll collect that Bull and earn the points indicated. Foul Tokens can be earned during the game that allow you to reroll clowns, reroll without discarding a bull, add another bull to their lineup, or score bonus points.

8 Seconds goes until one player has successfully ridden three Bulls, and then everyone else gets a final turn. The winner is the player with the most points in Bulls and Foul Tokens.

Vegas Showdown: Vegas Showdown is an optional play mode for 8 Seconds that eliminates a common issue with many multiplayer press-your-luck games – what to do when it’s not your turn. 8 Seconds – Vegas Showdown brings the excitement of betting to the game when it is not your turn to ride the bulls, keeping players engaged throughout the entire game.

Solitaire: 8 Seconds also has a solitaire variant that allows the game to be played solo. This is a quick diversion that can be played within the space of a lap desk or airline tray.

Additional Gameplay Modes: The Golden Buckle adds Golden Buckle cards, which are available to everyone, until someone acquires each Golden Buckle. Golden Buckles are challenging to obtain, but give various rewards. In The Riders, players get to take on the role of Bull Riders. Each Rider has a special ability that can be used whenever appropriate throughout the game.
categories: American West, Card Game, Dice, Print & Play, Sports
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Bad Campaign
description:
From the publisher:

Bad Campaign is the presidential party game. You are a candidate running a half-baked campaign for the Presidency against your friends. Players take turns reading question cards containing campaign slogans, political promises, and awkward statements. The candidates submit one of the hundreds of crazy answer cards to fill in the blank. The combinations are read out loud and the reader votes for their favorite. The candidate that gains the most votes by the end of the game wins and is moving into a plush crib on Pennsylvania Avenue. Just like in real presidential campaigns you will make plenty of horrible promises and terrible statements, but in Bad Campaign the more ridiculous you are, the better your chances for getting elected. The game pulls content from real quotes and situations. Combined with our offbeat answer cards you will be laughing with your friends at the fat cats in Washington in no time.


90 Fill-in-the-blank Question Cards- Containing Real Quotes, Awkward Statements, and Questionable Campaign Promises



450 Crazy Answer Cards- Creating Millions of Ridiculous Combinations



Bi-partisan fun. No political knowledge necessary or needed!



Fancy Gray Box Perfect for Holding Your New Favorite Game



Sense of Satisfaction You Will Derive By Participating in Our Country's Great Electoral Process OR Your Opportunity To Make Fun Of It
publishers: Bad Campaign LLC, Dolphin Hat Games

name: Trinity's Challenge
description:
Objective
Sole survivor... to be the only player that still has her mind intact!

In Hallux Rigidus the abominations emanate psychic energy which has been infecting the townsfolks. You play the role of a preparatory school girl who has gained psychic abilities but no control. During the high stress time of mid terms your angry thoughts are manifesting and attacking your antagonists mostly draining them of their sanity but in some cases much worse.

Represented through a series of dice rolls you go on the attack against the other girls who share a similar fate. It can't end until all antagonists are eliminated!

name: Torii: Kuge Starter Box
description:
Torii is a skirmish wargame set on Feudal Japan, created by Miniatures and Wargames to use Zenit Miniatures’ range of miniatures (specifically Kensei’s)
In Torii you’ll have to lead a group of about 8-12 warriors that will have work together to accomplish their clan objectives.

Every game is different. Scenery, main and secondary missions will change, so you’ll never get bored of playing Torii.

Torii is quick to learn, with great tactical and strategic depth, with a duration of about 45-60 minutes.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Marshmallow Fight!
description:
A game where you do stunts with Marshmallows to earn points. Earn 10 points and win the game! (There is one alternative win condition)

Players take turns revealing cards from a deck of 36. Each card challenges players with various stunts. Catch one in your mouth, build a pyramid, or zing one at a buddy's forehead!

Yes, there is a card that calls for everyone to throw marshmallows at each other with reckless abandon!

This game does require marshmallows purchased at your friendly grocer and one household item, a coffee cup or similar item.

name: Trot Wars
description:
Experience the no-holds barred thrills and spills of trotskyist political organising in this fast paced game from Proletarian Democracy.

Advance your revolutionary skills and knowledge from the comfort of your own sofa, as you create united fronts, hold public meetings, demonstrations and strikes, and sell the paper in an attempt to unite the advanced section of the working class into the one true vanguard party with which to lead the proletariat into glorious revolution.

Is your group’s ideology consistent or are there splitters amongst you? Will your events be hijacked by glory seeking rivals or will you be bussing the members in? Will you grow your group or will it be torn asunder by creeping autonomism? Most importantly of all, will you sell the most copies of the paper?

Each round players have a hand of 5 double sided cards, with campaigns, events, speakers and hijack actions. Players start a campaign (or join someone elses) and then in a timed round play event cards and then speakers to attend the events. Players gain or lose members from the unaligned activist pool to their party depending on the speakers, and roll dice to see how many papers have been sold.
Then they decide if they are going to merge or split parties, with weighted dice rolls to decide how many party members each player gets if they split.

The game can be won with a collective victory, where all players unite into one party and every unaligned activist has been recruited to that party, or with individual victories if unity cannot be achieved, based on how many papers have been sold and how many party members have been recruited.
categories: Humor, Party Game, Political, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game

name: Ultimate Combat Arena
description:
A two player collectible card combat game, where players take turns playing cards to punch, kick, block, or use special abilities to defeat their opponent. Each player has their own deck, and there are currently 4 different fighters, each with their own deck. Collect booster packs for heroic rare cards to increase your combat prowess.

To play: Each player starts with 10 health. Players shuffle their decks and draw 5 cards. The first player plays any card in his or her hand and effects are resolved, and then the other player plays a card. This continues until one player chooses to end the turn instead of playing a card, or cannot play any more cards. At which point players discard any unwanted cards, draw back up to 5, and the other player gets to go first on the next turn. If a turn ends with a player at 0 or less life, and their opponent has 2 or more life than them, then that player loses. Download the print and play versions here or at the official website, www.ucagame.com.

Current fighters include:

Ansell V'han - a classically trained arena warrior, using heavy attacks to beat her foes into submission.
Tatakai - an ultra fast ninja that uses speed to keep his opponent off guard and control the battle.
Rama Lux - a monk that uses the powers of light and darkness to keep his own health up and his opponent's down.
Senka Hekt - a mysterious necromancer who uses powerful magic attacks to turn the tide of battle.

name: Outer Gods and Interlopers
description:
Outer Gods and Interlopers is a social deduction game where Cultists are performing rituals to the great and powerful Outer Gods. A few investigators have attempted to infiltrate and subvert the rituals from within but the Cult Leader has becoming increasingly weary of this and has taken to sacrificing those within the cult.

Your objective as a cultists is to successfully get Rituals to pass and as the investigator team to sow enough discord that the cult will fail in their task of bringing upon certain doom to the world.

During the ritual phase the cult leader will reveal the top ritual from the deck, it will have one or more components required for successful completion. It will also have one disruptive component that if added to the ritual will bring discord to the cult. All other players will commit a component, from their hand of three cards, face down to the ritual.

All players will have a hidden background that may force them to play a certain way, ie. if you are the Madman you must play any offering components you have.

The cult leader will then shuffle and reveal the committed components and if the necessary requirements have been met the ritual will succeed and favor from the outer gods will be gained. If the ritual does not succeed the investigators will add more discord and get one step closer to winning the game.

The game features a unique moderator role that makes decisions with the game, as well as unique player abilities that provide many opportunities to either sniff out the Investigators or sow discord.

name: Mutiny Anyone?
description:
A fun and fast paced game of negotiation on the high seas. Beautiful and silly illustrations come to life as players struggle between helping the Captain voyage to new and promising lands or causing a raucous and leading to mutiny.

Game play is a simultaneous action, keeping everyone engaged and guessing, as they each try to become the Captain for the day. The captain will find themselves challenged in thought provoking actions that can appease their crew or sail on towards their own agenda.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Humor, Negotiation, Party Game, Pirates

name: Madner: Lost in Space
description:
You are a crew member in an alien ship. Alien for humans of course. The ship is malfunctioning and you are stranded in the human solar system.
Using primitive detectors, you are trying to identify as many planets as possible.

The quest is finished when Earth has been claimed and no one disproved the claim after 2 rounds or when a crew member receives maximum influence from their captain.

The winner is the crew member with the most influence.

Each player holds a detector card and a bunch of colored tokens.
Each round players execute 2 actions each turn.

The possible actions are: Detect, Claim and Disprove.

Detecting
Players use the detector cards and place them under each hidden planet.
Once flipped the player secretly sees a part of the planet and notes down the information.

Claiming
Players move the claimed card from the game board onto it's claimed location.

Disproving
Players use their detector card to disprove an existing claim.
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Educational, Fantasy, Science Fiction
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Crisis in Eastern Europe: Transnistrian Insurrection
description: This is the Second game planned to come out for our Modern Crisis Line of games. In Transnistrian Insurrection up to four players can take on the roles of the commanders of either; Transnistria/Russia, Moldova/Romania, Belarus, or the Ukraine. They will be fighting for control of the old Soviet sphere of influence as the Moldova/Romania your main goal will be to take out the break away nation of Transnistria before the Russian Army can break through the Ukraine to help them. The game works in phases where each player will switch off and have good opportunities to counter attack and stand there ground when need be. The game also uses an interest damage chit pulling system to simulate the unexpected nature of modern combat. This is a deep war-game that can make you think about the real possibilities of a war like this in the very near future.

name: Bloodstone Frontier
description:
Bloodstone Frontier is a tabletop skirmish game using high-quality resin figures that's set in a pioneer-punk universe in which the card-based gameplay mechanisms remove the requirement for tape measures and dice.

Set in the technologically-progressive town of Hope, gangs fight over stashes that supply them with the assets they need to prosper and survive. Generations ago, they were sent to this world to guide the human race to a new future based on intelligence and craft, rather than history and politics, but not much from the past has changed in the future.

The game is played with a standard deck of poker-sized cards that players use to perform actions, make attacks and defend their characters. Although the basic system is simple, few decisions are simple and many have knock-on effects that must be considered.
categories: American West, Card Game, Science Fiction

name: Earthos
description:
From the publisher:

Earthos is a strategy-based board game with features rarely, if ever seen in most board games today. Your objective in the game is to defeat your opponents by increasing technology, making strategic invasions and occupying enemy planets. Other strategic aspects of the game include rotating planets and moons, as well as random wormholes which allow units to move randomly. Politics can also play a pivotal role in match-ups with more than two players.

One last important highlight is the fact that each and every game can be a new experience. With the ability to change the shape of the board, pair up for team battles, and do much more, every game should be packed with fun.

name: Uncle Web Knows Best
description:
Are you ready for a pop-culture trivia game where you have to think up the questions, your opponent provides the answer, and we rely on the Internet to settle the bet?

The handheld 69-card deck features the question prompts from popular categories like movies, TV, sports, corporations, famous people, places, and things.

You versus me, let's go.

If I played the card "US Politicians, current age," and said to you, "Donald Trump, 67 and a half," would you say "Over" or "Under"? Once answered, use your phone to look it up and settle the bet.

Switch roles, play to 9. That simple!

name: Occyourpation
description:
From the rulebook:

Occyourpation is a game of Financial Management, simulating the normal day to day costs of owning your own home and car, while at the same time running a business. The object of the came is to own your own $30,000 car, $100,000 house and have a nest egg from your businesses totaling $1,000,000!

Occyourpation is an 1978 Australian made board game made by Cassa products and is an Australian themed economic game.

In Occyourpation, much in the same vein as Monopoly, players throw dice and move around a board while purchasing objects they land on. Players however are gated on which paths on the board they are allowed to take, each path with different penalties and rewards, by their level of vehicle and income. Players are allowed to purchase shares, businesses, houses and cars aiming to earn more and more money and eventually reach the Victory condition.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Trading

name: SOL: Adventure Special Tokens
description:
Nine new types of token (wild animal, trap, curse, nothing, move x2, sword x2, treatment, firearm, reroll)
These were given away with the original game SOL for the first buyer in French boardgame stores.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: 9DKP
description:
GAME SYSTEM



This entry is to allow for discussion/rating of the game system as a whole. It is not for a specific product or release. Versions will appear on the individual item pages.





9DKP is a Trading Card Game (TCG) for 2 players, that takes place in the 9DKP universe that was created by world famous, toy designer Erick Scarecrow. 9DKP eschews complex rules for a lighter, faster game that still provides players with the fun and depth found in other TCGs. This Streamlined game play makes 9DKP the perfect game for players new to the genre, or for masters looking for something new. With hundreds of cards to choose from, 9DKP: The TCG gives players nearly an infinite amount of choices when it comes to building their decks. Fill out your ranks with Character cards that generate DKP and offer special abilities. Think strategically and pair Characters with unique abilities to make powerful combos, or fill out your deck with Characters that quickly and consistently fill your DKP bank! Spend your amassed DKP to use powerful Skratch cards that can cause game-changing results, or use it to put into play rare and powerful Character cards that can annihilate your opponent!

—description from the publisher

Gameplay in 9DKP is very simple, consisting of 2 phases.

Phase 1 – Draw: draw 1 new card into your hand.

Phase 2 – Active: During the active phase you do the follow:

Wake up any character cards that are in Katnap.
Play 1 character card into your RANGE (with a max of 4 cards in your RANGE at one time). Generate or spend the corresponding DKP value of the card. That card enters in Katnap and cannot attack or defend during this turn unless otherwise stated.
Play any number of skratch cards you wish as long as you can afford the associated DKP cost.
Play passes to your opponent.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Fighting, Number, Zombies
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Trading

name: Races of War
description:
Peace was once kept between the races by the Order of the Paladins in the service to the King. That was until the chief paladin gave-in to corruption. After summoning Undead armies he destroyed the kingdom. Since the fall of the central government the races of the land have scattered and formed themselves into various factions. The factions trust none but their own and seek to prevent another from ruling over them.

In "Races of War" each player controls a faction and tries to defeat their opponent's faction, thus ensuring their survival for another day. Each faction has a unique array of creatures with varying abilities, spells and attacks.

The players take turns advancing creatures across the board. The pieces all look the same from the back, but have identifying numbers on the front. The identity of the pieces is only revealed when they are involved in an attack or use other abilities or spells. Be the first to locate and capture your opponent's commander and the rest will surrender.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: 2048: The Board Game
description:
It is fun and easy-to-play board game , appropriate for all ages, which aims to become a modern classic. The 2-player version is a real duel, while the 4 player one is a great family contest! There will be 4 gaming methods for 2-3-4 persons, You can vary them to provide entertainment for a quick-paced game as well as a longer family fun session. The game will also be suitable for championships.

The main target is to find pairs and place tiles from hand to reach 2048.

Is is a simple game, but carries a lot of opportunities to improve strategic thinking. So game by game you will find, this game is not as simple as it looks...


Nagyon lelkesek vagyunk, tudjuk hogy mekkora potenciál van ebben a játékban. A legnehezebb feladatunk az volt hogy kommunikáljuk a szenvedélyünket és a víziónkat, meglátásunkat. A tesztek során több, mint 95%-ban pozitív visszajelzést kaptunk ami teljesen különlegesnek számít a társasjátékok világában.

Tudjuk, hogy nagyon vicces-mulatságos a játék: jól bemutatja, hogy milyen rövid az agyunk illetve rövidzárlatos…

Játszunk még egyet?

Ez volt a leggyakrabban ismételt kérdés a tesztelÅktÅl és emiatt is van most itt ez a projekt.

Amikor elkezdtünk játszani nagyon sokat nevettünk, fÅleg saját magunkon. Reméltük, hogy ezt jókedv másoknál is elÅjön játék közben és így is lett. Most pedig meg szeretnénk osztani a világgal ezt az élményt.

Azzal tudjátok támogatni ezt a projektet, hogy vásároltok ebbÅl a készségfejlesztÅ és szórakoztató társasjátékból, egyet vagy kettÅt vagy négyet… vagy akár 2048-at! :)

name: Malifaux Second Edition:  Burning Revelation â Kaeris Box Set
description:
Crew box for Kaeris for the second edition. The box set contains Kaeris, Eternal Flame (Totem), Firestarter (Henchman), and three Fire Gamin.

The box set is for second edition and contains the plastic figures and associated crew cards.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Study Hall Skirmish
description:
It’s the last hour of the school day, on a Friday, before a vacation, and there’s a substitute teacher in study hall. Of course a spitball fight breaks out … Players will buy classroom combat troops, set them up on the study hall battle grid, and wage furious pencil driven warfare!

Players take turns spending 12 troop points, buying and placing a single troop each turn. Troops are represented by unique symbols, cost the number of squares they cover, and each have an action as detailed in the troop chart. Troops can never move once they are placed.

Once all 12 points of troops have been placed, players will take turns using the actions of all of their available troops. Some troops are only available on some rounds, and destroyed troops can never take an action. The start player is whoever was most recently in detention. Rounds are tracked on the round chart with each player drawing half of an X in the current round box after they have acted, making a full X after both sides have gone.

To use an action, place your pencil tip on the acting troop, close your eyes, and draw a line - an action line – toward another troop. An action is successful if the action line touches another troop, affecting the first troop it touches (unless the troop’s description says differently). An action line doesn’t have to be ruler straight, but it must travel in what is generally a straight line. You can’t scribble or go all ziggy-zaggy.

When a troop is damaged, shade in one of its squares. It doesn’t matter which square gets shaded. Repairs work the same way, but you erase the damage from the affected troop. When a troop has all it’s squares shaded in, it is destroyed. If a troop has been destroyed it can still be repaired.

The first player to destroy all their opponent’s troops wins! If no one has won by the 24th round, whoever has taken the least damage wins.

name: Hephaestus
description:
From time to time, blacksmiths from all around the world gather in a competition that shall decide who is the world's best blacksmith, the only one entitled to the blessing of Hephaestus, the god of the forge. But not all are worthy of such honor, and only those artisans able to create the best weapons, armor and shields have a chance.
Hephaestus is a simple, yet very involving game that brings all the strategy from the worker placement mechanics using only cards. Each blacksmith has a special skill and a single specialty. On her turn, the player must choose one of the actions of the game and pick up the card of that action:


Buy resources
Purchase contracts
Buy improvements for weapons
And Install Improvements


Each contract describes how to create an equipment, which can be either a weapon, an armor or a shield, and shows the resources and the amount of work needed to create the equipment. For each piece of equipment you will need to heat the metal, cool it down and then smash it with your hammer! The required time for each step depends on the equipment, and the time you will actually take to forge it depends on the action cards you will take during the game. Each time you complete a contract, you receive the number of victory points described in it, earning bonus points according to their powers and their improvements! The game ends when the contract card deck is over, and the blacksmith who has the most victory points is the winner!

Game Components:
- 104 Cards
- 4 players boards
- 26 Resource tokens

name: Malifaux Second Edition:  Vengeful Spirits
description:
Second Edition box set for Kirai. Box contains Kirai, Lost Love (totem), Ikiriyo (only summonable by Kirai, two Seishin (only summonable) and two Onryo. Box is in plastic and must be assembled. Box contains relevant character and upgrade cards.

Kirai is a ressurectionist master who specializes in summning spirits and manipulating spirits. The box contains three models that can only be summoned, so it contains a lower soul stone count than is normal for a crew set.
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Buccaneer's Bounty: A Piratey Wargame for Kids
description:
Buccaneer’s Bounty is a piratey wargame for kids. It’s designed to introduce the fun of playing games with models, dice and lollipop sticks(!) to children as young as 4 years old.

Where do I get it?
The full rules and print-to-play PDFs are available for free at http://www.farfaraway.org/blog/buccaneers-bounty/.

What do I need to play?
If you’ve never played wargames before all you need is a copy of the rules, some ordinary size-sided dice and access to a printer to print out the quick start paper ‘models’, treasure and lollipop sticks. You can replace these with counters and real lollipop sticks when budget allows! If you have a collection of models and some terrain already you can dive right in with those.

I don’t have any pirate models… is that a problem?
Not at all. There are 'print and play' models included. Buccaneer’s Bounty has rules for using other common model types.

How long does a game take?
About 20 minutes, even with 4 players. I wanted the game to play quickly with each player taking short turns, so no one is left waiting for long to act. The scenarios are quick to set up, so if you want to play another game it’ll only take a minute to get going again.

name: The Warlord
description:
Originally self published by Mike Hayes in 1974 as "The Warlord". This edition came in a red box.

An area-control game of domination similar to Risk, The Warlord allowed a player to use armies and A-Bombs to beat all other opponents to win the game.

The Red box version had large un-laminated mapboards.

Advertised in 'Games & Puzzles' magazine.

name: Bass Fishing Board Game
description:
The Bass Fishing Board Game involves moving around the board to different fishing spots with your boat pawn. At those spots you can use a combination of lures, action cards, and dice for the chance to land a big bass. The object of the game is to fill your boat with five of the largest fish. At the end of the tournament, each player's total fish weight is calculated and a winner is determined.

Visit www.bassfishingboardgame.com for more.
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Mobile Assault Card Game "Mao vs Chiang: Struggle for China"
description:
A fast action card game that combines strategic planning and tactical combat all in one. The best thing about the game is the portability. It has a small footprint, and can be played in 30mins to 60mins.

Mobile Assault Card Game "Mao vs Chang: Struggle for China" pits the nationalist forces of china against the communist forces, the game allows players to recreate the tension and stress of the Chinese Civil War post ww2. Each player starts with their five major cities on the table, and a hand of five cards. The cards in the game can either be unit cards representing regiment, and brigade sized units. Factories and population center cards that are used to produce two types of currency production, and manpower. By exhausting production, and manpower you may bring more combat units to bear against your enemy. the ultimate goal being to strike major blows to the enemy players five major cites and render their nation combat ineffective thus winning the game. But be ware the character cards such as Mao and Chiang these cards give all their units special buffs in combat and morale. But to counter this the player has one more type of card the political event cards, and propaganda cards these are used to assassinate the other players characters call on a major strategic bombing offensive, and boost a nations national will to fight. Good luck and may the best leader rule China.
