mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Dungeon Dealer
description:
From the designer:

Dungeon Dealer generates random maps with enemies, traps, and obstacles. Draw a card, roll a 20 sided die to see which position the new map section goes, and see if you've been surprised by the enemy. For both free drawing and 3D tiles, every card is different. There are literally billions of ways to lay out a map using these unique cards. Both decks can be combined to create massive dungeons.

For solitary, cooperative, and competitive play, Dungeon Dealer is a flexible game with a number of rules:

Solitary gameplay

a. Initially pulling a starting map card from the deck
b. hand drawing or placing three dimensional tiles in the shape of the map shown on the card
c. placing character within that drawn grid map
d. progressing from 1 inch square to 1 inch square within the perimeters of the tabletop roleplaying experience
e. drawing a new card once the player is on an unexplored/open edge of the map
f. rolling a 20 sided die to determine the north, east, south, or west orientation of that card
g. hand drawing or placing three dimensional tiles in the shape of the map shown on the new card
h. discarding that used card
i. reacting to the random placement of each asset on the card like enemies, obstacles, and traps
j. repeating these turns in a cycle as the map grows
k. ending game when all cards are drawn or all players perish.

Cooperative gameplay

a. Initially pulling a starting map card from the deck
b. hand drawing or placing three dimensional tiles in the shape of the map shown on the card
c. placing character or characters within that draw grid map
d. progressing from 1 inch square to 1 inch square within the perimeters of the tabletop roleplaying experience
e. drawing a new card once the player is on an unexplored/open edge of the map
f. rolling a 20 sided die to determine the north, east, south, or west orientation of that card
g. hand drawing or placing three dimensional tiles in the shape of the map shown on the new card
h. discarding that used card
i. reacting to the random placement of each asset on the card like enemies, obstacles, and traps
j. alternating these turns within a group of players until every player has had a turn
k. repeating these turns in a cycle as the map grows
l. ending game when all cards are drawn or all players perish.

Competitive gameplay for 2-10 players

a. dealing out three cards to each player or team of players which they keep secret, no player or team of players can have more than three cards at a time
b. starting on opposite ends of a blank grid map that is either a dry erase board or paper, or on a tabletop for three dimensional tile placement
c. progressing from 1 inch square to 1 in square within the perimeters of the tabletop roleplaying experience
d. drawing a card from the player’s hand once the player is on an unexplored/open edge of the map
e. rolling a 20 sided die to determine the north, east, south, or west orientation of that card
f. hand drawing or placing three dimensional tiles in the shape of the map shown on the new card
g. discarding that used card
h. replacing used card with a new card from the deck
i. alternating these turns within a group of players until every player has had a turn
j. repeating these turns in a cycle as the map grows
k. trading in an unwanted card in the player’s hand for a new card from the deck when the player rolls a 20 with the 20 sided die when orienting the card
l. giving the unwanted card to a rival player
m. progressing through the map, avoiding obstacles and vanquishing enemies
n. linking up the map in the middle so that all players meet
o. battling each other to see which player or team wins
p. ending game when all but one player or team survives.

Knowing that thousands of players have game components that require a game master to make playable, we wanted to create a system for randomly generating dungeons that does that work for you.

Keeping Dungeon Dealer simple was very important to us. One of the best things about tabletop roleplaying is how DIY the culture is. It’s a community built on making and sharing. By keeping this deck simple, we’ve allowed it to be adaptable in countless preexisting systems.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Royal Steward
description:
Royal Steward is a medieval period strategy board game. The purpose of the game is to impress The King so that he will appoint you as his Royal Steward. You impress him by performing various actions efficiently, building your wealth, and showing you are a knowledgeable and have great diversity.

You get to choose among 55 Occupations to play (Baker, Miner, Locksmith, Shipwright, etc.). Some Occupations obtain raw resources (cotton, gold ore, oak, etc.), while others convert resources (gold ore->pure gold, oak->spear, gold necklace->gold diamond necklace, etc.). Some even just perform services for prestige points (bard singing, physician curing the sick, etc.).

The game takes place over a year period, with 1 Occupation being used per month. Therefore, you have 12 months (turns) to impress The King and prove he should appoint you as his royal steward.

name: Croix-Rouge cartes Ã  jouer
description:
This game based on UNO, was given for free to blood donors in Belgium.

The objective of the game is to be the first to empty their hands.
In turns, players attempt to play a card by matching the previous card color, number or symbol. If unable to play, players draw a card from the draw pile, and if still unable to play, they pass their turn. Wild and special cards spice things up a bit:

Card "+1" / "+2"
Card "Invert"
Card "Skip turn"
Card "Change color"


Ce jeu basé sur UNO, était donner gratuitement aux donneurs de sang en Belgique

L'objectif du jeu est d'être le premier à se débarrasser de toutes ses cartes. Chacun son tour, les joueurs tentent de jouer une de leur cartes en correspondant à la couleur, le numéro ou symbole de la carte précédente. Si le joueur ne peut pas jouer, il doit prendre une carte de la pioche, et s'il ne peut toujours pas jouer, il passe son tour. Des cartes spéciales rendent le jeu plus intéressant :

Carte "+1" / "+2"
Carte "Inversion"
Carte "Passer son tour"
Carte "Changer de couleur"

name: Dumme Dame
description:
Dumme Dame is an abstract 2 player game printed on a postcard. Only a pencil is needed (and an eraser for multiple plays).

The playing field consists of 4 x 4 spaces. One player starts and writes a number between 1 and 3 into one of the fields and adds an orthogonal or diagonal arrow to the field. The next player follows the arrow and starts his/her player on the target space (the written number is the distance in spaces from the origininal space). Some limitations apply:

No move may lead over or onto an already used field.
No move may lead towards an arrow (no back and forth movement).


The player who cannot make a legal move loses.

name: Other Gods
description: Other Gods is the dueling card game that pits mythological gods of every tradition together in a pitched battle for divine supremacy. You play as the deity of your choice in the waning days of polytheism, desperately trying to retain your follower base while attempting to convert or destroy those of your opponents'. Win the game by being the last God with a following.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Justa
description:
Justa lets you play a joust this is the first version more content will be added so enjoy.

The first thing to do is to make your knight by rolling dice to obtain stats. The joust itself is divided in steps. Each step is resolved by rolling dice. The results of the joust are on tables and it is here where the modifiers of your stats play a big role.

The main idea behind this rules came from a knights tale and the masterpiece of cinema excalibur and also knights of the round table.

there is no set of free rules simulation nowhere so here it is for the players.

name: Heroes' Crossroads: The Battle of Lausdell, December 17-18, 1944
description:
From the publisher:
“Our victory stands behind the last battle!” –Excerpt from General Gerd von Rundstedt’s message to the German troops on the eve of the Wacht am Rhine offensive.

When the German offensive in the Ardennes opened, speed was of the essence for them to win. The capture of the crossroads at Lausdell in the first days of the attack was crucial, as this would allow the 1st SS Panzer division to breakthrough. Holding the critical road juncture were the 1st Battalion, 9th Regiment of the 2nd Infantry Division, with support from Company A, 741st Tank Battalion and elements of the 99th Infantry Division, who had fallen back in the face of the overwhelming opening attacks the day before at Lanzerath. Behind this small force there was literally nothing to stop the Germans. Tasked with seizing the Lausdell crossroad was the 12th SS, Hitler Youth Division. One of the war’s truly epic fights was about to begin.

name: Above Top Secret
description:
Above Top Secret is a turn-based strategic Card Game designed as a two player game or team play for 4+ players (which would require an extra copy of the base game). The game is suited for ages 12+. Depending on how many players are involved, the game will take approximately 60 - 100 minutes to complete.

You have been recruited to take command of the Defense Systems for a Top Secret Military Base.

There are many weapon systems at your disposal, including some that are classified Above Top Secret. These include prototype systems, which have been reverse engineered from recovered Extraterrestrial Technology.

As your Security Clearance Level increases, you will gain access to ever more advanced technology.

But beware; there are Extraterrestrial forces monitoring the conflict closely. Your brilliant strategic plans may be upset by their direct interference when you least expect it..

Each Military Base consists of four main areas. Players must protect their Base using the Technology and Weaponry at their disposal, subject to their level of Security Clearance. Secret Technology, Alien Technology and, at times, direct Alien interference features heavily within the game and will play a part in the strategies you develop.

Using your personal deck of Defense Cards, which you are able to configure depending on the way you play, you must seek to break through your opponent’s Defenses and destroy their four Base Areas, whilst ensuring that at least one of yours remains standing.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination

name: The Red Dragon's Lair 2: Pharaoh's Tomb
description:
The Red Dragon's Lair 2: Pharaoh's Tomb is a fantasy adventure in which you become a Monk, Sorceress, Wolfman or Dragonborn Avenger on a quest to defeat a evil Necromancer. You control the actions of a daring adventurer finding the way through a dungeon filled with undead monsters and treacherous traps. In the mysterious creepy corridors of the dungeon your quest continues against the evil forces that oppose you. Your daring adventure begins and your quest awaits.

Your goal is to clear the dungeon of evil and to defeat a evil Necromancer. You and the other players join together looting monsters and plundering the dungeon in search of magical items and weapons!

This game is a character-driven game, which uses both cards and dice to deal with the many obstacles within the dungeon and the battle with the Necromancer. Players play cards from their hands and roll dice to complete their goal.

Players choose a character deck at the beginning of the game then equip their special items and weapons. Each character is unique and uses different styles of play. The awesome forces that oppose you can prove to be more than a match and adventurers will die!

Working together, on their own or against the other players. They battle monsters and avoid traps. When the Necromancer is defeated the player that collected the most gold wins the game!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination

name: Things Man Was Not Meant To Know
description:
Rules which allows you run Cthulhu Mythos games using the Chain Reaction (1.0) and Guns and Girls rules. First published in the Ragnarok fanzine, issue 45.

It has rules on Special Abilities, Sanity Loss, Magic, Creatures of the Mythos and Scenarios.

The Beatiary includes;

Dark Young
Deep Ones
Elder Things
Ghouls
Mi-Go
Nightgaunts
Shoggoths


It has also has a Mi-Go weapons list.

name: Assault on Innsmouth
description:
Assault on Innsmouth is a miniatures game by Grégory Privat from Gloranthan Army which bring the very specific atmosphere of H.P. Lovecrafts' novel, "Shadow over Innsmouth" to the tabletop. The game is played using a slightly modified and heavily simplified version of the Two Hour Wargames system, Chain Reaction 2.0.

The rules covers;

Soidiers
FT17 Tank
Deep Ones
Hybrids
Shoggoths
The Star Spawn


The game was first shown at the London Wargames show SALUTE in 2009 and the rules are avaliable free to download (French and English).

name: Slimmer Man: The Getaway
description:
Run thru the forest and survive all you can cause Slimmer Man is behind!

As one of the six archetypes, you alone (or with a friend) have to walk your way out from the forest. Survive till you getaway or walk into Slimmer man's arms and yeah that's not a choice.

The board is composed of 9 Forest Cards. One of the cards (the start card) is dealt face up and the others? Shuffle them and then place them in a 3x3 formation.

Each turn you one step on the Forest cards. Each time you step on a new Forest card you turn it upright to see what you have to do while you are there. Some cards tell you to shuffle specific board cards, one lets you take a Light token and there is one you never want to find; Slimmer Man’s Card that makes you get a Fear token.

How to win? Walk around the board 10 times without finding Slimmer Man, but if he gets you, you receive a Fear token and you and your partner steps by the Forest are back to zero, but if you have Light token and Slimmer Man appear light him instead of receiving a Fear token. With 4 times that you give Light Slimmer Man or 10 steps through the Forest are enough to win.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Team-Based Game

name: Survive The Horde Party Game
description:
Survive The Horde Party Game is a 2-8 player character-driven game with zombie battles and in-game challenges intended for a 17+ audience.

The game starts by selecting a character card and a set number of brain chips. Players take turns in a clockwise order. To take a turn, a player takes the top card from the zombie deck and reads it out loud. Zombie cards may have an in-game challenge, a Curse, or you may have to attack the zombie with a roll of the dice. When a zombie is defeated, players are rewarded with a survivor card. These survivor cards feature wacky ways to slay zombies, help you survive, and sabotage other players. When a player fails to defeat a zombie or complete a challenge, they must turn one of their brain chips to its undead side. If all brains have been turned to their undead side, a player is now undead and must try to win battles and challenges to get themselves back in the game.

A player wins by being the last player with at least one healthy brain chip.

name: Square Game
description:
The purpose of 'Square Game' is to gain control of the most squares by the time the game ends.
In the game players take the pieces and place them in the play space (this is referred to as the board although there is not a physical board). When a player places a piece on the board they perform the action indicated on the piece. When a player places a piece to complete a square they capture the area.
Players move and play pieces creating or breaking squares until no further moves can be made and the game comes to an end.

name: Card Strike
description:
Description from the publisher:

Action and goal
You have 3 decks of cards. Terrorists, counter-terrorists and action cards(which help ter. or c.-t. to win battle but you can do not use action card if feel your person card is strong enough).
(1 vs 1) You can mix all cards and play so. Or you can play for any of 2 sides(terrorists or c.-t.).
The goal is to have any card(terrorists or c-t)by the end of the game.

Fun
This game have everything: the capture and release of the hostages, and defuzing bombs, monitoring, not a team playing, and even the invasion of zombies (coming zombies servers apparently). Game have ultimate funy combinations like - 3 meme royalflash kittys or Cheeter or Admin card.
The game was originally planned on the card field, but in principle has been made for more user-friendly format of the game.
Game developed with well-known CS players with experience of 10 years of playing.
Skins special forces of many countries.
Playing with humor.
It is interesting to play a lot of micro rounds. When you become pro it will be interesting to play against 2 or three players.
In plans to hold tournaments in the discipline of CS cards.
So you can already start training.

name: Battle of the Bands: Deluxe Edition
description: Battle of the Bands is, an all ages, fun, "screw you" type card/dice game for 2-6 players. (with expansions, up to 10 players!) Start your band and destroy your opponents onstage! With the separation of the main deck into the Red Deck (Resource Deck) and the Blue Deck (Events) BotBDE adds a greater level of control for your band and their ultimate goal. BotBDE also allows much more band battling with 6 player play-ability.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Music, Party Game

name: Merchants of the Sea
description:
Description from the designer:

Hello Captain! We've got some new worlds to explore!

Play solo, with others (up to 4 players) in coop style or against each other. Goal? Collect and earn the most Golden Coins when the last Merchant Ship arrives at his destination! This could take between 60 to 180 minutes. Depends a lot on how you play it! Playing pirate style? Possible! More into trading? Possible too! Or perhaps you’re a sneaky bastard and let your opponent drift of the corner of the Earth. Haven’t you heard it? The Earth is flat and you could fall off..

Every player starts with his/her own player card and a big empty table ready to explore new Islands to buy and sell goods (Silk, Coffee, etc). With the profits you buy upgrades to sail faster, turn sharper, become more devastating with better canons, upgrade the amount of goods you could hold and much more! Conquer the game controlled Merchants ships (up to 4) en bring them back to a safe haven. Collect their goods and earn even more Golden Coins!

Every player needs to sail upwind or at max with crosswind and depending on their speed marker placing their little ship marker 1 or more tiles further away. They pick randomly new tiles and place them adjacent around their ship. You will find probably more sea tiles (160+!) or maybe a new Island (up to 5)? Who knows! A fact is: no game is the same!

Don’t like the wind direction? Well, pay for it (in a auction) and change it! It comes with a flaw though: you’re sitting duck the next part of this round…

Remember: The player with the most Golden Coins wins in the end! Be wise to spend not all of your Golden Coins with upgrades/goods. You’re not the first to win with just a few Golden Coins ;-)

Description from the designer (Dutch):

Welkom aan boord Kapitein. Je gaat nieuwe werelden ontdekken, handel drijven en de piraat uithangen!

Neem als speler een eigen overzichtsbord en plaats de markers op de getallen binnen de blauwe balken. Zoals je ziet heeft jouw schip de mogelijkheid om Suiker, Specerijen, Koffie, Zijde en Slaven te vervoeren.

Maar hoe goed kan jij de wind bevaren? Tegen de wind in kom je geen steek verder! En alleen met zijwind of meewind kom je vooruit. Want dat moet je, je moet winst maken om jouw schip te verbeteren om uiteindelijk zo veel mogelijk goudstukken over te houden aan het einde van het spel als alle koopvaardijschepen binnen zijn.

Kies een plek op de tafel waar vandaan jouw schip zal vertrekken (de jongste speler begint en daarna met de klok mee). Deze thuishaven beschermt je tegen anderen en daar kun je goudstukken veilig opslaan. Echter kun je in jouw thuishaven niets kopen, verkopen of upgraden. Geef de windrichting een slinger en kies de windrichting naar het Noorden, Zuiden, Oosten of Westen die het meest in de buurt komt

Door jouw onervarenheid als Kapitein mag je jouw schip in het begin maar steeds 1 veld verder zetten. Met upgrades zal je sneller en wendbaarder worden. Iedere keer nadat je jouw schip hebt verplaatst leg je direct daar omheen nieuwe zeetegels en ontdek je misschien wel nieuwe eilanden met een haven. Aangekomen bij een haven worden op de eilandenkaart bijgehouden welke goederen gekocht en verkocht kunnen worden en voor welke prijs. Met goudstukken koop je upgrades in de havens die je aandoet. Besteed dus niet meteen al je goudstukken aan vracht!

Maar je bent niet alleen op zee… Er varen ook andere piraten rond en misschien zelfs schijterige koopvaardijvaarders met interessante waren…

Een spel om alleen of met anderen om samen (of tegen elkaar) te strijden!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Novice Knights
description:
Story:

Four Lords are at the King's Castle preparing for War. Each Lord has brought Seven Knights, all of whom have, for whatever reason, decided to make some poor decisions the night before the battle. All of these knights have found themselves in one of three places: The Tavern, The Inn, and the Armory. The Lords, having heard of the shenanigans going on throughout the castle, have dispatched messengers to each of their seven knights, instructing them to finish up whatever they are doing, and return to the barracks at once. To make things interesting, the Lords have offered handsome rewards to the knights who return best prepared for the ensuing battle.

The race is on for the Knights to return to their Lord's Barracks, ready for battle.

Game Play:

Novice Knights is a Victory Point game, kind of like Settlers Of Catan. The goal is to gain 17 Victory Points in the 4 player variant, and 19 Victory Points in the 2 player variant.
The game play itself consists of three areas: The Inn, The Tavern, and The Armory, each with its own unique game mechanics and ways to earn Victory Points.

The Tarvern is a simple "Roll the Dice and Advance" board game, kind of like Chutes and Ladders. There are separate symmetrical paths for each player to follow, with danger along the way. For each Knight that successfully navigates his way out of The Tavern, the player earns Victory Points.

The Inn is a basic tile choosing/flipping game, like a simpler version of Carcassonne. Players select tiles without knowing what is in store for them on the other side. Both danger and glory await behind The Inn's tiles.

The final section, The Armory, holds the most dangerous and challenging section of the game. This Card-Based section, reminiscent of Munchkin offers the Knights the opportunity to suit up before the battle. The only problem is, several Dragons have made their home in The Armory, and it's dangerous to go alone (Take this!).
categories: Children's Game, Humor, Medieval, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Melencolia
description:
A collection of 34+ multi-player abstract strategic games based on the concept of mental arithmetic, puzzle, tic-tac-toe, pattern recognition, and magic square. Every move you and your opponents make will influence your next move. The 4 basic games include FOUR EYES SQUARE, MAGIC SCARCE, ANTI-MAGIC SQUARE, and HIDDEN FLUSH. Our Vol.II & Vol.III downloadable manuals include another 20 new games - MAGIC LINK GO - Three in A Row, MAGIC LINK GO - Quadrilaterals, TRIPLE-SUM-ASSAULT, MYSTIC STACKER, PRIME-A-PAIR, MATCH UP 17, ‎EYES TO EYES, THIRTY SUM THINK!, TRIGINTA GENUS, KETTEN MAX, MAGIC SLIDER, ARITHMETIC WARLORDS, EYES ON PATHS, NUMMERFEST, TUG OF SUM, NUMBER-MINES, TIT-FOR-TAT, BINARY FOE, SERIAL LINKER, TOLL POSITIONS, FEUDAL MAGIC, DECEITS, SWIVEL PASS, CYCLIC BITS, MAGIC DEFUSER, MAGIC SUMS OF FOUR, EVENS AND ODDS, FRACTIONAL WAR, PRODUCTS FIGHTS, and EYE OPENER. More new games are coming in 2018. For a brief description of each game, please visit our BLOG page https://www.quxacto.com/blog-1/category/English-Posts .

These all-new innovative games are designed to train your mental arithmetic, memory, pattern recognition, problem solving, strategy formulation and planning skills. Each game is goal-driven and has a set of rules in which players can play against each other competitively. They are very educational and challenging for players of all ages. MELENCOLIA games are truly designed for the whole family, from youngsters to elderly and all ages in between. Students can practice their math skills while playing these games interactively with each other in the classroom.

Requires the Qu-MAT (sold separately) to play.
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Enclosure, Grid Movement, Memory, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Secret Unit Deployment, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Quxacto
description:
This abstract game is the best brain exercise for the whole family. To win, you must score as many points as possible while blocking your opponents' winning moves.

The goal is to score points by aligning the color of your tokens in rows, columns, diagonals and squares of four positions. The game combined the concepts of Go, Reversi, Gomoku, Chess, Mahjong and tic-tac-toe. Players must observe not only the tokens on the game board (Qu-Mat), but also each player's tokens in possession. The game ends when a player exceeds the target score preset by the players prior to the game. Using a special scoring procedure, this game allows players to play with money instead of points.

Requires the Qu-MAT (sold separately) to play.

name: Pagodarama
description:
The emperor has ordered his council to relocate all pagodas away from the capital. The fastest person who completes the task will be rewarded.

This abstract game combined elements of puzzle, Tower of Hanoi, Ludo and Chinese checker to bring endless fun for the whole family. It is designed to help players to improve their cognitive planning skills. The game also includes a separate game called "Pagoda Raiders" of which owners can download the player's manual from the company website free of charge. The well-designed and colorful pagoda layers make this game enjoyable to play.

Requires the Qu-MAT (sold separately) to play.

name: Rodent Hunter
description:
Your backyard rodent problem just got worst, you and your hunting buddies must do everything to get rid of them.

This is a family game which simulates the catching of rodents in the backyard garden. The concept behind this game includes treasure hunting, card action, dice-rolling and strategic planning. Like all other Quxacto games, this game has embedded several types of cognitive memory training for the players. Children will benefit a great deal in playing this game due to the subtle emphasis on visual and short term memory. Elderly can play this game to exercise their memory functions in a relaxed setting. The goal of the game is to capture as many rodent points as possible. This fast pace action game will bring infinite fun to the whole family.

Requires the Qu-MAT (sold separately) to play.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Educational, Exploration, Memory, Miniatures, Party Game
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Memory, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Tile Placement

name: Freebooter's Fate: Deep Jungle
description:
New inhabitants have been spotted in the jungles on Leonera: the Amazons! Dangerous warriors who were born for jungle combat and who sneak up on their enemies quietly only to suddenly pounce on them. Gather a pride of Amazons and go hunting for clothskins.

There are also reinforcements for the existing crews, however. Hot-blooded female pirates, Fate’s gift to women, smoke-bomb throwers, barrel wearers, barricade builders, failed circus acrobats and trained rat swarms are among the new characters for pirates, Brotherhood, Armada and goblins. Expand your existing crews and go out to show the uppity feathered females who really owns the jungle.

There is enough opportunity, because new scenarios have been added as well. And so you don’t lose track of things, the book also contains an index for both of the volumes published so far. So what are you waiting for? The jungle is calling you!

The book includes on 80 richly illustrated pages:

the new Amazons crew with 10 charakters
rules for a total of 17 new characters for the crews Pirates, Goblin Pirates, Imperial Armada and Brotherhood, as well as a new female animal handler Mercenary
expanded terrain rules, new traits and actions
5 new Jungle-scenarios like Hunt the Dodo or Man Raid
The Treasure of the Amayalli - mini camapaign with 3 more scenario


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Pirates, Print & Play

name: Love Will Tear Us Apart
description:
Love Will Tear Us Apart
A sad little game about dividing your stuff after a divorce.

How to play:

1. Hold the paper up between each other for 5 seconds. The side you are looking at shows your goal items. You then flip the paper over so each player is looking at the other player's side. (maybe draw a little stick figure example?)

2. Each player takes turns trying to rip out a single item at a time from the items on their goal side WITHOUT looking at it while the other player holds the page up.

3. Each item successful ripped off in full, with no pieces of any other item on the same piece is worth one point. Most points when all the items are taken or damaged wins.

4. Check PrettiestPrincessGames.com for a rules video and more details and variants.

You'll find that in the process of trying to get the most stuff, you'll not only end up destroying what you want by accident, but also knowingly trashing the stuff your ex wants.

Part of the Prettiest Princess Games Consumable 1-Sheet line.

name: Sky Kingdoms: Good Evil & Primal Forces
description:
Establish dominance of the skies with armies of battle-hardened warriors who attack from ancient machinations of war called Sky Kingdoms. Take control of the Good, Evil or Primal forces in this fast paced, expandable card game. Decimate opposing forces, and lay waste to their floating realms, then claim enough gold to build a new flying fortress capable of not only winning the battle, but the war itself.

At a glance
Sky Kingdoms is a light strategy game intended to keep every player engaged and active at every point of the game. The round-robin game mechanic (think Poker) keeps turns fast, and a single stat (think Blizzard's Hearthstone) makes for simple yet strategic gameplay.

Object of the Game
The goal of Sky Kingdoms is to collect as much Gold as possible by battling for control of the Skies. The first player to collect enough gold wins the game.

Card Battle mechanic
Each turn is made up of a series of Combat Rounds, where each player has the opportunity to use over 48 unique Unit Cards and Battle Cards in combination to produce the highest Combat Value, win Combat and collect Gold.

name: Spider-Man Miniature Game: Superior Spiderman Starter Set
description:
The Spider-Man Miniature Game is an expansion annexed to the BMG rules based on your favorite Web-slinger!
With this rules you will be able to build a crew with the most famous heroes and the worst maniacs from New York City!
In addition to the new releases, old heroes and villains will join the ranks of the new crews and gangs!

A copy of the Batman Miniature Game rulebook is needed to play.

Just when things started to go good for Peter Parker (for once), something bad happened. While visiting a dying Otto Octavius, Peter suddenly had his mind swapped with Otto's, allowing Otto to live and run around in Peter's body. But just before Peter died, Otto discovered the "true" meaning of "With great power comes great responsibility" via Peter's harrowing memories, so he decided to live up to Peter's legacy and become the Superior Spider-Man.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Spider-Man Miniature Game: Goblin Cult Starter Set
description:
The Spider-Man Miniature Game is an expansion annexed to the BMG rules based on your favorite Web-slinger!
With this rules you will be able to build a crew with the most famous heroes and the worst maniacs from New York City!
In addition to the new releases, old heroes and villains will join the ranks of the new crews and gangs!

A copy of the Batman Miniature Game rulebook is needed to play.

The Green Goblin Cult, a group of individuals who secretly 'worshipped' Norman Osborn and his worldview. This cult would play heavily in getting Norman removed from incarceration and they should not be confused with Norman's other cult-following, the Order of the Goblin.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Three Dimensional Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: AbrakaRun
description:
AbrakaRun is a game in which we will play the role of a wizard. He will have to move on a board to get first to the finish line, the King's Castle.
We will cast spells (yes, you are right in reading "spells") in order to move around the board because we want to become the greatest wizard of this Kingdom.
We will have "hidden" tokens to cast a spell and it will require a good memory on our part to use them. These important magic words are needed not only to get ahead, but also to fight the other wizards whose aim is to reach the goal too.

Description in Spanish:
ABRAKARUN, un juego donde interpretaremos el papel de un mago que deberá avanzar por un tablero para conseguir llegar el primero a la meta, el castillo del Rey.

Para avanzar, usaremos hechizos (sí, has leído bien, hechizos) porque queremos ser el mayor mago del reino. Para invocar esos hechizos necesitaremos ingredientes, que encontraremos en forma de tokens ocultos por lo que necesitaremos una buena memoria para poder utilizar los hechizos.

Estos hechizos no sólo nos permitirán avanzar, sino que también podremos atacar al resto de magos que intentan llegar al castillo y perjudicarles en su loca carrera hacia la meta.

name: Cosmic Supreme
description: An expansion bundle that included More Cosmic Encounter, Simply Cosmic, and two additional player colours (hexes and base tokens): dark green and brown.
mechanics: Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Apokalypse
description:
Apokalypse was a miniature wargame set in a dystopian future, the aftermath of the final war. It simulated the desperate skirmishes, firefights and encounters taking place in the last 120 days of humanity. The players took the role of powermongers, leaders and warlords of what armed forces still existing in the postapocalyptic wasteland, using remaining survivors as tools to enforce their agenda.

It was stated Apokalypse used 25mm miniatures but since that scale later came to be known as (non-heroic) 28mm you could generally say that 28mm is the default standard for the game. The length measure unit, "meters", was intentionally meant for being adapted to whatever scale of minis you had access to, making the game playable with all scales of miniatures.

When Hardcore Media was liquidated, around 1998-99, the game faded into obscurity and very much stayed that way.
In 2016 it was made available online, as a freeware document with the creators' consent, through a fan-made PDF of the original rulebook (available in the Web Links section).

There were occasional references to expansions throughout the core rulebook. The material for all of these was sadly destroyed when Hardcore Media folded and its creators moved on to different projects. Despite this, Apokalypse was a fully finished product and contains all the rules and information needed to play.
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Modular Board, Stat Check Resolution, Variable Player Powers

name: AireCards
description:
'AireCards' is a game first played at the AireCon Board Game convention.

Players fill out their AireCard by distributing 1000 points between 5 categories, although no two categories can be the same value. Collect 3 lives (tokens) and a custom AireCon dice (the 6 replaced by the AireCon logo) then you're all set to go!

The rules are easy, walk up to another player, challenge them and then roll your dice - then compare values in the matching category on your AireCards. The highest value wins and takes a life from the other player.

You can't challenge someone that just challenged you, and you can't challenge the same person twice.

At the end of the convention, hand in your AireCard and all the lives you've collected, whoever collected the most lives wins!

name: Zupper Dolls
description:
Zupper Dolls is a family playing game, which contain many special paper components, such as magnetic board, magnetic hero card, magnetic item card, easy to play with cute characters and drawing art, hope you and your family will like it.

It is a racing game, use difference team to fight again the boss, when processing the map, player team can get difference hero, action card and weapon,which have difference function to help player, who is the first finish the game is winner!

name: SudoKount
description:
SudoKount is a colorful, fun and brain challenging card game inspired by Sudoku and magical squares that renew the genre of number placement puzzle game making the experience touchable and multiplayer (both competitive or cooperative). It's also educative, decorative, and it can be brought everywhere...

SudoKount is very simple to play: draw a puzzle card and then use number tiles to solve it. Puzzle cards indicates an initial configuration for 5x5, 6x6 or 7x7 grids. Solving the puzzle consist in adding or removing number tiles so that the sum of each row and each column is equal to the goal indicated on the puzzle card.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Raccoon
description: A storytelling card game. Includes 55 unique cards (no duplicates) of photographed wildlife, mostly of raccoons. The game is "creative and non-competitive". Game play variations abound. For example players alternate drawing a card from the face down draw pile and place face up, and then describe the scene in a single sentence as it relates to previously drawn cards. A sequence of cards, left to right thereby tells a story. A variation has each player offer a scene description and then all players vote on the best one. Another alternative has players maintain a hand of cards and on their turn offer a card to extend the story, or all players offer one card and then vote on the best story extension with that one card added to the card sequence. Although not intended as a competitive game, it could be played where the winner is the first that runs out of cards (discarding your last card requires coming up with an ending better than any other players' story extensions), or collects the most rejected cards. A variation of "Go Fish" can be played where one player turns over a card, and then all players attempt to turn over the best matching card. The player with the best match as determined by vote takes the two matching cards, all other cards are turned back over, and that player turns over the next card to be matched.
publishers: EOS Interactive Cards, Moritz Egetmeyer Verlag

name: Boosting Bike
description:
Boosting Bike is a cycling game, with a special focus on making the movement of a peloton of cyclists on the board realistic, to have a "peloton feel" in the way riders move.

The number of riders in the race is fixed to sixteen (four teams of four riders). If there are less than four players, some of them have to take more than one team.

The rules say that the game is for 1 to 5 players. Of course, in the case of playing solo, the player takes all four teams. This lets clear that, although this not just a roll-and-move game and there are a fair number of decisions to be taken at each turn, there is not a complex strategy involved in the game.

The game does not include rules for different types of roads or riders. It represents a race on a flat circuit.

The winner of the game is the player who's riders arrive first at the finish.
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Throne Chronicles: Wild Uprising
description:
The elements are at war for the throne ,Choose your side and race to the crown. The main goal of the game is to get to the crown first in order to win, do all you can to stop the others.

Games consist of choosing your element and character. Each character and element has special abilities and different characteristics , for example: water does extra damage to fire element, fire does extra damage to nature, nature does extra damage to electric, and electric does extra damage to water. During the game you will battle against enemies and players, find random encounters, events and much more.

Game play:
Path will be tile based, placing cards to reveal the path ahead. D6 Dice will be rolled in order to determine where to move. The path has four colors (each element) and the dice will have the color you will move onto or the number of spaces.

Battles will consist of dice rolls to win, each player has a total life points. Dice is rolled and based on image on die is the action taken (defend or attack)

All players have same base damage and HP, it can be increased by item cards like weapons, armor and occasionally events.

Weapons:
Will be bought with gold or found along the way. Some weapons contain special abilities. Use them wisely.

Events:
In game you will events and depending on your choice it will change the outcome. Careful one choice can help you or damage you.
The events will go from finding a chest with treasure with gold or items,a trap or even finding a rare egg than will hatch into a powerful ally. Some events will not only affect one player but many such as earthquakes or gravity increase.

There is special event cards that will rarely play in game, such as: swap places, a tornado (which makes you loose weapons or armor) hired thieve (steals and item from one player and give to player who drew card) and many more.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Tile Placement

name: Kengo
description:
User summary

A vs tactical card game for 2 players. Players choose two fighting schools and have cards in hand with numbers. The cards need to be held in number order, and some of the cards might have to be revealed to the opponent; hence guessing what the other one has is part of the game. Players take turns playing cards and taking over threat foci, by cleverly choosing numbers on the cards that the opponent cannot counter.

The player to either deal 6 deadly wounds or 13 normal wounds to the opponent wins.

name: Rakshasa Street: Miniatures Game
description:
Rakshasa Street: miniatures game puts you in control of one of eight powerful soul masters in Rakshasa Street universe.These soul masters were divided into 2 groups fight each other.
The game using a unique “Card Allowance System” mechanism.Players must pay cards to move, attack, using items or skills, then replenish hand to end his turn. Players play a set of element cards to attack or defence. When a defender's hand more than his hand limit.He must discard these overflow cards as wound.
When a group of soul masters control all core tiles or kill each soul master of other group once. They win the game.

Description in Chinese:

categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Castrum
description: The goal CASTRUM is to be the first player building his entire castle. The game is played from 2 to 4 players with cards. Getting cards on a pad, you collect the resources to build your castle and escape the dangers of medieval times. When you get resources you put the resource card in front of you on your construction site area. When you'll have enough resources to set up a wall or a tower, you can exchange the cards with wall pawn or tower pawn. Then you castle is built. It's a family game.

name: Legions and Barbarians
description:
Tactical game of combat between the legions of Rome and the various barbarian tribes of Europe, England and Scotland.

The game is designed to be played by two players and completed in 30-60 minutes per battle.
This is the first game in the 60 Minutes to Victory series.

name: REVENGE!
description:
User summary:

REVENGE! began with a pair of heavily modified Monopoly boards and a greatly expanded set of rules, adding numerous complications and special situations to the game. Rather quickly, REVENGE! evolved into a completely original game that featured an intriguing blend of complex board game and basic elements of role-playing. The game generally follows a roll-and-move paradigm around a rectangular board (looking something like a doubled Monopoly board). Various board locations may cause special circumstances, including "teleporting" to off-board locales where, generally, various types of player-vs-player activities are allowed.

The game primarily was designed by Jack Harness and other members of the Los Angeles Science Fantasy Association in the early 1970s; it had assumed a stable, final form by about 1972. Games were said to last from hours to days. It was routinely played (and continuously modified) by society members until about the advent of Original Dungeons & Dragons. Many game proponents created implementations of the game, all with hand-drawn art from Jack Harness, some with minor rules variations.

In 2016, Lee Gold and Barry Gold converted their personal extant copy into electronic format. This involved a general revision for clarity and format of the not-inconsiderable rule book, as well as a production of a color electronic playing board. This version was published for free download, intended for print-and-play use. In addition to the revised and cleaned-up game, a scan of the original products also was made available.

The game is intriguing as a very early example of a basic type of role-playing game prior to the commercial advent of Dungeons & Dragons.
categories: Dice, Fantasy, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: In Yer Face Wrasslin: Board Game
description:
A tabletop Pro-Wrestling match simulation board game.
Two players each take the role of one of nine outrageous and 'In Yer Face' Wrasslers as they face off in a one vs one Wrasslin match.

Wrasslers take turns spending MP to move around the game's box (the Ring) and Attack. Every Wrassler has varying Attack and Defend cards to try and either deal Hurt to an opponent, or avoid taking Hurt themselves. After Attack and Defend cards are revealed, the Attacker rolls a single 6-sided Attack dice to determine if the Attack hit or missed.
Wrasslers can also pay MP to run, climb to the top rope, and brawl outside of the ring, as well as use traditional Wrasslin' weapons like Chairs and Tables to do even more Hurt. Finishers, Taunts, Special cards, and unique Wrassler abilities also feature.

Reduce a Wrassler's Hurt Points low enough, and a player can try to Pin or Submit that Wrassler and win the match!

Tag team matches allow up to 4 players, and 5 different stipulation matches, like the 'Raise the Roof' Ladder match are also included.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: National Pastime
description:
Historically important tabletop baseball simulation game, recognized as the precursor to the highly successful APBA series. Players of the game select lineups of cards, each card representing an actual major league baseball player. The sequence of play consists of a series of plate appearances as if playing a game of baseball. Each plate appearance is resolved by: (1) rolling two dice, (2) reading a number code from the batter's card based on the roll, and (3) looking up the number code on a chart corresponding to the current distribution of runners on base to determine the result of the plate appearance.

The designer, Clifford Van Beek, was granted a U.S. patent for the game system in 1925 (#1536639), though the game was not published until 1930. The game was apparently only published once, with 18 cards for each of the 16 teams then competing in the major leagues.

A recreated version of the game was published in 2003 by a company called Sports Game Publishing.

name: Am I Lion?
description:
Am I Lion? is a "take that" bluffing game that takes place on an African Savannah. Each animal has a special power that will affect the winner and loser of each round.

The base game comes with 8 different animals with special powers. The winner is the first to get rid of their hand of cards or players can be eliminated by gaining a herd or obtaining an African menagerie.

The winner of each trick gets to perform an action related to the animal they bluffed with.

Am I Lion? Am I Giraffe? Only those that bluff the best will know.

name: Pair Throw
description:
A strategic press-your-luck game of rolling dice for points.

The name is derived from the old Norse word "perthro", which means "dice cup", and is also the focus of the game: rolling (throwing) dice to get pairs of numbers.

Players roll 9 dice, set aside any matching pairs they want to keep, and then re-roll the remaining dice. Points can only be scored for pairs of numbers, and pairs must be formed on the same roll. If no pairs of numbers are rolled, the turn ends and the dice are passed to the next player.

Scoring can quickly get intense, as multiple pairs of the same number are worth bonus points, and getting 4 pairs plus a matching number on the "extra" dice allows players to re-roll all 9 dice again.

When a player earns a total score of 500 or more, all other players get one last turn to try and get enough points to surpass that score. Once all players have received a final turn, the player with the highest score is the winner!

name: Terra NovUP
description:
Terra NovUp it develops over several rounds, 9 or 12 depending on the game mode chosen, in their turn each player must make the best decisions to take off your StartUp.

Take charge of Distribution Channels, invest in your Customer Relationship collaborates with your strategic partners, control your costs to run activities or acquire resources, with them can develop Value Propositions for income customer segments.

At the end of the game the winner will be whoever gets the highest appraisal of your StartUp.

name: Hexmaze
description:
Hexmaze: a tile-based abstract strategy board game - Building a road has never been trickier

I. AIM

Be the first player to create a road between your home and the middle of the board by putting together hex tiles! That may sound really simple but it's harder than it looks!

II. SETUP OF THE GAME

Each player takes 4 hex tiles from the cloth bag and chooses his color. The youngest player starts and play continues clockwise.

III. HOW TO PLAY

Each turn, the player puts a hex tile on the board. It's important to note the following:
- at the beginning of the turn, you must hold 4 hex tiles in your hand
- your hex tile can be put wherever you want on the game board
- you can't pass on your turn
- two adjacent hex tiles must be connected to one another (see section V. for more details)

IV. SPECIAL HEX TILES

Special hex tiles (block, chainsaw, bomb, rotation and switch) can be used at any moment of the game. Thanks to them, you'll be able to change the course of the game.

name: BattleTech: Experimental Technical Readout â Primitives V
description:
Before there was even a Star League, the technologies taken for granted in the thirty-first century went through their awkward paces in a universe newly opened to humankind. In an age when the BattleMech was nearly unknown, when the DropShip was a new concept, and when tanks and fighters dominated the battle zones, the technology of the day was primitive by modern standards…and each new design with an experiment unto itself.

Experimental Tech Readout: Primitives, Volume V samples more of the early technology designs that dominated the universe of BattleTech during the pre-Star League Age of War period. Each design featured in this book demonstrates the primitive technology level of the first generation of BattleMechs, the last generation of Combat Vehicles (before the ’Mech supplanted them), and the low-tech aerospace units that flew above them. Although many were ultimately upgraded to “modern standards” and shown in Technical Readout: 3075, the units featured here reflect these designs as they were when first introduced to the universe they fought for. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 Primitive BattleMechs, vehicles, aerospace units presented in this book, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.

name: Flirt: The Card Game
description:
Flirt is a game that gets players winning hearts by "courting" other players for their hearts.

Flirt is best played with friends, and with everyone saying the flavor text, with feelings and with a straight face.

Setup

Each player starts with three hearts of different values and patterns. The aim of the game is to be the first to complete a set of hearts with the same pattern.

Attacking

To attack, "Court" by using Court cards of equal or higher value than the heart you're targeting.

Defending

To defend, block Court cards by using other Court cards of higher or equal value to the Court card being blocked.

Win Condition

The first player that acquires three (3) HEART cards of the same pattern wins. If a player loses all his/her HEARTS, the player is out of the game.

name: Continuity
description:
Did Indiana Jones rescue slave children from the Temple of Doom before King Kong terrorized New York city? Did Marty McFly first travel back in time in a DeLorean after Harry Potter's parents were murdered by Voldemort? Did the robots Wall-E and Eve meet before James T Kirk became Captain of the USS Enterprise?

In this game, players take turns trying to play fictitious event cards in a timeline. Featuring 234 cards from over 100 of your favorite fandoms from movies, television, books, and video games, Continuity is a unique and easy to learn card game that anyone can enjoy.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Wildlife Preserve
description:
Africa's animals are endangered. Poachers riddle the land. Nature itself is without mercy. You are one of Africa's daring rangers and you are tasked with keeping the animals that wander onto your preserve from harm. Expand your preserve, herd the carnivores away from the herbivores, and ensure that nothing gets unnecessarily eaten.

However, nothing in life is free. Expanding requires capital. How will you earn this capital? Do you take the moral path by giving private safari tours or do you take the darker path by allowing hunters to enter and take whatever prize they wish? These are some of the tough choices you must make while managing your wildlife preserve.

'Wildlife Preserve' is a push your luck card drawing and placement game that offers strategic decisions, elements of luck, and negotiation. Players will draw animals, place them on their preserve, and ensure their safety.

Each animal has a different point value and special ability. The goal of the game is to accumulate and keep as many points as possible in order to beat your opponents.
mechanics: Enclosure, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Trading

name: Jungla
description:
An exciting game in which you must face the dangers of the jungle, to be the richest explorer. Explorers will go through the jungle in search of "Eldorado". They will enter villages, cross rivers and confront beasts and tribes that will try to ensure that their expedition does not end well.

Each player starts the game with a character board, which indicates the initial abilities of this, as well as the life he has in each moment. He also receives a pawn of his color and a tent of his color.
During the game, each player can find cards that help them improve their skills or increase their lives.
The forest is represented by 73 tiles that are initially face down in the center of the table, we will turn them when we go exploring them, and a river that we must cross to go to the different zones of the forest.
During the turn of each player can choose between three actions:

-Explore the jungle; He moves his pawn to an adjacent tile, and turns it face-up. Once you have seen the type of tile, you must steal a card from the corresponding deck and solve it with a dice roll, which depends on the skill you have.

-Recover territory explored; You can move your pawn by adjacent tiles from one to three, as long as they are scanned.

-Getting a camp; If your pawn has been placed in an abandoned camp tile, you can place your camp there by placing the tent of your color on this tile. You can change the location of your camp as many times as you want throughout the game. (This helps you when you contract a disease of the forest, since you must go to this camp to receive the treatment and to be able to continue playing)

The objective of the game is to be the explorer with more gold in his power when the game ends. The end of the game, occurs immediately when some explorer finds the mythical city of Eldorado, the player who finds it will receive a bonus of 10 gold coins.
You will also receive a bonus of 4 gold coins, the most cursed explorer you have surpassed.

But beware, if a player is cursed when the game is over, he can not be a winner even if he is the one who has made the most money !!! So try to overcome the curses that you fell as soon as possible.

* * *

Un trepidante juego en el que debes enfrentarte a los peligros de la selva, para ser el explorador más rico. Los exploradores recorrerán la jungla en busca de "Eldorado". Entraran en poblados, cruzaran ríos y se enfrentaran a bestias y tribus que intentarán que su expedición no termine bien.

Cada jugador comienza la partida con un tablero de personaje,en el que indica las habilidades iniciales de este, así como la vida que tiene en cada momento. También recibe un peón de su color y una tienda de campaña de su color.
Durante la partida, cada jugador puede encontrar cartas, que le ayuden a mejorar sus habilidades o a incrementar sus vidas.
La selva está representada por 73 losetas que inicialmente están bocabajo en el centro de la mesa, las iremos girando cuando las vayamos explorando, y un río que debemos cruzar para ir a las diferentes zonas de la selva.
Durante el turno de cada jugador puede elegir entre tres acciones:

-Explorar la jungla; Desplaza su peón a una loseta adyacente, y la vuelve boca arriba. Una vez visto el tipo de loseta, debe robar una carta del mazo correspondiente y resolverla mediante una tirada de dados, que depende de la habilidad que posea.

-Recorrer territorio explorado; Puedes desplazar tu peón por losetas adyacentes de una a tres, siempre y cuando estén exploradas.

-Colocar un campamento; si tu peón se haya situado en una loseta de campamento abandonado, puedes situar allí tu campamento situando sobre esta loseta la tienda de campaña de tu color. Puedes cambiar la ubicación de tu campamento tantas veces como quieras durante toda la partida. (Esto te ayuda cuando contraes una enfermedad de la selva, ya que deberás ir a este campamento a recibir el tratamiento y poder seguir jugando)

El objetivo del juego es ser el explorador con más oro en su poder cuando la partida termine. El final de la partida, se produce inmediatamente cuando algún explorador encuentra la mítica ciudad del Eldorado, el jugador que la encuentre recibirá una bonificación de 10 monedas de oro.
También recibirá una bonificación de 4 monedas de oro, el explorador que más maldiciones haya superado.

¡¡¡Pero cuidado, si un jugador está maldito cuando la partida acabé, no podrá ser ganador aunque sea el que más dinero haya conseguido!!! Así que intenta superar las maldiciones en que hayas caído lo antes posible.

name: Fall of the Last City
description:
Description from the publisher:

“Long ago Kings in their Castles played a game called Chess to learn the arts of war. But war has changed and now we have a new game...”

Fall of the Last City is an abstract real time strategy game played in the apocalyptic future. The people who play this game cobble together the pieces from scrap metal and salvaged nuts and bolts. It’s a harsh and unforgiving game that reflects the wasteland that gave it birth and the hard men and women that live the lessons it teaches.

Everyone moves at once each round. This is a six player game where it is always your turn!

The game board is dynamically built and destroyed every turn, every aspect of the game gives the player meaningful choices.

Player interaction uses a challenge system based on the classic prisoner’s dilemma. The game can not be won through tactics or politics alone.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Real-time, Territory Building
mechanics: Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Elementa
description:
Description from the publisher:

Before the planets, before the stars…
Before the galaxies, before the universe…
Before time began…
Incomprehensibly powerful sentiences sought to dominate the preconceptual chaos of their existence and annihilate those that opposed their will.
To the victor, the ultimate prize: creation itself.

In Elementa, each player takes the role of one of these sentiences, aiming to defeat their opponent to ensure they are free to shape a universe to their own design. This is done by influencing the balance of the six elements in two distinct, but inextricably linked, theatres.

The first, representing the consciousnesses in conflict, enables players to infuse the elements with their raw power that can then be consumed, or nurtured, to determine the how the second proceeds.

That second environment is the domain of summoned, customised proxies - the elementals. Their power is governed by the first theatre and can be directly manipulated by players’ evocations. Conflict between elementals may encourage one side to end hostilities and rethink their strategy in a new round, but the battle of wills is not infinite and it is only the player who succeeds at the pre-defined end of the contest that is victorious.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Open Drafting, Worker Placement

name: Midsummer: The Goodfellow Expansion
description:
An expansion for the hidden role Faerie game Midsummer.

The Goodfellow expansion adds a new set of 18 trick cards to Midsummer, based on quotes from 'that shrewd and knavish sprite call'd Robin Goodfellow.'

These new cards can be used instead of the original cards, shuffled into together or both decks can be played alongside each other for twice the trickery. A new concept of cards that are kept for ongoing effects or until their effect is spent are introduced, adding additional depth and options to the game of intrigue and favours.
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Mythology, Negotiation, Party Game, Renaissance

name: Prehistorik: the card game
description:
Description from the publisher:

The time of a game, players put themselves in the shoes of a homo sapiens clan leader and send their hunters to seek food for the tribe. However, in these fierce ages, competition with other tribes is tough.

The game consists of 2 packs: the pack of hunter cards and the pack of food cards. By playing their hunter cards, players will try to retrieve the best foods for them and leave the bad foods for others.

Normally yours strongests hunters will leave with the good foods, and yours weaks hunters will try to avoid bad foods. But it's not that simple, because sometimes strong hunters can lose, and weak hunters can become strong.

Watch the short video to understand the principle (on youtube or vimeo) :

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iK4KZEOS1iI&;feature=youtu.be

https://vimeo.com/192649809

name: Quickdraw
description:
Description from the publisher:

Quickdraw is a fast, thematic spaghetti western modular microgame where players take the role of bandits and outlaws in the final scene of a pistols showdown.

Players simultaneous play action cards face down, which they then all flip and resolve at the same time. Do you stare down your opponent to make them hesitate, or ready yourself to fire? Exploit their weaknesses or utilise your skills?

Quickdraw is an affordable and expandable game.
categories: American West, Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That
publishers: Inside the Box Board Games LLP (ITB)

name: Dawn of the Zeds: Ernie "The Geek" Promo
description:
Promo card and chit for Dawn of the Zeds. This promo adds an extra playable character to the base game. His unique abilities include "Lucky Dice," "The Hotness," "Geeklist," "BGG.con," and "Storage Solutions."

It was handed out during BGG.CON 2016.
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Chit-Pull System, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Safe zone
description:
Safe Zone is an exciting new WWII themed board game for 2 players. Guide your tank across the treacherous minefield set up for you by your opponent. Your goal is to reach the safe zone, while gathering points along the way; but be careful! There is more than points buried in you path! One wrong move, and you'll hit a mine, forcing you back to the beginning.
Safe Zone combines chance with strategy to create a thrilling competitive game experience. Avoid your enemy's mines while hopefully watching them fall prey to your own. Safe Zone is a 2-player game but was designed to fit 2 additional boards, providing you with that 4 player excitement. 4 can play, but only one will make it to the Safe Zone!

name: Naturally Disastrous: Mutated Monsters
description:
The sun hid itself behind the desert landscape as the Mad Scientist ordered his young office assistant, Savannah, into the lab. Normally she was strictly forbidden to enter. Who was this creepy old man staring at her with such menacing eyes? He pointed. To her horror, she recognized the muscular young weapons expert strapped to a table. He had just asked her on a first date hours ago. He was now a brilliant glowing fireball struggling in his bindings. The Mad Scientist said with a sickly grin, “Marry me or suffer a similar fate”. She turned to run…

This expansion offers 3 new Mutated Monsters that both hurt and help the players. If you can get to them that is. It contains:

3 Mutated Monsters with Character Cards and Stands
6 Double Sided Action Tokens
12 Disaster Markers
1 Rule Booklet
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Naturally Disastrous: Zombies
description:
As if things were not bad enough, off on the horizon you see them coming, swiftly, ready to devour everything in their path. The Mad Scientist went too far with this mutation. Run…

This game enlists Zombies to make the Aliens job just that much harder and contains:

1 Rule Sheet
1 Double Sided Map Tile
4 Zombies with Character Cards and Stands
12 Double Sided Infection Tokens

name: Naturally Disastrous: Heroes & Monsters
description:
A massive, infuriated Yeti has been spotted roaming the land. No doubt another of the Mad Scientists latest concoctions. Three new Aliens, with the latest tech, volunteer for a mission in deep space. A Renegade, saddened that her pet Yeti, a once humble giant, is now a science experiment, resolves to assist you on your mission in hopes you will help her. Then what? Maybe she’ll hitch a ride.

This expansion contains:

1 Rule Book
3 New Double Sided Character Cards and Stands
1 Double Sided Renegade Card with Stand
6 Double Sided Renegade Tokens
1 Yeti Card with Token, Card and Stand
1 Sniper Discover-able Item Token

name: Naturally Disastrous: Legend of the Shadow Master
description:
A devoted master of the shadow awakens, his mind racing with terrifying suppressed memories. Malicious blood shot eyes of an old white haired man, a cold hard table in a gloomy lab. His worries over unsettling rumors cloud his judgment. The Divine Detonating Device along with its guardian, missing? A crashed alien ship with mysterious beings on board? Hope springs within him. Could these beings be the chosen, foretold to come, by the ancients? Would they help him thwart the Mad Scientists plans to harness the power of the Devine Detonating Device?

This expansion contains:
1 Large Shadow Master Character Card with Stand
1 Large Ferocious Mutated Bunny of Cabergon Character Card with Stand
6 Shadow Tokens
1 Divine Detonating Device (DDD) Token
1 Rule Sheet

name: Lethal Steel
description: Details coming soon.

name: Payoff Pitch Baseball: 2016 Cards
description:
Payoff Pitch Baseball: 2016 Cards is a set of 1,500 cards — including players and parks — printed on high-gloss heavy cardstock for use with the Payoff Pitch Baseball base game.

L/R splits on batter cards as with all Payoff Pitch Baseball sets.
publishers: PT Games, Inc., Sideline Strategy Games

name: Viska 5!
description:
"Give me five" in English.

Players move around the game board what represents different classrooms at school. There are combination of 5 dice on each classroom. Player in his turn rolls 5 dice up to 3 times and tries to get as many dice as possible from that combination.
Player gets mark for this subject according the number of dice that matches with the dice combination.
f.e. There are 4,4,5,4,3 at Geography classroom and player rolled three correct numbers: 4,6,1,5,3. He get "3" in Geography.

If everybody has all the marks the player with the highest average mark is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1964 Cards
description:
Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1964 Cards is a set of 699 cards — including players and parks — printed on high-gloss heavy cardstock for use with the Payoff Pitch Baseball base game.

L/R splits on batter cards as with all Payoff Pitch Baseball sets.

name: Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1964 Cards
description:
Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1964 Cards is a set of 899 cards — including players and parks — printed on high-gloss heavy cardstock for use with the Payoff Pitch Baseball base game.

L/R splits on batter cards as with all Payoff Pitch Baseball sets.

name: Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1973 Cards
description:
Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1973 Cards is a set of 900 cards — including players and parks — printed on high-gloss heavy cardstock for use with the Payoff Pitch Baseball base game.

L/R splits on batter cards as with all Payoff Pitch Baseball sets.
publishers: PT Games, Inc., Sideline Strategy Games

name: Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1977 Cards
description:
Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1977 Cards is a set of 926 cards — including players and parks — printed on high-gloss heavy cardstock for use with the Payoff Pitch Baseball base game.

L/R splits on batter cards as with all Payoff Pitch Baseball sets.
publishers: PT Games, Inc., Sideline Strategy Games

name: Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1979 Cards
description:
Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1979 Cards is a set of 941 cards — including players and parks — printed on high-gloss heavy cardstock for use with the Payoff Pitch Baseball base game.

L/R splits on batter cards as with all Payoff Pitch Baseball sets.
publishers: PT Games, Inc., Sideline Strategy Games

name: Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1982 Cards
description:
Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1982 Cards is a set of 954 cards — including players and parks — printed on high-gloss heavy cardstock for use with the Payoff Pitch Baseball base game.

L/R splits on batter cards as with all Payoff Pitch Baseball sets.
publishers: PT Games, Inc., Sideline Strategy Games

name: Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1991 Cards
description:
Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1991 Cards is a set of 1,002 cards — including players and parks — printed on high-gloss heavy cardstock for use with the Payoff Pitch Baseball base game.

L/R splits on batter cards as with all Payoff Pitch Baseball sets.
publishers: PT Games, Inc., Sideline Strategy Games

name: Payoff Pitch Baseball: 2013 Cards
description:
Payoff Pitch Baseball: 2013 Cards is a set of 1,289 cards — including players and parks — printed on high-gloss heavy cardstock for use with the Payoff Pitch Baseball base game.

L/R splits on batter cards as with all Payoff Pitch Baseball sets.
publishers: PT Games, Inc., Sideline Strategy Games

name: Payoff Pitch Baseball: 2014 Cards
description:
Payoff Pitch Baseball: 2014 Cards is a set of 1,324 cards — including players and parks — printed on high-gloss heavy cardstock for use with the Payoff Pitch Baseball base game.

L/R splits on batter cards as with all Payoff Pitch Baseball sets.
publishers: PT Games, Inc., Sideline Strategy Games

name: Payoff Pitch Baseball: 2015 Cards
description:
Payoff Pitch Baseball: 2015 Cards is a set of 1,224 cards — including players and parks — printed on high-gloss heavy cardstock for use with the Payoff Pitch Baseball base game.

L/R splits on batter cards as with all Payoff Pitch Baseball sets.
publishers: PT Games, Inc., Sideline Strategy Games

name: LUKBOC
description:
Description from the publisher:

LUKBOC mimics the hunting routines of Ospreys in which two or more players are competing for fish in exchange for scoring sticks. Each player has 6 rectangular pieces called the BIRDs. When a BIRD stands up on its square base vertically, it becomes an OSPREY. The middle of the Qu-MAT is the POND where fish tokens are placed. The 4 corner spots of Qu-MAT are called CLOUDs. BIRDs or OSPREYs flying into a CLOUD spot will be immune from any attacks. There are 4 exterior corner areas called the NESTs. A BIRD or OSPREY who was hit by an enemy BIRD will be placed there.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Ancient, Collectible Components, Dice, Educational, Number, Print & Play, Racing
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Worker Placement

name: Hull Breach!: Anaheim Production Platfiorm
description:
Originally released as part of Hull Breach!'s Corporate Wars box set, this individual deck has been revamped and improved for the current edition of the game.

The Anaheim Manufacturing Corporation is one of the Big Three Megacorporations in the Hull Breach Universe. It has been said, often, that Anaheim is what would happen if Enzo Ferrari was to buy Walmart, Bandai, and Acme, and merge them. Anaheim and its subsidiaries make or at least market... well, just about everything. Furthermore, everything is shiny or chromed or customizable or upgrade-able. They are the epitome of "Everything you wanted... and MORE!"
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination

name: Pirates of Praedonia
description:
Description from the publisher:

"In a world of vast seas and magical wonders, pirates and traders alike share the open waters in an effort to become the most renowned Captain of Praedonia.

Travel from port to port as you buy and sell mystical artifacts, vying to fill your vessel with endless treasure. Will you exploit piracy to grow your riches, terrorizing land merchants in your wake? Do so at your own risk, for the Fleet of Nimbus pursue vile pirates and offer bounties for their capture.

In Pirates of Praedonia, you decide whether to give in to piracy or to navigate the realm with honor. But whichever path you choose, beware! Spawned from the mysterious Shadow Reef lurks a nearby evil...the dreadful Dark Water!"

Players represent Captains who will navigate their ships to make the most out of the ever-changing market. Artifacts, and their going rates, change from round to round. Buy the available artifacts at a low price so you can turn the most profit. Don't have enough Aurum shards to purchase all you want? Plunder them! But in doing so you will attract the Fleet of Nimbus and other players who will want the bounty for your capture! Hire crew, equip cannons, and upgrade masts if you want to stand a chance in such cutthroat seas. If you fail in the dice-driven combat, you will lose your precious goods.

You must overcome the dangers of Dark Water, the Fleet of Nimbus, and combatting opponents - the player with the most Aurum after 7 rounds is the winner!

Whether merciful or ruthless, only the most cunning Pirate will rule the islands of Praedonia.

Pirates of Praedonia is a 2017 PAX South Tabletop Indie Showcase winner!
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Player Powers

name: Von Deutschland nach Amerika mit unseren Handels-U-Booten
description:
This WWI German game has a really unusual theme. Clearly published after the start of the war but before the entry of the United States, it is based on the idea of trading with America by using underwater freighters.

In game terms, it is a simple roll-and-move affair for up to six players. There are assorted spaces that cause delays or setbacks as well as a few that allow players to take money from the pot. The first player to complete a round trip from Bremen to the U.S. and back is told to shout "Hurra!" three times and take half the pot. The remainder is split by the rest of the players.

The game has art by Siegmund von Suchdolski, with a cover showing a winged Hermes head in a rising sun over a surfaced U-boat, and the board featuring images of a U-boat engine room and of U-boats in harbor, underway and being loaded with bales of goods.

name: Guild of the Fallen
description:
You are the leader of a prestigious guild in the city of Guildcrest, assigned by the royal family to
defend the four realms from newly emerging threats. You will have many recruits at your
disposal and gain the ability to spread your influence as your favor with the crown grows.
Alternatively, you can work to subvert the royal agenda and send aid to the enemies, helping
grow the corruption with the promise of power.

Guildcrest is a dice drafting & placement fantasy co-op for 1-4 players. You and
your competing guilds will select new recruits from a shared pool of dice: assigning them tasks
throughout the city, hire heroes, & improve your guild; all with the goal of defending the kingdom
from the threats of the realms. But don't fully trust your fellow guilds, one might be working in the
