On the other hand, PMC 2640 offers countless possibilities, as the rulebook contains a few dozen of unit entries, six scenarios and seven terrain generators, all of which ensure that no two games will look the same. The classic alternate activation (with small balancing modifications) makes the game fast and addictive.

name: Crown of AragÃ³n: James Leader Promo
description:
First released in 2017 at PAX Unplugged.

This promotional leader card is available by meeting Crown of Aragón lead designer James Searles in person.

Leader cards add variable player powers to Crown of Aragón.

James' leader side allows you discard and replace a card you draft, or you can give up his ability to play his event side, which lets you draft in the middle of your turn.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Giant Ugly Flesh Monster Excavation Force
description:
Giant Ugly Flesh Monster Excavation Force (GUFMEF) is a 2-4 player cooperative game where players harvest precious resources from the rotting corpse of a gigantic monster in order to fulfill contracts for corporate resources. Navigate the corpse, communicate as a team, and gather resources, but beware, this is a high-risk position! As time progresses, the corpse rots and the body of the creature becomes unstable. It becomes the duty of the force to make sure that they not only complete their job in a timely manner but help every person on the team makes it out alive; liabilities are not good for corporate!

With different monsters and different contract types, each play experience becomes its own series of trials; but hopefully, with the use of tools and wits, the force will have what it takes to excavate exactly what they need. Gravity and time are your biggest foes but that is just another work day for the Giant Ugly Flesh Monster Excavation Force.

name: Quardo
description:
QUARDO is an exciting strategy game that challenges your planning, analytical, and pattern recognition abilities. In the “Touch of Quardo” advance game, the sense of touch, spatial coordination, and memorization skills are added to test players' spatial intelligence.

The objective of Quardo is to form multiple squares or lines of four pawns with a common attribute and to collect the associated tokens/coins. The player with the most number of tokens/coins wins.

With the addition of blindfolds for covering the eyes of ordinary players, Quardo is also designed to accommodate blind or vision-impaired players. Appoint an observer to administer the game if necessary.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Math, Memory, Puzzle
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Movement, Memory, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: BuzzPutt
description:
BuzzPutt is a 1-4 player golf game that has you playing adorable bees! There are three pre-made putt putt courses that you and your friends can play on. Each person will select a bee and its matching ball. You have to place the ball on the starting point of the board, with the arrow pointing towards where you want to move.

Then, you roll the dice and pick a shot (basically a stroke in golf) based on what you have rolled. You can now move your ball that far. If you land on certain tiles, such as the honeycomb tiles, it'll cost you more movement points to move out. If you end up out of bounds, you must end your turn and start your next turn on the last tile you touched. Once everyone is at the end, you can move onto the next course.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Battle of Heroes: Myth Taken
description:
A quick combat squad game of 3 units each, where you see which mythological characters can best each other in battle (Egyptian and Greek currently, with more planned for the future).

No Dice. No Cards. No luck. Just pure strategy and choosing different team combinations.

Every turn, the player progresses each of their unit's turn meter (by moving the respective cube along the ready track) until they have a unit ready to attack. Each Hero has special abilities and attacks, creating an interesting strategy to every team. Each ability has a value (either damage, heal or alter turn meter) that the player activates and chooses to target.

Players win by defeating all of their opponents units.

Alternatively, more than 2 players can fight in a free for all, where each player is out for themselves.

Print and Play is available ahead of an upcoming crowdfunding campaign
categories: Abstract Strategy, Fighting, Mythology, Print & Play
mechanics: Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Principatat
description:
Principalities is a card game based on the titanic clashes between the Principality of Arberia, the Ottoman Empire and the Republic of Venice. The game has tokens, dice and cards depicting the main historical and political characters of that period. Players will choose the cards and use their features carefully to collect points and triumph over their opponents.

—description from the publisher (English)

PRINCIPATAT është një lojë e bazuar në përleshjen titanike të principatës së Arbërit, perandorisë Osmane dhe republikës së Venedikut. Loja ka xhetona, zara dhe letra që përshkruajnë personazhet kryesore të asaj periudhe. Lojtarët do zgjedhin letrat dhe do përdorin me kujdes veçoritë e tyre për të mbledhur pikë dhe për të triumfuar mbi kundërshtarët.

—description from the publisher (Albanian)
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Medieval

name: Ingression
description:
Ingression is a 2 player strategy game in two phases and has a fluid maze that changes each turn through player actions. In the first phase, the Build Phase, players work to build a maze of cards in a 5 x 5 grid.

After the maze is built, the Ingression Phase begins. Players navigate the maze by creating new paths on the grid. At the beginning of a turn, a play may draw a new tile and replace a tile already on the board, or turn a tile to create a new path. One of these actions must be taken each turn, and the player also must move if possible.

To win, a player must move their pawn to the other side before their opponent reaches theirs.

The game consists of 39 maze tiles and 2 home tiles, two movement cubes (blank red and blue colored dice), and a small full color instruction manual. It is designed to be small, portable, and easy to learn. Ingression can be taught to new players in as little as 5 minutes. The game does not require much space to play, somewhere between 1 and 2 square feet depending on how the players lay it out.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Modular Board, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Feline Fighting Force
description:
Lightyears from earth there is a small planet called Caturn-1. In many ways it is very similar to Earth of about 1000 years ago. There are castles, roads, trees and farms but unlike Earth there are no humans! Felines control the planet. Felines from the four great kingdoms, Forest, Fire, Sea, and Sky. For hundreds of years these four great kingdoms have battled for control of Caturn-1. Until Wildwood proposed a battle to end all battles. Each kingdom will send a FELINE FIGHTING FORCE of eight members to battle for control of the realm and the winning kingdom will rule Caturn-1 forever!

Each player starts with 8 cats, 2 traps, and 2 food laid out face down in front of them. Players take turns attacking opponents by revealing one card from an opponents field and resolving using numbered battled cards.

name: Kings of War: The Battle of the Glades Two Player Battle Set
description:
The Abyss was spreading; an affront to nature and reality. The Green Lady, in her divine wisdom, had called on the Druid folk to spread the word, forge alliances with the mortal races of the world and stand against the coming dark. The fate of the world is about to be decided in the largest conflict for an age. Whatever the cost, the sickening spread of the Abyss must be stopped!

This set contains everything two players need to get started in Kings of War, including:

Kings of War Gamer's Edition Rulebook, including full rules, 11 complete Army Lists, and more!
Battle of the Glades Guide, including lore, two starter force lists and a mini-campaign!
20 Hard Plastic Lower Abyssals/Flamebearers with Command
20 Hard Plastic Succubi with Command
20 Hard Plastic Naiad Ensnarers/Heartpiercers with Command
20 Hard Plastic Salamanders with Shield or Great Weapons and Command
1 Metal Abyssal Champion with Alternate Components
1 Metal Druid with Alternate Components
Plastic Square Bases
Mantic Points

name: Auction Lords
description:
In Auction Lords you visit several storage facilities where you get the opportunity to bid on multiple storage units with both hidden and visible items in them.
The game is played over a number of rounds and each round has a number of storage units you visit. The number of storage units is determined at the start of each round by rolling a die.
You can use your intuition and also bend the rules with your character's ability and the opportunity cards to get the most valuable items!
You can sell and/or trade the items on your own or even buy a store to carry and sell more valuables.
There are over 100 different items to bid on. Each item falls under 1 of 4 types. There are also bonus amounts you can get for each type of item depending on your character's expertise or on the store you may choose to buy.
Your goal is to have the most money at the end to win!
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Economic, Memory, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Set Collection, Take That, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: War on the Plains: A Campaign Supplement for A Good Day to Die
description:
Spiral bound book containing rules on Plains Indian Warface c. 1780 to 1850.

It is an attempt to accurately simulate the wars of the Plains Indians with rival tribes and with the Mountain Men

A campaign supplement for A Good Day to Die
categories: American West, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
publishers: HLBS Publishing (The Honourable Lead Boiler Suit Company)

name: Som i Serem Joc
description:
Board game for the whole family.

Do you have what it takes to build a new state and culminate the history of Catalonia?

Rate and win your freedom!

Goal of the game:
The objective of the game is to collect the six cards"Som i Serem"and deposit them in the ballot box.

Game preparation:
Each player chooses a donkey and puts it in the starting box. The cards "Som i Serem" are mixed well, the cards ask and the letters of Saint George and the Dragon, and they are placed face down in their respective spaces on the board. Each player prepares an urn and puts it in front of him. Before beginning, each player takes 3 cards We and We will be from the stack. The game starts with the youngest player.

The boxes:
Each time we go through the start box we collect a "Som i Serem" card.
Make holidays in the Pyrenees, the Costa Brava and the Ebro Delta.
Go back to the Festa Major and the Sant Jordi Day.
Dialogue to Parliament.
Take unilateral action for the Good Sickle.
And if you put an urn in front of you, you know ... vote!

How to win:
Win the first person who introduces the six cards "Som i Serem" in the ballot box and reach the nearest Parliament box.
Once in the Parliament box, a parliamentary majority must be obtained by throwing the dice and removing 4 or more.
Once achieved, the game is won.
Live in Catalonia!

—description from the designer (translated)

Joc de taula per a tota la família.

Tens el que cal per construir un nou estat i culminar la història de Catalunya?

Vota i guanya la teva llibertat!

Contingut:
4 rucs
1 dau
1 tauler de joc (40x40)
60 cartes Som i Serem
60 cartes de preguntes
30 cartes de Sant Jordi i el Drac

Objectiu del joc:
L’objectiu del joc és recollir les sis cartes Som i Serem i dipositar-les a l’urna.

Preparació del joc:
Cada jugador tria un ruc i el posa a la casella d’inici. Es barregen bé les cartes Som i Serem, les cartes pregunta i les cartes de Sant Jordi i el Drac, i es col·loquen cap per avall en els seus respectius espais al tauler. Cada jugador es prepara una urna i la posa davant seu. Abans de començar, cada jugador agafa 3 cartes Som i Serem de la pila. La partida comença amb el jugador més jove.

Les caselles:
Cada cop que es passi per la casella d’inici es recull una carta Som i Serem.
Fes vacances als Pirineus, la Costa Brava i el Delta del Ebre.
Torna a tirar a la Festa Major i a la Diada de Sant Jordi.
Dialoga al Parlament.
Pren acció unilateral al Bon Cop de Falç.
I si et posen una urna davant, ja saps … vota!

Com es guanya:
Guanya la primera persona que introdueix les sis cartes Som i Serem dins l’urna i arriba a la casella de Parlament més propera.
Un cop a la casella de Parlament, s’ha d’assolir majoria parlamentària tirant el dau i treient un 4 o més.
Un cop aconseguit, es guanya el joc.
Visca Catalunya!
—description from the designer
publishers: (Web published), Daniel Valcarcel Lillie, GÃ­njol Jocs

name: Railway Rivals Map LD: Lake District
description: Railway Rivals Map LD Lake District: a map that can be used with both Railway Rivals and Dampfross. This map covers the English Lake District on a scale of 1 hex = 3.3km
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Racing, Trains, Transportation

name: Railway Rivals Map GW: Great Western
description: A map to be used with Railways Rivals or Dampfross games covering the area of the Great Western Railway Company from London to Bristol to a scale of 1 hex = 5km

name: Railway Rivals Map SC: Scotland
description: A map for use with Railways Rivals or Dampfross covering most of Scotland from Carlisle to Inverness to a scale of 1 hex = 7.5km
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Racing, Trains, Transportation

name: Railway Rivals  Map: South East USA
description: A map for use with Railway Rivals or Dampfross games covering the South West area of USA from St Louis to Washington to Jacksonville to Baton Rouge.

name: Railway Rivals Map JU: Yugoslavia
description: A map for use with Railway Rivals and Dampfross games covering Yugoslavia to a scale of 1 hex = 20km.

name: I.C.O.
description:
A game of wise planning and crypto investing.

You are an upstart tech investor with a penchant for Cryptocurrency. Each time a coin forms big money will be paid out to top stakeholders. The player with the most fiat at the end of the game wins.

Each turn, players draw and event card that will affect their turn or all players next turns and then, play a hex tile from their hand on the board to establish new coins, merge existing coins, or grow existing coins. They then buy tokens vying to become majority or minority stakeholders so they can receive a payout upon a merger.
Player's may then research their coins and sell or trade their coins as they see fit.

Player with the most Fiat at the end of the game wins!
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Hand Management, Stock Holding, Tile Placement, Trading

name: Kicking Class
description:
Maybe you thought you were done with high school forever, or maybe you have been dreaming of the day you would finally start. Kicking Class brings an enticingly comical twist to high school. Players take on the role of students going through a whirlwind of hilariously relatable high school faux pas. In the game, you will race against your fellow students to come out on top and claim a full-ride scholarship to the university of your dreams.

Unlike your typical scholarships, which judge you based on boring things like your GPA or school contributions, the K.A. scholarship has developed its own unique ranking system. To claim this scholarship, you will need to pass classes, spread rumors, throw parties, and do whatever it takes to get the upper hand over your fellow students.

Whether you strive for popularity or bury your face behind textbooks, the options are endless. Now get ready to kick some class!

OVERVIEW

The game takes place over the 4 years of high school. Each year there are 3 trimesters, in which you will be taking classes. To pass a class, you will roll skill dice and see if you meet the requirements. If you pass, you keep the card and gain the reward. If you fail, you must draw from the dreaded failure deck!

You will earn scholarship points (SP) for passing classes, being popular, and taking the ACT. At the end of the game, whoever has the most scholarship points wins!

name: WimbleDOOM: Game, Set, MASSACRE!
description:
WimbleDOOM - Game, Set, MASSACRE! is a fantasy tennis dice & card game set in the world of Iotilas where races from different continent come together yearly to compete for a deadly & gruesome tennis match. This game is inspired by the tennis rules in our world and a simplified scoring system to keep the game tight & exciting.

This game is designed to visualize the weird fantasy world we have in our mind where fantasy races such as Orcs, Elves & other fascinating races competing in a dangerous Tennis match where brutality meet sportsmanship.

Each race will need more than Brute Force, Magic, Blessing & Luck to win the glory of the tennis champion and bring pride to their race.

Now that you have resolved all the 3 phases, you will begin a new round starting with the service phase again.

The game will end once the a player won 4 points.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Memo Fahrzeuge
description:
Memo Fahrzeuge provides entertaining memory fun for 2-4 children ages 2 years and older. Who can remember the positions of the vehicles and collect the most pairs?

How to play:

Did you turn over two of the same vehicle? Excellent! You can take the pair and keep it.

Did you turn over two different vehicles? Too bad, but it's OK! Once everyone has the opportunity to see the vehicle cards you can turn them back over again.

End of the game
Have all the pairs been collected? Then all children place their vehicle cards next to each other: The player with the longest vehicle fleet wins the game.

name: SPAT
description:
SPAT is a game of speed and accuracy for 2, 3, 4 or 5 players. Everybody plays at the same time and tries to get rid of their cards by playing them onto the shared SPAT piles by matching 2 of the 3 characteristics of the top card on the pile.

SPAT comes with a deck of 64 cards where each card has a number of animals in one of 4 backgrounds (For example: four pandas in line paper).
All players set up their base like solitaire and play cards onto common discard piles (called SPAT piles).

The object of the game is to get rid of your cards as quickly as possible.

NOTE: this is NOT a turn-based game! All players compete in real-time.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Math, Print & Play, Racing
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Recognition, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Werewolves of the Black Forest
description:
As mayor of a tiny village in the Black Forest your aim is to make your village the most populous in the best housing and to keep it safe from the ravenous werewolf population, all while quietly working towards your secret objective.

A deckbuilding game for 2-4 players with a card settling mechanic that allows cards to provide different benefits depending on if you put the card in play or leave it in your deck for future turns.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Metropolis
description:
Theme
Each player assumes the role of a property tycoon, with the objective of amassing the largest portfolio of iconic buildings, golf courses and luxury toys from around the globe.

Gameplay
Players choose a character figurine and begin at the start space, each player receives 7 resource cards, starting cash, a notepad and a player-sheet. Upon rolling the dice the first player then moves clockwise around the board, either landing on an asset, risk or deal space, they have the option to purchase the asset if they hold the required resource cards, or take a risk or deal card from the appropriate pile. A pre-selected banker controls the flow of cash for transactions and income which is received upon passing start.

If players land on an opponent's asset they must pay the indicated rent to the owner, inability to pay forces them to leave the game.

The play continues until one person is either declared the winner or all other players are eliminated due to running out of money.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Witchland
description:
A terrible prophecy said that terrible monsters would bring darkness to the world at the align of the planets. Despite all the efforts to prevent it, the monsters manage to scaped to our realm and transformed the pacate village of Ashwood into the lands of Witchland. Rumors of the Witchland reached the ears of the Hallowhood Guild, an ancient guild of monster hunters who had for generations fought dark forces in various corners of the world. Over the centuries, fighting monsters became no longer just a chore, but also Hallowhood's greatest pastime and its members eagerly awaited an opportunity like this to prove themselves!

Witchland is a semi-cooperative game. Players must work together to find the terrible monsters that are ravaging Ashwood village and defeat them before the planets line up, but at the same time compete with each other to see who will be the great hunter of this adventure.

At the end of the game, if players succeed in their mission, the player with the most victory points will be the winner. When the planets align, the players failed to protect the world from shadow monsters and now no bet matters anymore. Perishing in darkness is all that remains for humanity.

Teamwork is critical to group victory, overly selfish actions or incorrect decisions can lead to everyone's defeat! But remember: there can be only one winner!

During the game, play as one of the Hallowhood members and look for clues to identify the whereabouts of terrible monsters
while dealing with a horde of angry peasants. To do this, collect ingredients, make potions and acquire powerful artifacts that will help you through this nightmare. Make the right choices when dealing with countless crossroads along your journey and remember: the enemy is always on the prowl.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Santa's Game
description:
Santa’s Game is a card game with Christmas theme and a variety of Christmas characters. It is based on Czech version of public domain card game Crazy Eights (“Prší”). Santa’s Game introduces new rules and additional cards. Although the theme is Christmas oriented, the game is wonderful to be played at any time during the whole year.

It is quick and easy to learn, yet can be more fun and strategic than appears on a first sight. Being in a category of games based on random draw, clever strategy can sometimes eliminate randomness a lot.

Game contains 110 cards and rules.

Cards are divided into 5 suits, 22 cards per suit. There are four suits of colored cards (red, green, blue, yellow) and one suit of special cards (grey). Colored cards are: Reindeer/Number 1 to 9 (72 cards), Gift (8 cards), Christmas Tree (8 cards). Special cards are: Santa Claus (8 cards), Santa’s Sleigh (8 cards), Snowman (4 cards), Elf (2 cards).

At the beginning of the round, each player receives 7 cards. The goal is to get rid of all the cards in player’s hand by matching last played card on a discard pile.

Player’s turns are taken in a clockwise direction. A player can make only one action during each turn. An action is considered to discard a card, to take a card from the deck, to pass the penalty and to take penalty cards. Each turn player discards only one card to a discard pile (with the exception of Santa's Sleigh, where is player allowed to discard multiple cards). Each card has a function, which is executed after player discards it.

Based on a card on a discard pile, player can only discard the same color (red, blue, green and yellow) or the same value of the cards (same number, Gift, Tree). Special cards (grey) may be discarded over any card, except if player is receiving penalty. If player does not want or cannot discard any card, they must take one card from the deck.

Cards:

Reindeer – represents numbers 1 to 9
Gift – any chosen player at the table gets 2 penalty cards
Christmas Tree – the next player’s turn is skipped
Santa Claus – changes color
Santa’s Sleigh – discards more Reindeer at the same time
Snowman – passes the penalty to next player in the sequence
Elf – returns player to the game

—description from the publisher

name: Railway Rivals Map DX: "Dixieland"
description: A map to be used with Railway Rivals and Dampfross games covering SE USA from Cairoo to Hagerstown to Jacksonville to Natchez to a scale of 1 hex = 37Km

name: Dungeon Hunt
description:
Dungeon Hunt is a card game simulating the experience of a classic dungeon crawler. The play deck is formed by 54 cards.

Playdeck cards’ list:
4 hero cards;
12 dungeon cards (6 corridors and 6 rooms) + 1 Start card + 1 Elevator Exit card;
8 Monster Cards;
28 Equipment Cards;

Players: 1-4

3 difficulty levels

Setting
A race of hunter aliens (Predator like) lands on earth and take 4 warriors as prisoners for a survival game. The four are taken on a labyrinth-arena-ship where they must face mythological monsters finding at the same time a way to exit.

Cards general description
Hero cards are the sheets of all four characters, these cards contain all information to manage our hero.
Dungeon cards are exactly what their name suggests - corridors and rooms to explore. On these cards there are symbols which have a value during the game.
Monster cards are the sheets of monsters encountered in the dungeon, their statistics change according to the dungeon difficulty level.
Equipment cards are weapons, potions, and various items that can be used by heroes during the game.

Game setup:
Cards are divided into three decks - monsters, equipment, and dungeon decks.
Choose difficulty level (the dungeon cards number changes).
Place down the Start card.
Choose a hero.
Draw 2 equipment cards.
Now you are ready to to begin the turn.

Games turns"
Draw a dungeon card and put it next to the Start card matching the arrows correctly.
Draw a monster card and roll a 6 sided dice to determine the number of monsters.
Roll another 6 sided dice to determine how many actions heroes can take this turn. All actions are subdivided among characters.
Compare monsters initiative with the one of the current turn hero and proceed with the fighting. When all monsters are defeated, each hero draws a card from the equipment deck.
Before beginning a new turn, equipment cards can be attached or exchanged among players and other actions can be taken.

The turn passes to the second player and the game proceeds as described until the Elevator Exit room where heroes face the final boss monster and need to defeat it in order to win the game
—description from the designer

name: Volumes of Blood: Body Count
description:
Volumes of Blood: Body Count is a card game for 2-8 players set in the Volumes of Blood horror anthology movie franchise. In VoB:Body Count players take on the role of directors and try to make their own vignette scenes using Scene cards featuring characters, weapons, and locations from the movies! Each Scene card type has a Fear value that is used to determine how many Victims a director may claim in a scene and how many bonus cards a director may draw when a scene is successfully wrapped.

To create a scene, a director must collect a Killer Scene card, a Weapon Scene card, and a Location Scene card. Once each of these cards are in play in front of the director, a Victim card may be played into the scene as well. Gore and Effect cards can increase or decrease the Fear value of a scene. Scene, Gore and Effect cards may be played in any scene on the table by any director during that director's turn. Mess up the other directors scenes with Wild cards. Wrap a scene quickly and don't get stuck with low Fear value cards!

The first director to claim three Victims in their Body Count is the winner!

—description from the publisher

name: The Invitation
description:
The Invitation is a three to five player cooperative tabletop game where the players explore a derelict mansion and fight to avoid madness while completing the chosen scenario. Each scenario presents a plot, objective, and special rules for the gameplay. Certain scenarios introduce special mechanics that change the dynamic of the game. For example, the second scenario introduces a traitor mechanic in which one player secretly works against the rest of the players to accomplish his/her own goals.

The exploration of the house is based on a randomly ordered deck of Room Tiles, so each play through is different in how the house is laid out. Items, enemies, and events are also encountered in a random order, which also serves to differentiate each play through and adds to the replayability.

—description from the designer
categories: Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Maze, Print & Play, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Wickedest of Them All
description:
In every city, there is one witch who's the most popular, most powerful and above all the most wicked. Wickedest of Them All pits 2-4 players against each other as they take on the roles of some of the most ruthless modern witches of all time, each one with one goal, to be the WICKEDEST OF THEM ALL!

Players choose a witch and draw cards. Their goal is to see which character has the highest wicked rank by the end of the game. Each witch has special powers and three attributes. Magic, Wicked, and Status. Status is used to play minions and magic is used to cast spells.

Actions: a Player can perform one action on their turn. They may summon a minion, use a character action, cast a spell, or have a minion attack. Playing equipment or minions do not count as actions and can be played at no "cost" during a turn. A character can have up to 2 pieces of equipment in play.

Spells
Each spell has a number magic rank, in order for a witch to use a spell her magic rank must be equal to or higher than the spells magic rank.

Status and minions
A witch can call forth a minion in her player's hand if the witch has an equal or higher status than the minion.

Spells and minions as actions
Can be cast to affect the game, cast on minions or victims or cast on other spells as actions. Minions have an attack rank and can damage other minions and victims doing damage to their target.

Gaining wicked: Some spells grant bonuses to wicked as do destroying victims and minions. All minions are worth one wicked and victims are worth an amount of wicked equal to their "goodness rank".

End Game.
When the deck is depleted, the player whose character has the highest wicked wins.

name: Batman Miniature Game (Second Edition): The Book of Magic
description:
The Batman Miniature Game is a tabletop skirmish game featuring the powerful heroes and evil villains of the DC universe.
Will you join the Dark Knight against the mobsters who terrorize Gotham?
Or will you join his enemies to bring chaos to the streets and take back the night?

The Book Of Magic contains all the rules required to include Magic in your games of the 2nd edition Batman Miniatures Game. Includes 24 spell card.

A copy of the Main 2nd edition Batman miniatures game is required to use this expansion ruleset.
categories: Book, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Fox in the Henhouse
description:
Fox in the Henhouse is a micro-game for 2-4 players that can be played in 10-20 minutes. Each player is trying to accumulate the most Eggs (points) from their Hens. The Fox is a tricky scoundrel that shows up in all the wrong places and chases off the Hens and destroys their Eggs! It’s your job to keep the Fox out of your Henhouse and keep your Hens safe so they can produce as many Eggs as possible.

In Fox in the Henhouse, each player has only 1 card in their hand and two face down cards in front of them. The two face down cards are called your Henhouse. Hen cards have 1-4 Eggs shown on them. You are attempting to gather the most Eggs into your hand and Henhouse by the end of the Week (7 rounds). In addition to each player's hand and Henhouse are two face down cards in the center of the play area called the Field. On your turn you can select a card from anywhere on the table (cannot take a card from someone's hand). Once you have selected a card, you can choose which of the two cards you now hold to keep and which to put back, then other players take turns following the same format of selecting a card and placing a card. If a player selects a Fox card they must keep it in their hand unless they are also holding one of the 4 Fox repelling cards (The Farmer, The Farmwife, The Farm Dog or The Rooster). The 4 Fox repelling cards also have special abilities when played face up to help you manipulate the cards in play. At the end of the Week all players total up their Eggs and take the number of Egg tokens they have accumulated. After 4 weeks have been played then the player with the most Eggs wins!

name: WÄgrÃ³w 1863
description:
Game covers battle of WÄgrów, one of the most important skirmishes of January Uprising in the Russian Partition of Poland. It uses "Napoleon" system.

Battle took place February 3, 1863 near WÄgrów in east Masovia. On January 22, Polish partisans, under the command of the WÅadysÅaw JabÅonowski and Jan MatliÅski liberated a town from Russian forces. Here Poles established a military base, in a few days gathering almost 3,500 soldiers, mostly poorly armed, with about 500 scythe armed volunters, known as "Kosynierzy" (Scythemen).

Russians decided to recapture WÄgrów with quick attack of the combined force forces of a 1,000-strong infantry unit with artillery, led by colonel Georgi Papaafanasopulo. Poles, threatened by encirclement, decided to retreat from the town. About 500 scythemen were ordered cover the Polish retreat. Scythemen attacked the Russian left flank and routed Russian cavalry squadron and cannons. Thanks to their action, biggest part of the Polish forces managed to left the town, but almost all attacking scythemen were killed by Russian infantry fire.

Game covers whole battle in three scenarios.

name: Castella
description:
Two players play as bees and collect honey. The greedy bear will destroy the hive in the process to get the honey. To help their owner taste the delicious honey cake, players have to consider how to place their boards and collect resources. With mutual interference, the player who collects the most honey cakes wins.

How to play


Steps of the game


Step 1. Get 1 hexagon card and select Honeycomb Side or Garden Side. It's needed to connect any side of the hexagon when placed.

Step 2. Take actions of the card. A player can choose any hexagon card on the table and take its associated action.


Example of actions for the cards


Honeycomb Side of the card > Honey producing or honey

Get nectar cubes from bee card and put the cubes on the Honeycomb Card. Collect the honey cubes in the next run.

Switch the white / black nectar cubes to the numbers of honey cubes according to the card, and then put the honey cubes on BOTTLE Card. Every 8 honey cubes could convert into 1 CASTELLA Card.

Garden Side of the card > Nectar collecting

Collect 1/2/3/D nectar cubes from your own Garden Card and put the cubes on the bee card. The nectar cubes on the bee card could be used to produce honey.

How to use Greedy Bear Card

Bear attack: Put Greedy Bear Card, the Greedy Bear would eat all of the nectar cubes on the Honeycomb Side around the Greedy Bear, and also turn the Honeycomb Side into Garden Side.


Goal of the game


When all the hexagon cards are out, the points are calculated by the total cubes on both the bee card, the bottle card, and the numbers of castella cakes. The winner is the one who got the most points. If there are any Greedy Bear cards left, each Greedy Bear Card will deduct 1 honey cube on the honey card. If no honey cubes are on the honey Card, then no points would be deducted.

name: Royal Conquest
description:
Royal Conquest is largely based on an old Korean card game called Go-Stop. Match cards from you hand to those on the table and form winning combinations to score points. Call STOP once you've earned the minimum points and win the hand. Or call GO if you think you can make at least one more point before another player can make a call.

Stay alert because another player may have an Action card that could stop you from winning the game. The addition of Action cards gives this game its unique gameplay.

If you win a hand, you receive Gems based on number of players and how many times a "GO" was called. Once all the Gems are gone from the Gem pot, the player with the most Gems wins the game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: Vanquisher
description:
Vanquisher is a game of abstract territorial control, engine building, and city building. Players take on the role of kings competing to fill newly discovered land with their own buildings, while trying to block others from doing the same. Each player will use resources, bribe officials, and send armies in order to create the dominant kingdom and claim the land as their own.

In Vanquisher, players will take turns performing actions and constructing buildings in a limited map area. The area consists of a grid, where players will place their newly constructed buildings. But careful planning is essential, since buildings can only be constructed without them touching, a specification that can be used to a player’s advantage. Each constructed building will also give a special benefit to the player which they can use throughout the game to assist them in collecting resources, using army tokens to block other players, and allow them to use additional actions during their turns. A player can additionally use actions to bribe officials, which take form of cards that will assist them in creating a more efficient engine to claim the most land.

The game ends after 12 rounds, and players get points from territorial control, and bonus points for achievements, money, and certain buildings.

This game was made available as a free Print and Play by Ngb Designs.

From the Game:
In a realm much like our own, Kings search for undiscovered territory to expand their kingdom. News has spread of new land found far across the mountains, and Kings now rush to claim it as their own and vanquish others along the way.
Vanquisher is a strategic kingdom building game. Players take turns constructing buildings, growing their armies, and bribing officials in order to spread their influence on the unclaimed territory. It is up to the players to manage their resources to help grow their kingdom, and stop others from growing theirs.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Enclosure, Hand Management, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Grim Acres
description:
Description from the publisher:

Push the gate open, if you dare, and step onto the mist-filled grounds of Grim Acres. The overseer, Morticai Grimsly, has been waiting for you. He solicits your help in architecting his garden of gloom.

Quickly outbuild your opponent(s) in this casually creepy cemetery card game. Ghosts included.

Card Play Order:
Plot
Grave or Statue
Memorial
Remains
Haunt

New plots may be played next to existing cards. All other cards are stacked on top of the preceding card. Statues and haunts are end cards (nothing can be played on top of them).

In the first round, build your section by playing as many cards in order as you like. Extend your section from the central house, laying plots in line or grid format. On subsequent rounds, play one card at a time. If you can’t play, draw a card and play it if you can.

White Normal Cards: Only playable within your section or on another player’s green or purple card.

Green Open Cards: Any player may play onto any green Open Card, even outside his or her own section.

Purple Cursed Cards: Cursed Cards must be immediately covered by the next card in order (white, green, or purple). If you don’t have the next card, draw from the deck and play if you can. If not, play passes to the left until someone can play/draw the required card. Multiple Cursed Cards may be played in a row. Resume play to the left of the original Cursed Card player.

To win, be the first to play all of the cards in your hand.

name: For Better or First
description:
A tongue-in-cheek card game that has you racing against your opponents to reach 50 years of marriage first.

Think you've got what it takes to make it all the way to 50 years of marriage? In this card game players compete to see who's marriage can withstand the challenges many couples face- such as naughty children, money trouble, pesky in-laws and even the much feared sex drought! But don't worry, for each challenge there is a solution.

Game play is pretty simple. The game can be played with up to 4 individuals or 3 pairs(6 players total). Each turn involves drawing one card and playing one card. To win you must play year cards(1 year, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 10 years)to reach the total of 50 years before your opponents do. Before you can play any year cards you must play a married card. Once you're officially married you can start accumulating years.

On your turn you draw a card:

from the top of the discard pile or
the top of the deck


Then you choose ONE of the following as your play a card action:

Playing a card on yourself such as a Year card, Solution card or Immunity card(which protects you from specific Setback cards).
Playing a card on an opponent such as a Setback card or Divorce card to slow down their progress.
Or if you're unable to do either of those, simply discard a card.


If you have either a divorce card or setback card played on you, you can not play any new year cards till those cards have been resolved. Marriage cards resolve Divorce cards, Solution cards resolve Setback cards of the same color.

—description from the designer

name: Magnanimous
description:
Magnanimous takes place in the middle of the 19th century during the second Brazilian reign, at the apogee of the emperor Pedro II nicknamed "the Magnanimous." The players represent Barons with large properties in the Brazil provinces, and will dispute their influence over the economy, politics and the military forces with the recently declared "War of Paraguay".

An average Euro themed with area control, resource management, trade and an unique voting system. An asymmetric game with different strategic paths: race to have a directly influence over "the Magnanimous" or even manage your resources, provinces and politicians to conspire against the empire until the arrival of the dreaded republic.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Hand Management, Trading, Voting

name: Push Wars
description:
A game about anthropomorphic animals pushing each other out of an arena.

2-4 players

Includes:
Cards
Miniatures
Hex Tiles
Hex Arenas

The game is played by rounds, where you move your character on an arena formed by hexes, trying to push out the opponents out of the arena. Use special abilities and hexes, take advantage of the terrain.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Tile Placement

name: Warlike: Two Kings
description:
A strategic war against 2 kings. Similar to a game of chess except using cards instead of playing pieces for the units.

Each player starts with the same types and number of troops in their army and over the course of 5 days the winner will be decided by the number and value of the enemy forces they are able to capture.

The main mechanic uses knights, archers and mages in a way that is similar to rock, paper, scissors. There are also 3 special units and 4 tactic tokens that are also usable by players to try and achieve the upper hand, but after the dust settles only the most cunning king will prevail.

—description from the designer

name: Partido
description:
Partido, meaning “match” or “shape” in Spanish, is a must have mini-game. From 2-5 players, it’s great for the whole family, parties, or just chillin’ at the pub with a friend.

80 tiles with 1-4 half-shapes, draw one, make a match and gain points. First to 21 points total wins. Match two or more shapes in your turn gets you that number of points. Example: Match 2 shapes, receive 2 points, 3 shapes receive 3 points, etc.

Teach anyone this game in 1 minute! Super fun and super simple, however there is a little strategy available the more familiar you get with the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Educational, Puzzle

name: Machinations: A Game of Devious Schemes
description:
Machinations is a competitive tabletop game where players take the role of a soothsayer, zombie, superhero and more in order to complete their own agendas. While roaming the board, players discover new locations that may help them on their mission or reveal an obstacle that they must face. The board changes according to which combinations of characters are in the game for a unique experience every game. During a special phase called covert operations, players get to secretly perform their special abilities in order to get one step closer to winning the game.

Do you have what it takes to save the day from the alien invasion? Will you find the path to the buried treasure? Keep your identity hidden and get ahead by sabotaging other opponents. Just be careful or you might get sucked into the black hole or encounter the raging robot. Will you be the first to fulfill your Machination?
categories: Adventure, Bluffing, Deduction, Exploration, Pirates, Science Fiction, Spies/Secret Agents, Zombies
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: SpaceCiv
description:
The humans cannot live on Earth. The nuclear war has created new a new species,who,with their special powers,have taken over whole earth without any difficulty.

So you, along with the other survivors have shifted to a new planet in a far away galaxy. And you are their leader. Can you successfully create a civilization? Probably, and then, probably not.

Each turn a new disaster will occur upon your civilization and you have to use your military and resources to protect your civilization.
SpaceCiv is a solo PnP game. In this game, you cannot win.At the end of the game, you will be given Victory Points based on your surviving buildings.

—description from the designer

name: Treadheads
description:
Treadheads is a new and unique game system that covers Second World War and future combined-arms tactical combat. TH will integrate armor, infantry, artillery and air support for miniatures and hex-based board gaming. The unit level is individual vehicles & aircraft with squads & teams for infantry. Each player will command up to a reinforced combined arms company, confronting the same challenges and fortunes of war as real tank commanders and infantry squad leaders in combat with the enemy.

They will advance to contact, identify and react to threats, engage targets, and then adapt their own battle plans as necessary. TH encourages the use the tactics and strategies, including those taken directly from the real manuals, and features weapons platforms that perform with a high degree of detail & accuracy.

What sets this game apart from other games at this scale & subject? Treadheads centers around the concept of “Time in Action” as a way to simulate the interactive and simultaneous actions of units in a historical 1:1 engagement. This timing synchronizes movement and firing commands and eliminates additional rules and traditional Sequence of Play for initiative determination, orders phase, opportunity fire and over-watch, while allowing simultaneous movement & target engagement.

TH and the OODA Decision Loop: The principle of the Decision Loop (Observe, Orient, Decide, Act) was developed by USAF Colonel John Boyd. By mastering this process and getting "inside" the cycle, disrupting an opponent's thinking processes, and forcing him to commit to a plan before he's ready, this offers opportunities and pressures for him to make mistakes. That timing aspect of acting before your opponent is what allows you to seize the initiative and exploit it.

name: Just Borrowin'
description:
In Just Borrowin’, you take on the role of a family of tiny people who live under the floorboards, in the walls and in the nooks and crannies of a nice big house of rich and forgetful humans. Each night, you venture out to “borrow” items to make your tiny house bigger, better and nicer to live in. But beware of fellow tiny people, who are also trying to furnish their homes, and won’t hesitate to scuffle with you for the items they want.

What’s more, you have to look out for the cat, the ferocious pet of the humans, whose keen senses know when there’s a scuffle among the tiny people. Avoid the cat at all costs, or you’ll be cat food. Survive the scuffles and the feline wrath, and you’ll return with the materials to decorate your home. You can even assemble borrowed items to create more elaborate furniture. If you accomplish your goals for a dream home, you’ll be the envy of all tiny people.

This is a card-based game where 3-5 players start of with just a an empty room card. Their ideal dream home is dictated by goal cards drawn at the start of each game. Each turn, item cards are presented and all players simultaneously place their meeples on the items they want to grab. If two or more players go after the same item card, a scuffle breaks out. Scuffles are resolved with dice rolls but if the difference exceeds two, the cat will hear and disrupt the scuffle. Everyone flees and no one gets the item.

Players decorate their room card with the item cards. There are also Assembly cards where players are required to get two or more specified item cards to build into the Assembly. Assemblies score more and give action bonuses. Players may also trade items with each other, expand their tiny house by adding room cards. Play ends when there are no more item cards to grab. Then points are added. Item cards, Assembly Cards and Goal cards are scored and totalled.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Trading

name: Quotable Game
description:
Quotable Rules

Objective: This is a game full of funny/insightful/awful quotes—players rarely know who actually said these quotes, because honestly, can you name a single quote by Kim Kardashian? The objective is to either write the correct answer or trick your friends into thinking your answer is the right person.

Setup:

Players: 3-8 players

Phones: *A companion app is in the works* For now exchange phone numbers with the other players. Players will text answers to the Reader each round.

Scorekeeper: Designate a Scorekeeper—this person needs to pay special attention to “Scoring” Section…obviously.

Reader: Player with birthday closest to January 1 begins the game as Reader—the Reader will facilitate each round.

Gameplay:

1. The first Reader draws a card and reads the quote without revealing author.

2. TEXTING ROUND: Players text Reader a guess of who said the quote (at this point, players either think they know the answer or are trying to think of a fake author to trick their friends)

3. Reader re-reads quote after all texts are received

4. Reader announces all the options including correct author in any order. If 2 options are the same, only read that option once. (This includes repeat texts, and someone texting the correct answer.)

5. VOTING ROUND: After announcing all options, Reader calls for votes on each option. (Players MUST vote, and may not vote for their own answer, even if they believe it to be correct.)

6. Scorekeeper tallies/announces scores. Then player to left of Reader is now Reader and round is complete

Scoring:
Player texts correct author of quote on answer card (5 Points)
Player receives vote for their texted answer, if it was not correct. (1 Point each)
Player votes for correct author of quote in voting round (2 Points)
No player votes (or writes) correct author (3 Points for READER)
First Player to 21 Wins

name: Loud & Proud
description:
From the makers of Co-opoly: The Game of Cooperatives comes Loud & Proud, the fast-paced social justice word association game!

The gameplay is easy and quick. Players sit in a circle and flip over cards, if the symbol on your card matches another player’s, you face-off, and race to answer each others’ card prompt first. Your card might say “Civil Rights Leader,” and their card might say “Renewable Energy”—the first player to correctly answer the other player’s prompt (“Malcolm X!”) wins their card.

But watch out: A few cards force all players to give an answer at once or provide not one, but three answers! What ensues is shouting, laughing, high-fives, and the opportunity for important conversations.

This game is simple to learn, a blast to play over and over again, and refreshingly insightful. Along the way you’ll learn more about the many issues covered and get to know your fellow players better. Have fun, and no matter what, be loud and proud!

Loud & Proud is ethically produced.

Loud & Proud is great for:

A fun time with friends and family
Ice breakers for organizers and activists
Community events
Rallies and protests
The game is small enough to be carried around in your pocket! If your pocket is located in a pair of cargo pants, that is.

—description from the publisher

name: Rex IbÃ©ricus
description:
During the Middle Ages, the Iberian Peninsula was divided into several small states, Christian kingdoms (in the northern half) and Muslim emirates (in the southern half). Over almost eight centuries, these two cultures went through periods of war and peace, intolerance and coexistence, and the fragile alliances between ones and others kingdoms changed overnight depending on the political interests of each sovereign. (Christians against Muslims, Christians against Christians, Muslims against Muslims), with the Jews as an economic force that exerted as a hinge. Likewise, foreign powers such as the Papacy or the Caliphate also played their cards in the peninsular contest. In "Rex Ibéricus" you will have to take control of one of the main six Iberian medieval kingdoms: three Christians (Kingdom of Castile, Kingdom of Aragon and Kingdom of Navarra) and three Muslims (Emirate of Cordoba, Emirate of Granada and Emirate of Valencia). Through political intrigue, diplomacy and war, as well as economic and cultural development, you will have to fight to make your kingdom or emirate become the most powerful on the Peninsula, and be named "Rex Ibéricus".

For this, you will have the opportunity to occupy villages, castles and walled cities, and then build farms, palaces, churches, mosques, synagogues, libraries, towers and lighthouses, which will magnify your kingdom. Likewise, you must recruit armies and build fleets to defend yourself from your dangerous neighbors, and in no case will you do well to neglect the basic nutritional needs of your subjects, since you could face brutal peasant revolts of unpredictable consequences. You must also ensure the defense of your coasts, since the fearsome Viking warriors could land on them and destroy all the wealth of your prosperous State. To help you with these challenges, you will have four historical leaders from each kingdom (Isabella, Ferdinand, Urraca, Abd al-Rahman, Boabdil, Zobeyda ...), each of them provided with special skills depending on the position assigned to them (King, advisor, ambassador, emir, vizier ...), and you can also use them to seal alliances with other kingdoms through marital links, which will make you join forces to protect yourself from more belligerent third parties, while allowing you to engender heirs (princes and princesses) to ensure the survival of your legacy.

In the same way, using your political influence and the support of your allies in the assembly, you will have the opportunity to reach the cusp of the Iberian Court (common to all peninsular kingdoms), which will allow you to control powerful elite units. Nor should you underestimate the power of the conspiracy, which will allow you to carry out espionage missions, instigate internal revolts and even kill rival monarchs. Finally, you can embark on exciting sea voyages to the East (Rome, Baghdad, Jerusalem and China) in search of external support to implement your political structures and deal with your enemies, although long journeys will never be without danger. Are you prepared to travel to the Middle Ages and enter an exciting world of castles, swords, religious conflicts and palace plots?

name: EleMasters: The Octomic Bond
description:
HOW TO PLAY
EleMasters is a 2-8 player game that fosters a blend of competitive and co-op play. The objective of the game is to bond as many Atomo cards as you can on your turn, in order to win.

SETUP
Place the Octomic Ring in the center of the table.
Shuffle the full deck of Atomo Cards.
Deal each player their Hand (9 minus # of players).
All player hands remain face up in front of them as ‘in play’.
Place the remaining cards face down on the center of the Octomic Ring as the Atomo Deck.
Player with the highest Valectron count in their hand starts, then counterclockwise.

GAME OVER
The game ends when there are no more Summoned Atomo left on the Octomic Ring to play. When this happens, everyone discards the rest of their hand so only point deck cards remain.

Long game option: When the Octomic Ring runs out of Atomo cards, reshuffle the discard pile as a new set. Repeat until there are no more summoned Atomo, or no more bonds can be made by any player.


SCORING
The objective, is for each player to Bond as many cards as possible, so that you get to claim them for your Point Deck.
3pts/per Atomo card in your point deck.
1pt/per Valectron on each of those Atomo cards in point deck.
1pt/per Bond made with your point deck during end game scoring.

ROUNDS
The Active Player starts their turn by flipping the top card of the Atomo Deck over to reveal it as the Summoned Atomo for that round.

The Active Player then decides, based on all the cards in front of each player, themselves included, which cards to bond with the Active Atomo. The more cards bonded, the more of them you get to keep & add to your point deck at the end of that round, but also stay aware of how many Valectron points that card has as well.

Point Deck cards are not ‘in-play’ to bond to.


As the active player searches for bond combos, the other players should be verifying the bonds being attempted, as well as suggesting bonds that will help themselves as well as the AP. In this way, the game is both co-op as well as competitive.

At the end of each players turn, they should draw enough cards from the Atomo Deck to refill their hand.

Four modes teach you the game by starting simple, then adding mechanics which you can mix and match as you like:

Beginner: Basic Octets.
Casual: Phases to cool & heat Atomo’.
EleMagi: Radioactive Isotopes add stabilization complication.
EleMaster: Use correct bond types to ionize Atomo’ for more bonding options on your turn.

BEGINNER MODE
"Octets"

Rules:
• Form an Octet of Valectrons
• Ignore all other modifiers

“Valectron” is EleMaster slang for “Valence Electron”.
For this mode, you just want to create a total of 8 (an Octet) Valectrons around the Summoned Atomo.

To bond a card to the Summoned Atomo, place a hand card from yourself or another player onto a BondBloom (the glowing mineral leaves on the edge of the Octomic Ring). You can bond up to four cards.

For a successful bond, the total of Valectrons around the Summoned Atomo, plus the Valectrons around each bonded Atomo must equal a total of 8. No more, no less.

If you bond, place all the bonded cards into your point deck. If you can’t make a bond, discard the Summoned Atomo, return all hand cards to their owners, then end the round and let the next player start their turn.


In this Beginner mode, if the Summoned Atomo drawn has eight already, you simply add it to your point pile as an automatic point and that ends your turn. This does not apply in the other game modes.


CASUAL MODE
"Phases"

Rules:
• Form an Octet of Valectrons
• Use Phase modifier

Here’s where we harness some of the core concepts of chemical bonding through the ‘EleMagic’ of the Octomic Ring.

Each Atomo has it’s own default ‘phase’ on it which refers to the Heat Energy it contains at standard Earth temperatures, which determines the ‘state’ it’s in.

For example, “H2O” with low heat energy makes it a Solid we call Ice. Add more heat energy and it ‘melts’ into the Liquid we call Water. Add even more heat energy, bringing it to a boil and this begins to break it down into the Gas we know as Steam or Vapor.

The higher the heat energy, the more likely it is to lose valectrons, and thus its bond.

Adding an Atomo’s phase to its matching color on the ring, has no effect. However, if you add an Atomo to a color with more Heat Energy it loses -1 Valectron per phase increase. Likewise, you can add +1 Valectron for each phase downward you go as well.

This starts to give you more flexibility in working with the available cards in play.

ELEMAGI MODE
"Radioactivity"

Rules:
• Form an Octet of Valectrons
• Use Phase modifiers.
• Radioactive Atoms must be stabilized.

If you don’t see the decaying skull, it’s not a radioactive Atomo, and you can ignore this. However, if an Atomo card does have the Decaying Skull on it, this means it is radioactive and must be stabilized in order to use it.

If the summoned Atomo is radioactive, ALL bonds must be made through the plasmagic (yellow) blooms which makes it a stable isotope.

If you fail to create a bond with a radioactive summon on your turn, you must not only discard the Summoned Atomo but also one card from you point deck.

If you have no cards yet in your point deck, you must discard one from your hand after refilling.


ELEMASTER MODE
"Metal & Bond Types"

Rules:
• Form an Octet of Valectrons
• Use Phase and Radioactive modifiers.
• Use the correct Bond Types (below).

Metal Types:
Each Atomo has one of three Metal Types on it. These determine which cards can bond with the Summoned Atomo, based on the BondBloom you use.

Bond Types:
Each of the BondBlooms is able to perform one of three main Bond Types. You must use the correct pairing of Atomo, or the Bond will not work.

If the bond does work though, it adds or subtracts a set number of Valectrons from the bonding Atomo (no partials):
Ionic: +/- 1 Valectron
Covalent: +/- 2 Valectrons
Metallic: +/- 3 Valectrons

WORLD
EleMasters begins in the world of the Fractal Forest, where science and sorcery collide. Through the Octomic Ring, you can communicate with Atomo', the spirits of Atoms and particles. In learning to wield that ring, you as an EleMage can teach the Atomo' how to alter and bond elements of the periodic table. Train with your fellow EleMagi and then together take this expertise with you to save the world.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Phase Order

name: Magical Musical Chairs: The Card Game
description:
The entire deck is dealt out and one person is left holding the chair. A 10 point card that can only be played if it's the last card in your hand. Players take turns rolling the die, which has 4 colored music notes on it and 2 black notes. When rolled you may play a music card of the specific color from your hand and then take the action written on the card. Some cards allow you to steal a card or give a card away or make everyone shuffle their cards around the circle. In the 21+ version of the game each card also has a drink ability which may allow you to give a drink or even make everyone take a drink. Designed to be played with many people this game can take up to 10 players and is a quick fast paced party game. The game continues and players hand sizes decrease the elusive chair becomes easier to spot but only one person will end the game with it. The question remains will it be played for points or will it be stuck in someones hand for negative points?

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Music, Number, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Monopoly: The Materials Edition
description:
Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

Introduction
Monopoly: The Materials Edition was developed by PhD students from the Advanced Metallic Systems Centre for Doctoral Training. The students developed the game as part of a public engagement project which aims to raise awareness of materials science and engineering and engage people with the world of metallurgy.

From the rear of the box:
The game is played just like traditional Monopoly but instead of purchasing property, players buy different materials as they travel around the board. Materials including metals, ceramics, polymers and composites all feature in the game. Investing in research and development enables you to buy labs and research centres to upgrade your material to a more advanced technology, for example turning steel from paperclips into skyscrapers!
The property cards provide a brief description of the technology. Those with red backs are aimed at upper GCSE and A-Level students and the blue cards use simpler language for younger students (~KS3).

PROPERTIES
BROWN (naturals)
Wood / Rubber
LIGHT BLUE (polymers)
Thermoplastic / Thermoset / Biodegradable
PINK (ceramics)
Chalk / Clay / Sand
ORANGE (Steels)
Plain Carbon / Stainless / Speciality
RED (Light Metals)
Aluminium / Magnesium / Titanium
YELLOW (base Metals)
Zinc / Copper / Nickel
GREEN (composites)
Ceramic / Polymer / Metal Matrix
DARK BLUE (premium)
Uranium / Platinum
STATIONS
Recycling Station / Manufacturing Station / Processing Station / Extraction Station
UTILITIES
Water Works / Electricity Company
TAXES
Income Tax / Super Tax
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Hamsters of Panama
description:
Hamsters of Panama is new, original, simple but not stupid, funny but not childish, strategic but not too complicated board game. This board game allows players interact with each other, make strategies, harm fast runners or annoying talkers and many more.
To win the game players have to play as many rounds as it takes to move 12 steps ahead to reach paradise Panama island. Those steps are divided in four different difficulty levels from the easiest one to the hardest one.

In each round players get two special cards with certain features and take as many number cards as they think are enough for their playing strategy. After that players use special cards. Finally, results are calculated and players who meet level conditions move forward to Panama.

It should be mentioned that there is only one plane to Panama and many hamsters who want to be first, so don't be lazy, run fast, think hard, outsmart opponents and reach Panama island.

Join us and be prepared to survive the ultimate journey to Panama!

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Animals, Bluffing, Card Game, Humor, Math, Party Game, Travel
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Reign of Terror: The Protoan
description:
From the publisher:

Welcome Battle Commanders! The future of your faction's survival is depending on you! Gain influence and expand your forces to strategically defeat the opposing faction. You win the battle when you reduce your opponent’s health to zero. However, a Battle Commander must be cautious if their opponent is off-initiative. Since Battle for Sularia is a round-based card game, if your opponent is off-initiative, they have the chance to strike back and reduce your health total below theirs and thereby defeating you and winning the game!

FEATURES/GAME PLAY INCLUDES:

Multiple Play Modes
To start play immediately, you can play with the pre-constructed 60 card play deck included in the box. Players can then play in our "60/90" constructed format by customizing their play decks with the additional cards provided in the box! If draft play is more your style, we suggest adding one box of Reign of Terror to our Battle for Sularia core set box, which also supports 2-4 player draft play.

Construction Point Values
Unique "60/90" deck construction system. Each card has a construction point value of 1 to 4 points. Each deck must have a minimum of 60 cards and a deck cannot exceed a total construction value of 90 points. This system pushes the envelope on deck construction and maintains value and interests for all cards within the set – not just a few select overpowered options.

Two-resource System
Engaging two-resource system which includes influence and sularium. Influence increases once per round, while each player uses their influence to establish sites on their turn to help build their sularium stockpiles. Sularium is used to deploy combatants, which are used to attack your opponent's sites. The two-resource system in turn provides additional strategies for repeatable game play.

Round-based Game
Simultaneous combat! The game runs on a round-based system, which allows each player to complete their turn before the round is over.

Lore and Art
In addition to our engaging game play, we've forged our own path in terms of game setting. This allows us to explore new content and visuals without restrictions, which in turn provides new players with a fresh start and removes the barrier of entry associated with older legacy games and stories.

SETTING:

Reign of Terror: The Protoan introduces a brand new faction to the world of Sularia. The Protoan were originally designed as a biological weapon alternative to the conventional weapons of their time. They were engineered to aggressively spread a viral infection that would pacify an opposing force or civilian population, while leaving the surrounding infrastructures and environment relatively unharmed. Of course, “relatively unharmed” is a very subjective point of view. Because, if the Protoan could not pacify an enemy with its virus, then they would simply devour them along with anything else in their way.

The breeding facilities of the Protoan were believed to be one of numerous lost technologies of the time before the apocalyptic event know as the Fracture—nearly a millennium ago. Since the Fracture, they have evolved deep underground—far beyond their original design. Furthermore, the bio-engineering developed to control their population no longer seems to be effective, as they continue to spread at a rate far beyond their original life expectancy perimeters. As if the power struggle between the Jotune and Synthien wasn’t bad enough, this new emerging threat puts the very survival of everyone on the planet at risk.

OVERVIEW:

Reign of Terror: The Protoan is a new stand-alone card game and core faction that is compatible with our other Battle for Sularia card game titles. The Protoan have their own unique game play strategies, as well as familiar options you would expect to find in a competitive card game. See the keywords for a list of new mechanisms.

NEW KEYWORDS:

VIRUS/INFECTION

The VIRUS/INFECTION mechanism is a two-part ability. VIRUS is represented by counters that buff your Protoan combatants in some way. However, when those VIRUS counters are transferred—through various methods—to an opponent’s combatant, they become known as INFECTION counters. As the name implies, infection is not a good thing for your combatants. If your combatants become seriously infected, they will die.

CHALLENGE

If a Protoan combatant has the CHALLENGE keyword, it can single out an opponent’s combatant to defend against it. Whether through intimidation, mind control, or some primal subconscious response of the defender—it also doesn’t matter if the defender is reset or activated—it has to defend. While this may seem like a good idea by the defender for whatever reason, it usually results in it being completely devoured.

HARDENED

In Reign of Terror, we introduce HARDENED as a keyword that is linked to sites, however it's possible you will see this keyword on combatants in the near future. The ability is pretty solid, pun intended, as it prevents blast-through damage. So if you are familiar with the basic rules, you'll know how useful an ability like this will be in order to stay alive.

Reign of Terror was divided into two parts—Reign of Terror: The Protoan and Reign of Terror: The Exsularian. They are scheduled to launch in March and May 2018, respectively.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Paradox: The time travel card game
description:
!!! Disclaimer for existing players: The Paradox rule book has been updated to simplify the winning criteria. Updated rules can be found in the 'Files' section of the BGG page or from the Paradox website (www.gamesbypetesanders.com). You will NOT require any new game pieces. !!!

Paradox is a turn based card game in which players act as the offspring of leading timetravel scientist "Doc". Doc, a genius and slightly extrovert scientist, has spent his career in the pursuit of time travel. But Doc is becoming old, and needs to hand over his legacy before it is, ironically, lost in time. To select who will be his successor, Doc subjects you to the ultimate test, to return to the past in order to change history so that only one of you is born, sentencing your siblings to be the children that time forgot.

Paradox uses cards to plot the progress of game time and describe the events happening in each day. Player markers are used to track the location of players through the various timelines that may arise throughout the game. Players can change the events occurring in a day, create new timelines, or destroy timelines all together.

A selection of time travel devices can be found allowing players to go back to the past, fast forward to the future, or move between timelines all together. Astute players can use combinations of time travel devices and the correct event cards to go for the surprise win.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Travel
mechanics: Modular Board, Open Drafting, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: Wedge
description:
Bluff and Bet your way to victory. Wedge uses the deceptively simple mechanics of bluffing and set creation to regulate this clever game of wedging your card into just the right spot.

The game uses just a deck of cards, a handful of player markers and betting chips to create a linear line from 1-20. Players use cards valued from 1 through 20, dealt at random, to create the line. Placing adjacent to blocks can score you big points but that windfall can also be seen by opponents. Do you go for the obvious points or try to bluff and take your opponent's wagers.

A game of Wedge takes only 20 or so minutes and it is a great ice-breaker to get things kicked off or a nice closer to wind things up.

—description from the publisher

name: Hyperleague Racing
description:
Hyperleague Racing is a table-top game inspired by a love of racing style video games like Mario Kart and Crash Team Racing amongst others.

Players become the pilots in highly customisable intergalactic racing leagues where they fly between race markers while swinging round moons, asteroids, black holes and other space themed terrain while performing a range of tricks and manoeuvres to get ahead or better still, crash their rivals in to space junk!

In the standard game, players either play as individual racers of their own design or use one of the pre-generated All-Star racers in ‘all against all’ 2-4 player action. Options exist to also play as a pair of racers racing against other pairs, demolition derby and a fun version affectionately called Puzzle Racer Turbo.

In Championship Mode however, the player takes the role of a fresh faced racer from one of the factions and as the campaign progresses, the pilot gains Championship Points to spend on upgrading their pilot, ship or garage.

Each turn, players activate their racer and make a simple race action followed by up to 3 manoeuvres and then a trick. A typical player turn takes minutes and every action is a balance of risk vs. reward. This creates a straight forward but fast paced balanced game that suits gamers that like a game that can be played quickly as a fun 30 minute blast or by players that want a more tactical game.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Phase Order

name: React!: The Organic Chemistry Board Game
description: REACT! players are chemists who compete to transform molecules. Each player is a chemist running their own laboratory. The goal of each chemist is to draw and match the correct substrate and reagent cards to discover real organic chemistry reactions and synthesize their own target compounds. The first chemist to discover the correct reactions and draw the completed structure of their target molecule wins!

name: Test of Honour: The Samurai Miniatures Game â SÅhei: Warrior Monks of Mount Hiei
description:
Hozoin In'ei, the abbot of the temple of Mount Hiei, leads his group of monks in a bitter struggle for the future of this sacred land. Armed with bows, Naginatas and iron discipline, the monks are ready to pay the highest price for victory.

Contains:

7x Warrior Monks
18x Gaming Cards
2x Special Movement Bases
Spring Campaign booklet (rules and scenarios)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Lunar 5000
description:
Lunar 5000 a future based evolution of the Indy 500 races. Players start by constructing a race ship consisting of one engine and a variety of parts. Generally the engines give a big boost to speed and the parts have abilities that do a variety of other things like manipulating dice, hindering other pilots, and much more. With over 26 Engines and 60 parts there are lots of combinations to try out.

The second part of the game is the race itself. Once the pilots have completed building they will take off.
