categories: Animals, Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Humor, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Role Playing, Storytelling, Voting

name: Absolutism
description:
Absolutism is a party card game that presents players with unfathomable scenarios of daily life in a totalitarian society to which they have to offer solutions. But as no sane solutions can save you in a real dictatorship, in Absolutism.

The game offers a funny satirical take on dictatorship from a team of three who spent their childhood and adolescence in… communism.

We strongly believe that humor is healing. Some people who lived in Dictatorships still have a good amount of healing left to do. And some other people who just now make contact with some sort of pre-dictatorship reality will definitely need this humorous approach to survive and overcome it. We hope to provide some of that humor to them with the ABSOLUTISM game.

With a unique blend of descriptive language and political themes, Absolutism gives a deep understanding of a totalitarian way-of-life while having crazy fun.

—description from the publisher

name: Can You Handle It? Life With Kids
description:
Can You Handle It? Life with Kids is a stress management game. The higher your stress, the higher your score. The winner is the parent with the lowest stress points at the end of the game. Event cards present stressful situations that you must either overcome or accept. You can also play Event cards against other parents. Don't go out there all alone - use cards from your hand to help you lower your stress points. Equip Items to use throughout the game to help block stress from Events. Or you can use De-Stressors to lower your overall stress score. Once the deck has been played through, the Parent with the lowest stress score wins. But really, does any Parent ever truly win?

—description from the publisher

name: Brink: aim for the edge but don't go over!
description:
Brink is a dexterity game for the whole family. It is easy to learn but hard to master.

You throw the plastic cards over the table, aiming to stop the cards on the edge for the highest score. Just a little bit too far and you don't score any points.

name: ErotiXXX
description:
ErotiXXX is an adult game for couples that will guide you through a wide-ranging series of erotic challanges. Your endurance will be tested. Sometimes blindfolded you won’t always see what’s going on but you will definitely feel it.

The rules are simple. To play, place your tokens on the Start square, and take turns rolling the die. Each die roll is how many spaces on the board you move – then you do what the board or cards direct. [Sometimes for 2 minutes!] The first player to reach the final square having fully respected the game rules wins! The winner chooses where and how to have their final pleasure. If you ‘lose it’ during the game, you lose the game. But you will never have more fun delaying the outcome of a game.

Make it a hot night to remember for you both with this game.

Game contents include: 1 game board - 1 blindfold - 2 player tokens - 1 die - 3 decks of cards – 1 instruction manual.

name: Jet Ace
description: Jet Ace is a simulation of tactical jet combat from 1944 to the near future. Over 140 different types of fighters, attack aircraft and bombers are available to be flown on limitless missions. The basic game is easy to learn and can be played in less than one hour. From there, you progress to the advanced game, with different types of missiles, bombing missions, electronic countermeasures, anti-aircraft guns, SAMs, helicopters, ships and much more.m

name: #BadPlots
description:
A Party/Card/Trivia game that challenges players to identify a movie based on a terrible (but accurate) plot synopsis.

Players take turns selecting a movie from their hand and reading the synopsis aloud. The other players then attempt to guess the movie (with the active player giving up to three hints listed on the card). If someone correctly identifies the movie, then the active player discards it and draws a replacement movie from the deck. If the players are stumped, the movie is discarded without being replaced. Play continues until someone runs out of cards and wins.

The rules also suggest other play variations, but the core mechanics are similar. Also included are suggestions for different house rules including a drinking game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: World Of Mythology: King Of The Hill
description:
World Of Mythology: King of the Hill is an original tabletop easy playing and venturous strategy and also the successor of the card game World Of Mythology created by Jumperound creative lab. Playing for one of the ancient heroes with unique abilities - Heracles, Ramesses, Fenrir, Baba Yaga and Karna, - players have to finish quests of 36 Gods to get their powerful artifacts, sweep away 6 kinds of mythical creatures, build temples to praise their deeds, gather treasures and treacherous secrets in order to summon own Legendary Boss or fight together against the main enemy - dreadful Cthulhu.

Jumperound's 2017 was mostly dedicated to their new hit game development. Absolutely fresh mechanics, 85 characters, 17 models at the moment, 36 artifacts and Secrets, big illustrated map and several AR mini games will make World of Mythology: King of the Hill the real big thing on Kickstarter in summer 2018.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, King of the Hill, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Bio Maniac
description:
Bio Maniac is an educational card game about curing and preventing diseases. It consists of cards for diseases and cures, plus event cards. In a turn, a player flips open five cards from the deck, cures diseases with the appropriate cards (if these are available) and hands out the remaining cards to other players who can use them in subsequent turns.
At the end of the game, players gain points for cured diseases, with more points being dealt out if a player has collected more than one disease card of the same type. Uncured diseases score negative points. The player with most points wins the game.

name: Super Training Football
description:
Super Training Football is a simple card game for two players that simulates a football match. The game consists of a stack of cards, which each player holding five cards at the beginning of each turn.
To attempt to score a goal, a player has to collect and then play the required number of pass cards. Then they place an attempt card face down and the defender can place a save card (if they have any). The attempt card shows a quadrant of the goal, while the save cards covers most quadrants except a few - if the attempt was made at an unprotected quadrant, it's a goal.

Playing through the stack of cards represents one half of the game; after two halves are played, whoever scored most goals is the winner.

name: TAG! The Card Game
description:
TAG! The Card Game is a frantically fast paced card game of real-life tag. Where the goal is NOT TO BE "IT!".

Immediately get rid of the "IT!" card before the "TIME" card shows up... or you lose!

TAG! The Card Game is a non-linear card game that resembles "UNO" and Hot Potato. Speed is essential!To win you better play fast or out smart your opponents!

How to play:

The game starts with all players picking up (4) cards and picking a single player to be "IT!"
The player who is "IT!" starts by using a card from their hand and placing it onto the discard pile passing the "IT!" card to another player, making them the new "IT!"
Keep passing the "IT!" card until the "TIME" card shows up. Immediately place the "TIME" card down, whoever is "IT" at that moment loses!


"Real-Life TAG is dangerous, Play TAG! the CARD GAME instead!!!"

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Variable Phase Order

name: Witches' Sabbath
description:
A token take on tactical combat, Witches’ Sabbath is a 2 Player card-and-token skirmish game in which Players form a coven of three witches and one familiar to go head-to-head in the skirmish swamp- hurling brooms, spells, and unique abilities.

Master unique ability and cover systems based on the five major environmental elements of the swamp.

A roster of 15 witches and 10 Familiars to mix and match, along with a light play time, make for great replayability!

Features:

Easy-to-learn, hard-to-master system of location-based cover and abilities through the use of tokens
Ingredient collection and spellcrafting
Roster of 15 witches with their own unique appearance and abilities
Compact, easy to set up design makes the game great on the go!


Mechanics: Action Point Allowance System, Take That, Hand Management, Pattern Building, Modular Board

—description from the designer

name: Krak Skull
description:
Krak Skull is a nice game of words on the fact that the final goal of the game is To defeat the Kraken, and the characters you go to impersonate are Skeletons.
The game is a competitive with a small cooperative, pirate-themed component. We'll impersonate the most famous Pirates of all time in the form of skulls (time is Passed for them too), that at the helm of their own boats will compete for Reach the much-coveted treasure, facing the other players in bloody duels Marine and defeat fearsome and epic bosses. The goal is to accumulate victory points on the way that will lead players to Having to defeat the Kraken to be able to land in the Treasure Island.

Mechanical:The shift begins with the collection of resources (doubloons) and then 3 actions are granted to the player, including: Making a move, sticking with A broadside (up close), sticking with a cannon (remote), buy a Upgrade to the ship or repair the hull if you have been damaged. There's the Option to repeat the same action 2 times. A special die will influence The fate of certain types of attacks. If you suffer an attack, you can choose Cash out all the damage to counterattack at full power, or try to take it out Radius by halving the damage without being able to counterattack. Who sinks a player It steals the accumulated loot, so the risk assessment is a part of Important game. The parameters are all upgradeable by paying in doubloons, and will be reported in the The player's dashboard that each player will have available. Some portions of the sea are deeper than others, faced certain routes Could lead to major rewards. The game ends As soon as a player reaches the island, they start counting the points.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Queue, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game

name: The Drawing Game: The Hilarious Sketching Race
description:
The Drawing Game is a new, fast-paced group boardgame. Your goal is to frantically draw your way to the bottom the Wordsmith’s wordlist faster than the other team to win each round, best of multiple rounds wins the game.

Split into two teams (more possible, but two is best) and one ‘Wordsmith’ and position each team in a different room in the house (living room and kitchen, say). The teams can be almost any size, so long as you can see the piece of paper being drawn on. The Wordsmith sits at an equal distance to the two teams (on the stairs, for example) with the Wordlist. At the beginning of the game, one member of each team comes to the Wordsmith, and 3, 2, 1... the Wordsmith whispers the first word on the list to the two team members.

The two team members sprint back to their teams’ as fast as they can, word in mind, pencil in hand, they start manically drawing the word on a piece of paper and whoever is first to guess the word correctly then, themselves, sprints to the Wordsmith to whisper the just-guessed word to them, hear the next word on the list, and sprint back themselves.

It is a speed drawing battle, and sprinting battle between the two teams to see which can get through the Wordsmith’s list of 20 words fastest. When one team wins, the Wordsmith shouts the winning team name. The game then continues for as many rounds as you wish to play - warning, it’s highly addictive so be careful.

The Wordsmith’s job is far from mundane and simple word whispering. They are a key element in the overall absurdity of the game. They are the only player that knows (kind of) what’s going on at any one time. The teams will be so engrossed in what they’re drawing and guessing at speed that it is the job of the Wordsmith to keep the teams in the know on who is in the lead, by how many, how many more words there are to the end of the round. They are also the main judge of cheating, they must keep a keen ear on proceedings for any whispering of words to teammates. If two teams come running out of their respective rooms at the same time, it is the Wordsmith who decides who really was in front. Some useful phrases to have in the back of your mind, imagine we have Team Fantastics and Team Golden Oldies:

“Fantastics and the Golden Oldies are neck and neck!”
“Oooh, I’m sorry to say Golden Oldies you’re three behind the Fantastics at this moment.”
“Golden Oldies have made a comeback and have just overtaken Fantastics!”
“Oh dear, what’s going on with Fantastics, you’ve been stuck on this one for a while now.”
“And there’s only three to go to the end of the game, come on Team Fantastic, you can claw this back!”
“Last word now, seconds to go in this round.”

—description from the designer

name: Defenders of Dragonfell
description:
Defenders of Dragonfell is a cooperative “Tower Defence” style eurogame, where a team of 1-6 unique heroes (aged 10+) join the fight to protect their village against waves of monsters of ever increasing difficulty.

Attacking is dice based and a few bad rolls can quickly turn the tide of battle. To triumph the team must balance: using actions to attack the hoards (which earns them gold), with investing in building defensive towers (which takes several actions, but provides additional attacks each round).

Defenders of Dragonfell is an Action Point based game. Heroes can either, move, shoot or build to make their way across the map and start killing off the attacking wave of monsters. Killing monsters earns the hero gold, which they use to buy one of the unique tower types. Each tower works differently and by placing them strategically, powerful combinations can be created to save Dragonfell.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Football Dice: World Edition
description:
Football Dice is an exciting dice game based around national football teams. There are 16 teams to collect.

In each packet is one team, and each team has 3 dice; a defence die, a midfield die and an attack die. All dice are different colours relating to the teams colours, and include flag faces and cultural references. You can play with one set of dice by sharing them but it is better with a friend with another team.

Once you have decided who goes first and how long you are going to play for, we suggest 2 minutes, 1 player starts by rolling their defence die. Then you just follow the commands on the dice, and just like in real football, see who can score the most goals! If you roll a "flag face" you simply roll again.

—description from the publisher

name: TimeWinder
description:
A card game of time and space, where quantum mechanics decides the cards you are dealt, but you decide the outcome. You now have the chance to craft powerful machines, use wondrous items and collect valuable treasures and artifacts.

The game can be enjoyed by both newcomers and veterans, and although it can be easy to learn, it can be tricky to master. Amassing the most points by the end of the game determines the winner. Timing and the choices you make can be the difference between a winning and losing strategy. Every turn is a chance to snatch victory from your opponents.

The game is themed in a steampunk setting with elements of futuristic to implausible designs. A quick-paced tactical card game for 2-6 players.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Band Room Blitz
description:
Band Room Blitz is a party game designed for the quick witted wordsmith or the walking encyclopedia of bands at your table. Players create a unique band name based off of two categories played by the Band Leader (Color, Animal, Death, Noun, and more). Players can add extra criteria instantly with Modify cards. These offer ways to force a specific genre or name format, tweak the categories in play, and more options for throwing off your opponents.

Players can win bonus points for declaring real bands that fit the cards in play, and harder still they can add a time limit to each round. Whether you're a pop culture whiz kid or a creative comedian, Band Room Blitz is a blast for any casual game night.

name: Orcs Vs Vikings
description:
Orcs Vs. Vikings is a 2-4 player worker placement game where players will have to work together to gather the resources they need to build defenses around their village. The Orcs are attacking from the mountains and your tiny Viking Village doesn't have the amount of villagers needed to fight them off. Help is on the way but it will still be days until help arrives! You must fight off the invading Orcs while trying to build your defenses. Work together to strategically hold them off until help arrives!

Players will take turns in order by sending out the villagers they control to several of the locations on the board. Such locations as the Blacksmith, Odin's Temple, The Market or even the outskirts of town (like the Forest, Mines or the Quarry). You will have to collect the resources needed to build defenses. Once the players have placed their Villagers on the board, Orcs will arrive! Now in the same turn order, players will activate their Villagers to either collect those resources, trigger an action, contribute to a defense, or fight off an Orc! If 10 villagers die, you lose. If your village gets overrun, you lose. If you get all 4 of your defenses built, YOU WIN!

-description from designer

name: Un Gioco d'Ombre
description:
Un Gioco d’Ombre ("A Game of Shadows") is a 2-4 players card game in which you will take the part of one of the 4 archetypes of pure evil (the Devil, the Orc, the Ghost and the Boogey Man) in an attempt to conquer young and innocent souls before your opponents do. To achieve this you will have at your disposal every evil and corrupt tool ever made like rock music, fantasy novels or card games (like this one). Terrible, isn’t?

The goal of the game is to be the first player to collect 20 young, innocent souls, or points. In each turn the player can do three actions chosen among drawing cards from the deck or playing the ones in their hand, in any order. A little twist is that players are allowed to anticipate one or more of their actions in another player's turn, in order to prevent them from scoring points.

name: Rat-Snake
description:
Rat-Snake is a gambling game that requires two six-sided dice to play. Players will roll dice on a mat, wagering their ante in a silo for a payout. The game was created in the fictional universe of Lankhmar, played by characters in the game. It was made real and published by Goodman Games and sold through their website.

The game comes in a tube and includes six dice (although only a pair of dice are used per thrower.) Players take turns as the "Thrower" rolling dice. They pay a six coin ante, and roll the dice. If the dice show rats they lose coins out of their silo. If the dice show snakes they gain coins in their silo. After each roll players can decide if they want to keep playing or stop. If players lose all their coins they are out of play.

Additionally, players may make side bets on the active roller.

name: Memory Adventures
description:
Memory Adventures is a problem-solving memory game with a story line that's broken into four mini-levels of increasing difficulty that are color indicated (green, yellow, orange, red). As you answer questions, you are lead closer to victory.

To play, use your memory skills to focus on a card's picture for thirty seconds. When finished, flip over the card and answer exactly one of the questions on the card. Flip back over the card to check whether you were correct, advancing to the next card associated with your answer, whether right or wrong. Answer correctly, and you move closer to victory. Answer incorrectly, though, and you'll have to work a little harder to find your way...

name: Jackwagon
description:
Jackwagon A PARTY GAME FOR THE DERANGED is a tabletop party game. Players take turns drawing cards from a card deck and perform challenges to earn Badonka Dollars (play money. But BEWARE of the Jacked Up cards! With a Jacked Up card, the player then draws a Jackwagon card and ANYTHING goes with a Jackwagon challenge! If a player draws a challenge card they are unwilling to perform, the player can make a Jack-Offer and offer the card to the other players by paying them or getting paid by them to perform the challenge. However, be strategic because the object of the game is to be the player with the most Badonka Dollars after 60 minutes.

Are you a fearless competitor? Are you willing to be more shameless than your friends? Prove it and win the title of Jackwagon!

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Negotiation, Party Game

name: Ãber den Atlantik
description:
This is a race between airships, aeroplanes and ships from Berlin to New York and vice versa. The red party starts in New York, the blue in Berlin. Movement is controlled by drawing small tiles. The tiles show a blue or red airship, plane or ship. The player owning the pictured vessel places the tile in front of his vessel, covering 2 spaces and moves the vessel to the front of the tile, thereby determining a travel route over the Atlantic Ocean. There are also special tiles, labeld "Nebel" (fog), "Gewitter" (thunderstorm) and "Sturm" (storm) wich are used to block the opponents movement.

The first pary or player to reach his destination with all his vessels wins the game.

name: CoreBall: The Zero Gravity Sport
description:
CoreBall: The Zero Gravity Sport is a tactical sports game in space that pitches 2-4 players in brutal matches to control one or more balls while avoiding incoming asteroids and space debris.

The aim of the game is to score more points than your opponents during the course of four rounds by maintaining control of the ball and keeping your team hale and on the board. To do so, players must carefully pick a team of flyers, or highly skilled space suit-clad athletes, to steal the ball, grapple their opponents, push them out of the field or against the hazardous terrain and obstacles of a CoreBall circuit, or simply hack their opponent's space suits so they can't move.

Each flyer has unique skills and through careful planning and positioning, players can trigger combinations to outsmart their opponents and survive the ever-changing board.

name: Clash of Fate
description:
Clash of Fate is combat-based strategy card game where each player selects a team of 3 characters to battle against the opposing characters.

Clash of Fate characters are mostly traditional fantasy including a druid who shapeshifts into a werewolf, a lich, and a priestess. While the characters have their own backstory, they have been summoned to fight for a contest between two wizards.

The goal of the game is to defeat all of your opponent's characters. The game comes with pre-constructed decks for each character, but there are bonus cards that can be used to try new strategies.

—description from the publisher

name: Awkward Arms & Armor
description:
An (im)mature party game that blends judging the funniest submission with lightweight dungeon crawling.

Each round, one player is the combatant and faces off against a monster. Everyone else crafts weapons using a combination a prefix, a weapon, and a suffix card, placing them face down. The combatant reads the items aloud, selects one that he or she finds the most humorous, and selects one to use for battle. Battle outcomes are determined by rolling a number of custom targeting dice.

Points are earned for defeating monsters as the combatant, creating weapons that are used to defeat monsters, and by creating the most humorous weapons in any given round. Points can be lost by losing to monsters and by defeating adorable creatures worth negative points.

The first player to a pre-determined number of points wins!

name: Temple of the Dice Gods
description:
Temple of the Dice Gods is a co-operative combat exploration game for 2-4 players. It features 12 desperate, downtrodden, and ambitious heroes who seek revenge against the polyhedral lords of chance. It is said that if you kill one of the Dice Gods, your luck will never be the same.

In this game you will be playing as a group of heroes exploring the 3 ascending floors of the Temple of the Dice Gods. You must defeat the reigning deity on the third floor to be victorious!

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy, Medieval, Mythology
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Push Your Luck

name: BATTLE: Superheroes vs. Villains
description:
Battle is a card game between Superheroes and Villains. The Superheroes are trying to save the world, while the Villains are trying to achieve world domination. The game is played in 2 phases. The first phase provides an opportunity for each player to build a strong fighting hand (numbered cards). The second phase is using the fighting hand to win the battle! Once players are able to get rid of their fight cards, they can play their identity card on their next turn. If a Superhero saves the world, all the Superheroes win. If a Villain achieves world domination, all the Villains win.

Players try to improve their hand in the first phase by drawing and discarding cards. Once the BATTLE card is randomly flipped up from the middle deck, the battle begins (second phase). The player that flipped the BATTLE card will lay down a numbered card. The next player must match or beat the number laid. There are action cards mixed in to keep things interesting!
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Team-Based Game

name: Itzamazti
description:
The board game Itzamazti, created by Rafael Chávez Rivas, is an abstract game that originates from Mexican cultures, like most of my games, but this time it is based on the god Quetzalcoatl, or feathered serpent god, in its version of two-headed serpent, one of which swallows the sun at nightfall, to take it to the heavens near the moon, and vomit it at dawn by the other head of this serpent, doing with this the cycle of day and night, is a game with simple rules, but very fun.

Rules:
Each player chooses 3 discs of one of 4 colors, and starts in one of the two suns represented at the ends of the board in the languages ââof the snakes, interspersing these discs with those of another player, from there you must take your chips until the other sun, passing through the moon and avoiding being trapped by another player, because of being caught, you will return so many spaces the opposing player has advanced in his dice throw to catch you, delaying the advance of you, however, once you have managed to take one of your chips to the opposite sun, and with another of your chips you have caught another player, you can add the result in your dice to the points you have obtained according to the position of your chip in the goal sun column, making his opponents go back even more, the first player to get all his chips in the opposite sun wins the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Tehonbiki
description:
Tehonbiki (ææ¬å¼ã) is a traditional Japanese gambling game, based upon trying to select the same card (1 of 6) as the dealer.

It is based on several sets of tiles:
"Mamefuda" ( è±æ­) , "å¤§å°è»" , 48c. ( 6 x 8) + blank card held by the bank.
"Harifuda" (å¼µæ­) , "å¤§å°è»" , 42c. ( 7 x 6) held by the player
And memoku, or ç®æ¨ or rarely "Mefuda" which indicates the preference of the bank.

name: Match and Turn
description:
There are 30 double sized large playing cards with four designs and four colours. One side of each card has a different design and colour to the design and colour on the other side.

5 cards are dealt in front of each player, without disclosing what is on the reverse side of the card. The rest of the cards form a draw deck. The top card from the draw deck is turned over and placed at the side of the draw deck. The first player must match either the colour or the design shown on this revealed card. The player turns his matching card over and places on top of the revealed card. A player who can not go draws a new card from the draw deck, taking care not reveal what is on its' other side. The next player must do the same, and the winner is the first player to get rid of all their cards.

Whilst mainly luck, there is often a choice of which card to play, and therefore some element of skill. It is a quick and simple game which can be played many times with players of all ages.

The cards, which are bright and colourful, are placed in front of the player so there is no problem for little ones handling the cards, and there is no scope for cheating.

—description from the publisher

name: Game of Puss in Boots
description:
Puss in Boots is a roll-and-move game where the one player as Puss whose goal is to have his master marry the princess, and the other player as the King tries to thwart Puss in his attempt.

From McLoughlin Brothers' 1897 catalogue:

"This game is to decide whether Puss manages to marry his Master to the Princess or the King succeeds in outwitting the gifted but tricky feline. The play is of the simplest, being moves over a course by spins of the indicator, with suitable setbacks. The board and label are in full colors and gold"

name: Amerika: Target Amerika â The Bomber Projects
description:
Hitler’s fascination of New York City in flames drove Germany’s leading aircraft engineers to begin development of several options for bombers that could strike targets on American soil from European air bases. In 1942, the Amerika Bomber Project was born which produced several contenders vying for the chance to make Hitler’s dream come true. In Amerika, not only was the project very successful, but by 1946 heavily funded to aid in the air supremacy war over the Atlantic. The Horten XVIII B-2 (from the base game) became the best all-around platform of the project, and was the mainstay of Nazi bomber supremacy. The Arado E-555 and Messerschmitt Me-264 (from the expansion Bring In The Heavies) were both very competent designs as well, helping to soften defenses and destroy Allied installations.
But several other designs from the project were also produced in limited numbers to round out the air force and provide mission flexibility. When the decision was made to invade North America, every resource available had to be called upon for a chance at success to even be possible. Help turn the tide of war in Germany’s favor using these Amerika Bomber Project aircraft in AMERIKA!

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II

name: Tavernin
description:
Tavernin is a Poker-like game in which players attempt to build the highest valued party and bet against the other players using custom chips. The player with the highest valued hand collects the chips.

Players start with 5 cards and use "uno" like rules to connect the cards into a party. Each card has a banner at its center that asks a requirement to be met before it adds value to your party.

There are 2 different types of value that your party accrues. Levels which are the main tier of value, and Power which are secondary but still important.

EX: The Warrior 4 card asks that you have 2 matching color cards in your party. If you meet the requirement the card grants 4 Power to your party’s total value.

A traditional round goes:


All players Ante or big/small blinds (Preference)
All players dealt 5 cards
Initial round of betting occurs.
Discard phase.
Final round of betting occurs.
Call.


—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck

name: The Rangers: Rise of War
description:
An Adventure Battle Game

Build / Quest / Conquer

Your Squad + An Epic Game = Memories that Last

The Rangers: Rise of War is meant to be played as a 4-6 hour epic strategy game, or however long you all want to keep it going! Sure, we have rules to make the gameplay quicker, but this is supposed to bring friends together and battle for the ultimate victory.

Players control an army that has a specific alley in play. Players can choose to focus on their Heroes or begin to diversify their armies by upgrading buildings unlocking more strategic pieces, such as Archers or Calvary.

You may advance out capturing areas of the board that translates into coin and gives you a spell card or keep your hero in place and quest for epic gear and more.

There are many goals to win the game. If you are able to get both swords of power into your capital, bring 4 breeds to your capital or go for complete annihilation by taking out both of your enemy’s main capitals to win. Micro-games may have other added ways to win in order to condense the game time. Micro-games may also start with buildings already in place.

The game is set in the world of Adrasil. The Rangers has had several films projects as seen on The Fantasy Network, related to it as well as a comic, and a live-action event called "Weekend Warrior”.

—description from the publisher
publishers: Alliance Game Distributors, The Forge Studios (II)

name: Der Krieg beim Tisch
description:
Wargame for two players, printed in Czech Republic in 1940.
Precise wooden components.

name: Pussycat
description:
The cheese smells very well! But the mice can't get to it, since Pussycat sits in ambush!
A funny card game for children from to 8.

name: Thunderpwn: Post Apocalyptic Arena Combat
description:
Thunderpwn: Post-Apocalyptic Arena Combat is a card/board game for 2-6 players who want to brawl to the death using hand-to-hand combat and makeshift weapons! Thunderpwn is tactical, cinematic and packed with kinetic action that you will feel as you play!

It was developed in Little Rock Arkansas by PWN Productions and nurtured by the large community of gamers and friends that live in and around central Arkansas!

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Dice, Fighting, Miniatures, Negotiation, Party Game, Real-time, Science Fiction, Sports
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Destiny Aurora: Renegades â Tactical Cards
description:
Add special abilities to your commander - both on the planet surface and in space. Strategize and overcome your opponents with this new addition to the Destiny Aurora universe.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement
publishers: B&B Games Studio, Destiny Horizons, Inc.

name: Ready Set Battle
description:
The zombies have risen from their graves in this epic 2 player game. Ready Set Battle is easy to learn but takes a zombie lifetime to master.

Play as the humans and try to hold off the zombies to build up your military power and eventually overtake the zombies. Play the thunder down under card to control the pace of the game, and use your dreaded upgrade card to destroy the zombies forever.

Play as the zombies and come out hitting hard and fast. Zombie cards keep coming back each round with larger and larger attacks. Use the zombie dog to give flexibility in the game, and turn your opponent's cards into zombies which really frustrates the opposition.

Win the game by reducing your opponents life to 0. Will the zombies win with their early attacks or will the humans win by building up their military power? Get ready to battle in this exciting game!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Champions of the Internet
description:
Champions of the Internet is a party card game with real pics of the biggest champs to ever grace the internet!

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
People Cards: the most diverse, awesome deck of real people! You never know what type of person you're gonna get- fitness fanatics, body modifiers, drag queens, moms, models... you name it, we've got it!

Question Cards: Our Question Cards are hilarious and cover a wide range of topics- scary stuff, sexy stuff, sweet stuff. Plus, our added hashtags make them even funnier!

HOW TO PLAY
All players draw 5 People Cards. One player acts as the judge for the round and reads aloud a Question Card. The other players put down one People Card that they think best answers the question. It's up to the judge to pick their favorite played People Card. The player whose card was chosen wins the round! Play as many rounds as you desire.

5 GAMES IN ONE BOX
There are actually multiple games you can play! Inside the box, you’ll also learn how to play Slap That Ass, Bed Wed Dead, Identity Crisis and The Final Rose.

-description from designer

name: Frontier: The Card Game â Badlands
description:
Frontier Badlands is the add-on expansion to Frontier The Card Game!

Frontier Badlands features more player interaction, including dueling, stealing player's supplies using the Lasso, trading every turn, rigorous challenges once you've beaten the game, fun variants, and much more!

When you explore the Badlands, you'll encounter Martians, Ghost Bandits, the Thunderbird, and a slew of other opponents! Manage brand new supplies such as Cattle, the Gatling Gun and even the Martian's Vaporizer! Ward off calamities with Horseshoes, take down enemies with the Shotgun, and earn Legendary Notoriety; they don't call this the Badlands fer' nothin'!

-description from designer
publishers: Meet Me At The Table Games

name: Crazy Pirates!
description:
Players compete as pirates to be the first to collect a treasure and bring it back to their home island. Your pirate must land exactly on his island: if you roll too high a number, he must “move around” it until you roll the right number to land exactly on the island.

Players move their pirate token and one of four monster tokens on each turn according to the rolls of two different colored dice. Pieces move from point to point on a grid. There are four “whirlpools” at the sides. A pirate can use these whirlpools to jump to one of the other three sides.

Along the way pirates dice-fight each other and a cast of monsters, resulting in transfer of ownership of the treasure or, in the case of the monsters, loss of life.

Game composed of a cardboard game board, 2 wooden dice, 4 cardboard tokens, 4 wooden monsters, 4 wooden boats with a pirate on each and a wooden treasure.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: The Earth is Ours!
description:
The Earth is OURS!! has players choosing sides and playing with their teammates to achieve the goals set on either side. With a 216 card arsenal at your fingertips you and your teammates will enter a heated strategic battle that will leave you in stitches as you strive towards your goal of global dominance, only to be thwarted at every turn as your opponents counter your actions with "I don't think so!" cards.

"I hate the wait!" - good news, in this game, everyone has the opportunity to play on anyone's turn! Keeping players engaged in the fun throughout the entire game.

"Man, this is a blowout!" - something you won't hear. After hundreds of play tests, there has yet to be "domination" by one team over the other. This keeps players grasping at the reality of winning.

During game play each side strives to achieve a predetermined amount of points and aims to collect those points in each sector; Economical, Environmental, Industrial, Political, and Technological. The team that reaches the goal in each sector first claims the ultimate prize and shouts out.... THE EARTH IS OURS!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Set Collection

name: L.O.L. Surprise: Fashion Factory
description:
The conveyor belt assembly game where players get to build dolls at the L.O.L. Surprise factory! To start the 2-player game, players start the two-sided motorized conveyor belt. Players then use their player tongs to place a L.O.L. Surprise ball onto their side of the conveyor belt.

Players then draw a blueprint character card and race to find the various cards in the pile in front of them that make up their character's paper doll - doll, outfit, and shoes. Players must place the finished paper doll in the L.O.L. Surprise ball and remove the ball with the tongs from the belt before it falls off the end.

The first player to complete three balls wins!

—description from the designer

name: The Underbelly
description:
"The Underbelly is a game of conflict between prisoners and guards, which players use their cunning and skills to escape from the cold shadowy bars of the Alcatraz-like superjail of Underbelly, or to prevent the escape of the villains by keeping them in at all costs." (An excerpt from the teaser video.)

The Underbelly is a Card Game based on the mechanisms of Mafia and Werewolf format, which involves the conflict between prisoners and officers revolving around jailbreak plot.

Three roles of INMATES, GUARDS and SNITCHES are assigned to the players, which INMATES must strive to achieve their victory by collecting four "Tunnel Points" by the means of using action cards.
GUARDS, in the other hand, must prevent the inmate's escape attempt altogether by exposing their action cards and giving them WARNING cards, which may eventually lead to CONFINEMENT which means the confined INMATE can no longer play the game.

SNITCH in the other hand, must assist the GUARDS by feeding them support among the INMATES.

During the beginning of game, the GUARD players reveal their role cards alone, while both SNITCH and INMATE players are not revealed.
GUARDS also have the ability to appoint TRUSTY among the INMATES who they consider as a potential SNITCH.
INMATE appointed as TRUSTY is given significant privileges, which makes the trusty status both as an advantage that a rightful SNITCH can exploit or for INMATES to pretend as a SNITCH and use it against the GUARDS.

The inmate-only character cards have different abilities, however they are kept hidden until the ability itself is activated or the inmate player is CONFINED.
The aforementioned action cards are the represent any actions or activities that are performed by both INMATES and the GUARDS which can assist achieving their respective adjectives.
Event cards are the cards which have its effect every individual turn, which represents the varied security status of the prison and it will naturally aid the guard players to take control of the situation.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Mafia, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Game of Kingdoms
description:
Game of Kingdoms is a game where there is no winner, only a loser! A card game of attacking and defending, involving some luck but mostly strategy. The object of the game is to get rid of your cards before your enemies. You start with six cards and take turns attacking and defending. Higher card beats lower card and trumps beat them all- unless it's a higher trump... Will you be lucky and draw all the trumps or will you have to be strategic and make the best of every hand!? You'll be up, you'll be down - the tide may turn many times. Attack wisely and you'll bury your opponent, defend poorly and you'll get stuck with both hands full of cards.

—description from the designer

name: ä¸å³ãªãã¹ (Shitimi Narabe)
description:
User summary
ä¸å³ãªãã¹ (Shitimi Narabe) is a Japanese game of speed and recognition. (Shichimi is standard spelling rather than Shitimi).

Shitimi Togarashi is a Japanese spice mixture, which contains red chili pepper and six other ingredients which vary depending on producers.

In the game of Shitimi Narabe, you form a set of seven spices including chili pepper faster than anyone else.

You have an identical deck of 35 cards in which 13 types of ingredient are included. Spread four cards in front of you. If you think you need one of these cards to make a correct shichimi, place the card to your blend pile, then refill the space in front of you. The correct shichimi is: any number of chili pepper cards and six cards of different types, but never include habanero or the whole shitimi is spoiled.

Players race to make their shitimi, and the first player who has made a correct shitimi is the winner.

Publisher's summary

name: Going Further: Multiplayer edition
description:
Hurray, your company just got a lucrative job: build a road between two cities.
But the computer managing the production line just went bananas and random building material comes out of the factory.

You already heard this story? Yes, but now it is multiplayer!

Going Further is a fast tile laying game for 1 to 4 players.

Each player build his own road by joining tiles picked from a common set called "Tile Factory".
The tiles in the Tile Factory are visible to all players.
Beware that not all the tiles in the Tile Factory are immediately available to be played. Some of them can be unlocked only after other tiles have been selected and connected to a road. So, be fast to get to that valuable tile faster than your opponents!

The game ends when no more playable tiles are available.

Each player shall choose the best strategy to unlock new tiles while scoring as many points as possible and, at the same time, preventing the opponents to do the same..
In fact, each tile grants a different number of points; the total score consists of the sum of each individual tile points.
Additional points can be added or removed from the total, depending on the achieved road final configuration.

In particular, watch out for road loops and famous landmarks!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Take That, Tile Placement

name: Anti-Monopoly Luxus-Edition
description: German special edition with all 3 former Anti-Monopoly games. Limited to 10,000 copies, with numbered document.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Bugman Battle
description:
Bugman Battle is The World's First Party Game With BUGS. With simple rules and edgy settings, Bugman Battle enables strong interaction between players. Let’s battle and fill your parties with a fun experience.

The goal of the game is simple: Challenge your opponents and make them eat all of their own bugs!

You will get a funny game, yummy snacks and creative package at one time. Our colorful package is designed referencing the shape of the beetle. Hope you like it!

—description from the designer

name: Spicify
description:
Take your friends to a journey discovering each other as you never imagined...

Two teams of both boys and girls face embarrassing and exciting challenges to achieve victory. Two decks for different levels of difficulty and naughtiness: one to break the ice and another to get into the heat of the action.

The game has two different set of rules
Each card presents a challenge to the player to be performed alone or with a partner. Accepting a challenge awards the player's team with points, whereas refusing it will decrease the team score.

The cards decide how the two partners should be dressed (or undressed!) and if the partner is to be picked randomly or at player's choice.

The team with the highest score, wins the match!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Coop da Chickens: The Eggspansion
description:
An expansion to the game Coop da Chickens.

A 20 card deck. 10 cards to add into the standard deck and a 10 card egg deck used when hatching eggs.

-description from designer

name: Scrum: The Card Game
description:
Welcome to The world of modern software design! One to four players take on the role of competing Chief Scrum Masters in a race to help their SCRUM teams be the first to build and deploy their hottest new app idea. SCRUM teams Red Sparrows, Yellow Cranes, Green Owls, and Blue Crows each receive $500K of funding at game start and are able to use their funds to manipulate cards in hand or another player’s tableau. The player that most effectively manages their card draws, resources, and sprint planning actions will come out on top and lead their SCRUM team to tech geek glory!

Scrum: The Card Game is a hand and resource management game with a touch of “take that” which plays in 15-30 minutes. Players compete to get their 6 App Lifecycle cards down on their tableau first while avoiding software bugs and managing their resources effectively. Money can be spent to manipulate your hand during the “Sprint Planning” phase and “Blockers!” cards can be played instantly to ruin another player’s plan. Players will need careful planning, tactics, and a bit of luck to lead your SCRUM teams to App Store fame and fortune!
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: EZCAPE
description:
EZCAPE is a turn based strategy and cooperative card game about Teamwork, Deception, Survival and...Zombies! It is easy to learn, quick to play and will keep you entertained for hours. Each player is tasked with trying to save as many Survivors as possible while simultaneously fighting to stop from being overrun by Zombies. Played in a Russian Roulette style with a single (4 - 6 players) or double (7 - 12 players) deck of game cards ranging in values 2, 3, 5, 8 and 13. There are three types of cards - Red (Zombies), Blue (Survivors) and White (Zombie Traps).

The goal is to keep the attacking Zombies to below 21, while simultaneously taking risks to save as many survivors as possible and the game ends when half the players are converted into Zombies. It is quite fast paced yet provides ample opportunity for strategic gameplay.

name: Rome, IInc.: From Diocletian to Heraclius
description:
ROME, IInc. is a game of the Late Roman Empire (the period from Diocletian to Heraclius) for one player, or two co-operating players. A sequel to the popular ROME, Inc. you again will be running the Roman Empire like a business, but this time the barbarians are well and truly at the gates. Together the players operate behind the scenes, promoting and removing emperors, governors, and the occasional pope.

When corporate axeman Diocletian terminated his predecessor in the finest traditions of ROME, Inc., no one expected a complete rebranding operation. Realizing that something new was needed to revive the flagging fortunes of a corporate dinosaur he made his friend Maximinus co-CEO in a new east-west operation, ROME, IInc. Players can accept the challenge solo, or share control of the empire with a partner, one in the East, and the other in the West.

Together or alone, you control the mechanics of a failing empire, choosing five distinct “starting points” (286 CE, 363 CE, 425 CE, 497 CE and 565 CE) and run scenarios lasting 10-50 turns, depending on your corporate acumen and endurance. Each turn represents 5-10 years, with 10 turns in each of the five scenarios. If you already own ROME, Inc. you can extend the game into ROME, IInc. for a truly epic 90 turn game charting the rise and fall of history’s greatest empire.

Historical statesmen are not only rated for their abilities as a commander, administrator, and intriguer, but their devotion to the Christian Orthodoxy, and each has a special ability to give him an edge. Every turn sees crises and challenges that the players must deal with, to expand, or sometimes simply to survive.

The map consists of provinces grouped into the four great commands of Gaul, Italy, Illyria, and the Orient, each commanded by a governor. Provinces may be given to foederati barbarian allies to guard the frontier or plagued by heretics. Beyond these is the dreaded Attila the Hun, driving lesser barbarians from their homelands, and pillaging his way from province to province until defeated.

You decide where to allocate resources (capital spending), raise new forces (hiring), undertake prestige projects (public relations), pleasing the church (shareholders), or even setting aside a reserve for a rainy decade or two. You need to blend military acumen with careful administration, as well as intrigue, making the most of what you have each turn, just like any modern-day business. ROME, IInc. will give you a new perception of how war is a cost, business is a benefit, and empire is somewhere in between. It’s up to you to find a balance.

ROME, IInc. and issue #61 of ATO

Map - One full color 22" x 34" PtP mapsheet
Counters - 280 full color 1/2" die-cut pieces
Rules length - 12 pages
Charts and tables - 2 pages
Complexity - Medium
Playing time - From 3 to 4 hours per scenario
How challenging is it solitaire? - Excellent

Design - Philip Jelley
Development - Russ Lockwood

Graphic Design - Mark Mahaffey

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Civil War, Political, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Naked Truth
description:
Naked Truth is a social party game. It is a game of fun, personal, edgy questions about our ethics, experiences, sex, attitudes and desires.

One player selects a question and reads it to the group. Everyone then anonymously puts a Yes or No answer card into the center, and also guesses on their own score sheet how many Yes answers are in the group. The reader then reveals the answer cards, and everyone who guessed correctly gets a point.

The key is that players answer anonymously, so they can be truthful about topics that are usually unspoken or taboo.

First designed in 1993, Naked Truth creates funny, powerful and eye-popping moments when you discover how many pee in the shower, cheated on a lover or kissed someone before they knew their name.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Front 9 Tabletop Golf
description:
Tabletop Golf is a unique golfing experience. It’s golf - only much smaller! Just like the real thing, Tabletop Golf is perfectly suited for solo play, but is even more fun with 2 or more players, and whether you are playing solo against the course, or with friends against each other, the rules remain the same.

Build the hole, select a club, line up your best shot, and "Fore!"

Using its’ one-of-a-kind hole-building mechanism, players have tens of thousands of random holes to play, and are free to design their own.

With six different terrain and a full bag of eleven clubs at your disposal, decisions are both plentiful and meaningful, and with a playing time of less than 5 minutes per person per hole, Tabletop Golf is a compact gaming experience that is as easy and fun to play as it is hard to master.

The goal of the game is to finish the game with the lowest total score over a set number of Holes. A total score no greater than the par rating of the holes played is the target.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Simulation

name: Soup 2 Nuts
description:
Soup 2 Nuts is a party game for adults distilling all the best things about party games into one beautiful and delicious can. Players take turns moving through the courses of a meal completing actions, challenges and questions along the way. After each action your fellow players decide if you have earned the point. Good luck pandering to everyone you little pander panda.
Included are 108 cards with 648 questions, rules, a pad of paper and pencil, and a random surprise.

—description from the publisher

name: Neolithic: Warfare Before the Beginning of Time
description:
Neolithic: Warfare Before the Beginning of Time is a very simple wargame designed for small numbers (six to ten per side) of opposing units using non-metallic and simple weapons and armors. Units are either various types of humans or animals. Each unit typically has some specific single quality (e.g., a Spearman has a very high morale level, etc.). The game is limited to two opposing forces; players alternate taking turns. Checks in the game (morale, hit, etc.) are made using one or two ten-sided dice.

Units represent single combatants. Morale checks are made for each unit under several circumstances; failed checks lead first to degraded morale, then to rout. Movement is given in inches, and units may walk, run, or charge. Rout (flee) movement is given in random inches. During a turn, missile fire precedes mêlée and effects take place immediately (this gives considerable advantage to the player that moves first in the game). Units sustaining damage can be killed or captured.

The game does not use scale and any "small" figures (generally, miniatures or tokens) may be used.

A player loses when all of their units are killed, captured, or routed. Alternately, the players can agree upon victory conditions prior to the game (typically capturing specific units or routing a certain number of units to represent area control).

The game was provided as a downloadable PDF document, and at one time also was hosted online in HTML format.

—User Summary

name: Reveal: All the Colors of Kink
description:
Reveal is a Fun and Sexy Adult Board Game centered around sexuality and Kinks that you can play with friends, whatever type of Relationship you have with them.

Reveal is designed to fit 4 type of players: From the ones that just want to have a good laugh to people in the Lifestyle.

However you want to play Reveal, you choose the Level at the beginning and The Game will adapt to it.

The game is casual like Cards against Humanity or other similar game.

Any player can end the game, by collecting enough points to call an exit but what we noticed is that players in fact play until the cards rotate enough to go back to the same questions again. It's rare to see someone who quits Reveal.

The Game has 8 set of cards:

4 Set of questions with hidden point, strip and Joker cards
4 Set of Dares


The 4 set of questions are Experience, Opinion, Intimacy and Fantasy.
The 4 Set of Dares are in fact 4 level.

You spin a wheel at the center of the board when it is your turn, to determinate which category you will have to pick a question from.
Whatever category you end up during your turn, you can get a question, a joker (counter card), a Strip card (optional) or a Point cards.


Question are cards you need to answer. You will be judge by the other participants on your answer. If half of them judge that your answer is not satisfactory, then you have to put back one of your point card or Joker card in the pile of card.
Point card are collected to buy a dare to impose on anyone - when you have enough of them.
Strip card if used, request you to remove a piece of cloth.
Joker card enable you to counter a question, a dare or a strip card


Choose Your Level Before Playing

There is 4 ways to play Reveal: from casual to progressively sexual charged.

If you play level 1 of the game (to play with any type of friends OK to talk about kinks and sex). You will only be able to access the Dares from level 1 that you can purchase with the points you collect randomly as you pick up a card during your turn.

If you play level 2, only dare level 1 and 2 will be accessible, making the dare a little bit more provocative but still playable with friends.

At level 3, level 1,2 and 3 of the Dares are accessible. Now we are talking about Dares including 2 participants. So everyone need to be comfortable with that.

At least, level 4 includes all the dares. this last Level will make the game sexual and is designed for people in the Lifestyle.

Depending of the Level you choose to play, it will be more or less easy to counter dares and Strip cards. As you can imagine, at level 1, it takes some points to buy a Dare but it's easy to counter it.
At level 4, it is the opposite: Dares are easily purchase with points but hard to counter with Joker.

Strip cards can be completely removed from the game before starting. It doesn't change the fun of the playing Reveal. It just a choice you make to have people losing their Joker faster or not countering Strip cards.

—description from the designers
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move, Voting

name: Pyramid of the Sun: Promo Cards
description:
Promo card pack delivered with Argentinian preorder of the game:
It includes 9 cards, of 2 types:

"What's Up" (6 cards)

When played together with another card with the same symbol, the player must choose between two options:
- Winning points according to the number of connected symbols (as with a common symbol card)
- Pick up 3 cards and then discard 3 cards (no matter how many equal symbols have been connected)

"Bureau de Juegos" (3 cards)

When played, the player must immediately choose one symbol. During this turn, this card counts as having that symbol.

At the beginning of the turn of the next player, this card's symbol loses its value, and stops giving any bonus when connecting with any symbol.

name: Catastrophic
description:
After the discovery of a large underwater sea on a nearby planet, an international team of scientists set out from Earth to begin preparations for colonisation. After the initial terraforming phase, relations broke down irreparably and several sects formed, each laying claim to a region of the planet. Each player in Catastrophic represents one of the rival groups. To win, you must support the development of the most robust community of plants and animals, weaken those of your opponents, and adapt to survive the catastrophes the planet and your opponents continually throw at you.

Catastrophic is designed to help players make connections across large spatial and temporal scales in biology. Plant and Animal Trait cards (e.g. thick waxy cuticles and evaporative heat loss) help Species to withstand environmental Conditions that they must face in an onslaught of Events such as global warming, drought and habitat fragmentation. Interaction cards help players to support their community of Species through reproduction (by using the pollination card, or perhaps cross-breeding), protection (e.g. with the Doomsday Vault), collaboration (e.g. reciprocal altruism and obligate mutualism) or stab other players in the back with cheating, brood parasitism, predator ecesis and more.

—description from the designer

name: Rome, LLP. The Republic of Rome
description:
Before there was Empire, there was a ...Partnership? Yes, it was a world of clients and patrons where the words "The Senate and People of Rome" were not the hollow phrase it became under the Empire. For Senators, engaging in business was taboo, but money-making (even from graft) was not, and citizens of the growing Republic shared in their patrons’ wealth and prestige. But it was at best, a limited liability partnership, an unsuccessful general might merely be banished and replaced by another, but an unsuccessful legion might be....decimated.

ROME, LLP. is a solitaire game of the Roman Republic by Philip Jelley, as it grows from a small city state in 400 BCE to an empire in 27 BCE, when Octavian took the imperial name of Augustus. A prequel to the popular ROME, INC. (ATO 53) and ROME, IInc. (ATO 61) you will again be running a business, but this time the “Republic of Rome” is starting from scratch with minimal resources and highly competitive rivals, Brennus the Gaul, Hannibal Barca, Mithridates the Great, Spartacus, and Queen Cleopatra. The player operates behind the scenes, promoting and removing consuls, censors, governors, and tribunes (and dictators in a real emergency) as Roman legions monopolize the Mediterranean.

The pair of consuls rule Italia, allowing the player to choose which of the co-CEOs are best for the job in hand (unless they start arguing, which could be disastrous), with a censor to maintain public morals, and an obstructive tribune representing the workforce, vetoing senatorial appointments, and changing the game by proposing new laws. Provinces grouped into Italia and the eight proconsular commands of Aegyptus, Africa, Gallia Cisalpina, Gallia Transalpina, Hispania, Macedonia, Pontica, and Syria, each controlled by a Governor, who collects taxes, quells insurgents, and fights wars, but may March on Rome and make himself Dictator For Life.

Patrician and plebeian Statesmen are rated for their military, administration, popularity, and intrigue abilities, and gifted with a special ability. For example, Marcus Antonius has 4 Military, 1 Administration, 5 Popularity, and 4 Intrigue, making him a good general, appallingly corrupt administrator, exceptionally popular, and more than happy to remove his political rivals with a stab in the back, while his Leader special ability encourages him to rebel and might even make him an Aegyptian Leader like Cleopatra. Legions, auxilia, colonies, and fleets are used to fight wars and garrison provinces. Loyal allies protect the frontier as natives are civilized until they are ripe for annexation. Enemy leaders and barbarian wars pillage their way from province to province until defeated, encouraging revolts, and reclaiming territory. Fighting a war may mean a glorious triumph, ghastly disaster, or bloody stalemate, perhaps Fabius had the right idea.

Victory is determined by winning Prestige, earned by prudent administration, annexing provinces, winning wars, and plying the people with bread and circuses. If the barbarians take Rome, the Republic will fall and the game ends in in defeat, but bankruptcy and popular revolution will have the same effect. You alone control the mechanics of a rising republic, choosing four distinct “starting points” (400 BCE, 267 BCE, 149 BCE, and 82 BCE) and running scenarios lasting 10-40 turns (if you get that far), depending on your business acumen and endurance. Each turn represents 5-15 years, with 10 turns in each of the four scenarios. You can extend the game into ROME, INC. and ROME, IInc. for a truly epic game charting the rise and fall of history’s greatest empire.

You decide where to allocate resources (capital spending), raise new forces (hiring), undertake prestige projects (public relations), pleasing the Senate (shareholders) and the People (workforce), or even setting aside a reserve for a rainy decade or two. You need to blend military acumen with careful administration, as well as intrigue, making the most of what you have each turn, just like any modern-day business. ROME, LLP. will give you a new perception of how war is a cost, business is a benefit, and empire is somewhere in between. It’s up to you to find a balance. ROME, LLP. comes with one full color 22" x 34" mapsheet, 280 full color 1/2" die-cut pieces and around 12 pages of rules. Players should average from 2 to 4 hours per scenario

—description from the Against the Odds Pipeline Page
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Le Football Aux Des
description:
Le Football Aux Des is a real simple game, published in French in the Annual Book
of Selection du Reader's Digest "L 'Album des Jeunes".

It's a football game where each player rolls a die and the higher number wins the ball and passes or shoot to goal (depending his position on the field).

—user summary

name: Alternate Dimension
description:
Jump into a time-pod and gather data from other time periods - but beware, if you push the limits of time and space, you may end up in the Alternate Dimension! Alternate Dimension is a sci-fi, time-traveling adventure game featuring press-your-luck dice mechanics. Use time-pods to race your rivals through Jurassic, Medieval, Pirate-themed, and Future time-periods and be the first to return to the Modern Day to reap riches and fame.

You play as rival scientists who have just discovered time-travel and are eager to be the first to race through time to collect valuable time-period data. However, be careful! You may be tempted to strain your data-collecting capacitors by rolling extra Alternate Dimension dice, but if you roll poorly, you will spiral into the Alternate Dimension, lose precious data, and end your turn. Alternate Dimension is all about the data, fame, and glory! At the end of the game, the player with most data wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Tekkaforce
description:
A tabletop game of mecha warfare with RPG rules included. Build your units with building bricks or with everything you have at hand and fight anime-themed battles in PvP or PvE, or play an epic roleplaying campaign full of heroism and drama.

The Kickstarter campaign will end in Dec 11 2018. If funded, it will be sent to backers within Feb 2019, and it will be available for purchase as a pdf on DrivethruRPG within the same period, whether it will be funded or not.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Simulation

name: Dune: The Ixian Jihad
description:
Variant of Dune published in Heroes Vol. 1 #1
Playing pieces (leader discs & troops) published in The General Vol. 32 #1.

The IXIANS (New faction):

AT START— 20 tokens in reserves (off-planet).
Start with 20 spice.

FREE REVIVAL— 2 tokens.

LEADERS AND VALUES
Vizier — 3
Bator — 2
Bronso — 2
Baltern — 1
Levenbrech — 1

ADVANTAGE— You control the production and distribution of illegal machines.
1. Your tokens can move up to two territories per turn.

2. At the start of each spice collection round, you automatically receive ten spice per turn in addition to any spice you would normally receive, CHOAM charity included.

DISADVANTAGE— You must always move first

OPTIONAL ADVANTAGE
1. In the revival round, all Ixian leaders sent to the Bene Tleilaxu tanks are revived for free (the Bene Tleilaxu and the Ixians were notorious “partners in crime”).

ALLIANCE — Allies can take advantage of the Ixian movement and spice bonuses. The Fremen movement rate would be unaltered.

KARAMA POWERS:
1. When played by the Ixian player, it can be used to allow all Ixian tokens to fight at full strength regardless of whether or not they are supplied by spice. If they are spice supplied to start with, the strength of the units increases by one half per unit (four tokens would have the strength of six, five of seven and one half, and so on).

2. When played against the Ixian player, it destroys all spice he owns.

STRATEGY:
The Ixian player must contend with two weaknesses – always having to move first and poor leadership. Always moving first means almost no surprise attacks; enemy players will be able to retreat almost at will, fighting only when they want or have to. Low leadership values will force the Ixian player to assign large numbers of tokens to battles, as well as expend several spice points to support them. While their non-stop spice helps, the Ixians should not engage in non-stop fighting – instead, they are advised to build their strength, prepare themselves for the jihad, then strike!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Novel-based, Political, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Forty Nine Football
description:
Forty Nine Football (49F) is a strategy simulation football game that is designed to play out like a real game. Skill players and teams will perform according to their statistical abilities. Each team has its own Team Chart which includes individual ratings for all skill players. Defense and the Offensive Line are based on team effort, but are affected by injuries.

A big factor in the game is Influence. Teams are rated for run and pass Influence, which is affected throughout the game. A team gaining Influence (and both teams can on a play), increases their chance of affecting the play. There is a quick bout of suspense / anticipation as every play quickly develops to the final result.
The game plays using a combination of Dice, Game Action Cards, and Results Cards (random numbers are on the Results Cards for those who don’t want to use dice). There are no separate charts for looking up results, it's all right there on either the Team Charts or the Cards.

You choose if you want to coach either or both Offenses and or Defenses or let the Solitaire Charts call all the Plays, or you can use the Quick Play Rules where you only have to worry about the Offenses, or you can also let the Solitaire Charts make the decisions. A standard game takes approximately two hours to play, while the quick play option reduces time by forty minutes. The quick play rules use the same charts as the standard game making it easy to move between the two in case of a blowout.

A spreadsheet (Excel or Numbers) is included so you can create and print your own Team Chart. This allows you to recreate past season, or play along with any current season.

As in any real football game, weather plays a role. Quick reference cards are used for wind, rain, snow, or combinations of each.

—description from the publisher

name: MTR Board Game
description:
The MTR Corporation strives to provide a safe, clean and comfortable traveling environment for passengers. In order to maintain a pleasant journey to all, the MTR does rely on the cooperation from all passengers. For this reason, the MTR hopes to educate children through this special board game, encouraging them to develop a good sense of railway safety and courteous passenger behavior for the young generation.ãPlayers have to move their train piece, turn the spinner and travel to different MTR station for mission. They will encounter different challenges, interact with other players and learn the good behavior for taking MTR safely. The fastest player to arrive their destination wins the game!

—description from the publisher's website

name: Petition
description:
A card game set in a fantasy world, in which neighbouring societies battle to steal each other's Magic, Art, Economic, and Military cultures by sacrificing citizens and measuring faith. A resource management and betting game.

In the game, each player is given four cultural pillars to protect. Each player is given 5 cards and 1 prayer bead.

To capture another player's pillar, a player must bid, in prayer beads, for the favour of one of 4 gods. When one player petitions for favour, any other player may challenge the petition with a counter offer of beads. Then both the petitioner and challenger must offers, face down on the table, a tribute of citizens to the god. Depending on the combination of beads and citizens, the god makes a choice.

Once a player has gained the favour of a god, they may attack another player in an attempt to capture a pillar. Battles are fought with citizen and powerup cards. After a battle, the citizen tributes are discarded, and the god returns to the temple.

When any one player has lost all of their original pillars, the game is over. The player with the most captured and/or original pillars.

A solo mod is also provided, with similar mechanics.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Galaxy Runner
description:
Galaxy Runner by ZimGameWerks is a game of interstellar cargo transport and space adventure balancing skill, strategy, and luck for a fun, exciting, and highly adventurous game! Runners fly their ships from system to system to pick up cargo and make deliveries. The Sector map expands as Runners explore, opening new trade routes to farther reaches of the Galaxy. Use earned credits to purchase shares of the Stellar Transport Guild (STG) or upgrade starships in order to travel longer distances, carry more cargo, and win space combat challenges.

The Galaxy Runner who earns enough Guild Credits and accumulates the required Prestige points will be eligible to be voted onto the STG Board of Directors as Chairperson of the Board. The first Runner to be voted Chairperson wins!

—description from the designers
mechanics: Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Goodies & Baddies
description:
A combat game built around fighting Baddies and earning victory points. Become the first to reach the objective before your fellow heroes. But, beware. They'll do everything they can to interfere with your fight.

You and your fellow heroes must take turns to fight a Baddie. Using dice rolls for damage you and the baddie alternate rolls until either of you are defeated. Use your Goodie Cards in your hand to help you along. Your fellow heroes will be using their Goodie Cards to slow you down, intercept your fights, and steal your loot. The first to kill the most Baddies wins!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fighting, Humor, Number
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Sound Out: A Game For All Talks Of Life
description:
Sound Out is the first tabletop game of sound spelling! Each card represents a sound made by the mouth. Instead of combining letters to spell words players combine sounds to pronounce them!

Sound Out is compact with 5 gameplay options.

—description from the publisher

name: Dictators vs. Unicorns
description:
The world’s most vicious dictators raise from their graves to decide who is the ultimate bad ass. Hitler, Stalin, Mussolini, Saddam and Kim, joined by Putin, Trump, THE HONEY BADGER and others face one another in a final showdown. However, Mother Nature realizes that such a huge war will be the end of our planet, so she sends to the rescue THE RAINBOW VOMITING UNICORNS. According to an old prophesy, if a rainbow touches you, your gender changes. Thus, the evil dictators turn into nice old ladies, who instead of waging war, gift each other worm knit socks and go pony riding together.

Dictators vs. Unicorns is a fighting card game in which you take control of up to 3 character cards, that have an evil dictator on one side, and a nice old lady on the other. Your goal is to destroy your opponents’ characters before they destroy yours.

To deal damage to your opponents’ characters, you throw different action cards at them. There are 2 types of action cards – evil cards, that can be played only by the dictators and good cards, that can be played only by the old ladies. They all deal different amounts of damage:
Evil cards deal normal damage to dictators and severe damage to the helpless old ladies.
Good cards deal high damage to the dictators, because they hurt their ego and heal the other old ladies, instead of hurting them.

All dictators and old ladies have unique special skills they can use, by sacrificing health points. You can use the unicorn cards to turn your or your opponents’ dictators into old ladies or vice versa. You do that in order to use a specific skill, play a good or an evil action card, or deal a specific damage to a specific character.
During your turn, you can do any of the following actions:
