description: A simple, spinner game that shows the results of plays.

name: Art Major
description:
Art Major is a competitive card game based around matching the paint cards in your hand with the required paint cards for your next masterpiece.

Acquiring paint is a slow process, trickling in at a rate of one paint a turn. You need to either trade for the paint you need … or sell one of your masterpieces. Each painting can be sold for paint, rather than kept for victory points.

Additionally, the more paintings you can get in a gallery, the more prestige you receive. The first player to collect ten points is recognized as the master painter.

Art Major has a nice blend of strategy, bluffing, and trading. Players are encouraged to trade anything they want, and with only two simple moves, the game can really begin moving at a quick pace.

One interesting piece of Art Major is that paint only comes in primary colors (Red, Blue, Yellow), but most paintings require secondary colors (Orange, Green, Purple) to be complete. This means players must “mix” paints, and use extra cards to paint their masterpiece.

—description from the publisher

name: Rumble Kings
description:
Rumble Kings is a box of five minute fights that delivers a big punch. The game has a unique dice driven combat system and simple customization features offered through card drafting. During matches players compete by rolling dice, building attack sequences, and unleashing tactical combinations of punches, kicks and critical blows against their opponents. Each fighter has their very own signature ability and a limited amount of resources available during each match. Learning to maximize your dice rolls and understanding when to utilize your special abilities and Rumble cards is integral to victory. Throw too much, too quickly and your fighter may end up exhausted fighting an uphill battle!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Cycle of Prophecy
description:
It is a dark time for the inhabitants of the fantastic world of Bizmia. A period of desolation.

Bizmuth sites that had been used for thousands of years as a source of life and power, just went dark all at once. Their glow has now faded and their protective magic is no more.

Possessed creatures are terrifying everyone that dared to stay behind. Only those with proper equipment could defend themselves.

Catastrophic distortions in energy are also occurring everywhere without explanation. Anything effective or even a little bit useful against the forces of evil seems to have teleported to unknown locations. Will you be able to retrieve them?

You will venture in the world of Bizmia to look for your Gear Set as one of the four Heroes; Alf the Marksman, Orora the Warrior, Cosimo the Mage, Abinacle the Sorcerer. Your only fighting chance is to use your set’s unique abilities and pray for the support of the Spirit Dice.

Will you be the one Hero to restore the balance of Bizmia by the End of the last Cycle ?

Will you be able to finaly liberate The Dragle from his curse ?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Role Playing

name: Aboleo
description:
Aboleo is a two-player strategy board game played on an Aboleo board. On the surface, the board resembles a chess or checkers board but has some significant differences. It is a checkered game board with 64 squares arranged in an eight-by-eight grid with each square containing two dots (one at the lower left and one at the upper right) or circles indicating the proper positioning of a player’s piece within the square. 

Each player begins the game with 16 pieces: one king, one general, two chariot units, two cavalry units, two archer units, and eight infantry units. Each of the six piece types moves differently. An additional piece which is not present at the beginning of the game, is the noble. The noble piece replaces any infantry unit that makes it to the opposing player’s side of the board and moves in the exact same fashion as the king. The objective is to 'Aboleo' or abolish the opponent's nobility by executing three attacks resulting in the “death” of the piece. If the king is killed and no other nobility exists, the game is ended. If a noble exists, that piece is then promoted to king and game play continues. This is called a “coronation”. If more than one noble exists, the player has the option of choosing which piece is promoted to king.

To this end, a player's pieces are used to attack and kill the opponent's pieces, while supporting their own. In addition to Aboleo, the game can be won by voluntary resignation by the opponent, this would typically occur when too many forces have been lost, or if the player feels that the death of his nobility is unavoidable. A game may not result in a draw unless both players agree to concede.

—description from the designer

name: 100 syytÃ¤ liikkua SÃ¤kylÃ¤ssÃ¤
description:
100 syytä liikkua Säkylässä

100 reasons to exercise in Säkylä

A roll-and-move game for 2-6 players that want to discover SäkyläÎs varied exercise offerings.

Players roll the die and visit locations marked with a number or a color.

Numbers correspond to cards that contain a location, a short description of the surroundings and a task that they have to complete in order to discard it. Colors correspond to actions that result in players taking, giving or exchanging cards.

The tasks are miming various activities, sports or situations.

Alternatively, players can discard a card if they answer multiple-choice questions related to Säkylä sports, or pick up and execute Stretch cards that instruct the players to stretch in various ways.

The game ends when all players have reached the start/end location, and the winner is the player with the fewest cards.

—user summmary

name: Shredding Peace: Operation Shredder, the Raid on Samu, November 1966.
description:
“We neither believe in nor acknowledge the usefulness of the frenzied activity of the organized [guerrilla] bodies that…interfere with Arab planning, weakens Arab unity, provides the enemy with the pretext for aggression and initiative, and is leading us into a conflict whose timing and preparation is not propitious…”---Jordan’s King Hussein, October 4, 1965.

For nearly two years the Palestinian Fatah organization in the West Bank conducted cross border raids into the Israel that became increasingly deadly and violent. These resulted in nearly 100 Israeli dead and injured as well as extensive property damage, including private Israeli homes. In response, Israeli Prime Minister Levi Eshkol authorized a retaliatory raid, dubbed Operation Shredder, into the southwest corner of the West Bank against the town of Samu’ and several other villages south of the city of Hebron. The raid was carried out by the Israeli 35th Paratrooper Brigade, supported by tanks, armored halftracks, aircraft and artillery. It was the largest invasion of Jordanian territory to that point, and meant to convey a strong message that Israel’s restraint in the face of these attacks was at an end.

Unfortunately, Jordan’s King Hussein, ruler of the West Bank, was the sole Arab leader seeking a path of moderation with the Jewish State. For nearly three years the King had been meeting secretly with Golda Meir, the Israeli Foreign Minister, in an effort to forestall another war in the region and to find some path to peace. US President Johnson had helped facilitate these meetings, and supported King Hussein with these initiatives. The Israeli strike at Samu’ was fraught with peril, both militarily and politically. Can you do better?

Each copy of Shredding Peace is composed of the following:

Two 11 by 17 inch hex map sheets with game charts and tables.
91 un-mounted, double-sided counters
8 pages of rules

Infantry (Airborne, Headquarter) and Heavy Weapons are all Companies of about 100 to 120 men. Tank and the armored car units represent 2 vehicles, and each halftrack represents 4 vehicles. A hex on the map is about three quarters of a mile across. Each turn represents one half hour of time. The game uses a standard deck of playing cards and a ten sided die for play.

Shredding Peace is designed by Paul Rohrbaugh and features graphics by Dariusz Buraczewski.

name: L.O.L. Surprise: 7 Surprises Card Game
description:
Players set out to collect all seven items that make up the four unique L.O.L. Surprise! dolls. Each player starts with five cards and on their turn draw two cards. On their turn they can play up to three cards by creating sets of the unique L.O.L. Surprise! dolls or play action cards like Go Shopping!, which allows the players to draw 2 additional cards from the pile. Additionally players can try to make a set of seven Secret Message cards, and upon succeeding they can discard the set to search the draw pile for any card they need. First player to complete one doll set of seven cards is the winner!

-description from designer

name: Dogs of the Galaxies
description:
Dogs of the Galaxies is a card game for people not embarrassed making funny faces, uttering weird words or barking “Woof”, “Woof”, while wagging the tail. Players take turns drawing cards and describing the dogs in them; for example, what the dog looks like, what pranks it just finished pulling, or what trick it has up its sleeves - practically any way the player wants to describe the dog. Card drawer also mimics the facial expression of the dog described.

Others then compete to outdo each other by coming up with the weirdest names, captions or memes for the dogs described and, sometimes, the sounds the dogs make. The player with the weirdest name, or sound, wins the point(s) for the round. The first to get 10 points wins the game.

The player with the least point(s) wags his or her tail while barking “woof”, “woof” like a dog.

—description from the publisher

name: GO! Music
description: This is an educational game that features a deck of cards with musical notes and intervals. Instructions are included for riffs on children's games such as Go Fish! and Egyptian Rat Screw. For instance, in GO! Chromatic (the Go Fish! variant) players take turns asking the other players for matching cards, e.g., C# will match a Dflat.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Game System

name: The Wand Chronicles
description:
Follows successful publication of a book trilogy of the same name.
2 games in one:
Game one:
on the Elvish dimension of Laniakeea, players seek to recover the wand, Elvina, from the Sola Tree using spells and magic.

General Playing cards are numbered and include pick up forfeit cards (Either positive moves from Elfistra the Sorceress, or minus moves from the evil Rand Raneth).

On the roll of a dice, the highest number goes first and chooses which character they wish to represent. These are small standalone cards in plastic holders. Every other player then chooses their character.
The game then continues by the turning of the general playing cards and no dice. Spell cards are included, including the VAMABACK card which means the player that drew it, can choose an opponent and move them back to their home portal.There are a number of magical spell cards that create tension among all players.

The winner is the first player to collect Elvina the wand and game one ends here. Everyone gains points

Finish with a winner there or flip board over for continuation of the adventure by playing the 2nd game.

Game 2:

As a team, it is the quest of every player, including the winner from game one who has Elvina, to find and destroy the dark Lord Morg Spear'Nd in the Volcanic dimension of Pyramordial.

Movement around game board 2 is by the rolling of dice

Along the way there are lightning bolts, on which you can travel up, or dragon tongues, in which you have to travel down. There are also blue squares, where you collect positive points, and red squares where you would collect negative points. All points are noted on pads that each player has.

Every player has to reach the volcanic cave where Morg Spear'Nd is hiding. The player who holds the wand Elvina, then issues the destruction spell and Morg Spear'Nd is destroyed, and the invasion of the peaceful Elvish dimension of Laniakeea (Game board side 1) by Morg Spear'Nd is stopped. All points are added up, and only then is the overall winner of both games declared.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Hexerei: the Three Witches of WÃ¼rzburg
description:
Hexerei is a 1 vs All game of combat and cooperative maneuvering, set in a broody, war-torn 17th century Germany. Up to four players will play as Hunters tasked with finding and slaying the Three Witches of Würzburg before the opposing player-led Coven completes the Ritual.

Hunters will interrogate Prisoners from the Tribunal Deck to reveal unknown tiles on the gaming board in order to find Arcana Tiles. These allow to draw “leads” from the Arcana Deck and ultimately force the Witches to reveal themselves and fight. Hunters need to act fast, because the Coven will complete the Ritual in 8 turns.

The Coven’s powers are great, but its fight against time is no less dire. The Coven’s player controls each turn’s conditions by drawing from the Orbis Deck and can deal gruesome spells from his Maleficia Deck. He gains power from the Ritual and can summon Creatures. Each of these is based on the darkest German myths and can go toe-to-toe with any Hunter, but at the same time is specialized in a tactical role and could easily be wasted.

The Hunters and the Coven fight for board control: each struggles to mix favorable cards into the decks controlled by the opponent. A streamlined dice combat system favors decisive action, hard choices and risk-taking. Cooperation and resource-pooling is needed between Hunters to secure equipment and plan actions against the Coven. Rash decisions can spell ruin for both sides, since the number of Hunter “lives” are limited, and each Creature can only be summoned once. Each game set will contain original art and (unpainted) miniatures for Witches, Creatures and the Hunters.

-description from designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Team-Based Game

name: Malyava: Break free from the prison!
description:
The very word “Malyava” represents a "Kite" which is a prison`s slang for a small letter, sent by one prisoner to another or to outer mates, via secret ways.

The Game for three to six gamblers will create a fun atmosphere and light up your party. This is the multiplayer strategic based Game with rich visuals inspired by the Russian prison subculture.

Each gamer will assume the role of a Cop (Guard), a Con (Inmate) or a Kingpin (Prison Boss). Buying and playing the “Lousy life” cards, participants earn money and interact with other players. The goal of the Game is to move according to the Map and to be the first to reach freedom. You must solve a number of interesting tasks: such as writing an encrypted letter to a cellmate, keeping in mind that the Cop is hunting for it.

Should you get trapped – you must perform various funny or extravagant tasks. Who will win? One of the cons who achieved freedom or cop prevented escape? May luck smile up on you!

name: Kosmic Kittens
description:
"The intergalactic symbols of kosmic peace have been scattered across the meow-tiverse! Fearless, intrepid Kosmic Kittens have spread far and wide to collect them! It's your job to bring these symbols together, restore order and peace to existence and gain a better Kosmic score than all the other Kittens in the game!"

Kosmic Kittens is a purr-fectly fun pair matching card game for all feline fans across the meow-tiverse!
Swap cards with your neighbour
Match up pairs of symbols to score points

Use special power cards to improve your game

When all the pairs are matched, the winner is the kitty with the most points!

But beware of the Space Hound! If you finish with this dastardly mutt you’ll loose ten points!
Kosmic Kittens is a purr-fectly fun pair matching card game for all feline fans across the meow-tiverse!

—description from the designer

name: Galactic Space Exploration: The Ultimate Space Exploration Game! (Level 1)
description:
Galactic Space Exploration is a 1-4 player game where you manage your resources, buy and launch dozens of rocket ships, and be the first to head out into the vastness of space in the ultimate space exploration game! Best for kids aged 6 through 160.

Learn to master the market. Players must invest wisely to grow their resources and their fleet of Rocket Ships. Who will be first to explore the Solar System and the Galaxy?

The year is 2019 and here on planet Earth, we are faced with a big decision. Are we to deplete Earth’s natural resources, surely guaranteeing our species extinction, or will we expand our reach into the solar system and seek the riches outer space has to offer?

This game lets kids of all ages build their space empire by working hard for resources and making one savvy investment, one at a time.

Playing as the CEO of one of 4 space exploration companies, the goal is to be the first player to build their fleet of ships and explore beyond our Solar System. Space awaits - it’s up to you to make smart investments while sending your rocket ships to planets, moons, and eventually out into the Galaxy!

Players and seeking untapped resources for sale on the interplanetary market. You can grow your capital, increase your fleet, and expand your holdings within the Solar System—but one false move, and your organization will be on the wrong end of the space boom.

Will YOU be the first to reach the stars?

—description from the designer
categories: Children's Game, Deduction, Dice, Economic, Educational, Math, Number, Space Exploration
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Pattern Recognition, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Squex
description:
Squex is a 2-player abstract connection game, similar to Hex.
The game is played on a 8x8 board of octagons and squares. The goal of each player is to connect their corresponding sides of the board with a continuous line of pieces.

How to play:

On their turn, each player can place one octagonal piece on any free octagonal place on the board.
If a piece is placed diagonally to a piece of the same color, a square of that color is placed to connect them (it is possible to place up to 4 squares by placing just one octagon).
If a piece is placed diagonally to a piece of the same color and there is a square of the opponent's color in between them, the opponent's square is replaced by a square of the player's color. The opponent's octagons are no longer connected by the square that was there. This is called a "cut".
Whenever a player performs a "cut", the opponent can then play two times in a row (it should be noted that if a player performs a "cut" on the first of two consecutive turns, they lose the second turn and it's the opponent's turn to play twice).
A player only wins when they connect their respective sides of the board and it is impossible for the opponent to ever break that connection with a "cut". Usually after a player connects two sides there are still three of four more turns until the connection is "uncutable".


—description from the designer

name: Monopoly: Animaccord Edition
description:
It’s been 10 years since the Animaccord team started the production of the Marsha and the Bear cartoon. The series, which today, without any overstatement, has been a worldwide YouTube phenomenon that has conquered the hearts of billions of kids and their parents throughout the world.
This special board game is created and issued to mark the 10th anniversary of Animaccord Studio’s establishment. Step by step, you will pass through all stages of production of an animated series – starting with script writing all the way to the first episode releasing on air. Will you be able to sell the brand’s licensing for the creation of consumer products? Are you ready to be at the top of your industry and get international success?
The game vividly shows all the obstacles that the Animaccord studio has handled over the last 10 years. Just like in real life, you will face the design, technical, and financial issues, as well as the legal specifics of business management – simply everything behind the scenes of the tremendously popular cartoon.
Feels like a challenge? Of course! But, we believe that you will accomplish this mission and find success with your beloved heroes. Marsha and the Bear despite all obstacles you will face on your path. The Animaccord team has done it, so can you!
We wish you good luck!

—description from the back of the box

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Miremarsh: Game Designer Promo Hex Tile
description:
A promo hex tile available during the UKGE 2018

Encounter:

Spend a star symbol (blue dice) to switch any two tiles of the same level including anything on them
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Humor, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Push Your Luck, Tile Placement, Trading

name: Project Green
description:
Project Green is an educational, co-op set collection and hand management game, suitable for children of ages 7 to 12.

The game consists of 5 kinds of cards.

Technologies: Water Purification, Renewable Clean Energy, Recycling, Landform
Cultures: Safeguarding Water Resources, Pollution Reduction, Proper Consumption, Healthy Nurishment
Basic Needs: Water, Energy, Goods, Food
Α Volunteers card

Last but not least there are some pesky Pollution cards that mess with our plans to create the perfect Green environment.

The players draw cards from a deck which consists of Basic Needs and Pollution cards. Then they can discard 3 identical cards to put a progress token on the corresponding technology, or 3 different cards to put a progress token on a technology corresponding with one of the cards played. The cards are discarded beneath the appropriate technology

Cultures are wildcards that can be used instead of one card from our hand.

If a player's hand consists of 2 or more pollution cards then he has two options. Either discard one or more Volunteer tokens to discard the same number of pollution cards and draw new ones or contaminate a technology card with pollution thus turning the corresponding culture permanently.

The game ends after the deck runs out. Then the players are awarded points equal to the number of Basic Needs cards discarded beneath the Technology cards that match minus any Pollution cards.

The players win if they manage to score more than 30 points.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Environmental
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Primeval Clash
description:
Primeval Clash is a fast-playing skirmish miniatures game set in a world where prehistoric creatures and historical cultures join together on the field of battle.

Lead an army of some of the worlds greatest civilizations, side by side with some of the greatest creatures to ever walk the earth (or fly). A unique play system draws the focus away from the traditional approach of using dice to determine if you succeed, and instead determines what you succeed at. In this game you allocate your rolls to actions of your choice. It is a subtle, but game-changing approach.

——description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures, Prehistoric
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Kooky Cooks
description:
Our game is called Kooky Cooks. It’s a wacky educational card game that utilizes money math skills and introduces youngsters to exciting new foods in unusual dishes. Kooky Cooks is a game that is easy for kids to learn and engaging for parents to enjoy. Our game is specifically designed for 2-6 players aged 8 and up.
Players take on the role of a Kooky Cook. Racing to complete as many orders as they can, players scramble to earn the most cash before time runs out. Throughout player turns, customers continuously fill the restaurant and request bizarre dishes. In order to cook these dishes, players will need to play specific combinations of ingredients from their hands. Along the way players may find special ingredients that have game changing abilities ranging from gathering extra ingredients to kicking out customers.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math

name: HellBringers the Card Game
description:
The Backstory

In the beginning there was darkness, all-encompassing, complete darkness. A black hole that hungered to consume everything. This darkness is called Demogargano. But there was also light, glimmering and blinding, known to man as God. Existing separate from each other until by chance, or fate, they collided stealing energy from each other creating a new existence. Life blossomed, evolved, and thrived. Like two sides of a coin the light and dark coexisted and influenced man. As time went by the light created Hell as a means to quarantine evil caused by the darkness. Lucifer’s fight with God and his ultimate exile resulted in his right to rule Hell.

Lucifer enjoyed his rule for a millennia until he started to sense the rise in darkness and the existence of Demogargano. After having visons of Demogargano he experienced fear for the first time and left the Golden Bastille in Hell to go into hiding. With his absences many saw the opportunity to seize the power of Hell and three factions were formed. The order of the Devil lead by Belial, seeks to preserve Lucifer’s rule for his eventual return, maintaining the power structures as they are. The Council of Hate consists of the armies and legions of hell, military class demons, ruled by Beelzebub. The Council of Hate seeks to bring order to the chaos of Hell no matter the cost, but they also want to destroy Lucifer’s legacy and shift the balance of power. The Horde are the embodiment of chaos and pandemonium. They are ruthless, mindless demons who want to overrun Hell and destroy everything in their path. Astaroth is the only one that can control them and keep their bedlam at bay. Baal, a powerful sorcerer, and second in command of the Horde, turns on Astaroth and casts a spell banishing him to another dimension.

Lilith, the queen of Hell and estranged wife of Lucifer, senses that Astaroth has vanished and she fears the Horde will over run Hell with Baal at the helm. She finds Baal and challenges him to a battle to the death and wins. By doing so she left the Horde with no leaders, in turn granting them greater power and increasing Demogargano’s grip on the world. Lilith could travel through dimensions but she could not sense or locate Astaroth from Baal's spell. In that moment, Demogargano’s presence strengthened and Lilith is seized by the same visions that Lucifer suffered. In effort to preserve Hell and stop Demogargano from destroying everything, she forms the HellBringers. They are a rag tag group of demons, men, creatures, mercenaries, wizards, cyborgs, and the most bad ass pug ever. They are tasked with stopping Demogargano and raising a little hell along the way. (The story continues in HelllBringers #0, which can be found in the Art of Mark May Volume 1)

The Game

HellBringers is a card game stemming from the HellBringers first appearance in comics back in 2015 which can be found in the "The Art of Mark May Volume 1". Since then the universe has grown to not only include a wide range of intriguing and powerful characters. The villains are what make HellBringers unique. Set in deep culture and a plethora of mythologies from around the world, HellBringers brings characters from all walks of existence.

The full 52 card deck comes with 42 characters to introduce you to the HellBringers universe and 10 special weapons cards for multipliers to help you with those BOSS battles! There are 3 ways to play #HellBringers! Gauntlet Mode, Survivor Series Mode, (Both due in August) and the Game Board mode coming in October!

How to play

You need two dice, a paper pad, and something to write with to keep track of hit points. To enhance the hellish experience, 2 skull dice are included with the full game with mat if you buy that reward option. The cards themselves have SILVER FOIL on the front to make everything shiny! Oh....shiny! Fun to look at. Cards have 6 stat categories that make up a character’s total hit points. The game is played by rolling the dice and using total rolls to take off hit points as an attack. There are weapons cards that act as multipliers and every time you roll doubles it means something different. Can you get through the first battle of gauntlet or map mode? Are you ready to bring hell upon your enemies?

Here are the rules for the game!

There are three ways to play HellBringers. Survivor Series (Card deck needed only), Board Game mode, or Gauntlet mode (Card deck needed only)

First take out any card with a 666 or 000 attached to it and put it in separate pile for later. Here are the rules for doubles and the categories for stats.

Rolling Doubles:

1’s Into the Snakes Eyes : Instant kill
2’s Double Deuces: Restart battle (All HP reset)
3’s The Tribus – Attack is 3 times what you roll for the next attack roll.
4’s The Four Highwaymen Cometh – Choose a card from the deck to help you attack for the rest of the battle. This card cannot be attacked by opponent and will be put back in deck after battle. Do not get to keep for future battles.
5’s The Five have Risen – Gain back ALL HP
6’s One More to Summon Him – Roll again , If you can roll a 6 on either dice than you summon Demogargano to fight for you for the rest of the battle.


Stat Categories:

Evil Within
Magic
Durability
Strength
Fighting Ability
Intelligence


All categories are added up for total HP of any character.

Survivor Series mode:

2 players draw 6 cards a piece. One each until 6 are laid out. They then use 2 dice to roll and determine how much an attack has taken of their opponents HP (Health Points). Overall HP is determined by the combined total of the stat categories on the back of the card. The attack is subtracted from that total number until it reaches zero in which case the opponent is defeated. A notepad is suggested to keep up with HP and attack subtractions. In Survivor Series mode you face off 6 vs. 6 and you can choose to attack anyone in the deck for your turn. Once the card for the opponent is eliminated he goes into a defeated card pile. This continues until the player has defeated all of his opponents cards. The player then gets to revive any fallen cards he may have endured as well as the opponents cards and choose any 6 out of them to proceed forward to fight Demogargano. However, before you do that you must first draw a weapon card from the deck of the weapons cards. Weapons cards act as multipliers for attacks which you will need against Demogargano who will vastly out number you in HP. You also now get your 7th member of your team to help you defeat Demogargano. This is where you will roll one dice. If you get a 1 you get the “Bum Jesus” card, if you get a 2 you get the Norgren card, if you get a 3 or 4 you get Attila, and finally, if you get a 5 or 6 you get Astaroth. These cards feature different results. Norgren, Attila, and Astaroth all have 666 in one stat category making their total HP brought to the group a welcome asset and required in order to defeat Demogargano as he has 3 over 666 categories. Bum Jesus who you will receive if you roll a one has a 000 stat category making him able to sacrifice himself in order to defeat Demogargano without even rolling the dice. Meaning if you roll a 1 with the dice you win the game instantly.

The game can be played by two people or by yourself battling yourself to see who goes to fight Demogargano.

Gauntlet Mode:

In Run the Gauntlet mode the game play of HellBringers is the same except that when you and your opponent draw your first cards you instantly battle them. When the opponent’s card is defeated you will then put that card in a separate pile for later. The player then keeps the card with the battle damage of HP that was suffered from the battle. The opponent then draws another card and the battle damaged card from before fights that card. Both players get 6 cards in total and they battle this way until no cards are left for the opponent. The player then chooses 6 cards from his pile and the defeated pile to fight Demogargano and the rules are the same as Survivor Series for the final battle. See above.

Board Game Version:

Players rolls one dice. Player moves spaces until reaching weapons card pick up slots, team builder slots, and also battle zones. Players have the option of killing player and gaining double attack or having player join their team in the battle zones. Weaker players would be a reason you would kill of a player in order to double your attack. At this point you are choosing the bolster your attack rather gain HP of total team. Weapons cards act as modifiers. Team building is the goal of the board along with minor battles before you make it to the end of the game where you fight Demogargano. Unlike the card deck game version, you do not have the option of rolling for a special character at the end. You must make up your team as you go and if you are defeated in battle you have to start over. Game is 1-3 players and you can play by yourself as you just need to roll for the opponent as well during battles. During battles doubles mean the same as in regular card deck versions of the game.

Amazing Contributing Artist

Incredible art from the likes of Mark May, Marat Mychaels, Bob Camp, Chris Giarrusso, Ed Smith, Sean Forney, Steven Pulawa, Ryan Kincaid, Phil Spaulding, Cara Nicole, Brady Overstreet, Rick Lozano, Russ Casseday, and Sara Frazetta (Her first published work, granddaughter of the GOAT Frank Frazetta)! Some of the best artists from the comic industry come together to make one HELL of a card game for you! Pledge now to receive a game with challenging aspects, premium art, and overall fun to bed had! These cards are gonna be collectors items for generations to come!
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Bushido: Risen Sun â Hiroto
description:
Hiroto has returned to the Jwar Isles, but he is in no fit state to either raise hope in those scattered forces of the Shiho who still harbour loyalties nor incite fear in those that took all that was precious from his family. Read more about Hiroto here.

This model can be fielded as part of a warband affiliated with the following factions:

Jung Pirates
Silvermoon Syndicate
Tengu Descension

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Risen Sun â Eldest Brother
description:
Loyal to Hiroto, Drunken Master in ways that are difficult to describe, where Hiroto leads Eldest Brother follows. Read more about Eldest Brother here.

This model can be fielded as part of a warband affiliated with the following factions:

Cult of Yurei
Jung Pirates
Savage Wave
Silvermoon Syndicate
Temple of Ro-kan

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Situations
description:
Situations is a game where you and your friends (or acquaintances, or classmates, or family, or mortal enemies) construct the situation of a story together, taking turns adding people, events, places, and so on, and then each player writes their own story by interpreting the web of relationships they just created. The player who wrote the best story (by popular vote) wins!

The game has two phases. In the first phase, players have hands of cards: nouns, adjectives, and a few special cards. Each noun card has the noun itself as well as questions that establish relationships to that noun. On a player's turn, there are three possible actions:

They may play a noun (potentially along with adjectives describing it), connecting it through the questions to a noun already on the board
They may add an adjective to an existing noun
They may play a special card


After seven noun cards are on the board, players proceed to the second phase of the game, where they each write a story interpreting the web of nouns and relationships formed by the cards. When the players are done, they read the stories aloud, then vote on a favorite. Whoever wrote that story wins.

—description from the designer

name: Bockarna Bruse
description:
Help the Three Billy Boy Goats over the bridge but beware of the troll!
A fast-passed tableau building card-game for the whole family. Draw cards and place them in front of you to build the bridge. If you find a troll, you can steal cards from your opponent.
The first to complete the bridge wins the game.

—description from the designer

name: Merc the Monarch
description:
Merc the Monarch (as in Kill the Queen/King) is a 1 on 1 strategy game that takes place at a dinner party between rival kingdoms trying to assassinate each other's Monarchs.

Move your masked guests around the table getting closer and closer without getting caught.
If you think someone is moving too close to your Queen or King, reveal their identity quickly.
When you have your assassin in place, signal them to strike! But don't forget which guest was your own Assassin or you will have revealed yourself as the fool.

The board acts as the dinner table. The cards are all masked guests with different abilities that come into play as they are revealed one by one. Gameplay is easy to learn, hard to master. Deceit, caution, and a sharp memory will all be essential to win Merc the Monarch!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Queue, Storytelling, Tile Placement, Traitor Game

name: Rustic Cuff Monopoly
description:
This edition of Monopoly is centered around the popular, Oklahoma, jewelry line, Rustic Cuff.

Rustic Cuff was created in the summer of 2011 by Jill Donovan. Jill’s lifelong obsession with cuffs and a need for a creative outlet turned into so much more. With her days filled with young children and her evenings filled with teaching Law at the University of Tulsa, Jill began teaching herself all aspects of leather making and metal design in her guest bedroom in the middle of the night.Rustic Cuff has been featured on Good Morning America, ABC’s The View, The Wendy Williams Show, and E!News. RC has also gained favor with celebrities including, Giuliana Rancic, Miranda Lambert, Gayle King, Kathie Lee Gifford, Elisabeth Hasselbeck , and GMA’s Lara Spencer to name a few. The most popular sparkly bracelet is the Emerson style.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Reise durch Italien
description:
Objective: Be the first traveling through Italy.
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game; ending on any space follow instructions.
as usual: pay money - get money back being 1st, 2nd, 3rd

notes:
very nice/cute pewter pawns - impressive drawings
likely published ~1900.
Similar game to "Reise durch die Schweiz nach den italienischen Seen".

—user summary

name: Monopoly: Ariel Edition
description:
This edition of Monopoly was produced for the Ariel Investments company. The token are a tortoise (the symbol of the firm), a sleeping hare, a bull, a bear, a dollar sign and a loving cup. The money,title deeds, Chance and Community Chest cards are customized. All the title deeds are named for Ariel properties. Stock exchanges replace the railroad spaces. The Chance and Community Chest cards are renamed Fork In The Road and Ariel Community Academy.

Players roll dice to determine how far they move. Landing on a space gives the player the option of buying the property. When a player collects all the properties in one color group, the properties can be improved by building. When players land on a space owned by another player they must pay rent. Rent is determined by the location of the property and the number of improvements on the space. Some spaces instruct a player to draw a card which can be beneficial or harmful to the player. Players must avoid going bankrupt to stay in the game. The winner is the last player left in the game.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Deep Space Conveyance
description:
In Deep Space Conveyance, players take on the role of shipping companies trying to deliver goods accross the galaxy, fulfilling contracts and objectives.

Expand your company's empire by establishing outposts on planets, unlocking special abilities and discovering powerful technologies.

Develop your weapons to hinder your opponents, defend your ship and destroy space pirates for greater rewards.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Player Powers

name: Mars Needs You!
description:
You are the representative of one of 6 Corporations, currently on a Satellite in orbit around Mars, tasked with the job of exploration and conquest of Mars for the profit of your employer over a maximum of 6 years. Uncontaminated water on Earth is scarce and so it is the chosen commodity and the benchmark used to evaluate your success in competition with the 5 other Corporations.
Your Earth Corp is sending you, on a yearly basis, a diminishing amount of water from Earth for your use on your satellite. You utilize this water to activate "Squishy" (men) and "Crunchy" (robots) stored on your satellite. You use Squishy and Crunchy to drop down from your satellite to a constantly rotating planet Mars to explore the hidden terrain and discover water resources. Each Squishy that holds a terrain hex at the end of the fiscal year will provide water to send back to Earth in a running tally with the highest total at the end of the game being awarded the Monopoly of Mars for their Corporation.

Each Fiscal Year is divided into 4 Quarters and a Fiscal Year End. During the turn order players: receive water from Earth and roll for safe transit; active Squishy and Crunchy units; bid on the Chair; resolve storm movement and damage; determine and wait for Mars rotation; move units down to and around on Mars; resolve hex control through conflict; resupply their units on the surface with water from the satellite; accumulate profit points for terrain held; attempt to discover Alien Tech; and generally mess with the competition whenever they can using MarsNeedsYou Cards.

MarsNeedsYou Cards are held by players and used to benefit themselves or mess with the competition. Players also bid with water for a "Chairmanship" which allows them to roll to determine the amount of rotation of Mars before players are allowed to move their Squishy and Crunchy to the surface. "Chairman" also get to decide which of all the players will go first, with play proceeding in a clockwise order. This allows them to decide where they would like to be in the order of play. Where conflict occurs between multiple players for a terrain hex the "Chairman" also decides who fights first, even if they are involved in the conflict. And speaking of conflict, players who move their units onto other player occupied terrain hex are now in "Strenuous Negotiations" and must roll dice to determine who will hold the terrain and reap the profit from it and who will die and be rendered back into water for collection. If a player is not involved in any conflict they may pay water and roll for the chance to collect an Alien Tech Card which will provide them with an advantage courtesy of found Mars Alien Technology.

At the end of the last Fiscal Year, players count up their profit and any game bonuses for things like holding specific terrain or having the most Squishy on Mars and see how much total profit they have sent back to Earth. The player who squeezes the most profit from Mars is granted the development monopoly and wins the conflict!

-description from designer
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fighting, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Temptation of the Sphinx Diamond
description:
From Gamecrafters: "Temptation of the Sphinx Diamond is an easy to learn bluffing game for 2-4 players.

The year is 1926. The astounding Sphinx Diamond has been brought to London from Egypt. A glamorous masquerade party is being thrown to celebrate its unveiling. However, thieves lurk among the city’s rich and famous, each planning to steal the rare jewel. In Temptation of the Sphinx Diamond, players take on the role of a thief in disguise. They must guard their true identity while using poison to eliminate their competition."

---

Temptation of the Sphinx Diamond is a quick, fast-paced mystery card game in which players are attempting to be the last one standing without having other players uncover their secret identity. The game has two sets of characters: one set is masked, which are placed down in a row in the center of the table, the others are unmasked and one is secretly dealt to each player. Each player is now working to keep their character alive (no poison cards played on the character) until the end of the game.

In addition to the character cards, there are poison and antidote cards and three (3) item cards that can be added for varying levels of difficulty.

Each player takes two (2) actions on their turn:

• Draw a card (poison or antidote)
• Play a card - play a poison on ANY character even if they are already poisoned. The poison remains on the character until any players play an antidote with the matching icon on a poisoned character to remove a poison. (Example: Snake antidote will remove a snake poison on a character.
• Move an item - The items sit above the characters and can be moved to an adjacent character.

The base game is played with just the Mirror in play. When the mirror is above a character, that character cannot have poisoned played on them. (Antidotes can be played.)

When there is one (1) character that has no poison cards on them the game ends. The player who is that character will reveal themselves and they are the winner. However, if that character is NOT one of the player characters, the game resumes.

The Sphinx Diamond and Opera Glasses items can be added to the mix to up the difficulty of the game. They move in the same way as the mirror but have different effects. The Opera glasses item allows players to peek at each other's hand of cards. The Sphinx Diamond changes the win condition: In order to win, the player must be the last character with no poisons AND have the Sphinx Diamond above their character.

name: Through Europe in all Directions
description:
It is typical roll and move board game about traveling through Europe around 1920 published by Hausser OMHL, in Germany.
The game comprises a Map, six figures, two dice, directions, description of towns and coins. The starting point on the game board is at the same time the goal for each player, where he must return. Who returns the first - wins the game.

name: Thunder Upon the Water: The Battle of Albemarle Sound, May 5, 1864
description:
Thunder Upon the Water details the battle of Albemarle Sound fought on May 5th, 1864. Via the sound’s numerous ports Confederate blockade runners brought badly needed supplies for the rebel nation. In April a Confederate army supported by the new ironclad CSS Albemarle, captured the Union held port of Plymouth. Encouraged by this success, Confederate General Robert Hoke planned an offensive to recapture the city of Bern, held by Union forces for nearly two years.

Captain of the CSS Albemarle, James W. Cooke, steamed out to battle in afternoon of May 5th supported by two gunboats, the recently captured Union gunboat CSS Bombshell and the CSS Cotton Plant. The Confederate “Mosquito Fleet” ran into a Union squadron of eight gunboats, five of them new “double ender” side wheel steamers designed as rams to attack Confederate ironclads. The resulting battle was a classic of strength vs. numbers. The Union ships held off the Confederates, but both sides were severely bloodied. Can you do as well or better than your historical counterpart?

Each copy of Thunder Upon the Water is composed of the following:

• One 11 by 17 inch hex map sheet.
• One sheet of 142 single-sided, un-mounted counters
• One Players’ Aid Sheet
• One set of rules

Players use a standard deck of playing cards to activate their units and resolve some game events. Players also use six and ten sided dice (one of each). Each turn represents 15 minutes of time. Each hex is a little more than 200 yards across. Each unit represents 1 warship. The game is designed by Paul Rohrbaugh and features graphics by Bruce Yearian.

A supplemental card set for the game is also available. It replaces the standard deck of playing cards called for in the rules, feature graphics that compliment the game’s, and has rules reminders on pertinent cards.

-description from designer

name: Sovereignty
description:
In Sovereignty, you must expand your empire economically and militarily until you achieve world domination. Expand your territory by building forts in uncontested lands or by capturing enemy forts. Develop your economy by exploiting natural resources and trading with minor nation ports. Invest in technology for long-term strategic advantages. Recruit an army and build a fleet to protect your empire’s interests and conquer what is rightfully yours!

Begin the game by building a map out of the 20 unique land and 24 sea tiles which snap together for fast, stable assembly. Tiles feature 7 rare resources, which each provide a special bonus that will influence your strategy. This hex-based map will become the battlefield where you must position your armies tactically to threaten enemy forts while still defending your own. Battles involve revealing your army cards against your opponent’s cards, and are resolved based entirely on the regiment composition and technological advantages – there are no dice or random draws, just imperfect information. Naval fleets provide strategic support to your armies, allowing you to quickly transport troops or even blockade your enemy’s capital to try to starve their economy. Players are eliminated once their capital fort is conquered.

While Sovereignty is primarily a competitive strategy game, it also features a more story-driven campaign mode for solo/cooperative play. Become Napoleon in his campaign to conquer Europe (and with enough skill, the world). Engage in historic battles against an automated opponent, driven by behavior cards that react to your decisions. Each province you capture on the world map provides benefits for future battles, so you gain strength between each game you play.

Sovereignty was designed to be relative quick to learn, but difficult to master. The modular map, rare resources, and technology systems all result in a large diversity of strategies, so every game is unique. The artwork and thematic elements are all designed to provide an immersive experience, so you really can feel like you are building and growing an empire.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: Monopoly: Accra Edition
description:
Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

From the rear of the box:
Accra, which elegantly stretches along the Atlantic coast of Ghana, is the country’s capital and largest city, with an estimated urbanpopulation of 2.3 million.
Originally built around a port, it served the capital of the British Gold Coast between 1877 and 1957. Accra has since transitioned into a modern, growing metropolis, the city reflects a history ranging from the 19th century architecture to modern skyscrapers and apartment blocks.
Accra is the home to the Kotoka International Airport and is your gateway to original Ghanaian hospitality, peace and joie de vivre! Accra is also home to many restaurants and “chop bars”, where you can sample authentic, divine-tasting Ghanaian and continental dishes. The city is vibrant and serves as Ghana’s economic, administrative, cultural and entertainment hub. The world famous Azonto dance, among several other dance genres, originated from Accra. Accra is also home to some beautiful sandy beaches. Tourism is thriving in Accra and the country as a whole.
In 2010, the Globalization and World Cities Research Network designated Accra a Gamma-minus-level world city, indicating a growing level of international influence and connectedness. Its entry into the internationally acclaimed MONOPOLY family underscores its unique status as an emerging tourism and business city.
The City of Accra Edition provides an exceptional city tour. It captures the rich diversity of the city’s exciting offerings and highlights the extent to which it has evolved over the past decade. You can now play this classic game with Accra’s street names and some of its most recognised landmarks. Savour a piece of the true magic that the City of Accra exudes, and experience its energy and pace. At the same time you will learn about Ghana from an architectural and historical point of view.
Find your favourite Accra hotspot, roll the dice and build your property empire from Nima to Ridge via Airport City in this special edition of this most famous board game. In 2013, the New York Times, named Accra as one of its top Travel destinations and listed it 4th on their “46 places to go in 2013”. The prestigious paper described the city as “a buzzing metropolis ready for business and pleasure”.
“Charley, welcome aboard!”
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Mamlejet Kohanim: Una NaciÃ³n Eterna
description:
Mamlejet Kohanim is a semi-collaborative collectible card game, set in the time of the first Kings of ancient Israel, in which each player assumes the role of Commander of a Division of the King's Army. The players are allied to each other, and the objective of the game is to be the first to demoralize the enemy army through different tactics: soldiers, objects, and other strategy cards. The combats are resolved by dice rolls.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Educational, Mythology, Religious
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: I KNOW IT ALL
description:
Inspired by a very old game called "Baccalaureate" among Francophones and "Categories" among Anglophones, I KNOW IT ALL is a board game created with the intent of uniting generations around themes testing their abilities and speed thinking. It presents a familiar universe to the players while remaining original; unlike the games above, we wanted this one more accomplished, more modern, more complex and much more captivating. We know beforehand that it will offer players, families and/or friends a unique experience while they are experiencing intense moments of fun, laughter, and knowledge building.

Geared towards ages 12 and up, I KNOW IT ALL is a game that tests your global knowledge. The winner is not necessarily the oldest or smartest person at the table, but the one keeping up with the fast pace and thinking on his/her feet.

—description from the designer

name: Honour Bound
description:
Basic Outline:

Each player starts with one shogun card, three daimyo cards and five samurai cards. All players also draw five action cards each at the start of the game.

The goal of Honour Bound is to KILL the other opponent's Shogun to have complete reign over feudal Japan and win the game

Phase 1: Selection

Each Player selects a character of their army and places it face down

When both cards are placed down they they are flipped over at the same time

Phase 2: Honour Declaration

Both players roll the dice to determine their base honour level

If you have played a Samurai card then you can roll once. A Daimyo is two rolls and a Shogun is three rolls. The sum of all your rolls are added together to become your base honour level

The player with the lowest honour level is on the defensize

Phase 3: Tactics

Players can place their initial actions cards if any are available, the defensive player places their initial action card first, but the offensive player can also play an initial action card after the defensive player has decided to play theirs or pass their turn

Phase 4: Swordplay

The defensive player must place their active action cards to either increase or decrease their honour level by using a power card, or reduce their opponents honour level by using a protection card

Eevery time a card is played the offensive player has the option to play an action card to counter the defensive player if they wish

This goes on back and forth until a player can no longer defend itself

Once the defensive player can no longer place action cards or chooses not to, they discard their army card into the army discard pile and the offensive player takes their army card back into their deck

Both players then take an action card and phase 1 loops back until a Shogun is killed and the winner is declared
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Player Elimination

name: Sembrando Agua
description:
AguÌita is the protector of watersheds and teaches people to inhabit them in Peru means being exposed to multiple hydrometeorological dangers.
helps AguÌita management to the watershed, using the best strategy to win the game. Beware of floods and droughts, use prospective corrective and reactive management charts to be the first to manage disaster risks in your watershed.

shuffles risk management cards, hazard tiles and vulnerability cards separately. Place the danger tiles face down in the center of the table and unfold 5 cards on the side of the table, then place the risk management deck on the side of the tile deck and deal 4 cards to each player; Place the vulnerability cards on one side of the table, these cards will be used only when one of the players manages to complete a watershed.

—description from the designer

name: The Drowned Earth: Oviraptors
description:
Oviraptors are faction neutral, and so can be used with any other factions, or as NPC models in certain scenarios or using the Alternate Rules found in the hard copy of the rulebook.

Oviraptors (x2), is a pack of two multi-part metal wargaming miniatures in 35mm scale. The models are lead free, and come supplied with two 30mm base and one profile card.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Prehistoric, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Storytelling

name: Composure
description:
Composure is an adult card game to challenge your relationships.

Each card asks you to take a position on a challenging question or scenario. Many of the cards are person. Topics include sex, politics, race, brutality, stereotypes, etc.

Players use their cards to challenge others at the table. People that can keep their composure while discussing the cards, earn chips. The player with the most chips is the winner.

name: Anthony P Rothbard's O.S.
description:
Roll dice, arrange them, then place colored nodes on the matrix to build a network of computer resources. Construct patterns of effective node clusters to earn points and gems, debug defective node clusters and compete with your opponent for limited space on the matrix board. Win by being the first player to earn five gems. Use spatial reasoning, critical thinking and play-by-numbers strategy to become the most efficient artificial intelligence to ever achieve sentience.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Take That

name: Show Business: Tycoons
description:
Over last 9 years since premiere author of "Show Business" has been listening carefully to below complaints of the players:
- The game is too long;
- The rulebook is a nightmare;
- There's no Player Aid;
- For such heavy economic game the luck factor is unacceptable;
- The prints on Trend dice wipe off.

And here you go! "Tycoons" - the expansion to "Show Business" responds to all above complaints and delivers:

- A deck of brand new cards with 6 new, very powerful CHARACTERS along with compatibility reprint of 80 cards from basic game;
- Completely redesigned, improved and reprinted Rulebook of basic game (hope this time it will be the fastest comprehensible reading ever :-) );
- Brand new Player Aids;
- Fine tuning of elements that made first edition of "Show Business" a bit chaotic and luck dependent (due to unpredictible hostile actions and overall randomness). Now the game gives much more support to counteract hostile actions of your opponents and concentrate steadily on career of your band.
- 3 different time scenarios: short for newbies (40 to 100 min), medium for regular players (60 to 150 min) and extended for fans (80 to 200 min). The low values show play time for 2 players the high for 5. Decide yourself how much time you want to play and go on;
- Stickers for Trend Dice.

"Tycoons" will be distributed as a standalone package for owners of basic game as well as an expansion integrated in one box with basic "Show Business".
Give it a second chance or brand new try and enjoy!
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Travel
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Cauldron: Bubble and Boil â Coven Deck
description:
The Tarot card sized Coven Deck lets players play specific witches with asymmetric powers. It can be played one of two ways. The easiest way is to start each player with a Coven Role at the beginning of the game. The slightly more challenging version has all the roles out and listed on each one is a REQUIREMENT. If you fulfill the requirement then you gain that role.
You can only have one Coven Role.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Cauldron: Bubble and Boil â Location Pack
description:
This mini-expansion adds a whole new mechanic to the game, Location Cards. These cards, when played, place locations in the game where players may (and sometimes MUST) interact with those locations. Each location has its own effects. Locations may help you lose Corruption, find resources, or score VP for example. Once they are discarded from play, they leave the game.

Unlike the other cards in the Cauldron: Bubble and Boil deck, these cannot be used in gardens.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Cauldron: Bubble and Boil â Moon Deck
description:
This Moon Deck Mini-Expansion creates an event deck separate from the main game's deck. It follows the phases of the moon and gives bonuses and penalties to your actions depending on the phase of the moon.

—description from the publisher

name: Fray! Flarestorm
description:
A century after the Flarestorms began and brought an end to the digital age humanity has stabilized, but now finds itself locked in a struggle to define the future. Roving bands of searchers pick through the abandoned cities of the world for forgotten pieces of OldTech for their own ends, fighting brutal desperate battles with the weapons of this new world, finely crafted repeating flintlocks, sun charged sinew and blade, attack wolves and crossbows. These are their stories...

Fray! Flarestorm is a board based skirmish game that brings a fresh new take on the skirmish genre with an eye toward realistic simulation of small scale conflict, doing away with many of the shortcomings that have plagued the skirmish genre while introducing new mechanics that simulate simultaneous action, in a system that could be applied to virtually any genre or setting.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Planet Fulcrum
description:
Planet Fulcrum is a strategic 1-4 player, area control board game with tech-tree character development and deck-driven battle. Players assume the role of an unwitting adventurer. Transported, stranded, and endowed with powerful abilities by the mysterious planet to compete for its gifts.

To master their new-found skills, players must form a bond with the planetary regions by gathering and distributing Fulcra; coalesced cubes of raw power to control territory. This shared goal will make conflict inevitable, as players battle to reduce their rivals' ability and hold over their new home.

For every action a player takes, the planet will react. Delivering judgment on the players' morality and aligning them to one of three factions. The righteous must work together, whereas the devious bid to subjugate all.

Players will accrue points by controlling territory, leveling up Power cards, and collecting items. The game ends when every territory is under player control. The player with the highest points total is the victor.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Science Fiction, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Take That

name: Four King Rabbits
description:
Four King Rabbits is an infectious, orgasmic, and slightly morbid card game (16+) for a party of 4 to 6, set in a not-so-parallel universe of sex-hungry rabbits.

In this game, players take turns drawing STDs and action cards. The goal is to avoid death from accumulating too many STDs, and be the last rabbit standing. Lie about your own STDs, and use the action cards (e.g One Night Stand / Gang Bang) to infect your friends, protect yourself (e.g Condom / Divine Intervention), or skip drawing a disease (Masturbate).

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Educational, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Take That

name: Total Monstrosities the Card Game: Black Market Blue
description:
Total Monstrosities the Card Game - Black Market Blue is a game for 1 – 6 players that takes roughly 20 minutes.

The aim of the game is to win 10 Totalmon Cards before your opponents. You win Totalmon cards by having the strongest overall Totalmon at the end of a round. Use Buff and Support Cards to raise your total, or better yet, Mutate your Totalmon into stronger Totalmon to gain the edge.

—description from the designer

name: Pandeng: The High Roller Card Game
description:
Pandeng is a climbing card game for 2 to 4 players using a deck of 57 cards. 4 players can also play as teams of 2 sitting opposite each other.

A similar game is said to have been played by Imperial officials during the Han Dynasty in China ... for money!

In Pandeng you want to collect as few cards as possible. Each player starts with a hand of six cards from a deck that contains cards numbered 2-11. One player starts by playing a single card or multiple cards with the same value, calling out the sum of the cards as it is played.

So if the player plays a 4 (or two 2s) he deals it to the center of the table and calls out “4”. The next player has to play a card (or cards of equal value added together) to surpass that sum or else collect all of the cards played so far. They then start with one or more cards again in a new deal.

The number 8 (long regarded as the luckiest number in Chinese culture) is the strongest card in the deck, it beats them all! So what beats an 8? Two 8s! And two 8s succumb to three 8s and so on. There are eight 8's in the deck, and when to use these 8s is a key strategy in Pandeng!

As soon as the draw pile of cards is gone, and one player is out of cards, the game ends immediately, and everyone else adds the cards in their hand to the cards that they've collected counting the cards for a score. After playing as many rounds as the number of players at the table, whoever has the lowest score wins!

The 57 card deck consists of:

Three 2s
Three 3s
Four 4s
Five 5s
Six 6s
Seven 7s
Eight 8s
Nine 9s
Nine 10s
Three 11s

—description from the designer

name: Shootout
description: A western themed game where 2 players cooperate to clear a town of outlaws. On your turn you hear a shot and must guess where it came from. If you're right, the shot misses and you get the drop on the outlaw. If you're wrong, the shot hits. Once you deal enough damage to the outlaw, the building is clear. You win the game when all 8 buildings in town are cleared of outlaws.

name: DinoSporrrt 2.0
description:
For whom:
DinoSporrrt for children and adults, for rest with family, friends, in the party. For all who like excitement, activity, laughter and dinosaurs)

What gives:
You can drive balls alone, but it is more fun for two or two against one or even four! The kids play simultaneously with two hands, the figures rotate with their fingers (they can be played separately). Unlike similar sports games, you can navigate around the field. In order to play from the age of 3, small parts were removed from DinoSporrrt, which is also convenient when traveling.

name: Tafl Up
description:
Tafl style games like Hnefatafl, Tablut and Halatafl have been popular down the centuries among Vikings and into the Renaissance. A skilled warrior was often buried with a tafl (board) as an honour gift.

Round pieces move diagonally (bishop move) and jump orthogonally. Square pieces move orthogonally (rook move) and jump diagonally. Players are trying to get three pieces in a line, past their centre line. Once this happens, the pieces "Tafl Up" into a stack. First player to get all their pieces into stacks, wins the game. Simple.

Tafl Up takes the usual capturing style of the game and turns it on its head by making the players flank (capture) their own pieces. With no taking, there is no player elimination, but players will find strong competitive elements in blocking and efficiency.

—description from the designer

name: The Singularity Deck: Extended Ranks
description:
The Singularity Deck's extended ranks add the additional ranks 13-24. These ranks are available for all six of the Earth Set suits (spades, clubs, hearts, diamonds, triangles, and ovals) as well as all six of the Cosmos Set suits (antimatter, stars, dark matter, dark energy, asteroids, and planets).

The Earth Set's extended ranks can be bought separately by suit or all together, while the Cosmos Set's extended ranks can only be bought separately by suit.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Game System

name: Shadow Empires
description:
Shadow Empires: where the shadow government is real and pursues world domination

You must have heard about secret societies, shadow governments and agencies, to whom even their three-letter abbreviation is a secret.
You think, these are just fairy tales, unfounded fictions, conspiracy theories of doodling fools who sit in the basement of their house with their tin-foil hats on?
Well yes, the shadow government works with deception now-days... getting rid of bodies is nasty job, even if the Illuminati buys them from the Free Masons to make hamburger out of them to feed their Reptilian servants.
Or is this yet another fiction? Who knows...

Come and get to know the Real Truth with Shadow Empires!
Be a Reptilian, lead the Illuminati, conquer the world with the Vampires or build your empire with the Free Masons - just like they do in the real world! Or do they?
Come and take lead of the great powers of the world, conspire against other cabals through the ages to hold the whole world in YOUR hands!

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Educational, Humor, Party Game

name: Kitty Cataclysm Purrsonality
description:
A 7-card expansion to Kitty Cataclysm.

Different superpowers for everybody!

Everyone starts with a unique purrsonality card. On your turn, instead of playing a card, you can activate your special power! Each card offers unique powers, to be used twice each game.

The expansion makes the game slightly less likely to end via empty hands, and adds a little bit more to think about.

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Dragonfire: Solo Adventuring
description:
Single Player Rules for Dragonfire
This expansion provides the necessary ruleset to make the minimum player count extend to 1.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Role Playing

name: Last Alliance
description:
In the Last Alliance game, each player represents an influential lord who claims power. Each player has a hand of similar cards that represent support among the most important factions of The Misty Land.

Each turn, the player chooses a card that represents the delegation they will send on the Glittering Mountains to discuss, ally (or beat!) with other delegations. Depending on the card played and the combination of cards which will be revealed, different effects will occur.

Diplomacy, bluffing, strategy, luck and the ability to convince other players to play certain cards will cause you to lose or be able to keep your cards. All players, play, all the time, at the same time. You will have to eliminate players, but without targeting anyone directly. The last two players with at least 3 cards are the Last Alliance and win the game

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Fantasy, Medieval, Memory, Negotiation, Party Game, Political
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Role Playing, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Potocracy
description:
Potocracy is an exciting new board game where you capitalize and monopolize the cannabis industry in each state. Build your business, rake in the profits, take down the competition.

You collect the required cards and cash to setup a business in a state. This may include cards for legalizing cannabis in the state if it is not legal yet. Cards can also be collected to take over an opponent's business, to federally legalize cannabis, or to stop opponent actions.

Each state business progresses through:

* not owned
* Medical business
* Recreational business
* Greenhouse added

Businesses are subject to takeover until the business is monopolized with a Greenhouse.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Project Z: Male Survivors
description: Contains 10 male survivors and includes a weapons options sprue for even more variety. Also includes game cards unique to this expansion set.

name: Backpackers Race
description:
Backpackers Race is a fun family game of boycott and cooperation with your friends, whose main objective is to know the world, traveling through all the continents, without the other players discovering in which country you are hiding.

The game method consists of playing country cards from your hand to the table; Pass at least one turn in each country, without being discovered, and add it to your passport as a visited country. Through Questions the other players will try to guess your current country; If they do, they will take your country and add it to their passport. This is a turn based game. Each player may only play cards from his hand.

The Countries are the objective of the game. In your turn, and only once per turn, you can travel to a new country: simply lower it from your hand face down to the table.

Your mission begins in Antarctica, where your spaceship lands. Your goal is to "CIRCLE THE WORLD" or "COMPLETE YOUR PASSPORT" before your companions do, keeping you alive and without being discovered. To CIRCLE THE WORLD you have to visit the 6 Continents of the game. To COMPLETE YOUR PASSPORT it is necessary to have 10 countries visited.

—description from the designer
categories: Educational, Print & Play, Space Exploration, Travel
mechanics: Memory, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Team-Based Game

name: Magic Penguins
description:
Be the last man standing by using your magic penguins to squash the other player's butterflies.

Players will use their army of wizard penguins to defeat the other players. Each player has butterflies to represent their hit points. Once they are all squashed they are out of the game.

There are 4 different types of penguins. Blue Wizards squash butterflies, Green Wizards heal butterflies, Orange Wizards Shield and protect butterflies and the Red Wizards counter spells.

On each player's they will draw 2 cards and then may play as many as one penguin type as they want, or pass to build up their hand. For a many penguins as the same type is played, that many Red penguins are needed to counter the spell, all or none. Players may combine their counters to stop a spell. Momentary alignment, don't be fooled they are still going to squash your butterflies as soon as they can.
Once a player has all their butterflies squashed they are out and can't get back in, last man with a least one butterfly left, wins the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Common Wealth
description:
This a post-apocalyptic stock trading game.The World ended, and now it is re-building. Race to be the first millionaire int he new world. Players will be encouraging their commodities to be the new currency for the world to trade with.

Each player will control a commodity they can use to barter, trade and work to increase or decrease the value of. The value of the commodities will be tracked on the game board. On player's turn they will have 4 actions points to move, and perform their actions such as, pick up cards, trade commodities, collect a commodity, collect gold, increase a value of a commodity or decrease the value of a commodity.

Each game will turn out and play differently. There is only so much of each commodity you will need to collect yours and other players goods. Each time a player collects another players commodity they collect one also. If someone manages to collect more of yours than you do, you may need to work to decrease the value of it. What becomes popular changes in every game.
