There is also gold in the game, and every time someone collects gold, it's value decreases and never can go back up.

Once a player has a million dollars worth of value, the game ends and everyone counts their total to see who wins. It is very common if one player reaches the threshold other players also have as well.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Point to Point Movement

name: Damn It Joe!!!
description:
A hilarious trick taking game with a twist, that will make you say "Damn it Joe".

The is a flag ship game for my company. All the damn it cards have my face( Joseph Roche or Joe) on them.

The game is a trick taking game. The first player plays a number and any amount of that number, the next player must if able play a higher number card, they can choose how many of that number they want to play, does not need to be the same amount as previous player. Players continue playing until no one is able to play a higher number, the last player to play a card takes the pot of cards. The numbers on the card are red or green, 2 of each from each number. Red cards a negative 1 point, and the green cards positive 1 point. Whoever gets the cards may or may not want them.
This where the Damn Cards comes in, with a few other choice words tend to follow. Everyone starts with a "Damn It Joe" and "Damn You Joe" card. At any time during the hand or wait till the last number card is played, use their Damn It Joe card to end the round and choose who gets the cards. If it good give them to yourself, if bad send it to your enemy, but then if some one plays their Damn It Joe Card, any player can use their Damn You Joe card to trump the round and then they get to select a player to receive the cards. The Damn cards can only be used once per entire hand, so use them wisely.
After all the number cards are played, players will count their total, high score wins the hand. If a player wins 2 hands in a row or 3 hands total, they win the game. The player who won the previous hand generally tends to get all the hate, and the cursing tend to increase, and it's hilarious.

—description from the publisher

name: Envy Me
description:
During a dream, I watch a game being played. Immediately after waking up I wrote down everything about the game. With in a week I had my first prototype, and after the first play test, I realized dream rules and reality doesn't match. Few months of development later, the game is amazing and ready to go.

This is an anti-worker placement game, the game plays as a worker placement game, but almost everything you do will help you and your opponents, with your opponents getting a better benefit than you. Don't worry they are dealing with the same situation, figuring out how to optimize every move to take make their score at the end of the game the highest.

Every time you play the game the game layout is different. For each player player there is an addition tile grid added, the grid system is mixed and laid out randomly each round of the game. No player can memorize best moves, because that will change every game. There is 3 round per game, each round depending on the amount of players and players playing speed, between 15 to 30 minutes.

This is a heavier strategy game, if you like games where every move is important and the wrong move can cost you dearly, then this is the game for you.

—description from the publisher

name: Stitched Art
description:
Stitched Art: Create your own master pieces by stitching together different art works. Creating artworks with all their matching pieces or all from different designs gives you the best score.

The game contains 6 different art designs, and 2 sets of each. The art designs are divided up into 4 x 4 tile pieces. Each player starts the game with one piece of a design.

One a players turn they draw from either the face down draw pile or the top tile of the discard pile(once the pile has been created). with the new tile will if able connect to the piece they already have, there are stitch nodes on the sides of the tiles, if at least one of the nodes colors match they can connect it, for every matching node they get a point. If a player finds the entire set, that is worth 16 points, but if each piece of the 4 x 4 design is from a different art design, then the player get a 5 point bonus, which can be more or less than 16 points.

Once the draw pile is empty or a player completes 3 art designs the game is over, the players count their score to see who won. The game is about 10 to 15 minuets long, having to give in and not waiting for the perfect piece will happen.

—description from the publisher

name: War: Battle of two kingdoms
description:
War, Battle of Two Kingdoms is a team vs team card game. Use your army of knights, archers and wizards to destroy the other team's castle.

Both teams will have 3 team members,each controlling a different army type, each with their own card deck. Any deck not controlled by a human player, will have their top card played each turn.

Each player starts with their deck of cards, shuffle and draw 3 cards. Each turn, all players will play one card from their hand, or top card of a deck not controlled by a player. You can tell your team what you are planning to do, but then the other team will hear you, you may not show your hand to your team.
The cards will be flipped up at the same time and played out in alphabetical order. Generally, the wizard will play first, casting a spell on the battle field, followed by the archers to kill as many knights as possible, then the team that has the most knights left over after the wizard's and the archer's onslaught will destroy an enemy's wall.

Each deck has their ultra actions, wizards have a fireball to annihilate all cards played this turn and remove them from the game and destroy a wall from both team's castle.
Archers can kill a enemy's wizard before they cast their spell.
Knight have a Juggernaut which is very hard to defeat and almost every time destroy the enemy's castle wall.

All cards in each player's deck will be used, once a player plays a card they will redraw at the end of the turn, but once the draw pile is used up, players will use the remaining cards in their hand before reshuffling their cards.

Goal of the game is to destroy the other teams castle, first team to destroy the other team's castle wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game

name: GameRox
description:
Be the first player to finish all five GameRox levels. Each level involves tossing and catching different combinations of GameRox. Each player takes five GameRox in on hand, tosses them in to the air, and tries to catch as many as possible on the back of the same hand. Whoever catches the most goes first.

Players are only allowed to toss, pick up, nudge, and catch GameRox with one hand at a time. After you have tossed the GameRox into the air, you are allowed to nudge any GameRox in the play area closer together using the same hand as long as you continue catching the tossed GameRox.

Level 1: Cast your GameRox over the play area. Pick and throw one GameRox into the air. Pick up a second GameRox from the play surface, then catch the tossed GameRox. If you succeed, keep tossing and picking up a single GameRox until you have picked up all four GameRox. You can set one GameRox aside after picking it up. If you drop a GameRox, it’s the next player’s turn. Once you succeed in picking up all four GameRox, move to Level 2.

Level 2: Pick up two at a time.

Level 3: Pick up three or one at a time.

Level 4: Pick up four at a time.

Level 5: Put all five GameRox in the palms of your hands. Toss them into the air and try to catch all five on the backs of your hands. Then, with the GameRox, still on the back of your hands, toss the GameRox into the air again and catch all five in the palms of your hands.

Redo Points
The points on the flat side of the GameRox are Redo Points. Each time you cast your GameRox, add up the numbers that land face up. You can spend 5 Redo Points to redo a toss if you drop a GameRox, or 20 Redo Points to skip an entire level.

—description from the designer

name: Soy What?!
description:
Soy What?! is a sweet and fun card game that plays vegans and meat eaters in a spicy battle for the best meals.

Goal:
The goal of the game is to collect the most food points and not get food poisoning.

Setup:
Each player gets a secret role (vegan or meat eater) and a food allergy card. Additionally every player gets 5 cards.
All other playing cards are stacked in the deck which is placed in the middle. Then the game starts clockwise.

Gameplay:
During the game, players place food cards on the playing field and after that always take a card from the deck.
The points on each card count for either vegans or meat eaters - some cards always count.
If certain criteria are met, the active player can or must take all cards placed. These cards then count as one meal.
A player can only have three meals. If he obtains a fourth, his first meal must be taken out of the game.

End of the Game:
The game ends after the deck is empty and the last meal is played out. Then players reveal their roles and allergies.
If one of the collected food cards contains an allergy that the player has - the player is out.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Metro Maps
description:
Metro Maps is a board game all about building and matching shapes, while stopping your opponent from doing the same. Players must build stations and lines to complete the route shown on their card, it’s as simple as that. The tricky bit? You will need to combine multiple routes together as efficiently as possible while spending your resource cards in order to stand a chance of winning. Other players can block you at any time and if you don’t match your route exactly, you loose points.

Featuring artwork and gameplay inspired by the London Underground map, Metro Maps is a fast paced strategy game for between 2 and 4 players recommended for ages 13 to adult.

—description from the publisher

name: Ajechis
description:
Ajechis is a fun family board game where chess pieces join the parcheesi board to make the game more fun, dynamic and strategic.

It is played with a dice, a current parcheesi board and 5 chips (Pawn, Horse, Tower, Bishop and Queen or King) for each of the players (Yellow, Blue, Red and Green). Each player's chips are the same color. The objective of the game is for each player to take their chips from the start to the goal; trying, along the way, to eat others. The first to get it will be the winner.

Like parcheesi, it is a turn-based game, where you can only move your chips in your turn. In your turn you must choose to roll the dice (and move one of your chips that number of squares), or make a special move with one of your chips. At the end of your move, and its consequences, the turn passes to the next player.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: BS Button Game
description:
Based on the already popular games Doubt, Cheat, and Bullshit, BS Button Game is a shedding game for 2-6 players. The deck contains 52 standard playing cards featuring original art, two jokers, and two bureaucrats. Any player can call a bluff by pushing the BS Button which flashes red and calls bullshit with one of 60 random celebrity impressions.

The joker and bureaucrat cards allow play with as few as two players.

Jokers and bureaucrats are wild. Additionally, any player who holds a bureaucrat and has incorrectly called a bluff or has been called on a bad bluff can play the bureaucrat and override the call. Whoever plays the bureaucrat redetermines the next card and plays it.

Play continues until one player discards every card while avoiding a valid call of bullshit.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Electronic, Humor, Mature / Adult

name: BS Button Game: Expansion Pack
description:
BS Button Game Expansion Pack offers a new spin on shedding games like Doubt, Cheat, and Bullshit. It includes a sound button, True Blue, which flashes bright blue and calls bullshit 70 different ways, 52 standard playing cards with original art, and a new wild card, the activist.

The addition of the activist card allows stand alone play with three to six players. BS Button Game Expansion Pack can also be combined with BS Button Game to accommodate up to twelve players.

The activist is wild and can be played to call a rank out of sequence and force an opponent to discard that card or to bluff. Players have the option of hitting the BS Button anytime they suspect a bluff.

The first player who discards every card while avoiding a valid call of bullshit wins.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Songs From the Axe and Fiddle
description:
Songs from the Axe and Fiddle presents a collection of brand-new ways for you to explore the world of Fall of Magic.

Each “Song” includes a new introduction, names, titles, setup, and prompts that focus on a particular character, or part of the world. Use them as a introduction to a longer Fall of Magic game, play them in sequence, or play them between sessions of your regular game of Fall of Magic.

The four Songs included in this collection are:

Song of the Fugitive
Song of the Swineherd
Song of the Deep
Song of the Stormwing

—description from the publisher

name: Legends of Wrestling: Expansion Pack 2
description:
The second Legends color expansion pack, with a focus on southeastern US wrestlers. This game edition includes 10 new game cards and a printed handbook featuring bios for all wrestlers.

Wrestlers included are: Barry Windham, Brad Armstrong, Magnum T.A., Tully Blanchard, Blackjack Mulligan, Ivan Koloff, Sam Houston, Johnny Valentine, Jimmy Valiant and the Masked Superstar

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Sports

name: Legends of Wrestling: Expansion Pack 3
description:
The legendary Stan Hansen makes his LOW debut in Legends Expansion III! Hansen is an international superstar with ties to many of the current LOW roster. Will he reform his devastating tag team with Brusier Brody? Will he target former rival Nick Bockwinkel? Your promotion is about to be turned upside down! The set includes the following wrestlers.

Steve “Mr. Electricity” Regal, Nick Bockwinkel, Ray Stevens Stan Hansen, Mad Dog Vachon, Red Bastein, Larry Zybysko, Butcher Vachon, The Crusher and Billy Red Lyons.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Sports

name: Rome & Carthage: Bonus Cards
description:
4 bonus cards bonus cards available at Spiel 2012 and distributed with Plato magazine #59 (September 2013).

These cards are useful with the 'Rapid Conquest' advanced rule, which is included in the rules booklet.
categories: Ancient, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Le Tour de France des Petits Chauffeurs
description:
"The tour de France by young age drivers".
The board game theme - Take a Tour de France rally by car.
The fastest driver wins the game.
It is typical spin and move board game.
Great looking metal cars representing automobiles of the time.

—user summary

name: Heroes of Arcannis
description:
Heroes of Arcannis is a competitive dungeon crawler game for 2-4 players. There are Monsters to slay and Legendary Items to collect! Heroes battle their way through a Quest Line until they are strong enough to secure solo victory over the ‘End Boss’. Each Boss has its own unique set of abilities that not only make the Boss itself an epic battle, but each Boss will also affect how other monsters throughout the game interact with our Heroes, making each game its own unique adventure!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Surrounded!: With a Shotgun
description:
In Surrounded! With a Shotgun you and up to three friends are holed up in an isolated building surrounded on all sides by vicious hoodlums intent on your demise.

Fortunately, you are well armed and know they are coming. However, if they get to the building faster than you can take them out, you will be overrun. Can you survive being Surrounded! With a Shotgun?

Players win by either surviving a 25 card deck or by eliminating all hoodlums. Each round a card is drawn to indicate where new hoodlums enter the game, and where they will advance. Then each player gets to take a number of actions indicated on the card. These actions will usually be to shoot at hoodlums, but you could also move or build barricades.

1 to 4 players with custom boards for each player count.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Godsland
description:
Godsland – A board game which unites 5 mythologies: Greek, Egyptian, Norse, Chinese and Georgian. Choose your favorite mythology and lead your nation to victory. Use mythical creatures and other warriors to conquer lands and become the only ruler of this world. Bring glory to your nation by wise and proper strategy plans. NO LUCK! Everything is in your hands! Nothing limits your decisions. The only limit is your enemy. You will feel the real taste of strategy game when you rule the country based on your skills and not luck. 3D miniature figures, different boards, effective system for controlling resources, tokens, different cards. all this in one game – Godsland!

During the game you will have to make decisions as you have different options: taking resources, recruiting soldiers, attacking neighbor territories, selling different resources to get more gold, upgrading villages, breaking and building bridges, using god’s powers, mythical creatures
It is crucial to have a good strategy in this game as everything depends on you. To become the mighty ruler you will have to control at least 15 territories.

Beside your warriors you will have to use mythical creatures to defeat your enemies. During the game you will get some cards where can be blessing or fury from your gods. Those might help you for achieving your goals or on the opposite benefit your enemies.

—description from the designer
categories: Fantasy, Miniatures, Mythology, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Finding Fluffy
description:
Finding Fluffy is a tile based, competitive, path laying game where two to four players race to find their lost pets.

The game comes with two sets of rules, Basic which can be played by children as young as five. In this version the players are just placing tiles and trying to find their pet in the most efficient way, this teaches the kids logic solving and basic mathematics.

The second set of rules, Advance, is aimed at kids who understand how the basic game works and want more of a challenge and also adults looking for a short strategy game. In this version tiles placed by individual players count towards end game scoring in different ways.

The game plays in around thirty minutes and is beautifully illustrated by Mary Cousins.

—description from the designer

name: Heroes of History: Tales Of The Ancient Greece
description:
The game Heroes of History: Tales Of The Ancient Greece is in many ways a varied entertainment for adventurer, fans of history, friends of cooperative games and many more. You will play through fictitious stories of the Greek mytholgy. Therefore the players take on the role of the Heroes Hercules, Achilles, Hector and Atalante. The Heroes have to fulfill various tasks before a certain amount of enemies reach a particular field. The Heroes will be confronted with both predictable and unpredictable situations which occur through certain decisions taken by the cooperative group, as well as through specific action cards. The story will take a good ending if all story goals have been achieved on time. All stories are built on each other and are divided into 14 chapters each. All of them will be connected by the Meta story of the Kingdom of Knossos.

NOW COMPATIBLE WITH ANVL.CO HEROES!!!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Mythology, Puzzle

name: Diaspora: Flight
description:
A unique engine building board game where you pilot a generation ship to a distant planet. Every turn, you must choose how your crew spends their lives - installing new parts on your ship, working in those facilities to increase the Crew you have available, creating immortal Drones and innumerable Clones to take their place, or resting comfortably with ample time to raise the next generation.

As your ship approaches the planet, you must carefully balance the needs of your ship with the future needs of your colony. Once the planet is reached, the Crew you have in stasis on your ship will determine which among you can start the most successful colony.
Humanity has a chance for a new start. You could lead what is left of us into a bright future on our new home.

Each game features a randomized sub-set of available Parts for you ship and Landing Sites that determine scoring. Every game will play differently. Bidding Fuel to outrace the other ships determines what Parts you can buy every turn, while Influence can be used to determine additional rules every ship must adhere to. Simultaneous turns keep the action moving and everyone engaged.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Modular Board, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: getCrewd
description:
Here's $40 million. Produce a movie. Crew-up. Get a Director +Actor +5 Crew cards to win. It's all in the Cards. It's your backstage pass to movie-making. Strategic-Competitive-No Trivia

Each player is a Producer.
1. Game play starts by dealing each Producer one 'Budget Card'
'Budget Cards' range from $36-$43 million, in 4 different genres)
2. Deal each Producer 3 'Crew Cards'
(For groups over 5, deal 4 'Crew Cards' each)
3. Stack Action Deck + Crew Deck in middle of table.
4. Producer with the lowest budget goes first.
a. Pickup 'Crew Card'
b. Then discard a 'Crew Card' from your hand to optimize your hand. Discarded card forms your Discard pile. Each Producer will have a Discard Pile.
c. Read Action Card aloud to everyone....do what it says.
5. Play continues clockwise.
All future turns gets to select a Crew Card from the Deck or from the top card of another Producer's discard pile.

Winning Hand is:
7 Crew Cards (Actor+Director in your genre, plus 5 Crew)
No Duplicates
Stay on or under budget

FYI -
1. getCrewd is built for anyone who's watched one movie
2. Game is packaged in a round retro-style Hollywood film can
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Space Empire
description:
Build a trade empire across the galaxy and stop your rivals from doing the same.

There’s a whole galaxy to explore - and it fits in a mint tin. You are an interplanetary trader, building your empire from the galaxy's many and varied Worlds.

Every turn you will use two actions to build rows of matching resources by playing new World cards or upgrading your Worlds. Will you expand with more Worlds, or stack as much as you can on your existing Worlds before your foes hit you with a downgrade?

—description from the designer
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Melding and Splaying, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Take That

name: Crooked Revenue
description:
Crooked Revenue is a card game about getting rich quick in ways that laws and respectable people might not agree with. Compete with your opponents to be the thief who walks away with the gem, by any means necessary.

Featuring

Easy-to-learn gameplay
Hand-drawn artwork
Quick rounds
Educates you in the art of stealing from people
Helps you figure out which of your friends you should keep your wallet away from


Basically, it plays like the children's game Old Maid but in reverse. If Old Maid had briefcases, cameras, and shady characters.

There's a single gem card hidden somewhere in the deck, and the player who holds it at the end of the game is the winner.

Spend your turn either drawing cards, stealing from your opponents, or playing from your hand as you try to piece together who holds the prize. Once you figure it out, take it and make sure that you get to keep it!

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Gaons & Golems
description:
Blurb:
Last Gaon Standing wins
Summon up to 4 Golems to help you
Simple mechanics, fast paced
2-4 players
2 player game lasts about 5 minutes
A balance of Luck and Strategy
It's sort of like Chess with Dice, sort of

Game-play:
The board has 113 spaces, each player controls a Gaon (like a wizard) and starts with 1 Golem.
Players take turns rolling a D6 to get their number of moves.
Moves can be split between any of your play pieces (Gaon and Golems).
If you score a 6 you can trade your moves to summon a new Golem, up to a max of 4.

Goal of the game:
The aim is to defeat your opponents Gaon.

Game-play:
If you have a play piece next to an opponent play piece you can choose to attack.
Each player rolls a D6, highest wins.
If you score the same the attacker wins.
The loser loses a life, the Gaon starts with 3 lives but Golems only have one.
So when a Golem loses a battle they are dead and removed from the board.

You can also make a Combi-attack if you have more than 1 play piece next to the same opponent piece.
In a combi-attack you add 1 to the dice roll for each additional piece attacking.
Each piece can only attack once per round so you can choose between making individual attacks or combi-attacks or not attacking at all.

More blurb:
The prototype game has some cute play pieces and there's a token to keep track of Gaon's lives.

Like chess it's a game of protect your king and kill their king, where here the king is your Gaon.
Instead of pawns and knights and bishops to help you, your army comes from rolling a 6 and summoning a Golem.

The strategy element comes from the decisions of who, how and when to attack and when to run away.

The luck element has a major effect on gameplay and the tables can turn very quickly making for an exciting bout.

—description from the designer

name: El shaman urbano
description:
A research game at your fingertips.

Strategy card game, based on the novel of "El Shaman Urbano", which parodies research novels

On each turn, players can incriminate a character by adding an object to the crime scene or selecting the one they believe has been publicly guilty. Win who discovers who is to blame at the end of the game/

Un juego de investigación al alcance de su mano.

Juego de cartas de estrategia, basado en la novela de El shaman urbano, que parodia las novelas de investigación
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Humor, Murder/Mystery, Novel-based

name: Tin Thau: The Board Game
description:
Tin Thau - The Board Game is a board game about Taiwanese Parade Formation. By combining it to the game mechanics and character arts. We hope to let people learn about it easily while playing the game happily.

Parade Formation is a unique and iconic cultural assets originated from Taiwan. Some performance group like Chio-Tian Folk Drums & Art Troupe, Na-Cha Folk & Arts Troupe, also perform overseas several times, and gain a lot of reputation internationally. But in Taiwan locally, this culture does not be valued as much, and the younger generation are lack of knowledge about it, even have some negative prejudice. Therefore, we want to create a simple fun way, to let the people know what this culture is stand about.
During the game, player represent different parade formation, lead your own team travel across the city, and complete the gods’ missions. Every turn player draw a lot to decide moving distance, there is also a chance player trigger event while moving, and need to throw dividing blocks to the determine the aftermath.

—description from the designer

name: Jenga Ocean
description:
Jenga Ocean is a variant of Jenga. It is played like Jenga, but approximately half the blocks have marine animals printed on them, and players earn 1 point for each animal they collect. The player who caused the tower to fall loses 5 points.
—user summary

Jenga Ocean is the first board game to be made from recycled plastic fishing nets.

Discarded fishing nets have been identified as the most harmful form on plastic pollution in the ocean. Endangering sea life, discarded nets entangle thousands of marine mammals each year. By supporting the collection and recycling of these harmful materials, Jenga Ocean helps protect sea life and marine ecosystems.

Jenga Ocean is made from over 25 square feet of recycled fishing nets, proudly sourced from Bureo's recycling program. Founded in 2012 by surfers who love the ocean, Bureo works with communities along the coast of Chile to collect and recycle discarded fishing nets.
—description from the publisher

name: JW Studio Maker
description:
JW Studio Maker is a fast-paced tabletop experience! Each player takes on the role of a Movie Producer working for the world-renowned Billionaire JW and his newly formed movie studio. Collectively players will have access to over $100 million to gather talent in the form of Directors, Casts, and Writers. The winner is determined by the amount of money each player’s movies have earned by the end of the game.

JW Studio Maker is played over several rounds, each round representing one week of movie production. As the Producer, players assemble movies by choosing from the best available talent and combining their star power to generate revenue at the box office. Participate in intense bidding wars, win awards, deal with disgruntled employees, and most of all make movies!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Ezrok Wargame System: Ezrok the Warlord
description:
Ezrok the Warlord is a free print & play module set that uses the Ezrok Wargame System (EWS). The EWS framework is a minimalistic hex & counter wargame system designed for quick play. This set consists of five modules; each having its own map, counters and other materials. The modules in this set take place in the era where Ezrok leads a portion of the Army of the Protector. It is during this time that Ezrok advances his skills in warfare strategy.

The modules include:


Bloodbath at Altar Hill
Scourge of the Wolfmen Beasts
Engagement with the Ice Elves
Adventure in the Mouth of Hell
Rise of the Last Sorcerer


—description from the designer

name: Ezrok Wargame System: Ezrok the Border Marshal
description:
Ezrok the Border Marshal is a free print & play module set that uses the Ezrok Wargame System (EWS). The EWS framework is a minimalistic hex & counter wargame system designed for quick play. This set consists of five modules; each having its own map, counters and other materials. The modules in this set take place in the era where Ezrok accepts the post of border marshal. It is during this time that Ezrok is entrusted with safeguarding the outer borders of the heartland.

The modules include:


Madness of the Minotaur Cult
Dawn of the Black Dragons
Marauders of the Wasteland
Trouble on Troll Mountain
Evil in a Dead Forest


—description from the designer

name: Ezrok Wargame System: Ezrok the Protector
description:
Ezrok the Protector is a free print & play module set that uses the Ezrok Wargame System (EWS). The EWS framework is a minimalistic hex & counter wargame system designed for quick play. This set consists of five modules; each having its own map, counters and other materials. The modules in this set take place in the era where Ezrok has become king of Calatar. It is during this time that Ezrok must resolve internal conflicts within the heartland; along with indulging a series of dangerous hunting expeditions.

The modules include:


Conflict in Ardon
Conspiracy of Blood
Hunt for the Wild Griffin
Storm of the Grey Mastodons
The Giant Boar of Valadur


—description from the designer

name: Ezrok Wargame System: Ezrok â The Lost Adventures
description:
Ezrok — The Lost Adventures is a free print & play module set that uses the Ezrok Wargame System (EWS). The EWS framework is a minimalistic hex & counter wargame system designed for quick play. This set consists of five modules; each having its own map, counters and other materials. The modules in this set take place in various periods of Ezrok’s life, and are considered to be his lesser known exploits.

The modules include:


Invasion of the Amazons
Assault of the Arctic Beastmen
Fury of the Lizard Men
War of the Damned
Lair of the Muck Monsters


—description from the designer

name: Gearworks: Yakyong Promo Card
description:
A promo tinkerer card that can be used in place of the other red tinkerer (Bartleby).

Ability: "When replacing a gear card, take the card you replaced to hand."
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Monolith: Board Game System
description:
Monolith is the core or basal element of a new entertainment system reported in the form of the board game or the Monolith system.
The system sees Monolith as the central element which is the base box comparable to the classic concept of Console.
The central element of the "Monolith" system is interpreted as a console

Inside the box there are in fact the cardid elements, such as the player's dashboard (pad), dice, cubes, dividing screens, etc., which will be inserted with the components present in the boxes that the player decides to purchase. So as to give shape to the game you chose to play with, generating a completely new and engaging game experience
A Monolith box allows you to support a minimum of 2 players up to a maximum of 6, depending of course on the game you want to play with.
The games currently available for this platform are: Browl Inn, Atomic World, Terror

Browl Inn: competitive fight simulator for 2 to 6 players with an average duration of 30 ’per game
Atomic World: cooperative game for 3 to 4 players with an average duration of 60 ’per game
Terror: semi-competitive management from 2 to 5 players with an average duration of 45 ’per game

name: Angel Investor
description:
Angel Investor is a deck-building game for 2 to 4 players. Players are investors competing to become the most famous before they run out of money. The game is presented as a satire on silicon-valley start-up culture with card art that depicts anthropomorphic animals taking part in exaggerated acts of office politics.

It features unique deck-building mechanics where all players modify cards in every "start-up" deck. It was designed by an artificial intelligence consulting company using their algorithms to optimize balance through simulation and boasts a simultaneously chaotic and high skill game as a result.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Investment

name: What To Where!?
description:
You're going places! But what you take on your journey isn't up to you to decide, and the the people who are "packing your bag" don't know exactly where you're going. Still, they're doing their best, and you'll pick the person who packs the best combination of items for you. Between you, you'll figure out What goes to Where.

What To Where!? is a hilarious party game of questions, answers, and storytelling.

The game is played in rounds - play one round or play 20, whatever you want. Each round, one player (called the Traveler) secretly takes a Destination card which indicates where they're going. The other players have a predetermined number of Question Actions denoted by chips, and in the center of the table a pile of Item Tiles, all unique. All at the same time, the players who are not the Traveler sift through the Items, trying to pick the very best set of four for the Traveler to take with them. Meanwhile, the players may cash in chips to ask limited Questions that will narrow down where the Traveler is going.

Once all of the Question Actions have been taken (all the chips spent), the Traveler reveals their Destination and all players reveal the Items they selected. Then everyone gets a chance to tell a story to justify why they picked what they did. The Traveler chooses who "packed" the set of items and declares that player the winner for the round.

—description from the publisher

name: Yacht Club
description:
Players are influential socialites and moguls in their world of excess, who enjoy impressing each other with their bottomless wealth. They will try to one-up each other bidding during auctions, designing and building the most luxurious yachts, and also engage in a bit of "take that". Players will wheel and deal, swindle and steal ... stepping on one another as they climb the ladder to success.

Whoever owns the most prestigious fleet in the Yacht Club at the end of the game will be the envy of the "1 %".

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction: Once Around, Auction/Bidding, Events, Hand Management, Investment, Set Collection, Take That

name: Terra Incognita: Real Theory of Everything
description:
Terra Incognita: Real Theory of Everything is a game in which players represent one of two factions: scientists or conspiracy theorists. They must decide once and forever: is Earth flat or spherical?

During the game, players build a deck by selecting the appropriate cards from one of the factions. In this way, players can accumulate points of Hidden Truths or Science which can then be used to change the world. Literally!

Points of Hidden Truths and Science allow the player to buy tiles that are used to build a map of the whole world. It’s up to them if Earth will be flat or not! It ensures appropriate actions which can strengthen your decks.

At the very end – there can only be one winner! The person who wins is going to be the most powerful and - very likely - will change the face of the world forever!

Highlights:

A great combination of classical deck-building mixed with tile-placement game. The world hasn’t seen something like that yet! Call your mom, call your boss, and gather a team to play! The unique, fresh mechanics and immersive experience of a dynamic, interesting play for gamers on every age is seriously mind blowing! You simply cannot miss that.
An incredible sense of humor - get your sores ointment ready, because as a result of compulsive laughter caused by the game you will have to lubricate your cheeks and stomach!
Be whoever you want in the game - we won’t judge!


Do you want to prove that Earth is flat, vaccines cause autism, governments poison us using chemtrails, UFO kidnaps people, everything is caused by Illuminati, Big Foot and Loch Ness Monster exist? Now you can!
Do you want to save the world from these above and you believe in science? In this game you can even land on Mars and design a new cancer vaccine to benefit mankind, so let’s go!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Tile Placement

name: Soothsayer
description:
The Head Oracle is gravely ill. A terrible storm has torn through the land, filling the people with fear. They turn to you; oracles of the temple, sacred predictors of the future. You must guide them.

You will take on the roll of oracles and vie for the favor of the ailing head of your temple. Constellation cards dictate star patterns you must create on the shared board, but also possible interpretations for the prophecy; matching these carefully to create the oracles' signature rhyming couplets will lead to victory.

If you survey the board and do not like your odds for the future, you may also turn to the past for aid. Each game one of ten possible supplicants will be chosen at the beginning of play. Their branching past will be revealed as cards are played, and with it, shrines offering powerful abilities will awaken.

View the past, predict the future, and outwit your opponents to prove yourself worthy of becoming the next Head Oracle.

-description from the designer
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Pattern Building, Storytelling

name: Jungle Rumble: Meowtopia â Promo Personal Board & Kitten Tiles
description: Add one more personal board and 6 kitten tiles.

name: Kutu Buku: A Game of Nerdy Talks
description: Kutu Buku: A Game of Nerdy Talk is a social-party game that combines the elements of trivia game with bluffing. In turns, players will be the Active Player who talks about certain topic. Active Player has to choose whether they want to tell the story truthfully or fabricate it. The other players will discuss it, then they will vote either the story is a fact or faked. Active Player and others who guess correctly will get point(s) as many as the number of players who guess otherwise. Try not to be too predictable, since if all the players voted unanimously and correctly, you will get penalty! The game will run until 2 rounds, or 1 round if we play with 6-8 players.
categories: Bluffing, Educational, Humor, Party Game, Trivia

name: Empress: Fight To the Top
description:
Empress is a world of exotic steam and punk in which a one-eyed despot rules supreme. It is a world of indentured peons and hardworking mules, traveling tinker bands and perspiring fixers bathed in furnace glow. Merchantmen anchor off far-flung ports while rank upon rank of Her Majesty's rifles assemble in faceless obedience. A darkened corner could turn up one of Turing's programmatic spies while, ensconced underground, seers break through into a kaleidoscope of forbidden futures. Here, there are dukes (one mad), princelings with dark pasts and kings and queens of uncertain allegiance. Overhead, her Highness's trusted fighting aces rule the skies; beneath, her elephantine automatons shake the very ground.

In this realm, the all-seeing, all-knowing tentacles of the Great Empress reach far and wide. So wide, in fact, that many have despaired of freedom and—at a glance of her one baleful eye—life itself. But there is hope: a tale overheard in the fevered ruminations of a nameless prophet speaks of a day when one of her subjects will approach the throne, wrench the cephalopodic scepter from her grasp and end the reign of terror. But who?

Welcome to Empress, a climbing game of cunning, strategy and power. The premise? Be the first to shed all of your cards and ascend the throne of the Great Empress. But beware—a tragic misstep and you could find yourself wallowing in drudgery as a Peon or Mule. Empress may be played with any number of players from 2 to 8 (add a second deck for 5 or more).

—description from the publisher

name: Time Editors
description:
2-4 Players
Ages 12+
30 min. per player

SUMMARY:
In the year 2475 world nations race to save the past and control the use of time travel.

STORY:
The amount of anomalies created through time travel in the 25th century has become a major world concern. The FTCN (Federation of Time-Traveling Capable Nations) has voted that all nations must give up their time travel capabilities. A single task force of “time editors” (agents that specialize in changing the timeline) will be kept on standby in the event that they are needed to save humanity from any possible future disasters. Only the nation with the most skilled time editors will retain their use of time travel. The task force of time editors will be chosen through a “time editing” trial. The first nation to prevent four disastrous past events will retain the use of time travel and will have command of the official global task force of time editors.â

PLAY:
The game is a blend of:
• resource and economy management
• a worker placement system in the present and past
• storytelling

To win the game you must prevent 4 disastrous events in the past from happening.
Player mats have two halves - past and present. People and resources you take to the past can only be used in the past. People and resources you keep in the present can only be used in the present. Each player has 4 types of time editing specialists: Science, Technology, Military, and Politics. Specialists have unique abilities when they are in the present, but when they travel back in time to change the past you lose their abilities in the present.

You can send 1 to 4 specialists back in time if you have the necessary resources. Sending multiple, or all, at once will reduce the wormhole resources needed by reducing the number of time jumps (1 per turn). But keeping some specialists in the present will allow you to use their abilities to strengthen your economy, intelligence, and undermine other nations. Who and when you send where is your choice!

Each player is given unique disasters in the past that they will need to prevent. (There are 16 time lines with 80 unique events). In order to change the time line and prevent a disaster, you must change the events leading up to the disaster. Certain specialists are needed to change specific events but you can decide which event you travel to. Attempts at changing the time line involve storytelling (a game tester favorite!) and pulling tiles to create ripples through time.

In order to time travel and pay specialists to change the past, you will need an economy. There are over 130 possible economic setups with variable risk/reward factors. Players explore planets, build mining colonies, mine resources and transport them to Earth. Planets further from Earth have richer mining deposits but will take longer to reach (unless you can afford to create wormholes or pay to use other players’ wormholes).

Resources can only be used once they are returned to Earth, so you will need to plan ahead multiple turns for where/when your time ship will be and which specialists are where/when. Resources can be used to buy items for your economy, buy action cards (draw 3 & choose 1), open wormholes in space (for faster travel to planets), open wormholes in time (to change the past), pay time editing specialists to change the past, or hire A. I. to give you the probability of causing a time ripple.

—description from the publisher

name: Scratchees: Boomtown Baseball
description:
5 Different Boomtown Baseball Games

Free! Dr. Scratchov Scratcher!

disposable games to scratch, play & throw away

OBJECTIVE: The Boomtown "Bats" are hosting their archrivals, The Mudville "Muggers", in another classic confrontation at famous Boomtown Stadium! It's the top of the ninth, Neither team has scored. Who will win this critical game?

PREPARATION: Choose your team. The teams bat with a lineup of four batters picked at random from their full team of nine. A batter's lifetime "stats" are shown below his name. The batting order starts at the top (near the pitch indicators) and is repeated if necessary by returning to #1 as the fifth batter. Keep track of all base runner with pennies placed on the baseball diamond. The "Muggers" bat first.

HOW TO PLAY: The pitcher throws each ball by placing his finger tip on the pitch of his choice and announcing either "fast ball", "curve ball", or "slider". The other player then scratches any one of his four "swing" boxes" under the pitch for the player he has at bat (if all a batter's swing boxes are scratched for one type of pitch, the pitcher must throw something else). It will reveal one of the following results:

HR (Home Run) - It's a hit out of the park. The batter and all runners score.

X (Strike) - Get 3 strikes and the batter is out.

W (Walk) - The batter advances to first base.

G (Grounder) - It's a hit. The pitching team must play the ball. The pitcher scratches any one of his ten "Infield" squares to see the results of the play.

FB (Fly Ball) - It's a hit. The pitching team must play the ball. The pitcher scratches any one his ten "Outfield" squares to see the results of the play.

When and Grounder or Fly Ball is played by the pitcher the following things can result:
S (Single) - The batter and all runners advance one base.
D (Double) - The batter and all runners advance two bases.
T (Triple) - The batter and all runners advance three bases.
HR (Home Run) - The batter and all runners score.
O (Out) - The batter is out.
DP (Double Play) - The batter and the furthest advanced runner (if there is one) are out. Scratch two out squares on the scoreboard.

Keep track of "Runs" and "Outs" by scratching the squares left to right on the score board. After the "Muggers" have made three outs, the roles reverse and the "Bats" come up to the plate. After the "Bats" have three outs, the game is over. The team with the highest score wins. In the event of a tie, play another card for "extra innings".

SPECIAL HINT: You will notice, after playing a few games, that each of the nine batters on each team always bats exactly the same way every time. For example, Homer Bundy, the slugger Right Fielder for the "Muggers", always hits a home run if you pitch him a fast ball. The more you know about each batter, the better you can pick the right pitch or choose the right swing. Fast ball pitches tent to either be hit hard or get a strike. Sliders tend to produce grounders, and curve balls tend to produce a lot of fly balls and walks.

—user summary

name: Co-op
description:
Co-op is part simulation, part send-up, of the unique experience that is living in a housing cooperative ("co-op" for short). For the unacquainted, living in a co-op is similar to sharing a house with roommates, but with a lot more structure... Members of a co-op typically share responsibilities such as cooking and cleaning, while house rules are established during meetings through direct democracy. Resources, such as food (esp. granola) and utilities, are usually purchased by and shared amongst the members. CO-OP was developed by two seasoned (with sriracha) members of a real housing cooperative, as an attempt to game-ify the fun and complexity of collective living.

In the game, each player represents a housemate in the same co-op. Players must take 1 "action" on each of their turns, the most basic of which are Cleaning and Slacking Off. When a player Slacks Off, they convert some of the house's Cleanliness into their own Free Time (duh!)---this Free Time can be spent to gain points that help win the game. When a player Cleans, they gain access to Karma (by their good deeds), or may influence the very mechanics of the game by trying to pass a House Rule. Karma and Rules are represented by their own decks of cards: the Karma Cards confer secret advantages that may be played at a later opportune moment, while Rules are drafted from a row of 5 cards that are publicly displayed to all players.

It's worth noting that CO-OP is NOT a "cooperative game" (there are individual winners), and there can be a lot to keep track of if you want to best the other players (grrr). However, the play experience is usually quite casual---this is largely due to the Karma Cards, which each have their own co-op-y theme, and require the player to perform a mini-activity in order to gain the card's benefits. Some activities simply encourage players to share their life experience, while others might ask them to sing a song or tell a joke... something different every time! CO-OP is a blast with friends and family, and also a great way to break the ice with perfect strangers.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Acting, Constrained Bidding, Open Drafting, Race, Singing, Storytelling, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Imminent Collapse
description:
Imminent Collapse is a cooperative strategy game where players work together as the special operations team, Black Falcon. The team must gather Intel, secure designated Target Sites, and clear Rebel strongholds while managing their collective resources as well as mission time.

Game Play Overview

Arrange the 9 Sector tiles in any configuration.
Draw cards from the game deck to establish the sites of the Rebels, Intel, and Targets and place the colored cubes on those sites. Return those cards to the deck and shuffle it.
Each player will draw a certain number of cards to start the game.
Based on the locations of the Rebels, Intel, and Targets, players will place the Insertion and Extraction tiles adjacent to any of the Sector Tiles. All players start the game at the Insertion Point.
The game is divided into three 10 day Phases. Players try to acquire Intel cubes in Phase 1 and Rebel/Target cubes in Phase 1 and 2. The cubes can be used in Phase 3 to acquire various special abilities.
Each player can take three actions per turn. These actions include opening a Portal, acquiring Intel, capturing a Rebel, neutralizing a Target, trading cards with other players, or moving from one site to another. All actions can be repeated during a turn.
At the end of a turn, players can discard any number of cards and draw additional cards to meet the hand limit.
When all players have completed their turns, the Mission Tracker is advanced one day. By the end of Day 30, players must capture all Rebels, neutralized all targets, opened Portals at the Insertion and Extraction Points, and returned to the Extraction Point in order to win the game.


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Modular Board, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: Pontus Euxinus
description:
Before 1204, the Black Sea remained closed to foreign merchants. The Fourth Crusade facilitated its opening to Venetians who barely reaped any profits. Only after 1261, in competition with the Genoese, did the Venetians organize the first commercial activities related to high-value cargo. Despite the difficulties in recruiting and commanding the crews, the connections with the Black Sea were essential for the Venetian economy in the period.

At Pontus Euxinus, players take on the role of traders sailing the difficult Black Sea, with all its challenges, to earn profits for their family and reputation for their home. Throughout the game, players will need to not only make the most of the goods they transport, but also build ports along the huge coastline, build cities and establish influence at various points.

The game works through an innovative system of data use in which each round the parameters change and the players need a good planning to face the difficulties. Navigate, trade and exert your influence and be the great Black Sea trader in this strategy game that mixes tactics and luck.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Queue, Contracts, Market, Pick-up and Deliver, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Devil's Run: Route 666 Demolition Derby
description:
6 double sided Tiles which form the perfect circuit for a Demolition Derby and rules to make this version of Devil's Run refreshingly different, multiplayer and super exciting!

Also comes with three Race missions

The Bend tiles come with curved grids for the Demolition Derby and a square grid for use in normal Devil's Run games.

You will need a copy of the Devil's Run core game to use this Expansion Pack.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Fighting, Miniatures, Racing, Transportation, Travel

name: TenCo
description:
TenCo is an abstract strategy game for two players.

It contains classical Elements of games like chess and go, mixed in with a lot of inovations.

Goal of the game is to gain control of four fortresses or overthrow the opponents lord. Gaining dominance with your army or bring your opponents army to a halt are also possibilities to win.

Only the lord, his guards and a shield unit start the game on the board. You can muster new troops with resource points and throw them into the battle.

Every troop type is a specialist in one or more of the six attributes. Figures can jump, flank, take, destroy and restrain to influence the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Catch the Leader, Square Grid, Tug of War

name: Stiiki-World
description:
This is "Stiiki-World" a nice, colored, sferic wolrd, "Stiiked" in one word.
It was habitated by life-forming called "Stiiki".
The "Stiiki" was advanced up to beeing perfect creatures, amazing warriors, able archers and powerfull mages, everybodys with an unperfect genetic problem: Huge EGO.
Stiikis always been in fight, everyone think to be the best.
To exceed their limits Stiiki had learn to channel their EGO and turn it into unique skills.
Ok, we have 2 news.... the good one:
KING STIIK it was only one Stiik be able to peacekeeping and make an alleance called "Stiiki-Squad", with his huge and high-sounding EGO; this Stiiki-Squad was made-up with megalomaniac and boastful Stiiki never seen in Stiiki-World.
This Stiiki-Squad bring peace and order in all Stiiki-World.
The life expentacy of a Stiik is 30 minutes it's mean that the badly news is:
King Stiik is just died.

YOU HAVE TO RUN!
MAKE YOUR STIIKI-SQUAD, FACE OTHER MASTER-STIIK, GAIN THE KING-STIIK TITLE, BRING PEACE AND ORDER INTO STIIKI-WORLD!

Stiiki-World is tactical turn based game, totally sand-box for maps even for gameplay mode.
Many playable characters with uniques skills.
Very simple to learn but hardest to master it!
Few rules, extremely well balanced but it's tactical nature make in love pro-gamer and newbies.

—description from the designer

name: Pro Roma!
description:
“Rome don't pay traitors” (puts them to rule)

Pro Roma! is a strategy and management game in which players put themselves in the shoes of Rome senators with the goal to obtain power through their management to lead their faction to the hegemony .

To do this, first they must fight in the Senate to obtain Charges and be able to take control of the different areas of the city management: They must be efficient enough to be recognized by the people, making the City prosper and defending it from incursions. and dangers from its borders.

There are three phases: Election, Management and Event.
In the first phase players take resource cards and they must decide which card must be used to obtain votes, votes that later will be decisive to obtain Charges through a hidden betting mechanism, Charges like the Consul, the Edil or the Tribune. The game compensates those who obtain less relevant Charges giving them more possibilities to opt to better Charges.

In the second phase players will be able to perform the actions assigned to their Charges in a established order. For which they will have the resource cards that remain in their hand. The goal is to put their counters every time he can do a successfully action.

In the last phase maybe Rome must face a raid, for which the military investment that the players have made so far can be decisive for the victory.

The game will ends when a player uses all its counters, being declared the winner. On the other hand, an automatic victory is also possible if a player must use a counter when he doesn't have any counter in his reserve.

—description from the publisher

name: Äamba
description:
A card game for 2-5 players that resembles Uno, Mau Mau, Prší, Crazy Eights. It's fast paced, full of twists and turns, with pretty illustrations and czech school environment names.
The game is played with a 32-card pack. The aim is to be first to get rid of all of one's cards. But- you can get more cards due opponent's actions, you can be even get back into the game even though you have no cards left - simply twists and turns.

name: Birds of Prey: Missile With A Man In It
description:
Few aircraft embodied “the future” like the F-104 Starfighter. The shining needle-like gleaming metal fuselage and pressure-suit clad crew evoke spaceships more than aircraft. Lockheed’s legendary designer Kelly Johnson interviewed fighter crews during the Korean War and created a simple fighter that maximized performance. His team conceived of the smallest aircraft they could wrap around a powerful engine. The Starfighter served with many air forces around the globe, in roles from interceptor to nuclear bomber.

But reality was harsher than space age dreams. The F-104 gained its Missile With A Man In It nickname in an era when many spacecraft exploded in the first moments of flight. The Starfighter’s cutting-edge design and all-for-performance approach led to a career marred by far too many losses of aircraft and life.

Missile With A Man In It contains every F-104 Starfighter combat variant, plus the proposed CL-1200 Lancer. The included opponents promise a wealth of Zipper-centric mayhem. Scenarios includes every known historic F-104 encounter, struggling over Hainan Island during the Vietnam War, battling between the two Chinas across the Formosa Strait, or soaring against the backdrop of the Himalayas in the Indo-Pakistani Wars.

Learn to fight the Starfighter from Killjoy, teaching players to employ the aircraft’s unique “double-attack” fighting style. Explore the Starfighter’s achievements in the USAF’s Operation Feather Duster evaluations, and about the Starfighter’s infamous safety record, digging into the history, causes and myths.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: L.O.L. Surprise: Sleepover Surprise
description:
The L.O.L. Surprise! Sleepover Surprise game is an active party game where kids try to complete the most hilarious, wacky, and fun challenges to win. Players try to complete L.O.L. Surprise! themed challenges that'll have everyone dancing, laughing, and doing so much more, over 10 rounds. The player with the most points after 10 rounds wins.

—description from the publisher

name: 8-Cylinder Overlords
description:
8-Cylinder Overlords is a game of building, defending, and attacking roads in a post-collapse world. 2-4 players take on the roles of Overlords, human brains encased in heavily-armed and armored supercars that rule over auto-worshipping Pedestrians. There are only a few Overlords left and they are racing to build a Road to a Lost City of forgotten lore and restorative technology. The first player to complete a 20-30 space long Road and drive her Overlord to the end wins the game!

Each Player draws cards from the Road deck and lays down the cards in a line to form their Road. Simple Pavement cards extend the Road. Installation cards give you many more options: Farms allow you to create more workers. Refineries create the Fuel that you must pay to build each part of your Road and to compete in the Auction phase. Fortresses allow you to attack your rivals' Roads with withering Barrages or daring and potentially lucrative Raids. Once the Card is added to the Road, Players crew their installations by placing Peds in the spaces on each card. Players then go through the breeding, refining, and attacking phases and end their turn with the option of selling any cards they don't use.

During every phase of a Player's turn, the Overlord figure has a special ability that can be used to augment the action, such as drawing more cards, motivating installations to act again, directly attacking rival Roads, and more. But each Overlord Action costs fuel from the Overlord's reserve and Players must make good choices about when to use these additional abilities.
After each round of turns, Players move to Walkerville, a neutral territory where upgrades, special power cards, more workers, and various unique actions are sold in blind auctions. If two or more players compete for a single auction item and reach the maximum bid, the issue is decided by a frantic, high-stakes Drag Race. Auction wins can dramatically turn the tide of the game and Players are encouraged to bid aggressively.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Chaining, Constrained Bidding, Dice Rolling, Map Addition, Network and Route Building, Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement

name: Full Circle
description:
The end of the word is just the beginning

Using the letters laid out in the middle, spell a word along the rim of the disc! Build off of the letters the previous player used, so you score more and make them lose points! If the previous player spelled GAME, and you spell MEETING using their M and E, you cause them to lose two of their points, and you get seven (one for each letter)! If the next player spells GASP using your G, you lose one of your points and they get four…and so on! Use a little strategy when you spell, trying to make it difficult for the next player to steal more than one of your letters. As letters from the middle are used, replace them from the extra pile—so your letter choices are always changing! It’s a great game for all levels of spellers.

—description from the designer

name: Fire Emblem 0: War of Darkness Theme Deck
description: Most Starter Decks come with one booster pack, with Sets 1 and 2 bringing two booster packs and Sets 7 and 8 not providing any booster packs. Each Starter Deck contains 50 cards, with some exclusive cards that can't be found in a booster box.

name: Fire Emblem 0: Conquest Theme Deck
description: Most Starter Decks come with one booster pack, with Sets 1 and 2 bringing two booster packs and Sets 7 and 8 not providing any booster packs. Each Starter Deck contains 50 cards, with some exclusive cards that can't be found in a booster box.

name: Mythology Rummy: Pandora's Box
description:
Pandora's Box is the first in the Mythology Rummy series of strategic tabletop card games. Pandora’s Box starts with simple rules: draw, play, discard. Additional strategy elements add excitement, wrapped in a tapestry of characters and origin stories from Greek Mythology. Players make points from Myths, steal cards from other players, and ultimately win with the most points.

You do not need to know how to play Rummy or be a scholar in Greek Mythology to play this game. The fun is in the learning! To win, you must employ strategy, as well as luck.

Experience the whimsy of the gods, wield the Midas Touch, and exercise the power of Zeus. Play your cards right, and you will open the unpredictable Pandora’s Box.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Turn Order: Progressive
publishers: God of Games, Independent Publishing Company

name: Gravity Falls: Quest for the Ultimate Summer Adventure
description:
Gravity Falls: Quest for the Ultimate Summer Adventure is a fan-made adaptation of the Disney series Gravity Falls: The now-13 year-old Pines twins return to Gravity Falls with dreams of having another amazing summer adventure with their friends, but it's not starting out to be much of an adventure. Waddles has been banned from the bus system and had to stay behind in Piedmont, Stan and Ford are both off on their own adventures in parts unknown and Wendy got a new job outside of town! Tourism is way down and business is not good at the Mystery Shack so far either. Soos has been nice enough to let Dipper and Mabel stay in the Mystery Shack attic again as his guests, but what's the point? It starts to seem like the twins aren't going to re-live another 'amazing summer' after all... that is until Candy, Grenda, Pacifica, and Gideon pay a surprise visit to the twins. They tell the twins tales of new strange things going on in town and how the four of them have been out adventuring every day and are now on a quest to get to the bottom of all this new weirdness. For Mabel and Dipper, nothing sounds better than a Quest for the Ultimate Summer Adventure in Gravity Falls!

Players assume the role of one or more of the Gravity Falls characters: Dipper, Mabel, Candy, Grenda, Pacifica, or Gideon. Each character has unique abilities and each can be "leveled-up" to further expand their uniqueness. Players take turns moving their character(s) on the game board, which is a representation of the Gravity Falls townsite and surrounding area. On each board space a player may choose to stop and perform an action, such as visiting local shops to purchase equipment, supplies, or items to use as weapons, or they may "Search" their current location. Searching requires players to draw a card from the Search Deck, which contains random events, Foes, and item cards.

Encounters with enemies (Foes) requires that characters first make a "Fear Test", pitting their own "Weirdness" against their newly-encountered Foe. The game also employs a "Fear Tracker" which has increasing threat levels indicating how frightened the characters are at the moment. When the Fear level is low, creatures like a Gremgoblin or Giant Fruit Bat may not seem so scary at all. But, as the Fear level increases, it is possible that even encountering cute critters like Fairies, Beavers or a Snake-Badger (or is it a Snadger?) may be terrifying causing characters to initially flee before they are willing to re-consider engaging in battle.

Games may be played using a fully randomized game board and Search deck, or players may use the Quest book that is included with the rules to play through a story-driven series of increasingly difficult Quests to discover what is behind these strange goings-on in Gravity Falls. For each of these Quests that are completed the players may draw a single Treasure card, which is often a rare or unique item that they can keep or trade in to the Mystery Shack in exchange for in-game bonuses or perks.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: The WitchBorn: Daughters of Twilight
description:
Just Don’t Call Them Dark Elves!

Far beneath tortured Perdition lays a honeycomb of twisting turnnels and deep caverns. Venture from a dark and Hidden Realm to brave the blinding light of The WitchBorn ravaged world. These are the Daughters of Twilight.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Baladana
description:
Baladãna is a new and exciting strategy game for two players.
There are some obvious similarities with chess, however Baladãna is more abstract and even more complex and dynamic.
The biggest difference is that while in chess the way each playing piece can move is always the same, in Baladãna, the way figures can move is dynamic, determined by their 'powers'. The configuration of these powers, represented by the colored rings, is updated throughout the game - players can change the position of one ring as part of each move, placing up to 3 rings on any figure. When more rings of different colors are placed on a figure the powers combine.
The objective is to capture both of your opponent's golden rings.

—description from the designer

name: Branle-Bas De Combat
description:
Branle-Bas De Combat: Miniature Combat rules for naval warfare in the Age of Sails.
1/1200 scale
from 1765 to 1815

Each player controls 6-8 ships

Sequence of play:
1- Test - if needed
2- Movements
3- Fire
4- Contact between 2 ships

Rules in French

—user summary
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Book, Napoleonic, Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation

name: Animania: Adorkable Pack
description:
2020 Promo

“Just fights, no kills!” Delightful and funny, Animania sure would be the greatest pick for your party! In this boisterous competition, comes two charming animals — the Adorkable Shoebill and the Provoking Alpaca! Their high popularity makes them the target of hostility! The competition sure would be much more exciting than before!

This is an expansion pack of Animania and cannot be played without the game.

ï¼ï¼ï¼ï¼ï¼ï¼
