name: Starmada: 2020 Rules Annex
description:
The Starmada: 2020 Rules Annex is a supplement for the Universal Game of Starship Combat. It provides clarifications and revisions to the existing rules that collectively update the Unity Rulebook to version 2.0.

In addition, the book contains a number of new rules, including three alternative movement systems; over a dozen new starship systems and weapon traits; and the introduction of customized range bands, allowing players to more accurately simulate the weapons from their favorite sci-fi settings.

Finally, the Rules Annex includes thirteen additional scenarios and an updated Appendix Z that consolidates all of the tables and charts required for play.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Vehicular Arrangers
description:
Have you ever been watching soccer and thought man, this is boring! I wish these humans were vehicles. Like a tank, a train, a spaceship and even a boat.

Vehicular Arrangers does exactly that. Using the basic principles of soccer and some interesting physics, players try to score on the opposing player's goal, just like soccer.
If you ever wondered what would happen when a sailboat meets a tank on a soccer field, you’re in luck. Spoiler alert! The tank flatters the sailboat! Each vehicle has a special move that ensures even more mayhem on the field.

Vehicular Arrangers is a two-player card game that simulates vehicles playing soccer. The game is played by making simultaneous decisions on each turn. Those decisions direct players’ vehicles across a hex grid field. Some of these decisions will cause vehicles to spin out and crash; others will allow a vehicle to score a goal. A player wins when they score the most goals before the decks run out of cards. If tied, players reshuffle, sudden death starts, and the next goal wins.

The game is played in rounds. Players simultaneously assign cards to their vehicles behind a screen and once everyone is ready, they reveal them. Then they execute the actions of their cards in initiative order among all players. Vehicles will bump other vehicles, vehicles will dribble and kick the ball, and things will lob into the air over other and into other things.

There are 4 special cards in each player deck that embrace the special properties of each vehicle. Tanks crush other vehicles. Trains can drag objects behind them. Spaceships can teleport. Boats can pull objects to them.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Multiple Maps, Pattern Movement, Programmed Movement, Relative Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Sudden Death Ending, Team-Based Game, Three Dimensional Movement, Variable Set-up

name: Monopoly: City of Utica
description: City of Utica themed monopoly game.

name: Castle Dukes: Within The Walls
description:
The official expansion to Castle Dukes, this game focuses on minimizing luck and vastly pushing up the ability to control just about any resource. It also introduces villagers and their little homes, which will litter the fields within the sturdy walls of the castle. These folks are the key to giving you that extra edge over your rivals! Planting of greenery will also give you additional stuff, which allow better control over the dreaded Construction cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval

name: Anaconda: Expanded Points List
description:
In the decade plus since Anaconda was released, the proliferation of knowledge regarding naval aspects of the Civil War advanced at a rapid rate. Old assumptions have been challenged and ‘lost’ data has been deduced through diligent research and conservative conjecture. Some ships that were so shadowy in detail to border as myths have been documented and detailed and made worthy of hitting the game table. When coupled with the explosion in the availability of gaming models in both 1/600 and 1/1200, it is clear that Anaconda required an expanded points list.
Yes, the game includes the basic calculations that allow gamers to generate the point values, but hey – here at Blue Water Designs, we got your back!

This is an expansion of the point lists within Anaconda. You must have a copy of Anaconda to make use of this product.
categories: American Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: The Basketball Champion
description:
Basketball? A Board Game? A Basketball Board Game? YES, that’s what we created!

We transformed one of the best sports in the world into a fun and challenging board game. In this game, you’ll build your own basketball team with amazing characters. Play Special Cards to strengthen your team and weaken your opponents. Draft upcoming players and trade wisely. And then, get ready for the BIG TOURNAMENT and defeat your opponents to win the trophy! And don't worry, we created the game in a way that everyone can play, have fun and fall in love with it - You do not need to be a Basketball fan. But maybe you become one, after playing this game.

The Basketball Champion is a game where you focus on building your arena with players and arena cards that you can play either to strengthen your team or to weaken others. This will be helpful in defeating your opponents in tournament and win championship trophies. Person to win maximum championship trophies wins the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Humor, Sports
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Events, Hand Management, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Interrupts, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Score-and-Reset Game, Set Collection, Take That, Trading

name: Card Story: Journey
description:
It’s time to hit the road and start an adventure.
Choose your way and reveal the cards of destiny.
Travel to the Legendary City and get your magical reward at the end of your journey.

Rules are that simple:

Draw your mode of transport.
Decide, where to go.
Discover your adventure.
Get your reward.
Calculate your score!
Tell your story!


Almost 20 000 stories possible
54 unique cards

Gameplay example:

Natalia draws the Magic Carpet – no one has faster transport, so she starts. She decides to go into the woods.
She meets the Beast, and draws the next card. The Beast is asleep, so she can take it's treasure.
She draws another card – and is visiting the Magic Palace. She draws again – and Magical Unicorn appears.
As a prize Natalia gets Seven-league Boots.

Card Story is a unique "choose your own story" card game.
You can tell the stories again and again, each time creating different combinations.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Children's Game, Exploration, Humor
mechanics: Move Through Deck, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Storytelling

name: United Nations: a oneness-world-family game
description:
"When you have reached the point where you no longer expect a response, you will at last be able to give in such a way that the other is able to receive, and be grateful. When Love has matured and, through a dissolution of the self into light, become a radiance, then shall the Lover be liberated from dependence upon the Beloved, and the Beloved also be made perfect by being liberated from the Lover." â Dag Hammarskjöld (second UN Secretary-General, 1953-1961), Markings

United Nations: a world-oneness-family is cooperative game about love and service, a game with a voting, worker placement and crisis management, where players will take on the role of high UN officials and UN affiliated agencies in a quest for world peace and harmony. The goal of the game is to present historical events while at the same time giving the players an active role in avoiding crisis and promoting peace in all its manifestations.

At every moment the game's four natures of world tension, military, economic, social and diplomatic, is increasing. Every United Nations Secretary-General's mandate is interspersed with challenges such as the Cold War, Suez Canal, Ebola outbreaks and dictatorships. But great events also lighten and brighten the welkin of the world's hopes and promises - Gorbachev and the Fall of the Berlin Wall, smallpox is eradicated, UN-supervised elections install a president elected by the people.

Every mandate (round) players will inspire nations to vote and adopt resolutions in both the General Assembly and the Security Council. Each adopted resolution, in turn, will make available powers for UN agents and local governments to address their tensions of greater concern at the time. Tensions not addressed (by lack of time, manpower, resources or positive intention in the voting sessions) might erupt into crisis with the flow of the regional tension deck. A crisis will affect not only the originating region, but its neighbours as well.

Play continues for one round for each of the eight UNSG mandates. Players lose if 10 crisis happen but, as in life, the real goal of the game is to reach the highest possible score by working together for progress, and not just to avoid crisis. The UN stands for the high ideals and hopes of the world's people, so players have to strive to reach the UN agendas for the continuous progress of the world as a oneness-family. Players win if they do not lose for having ten crisis, establish at least seven of the eight possible UN regional offices. Then they score points for each resolution adopted, for each UN regional office they can establish, and lose points for every crisis that happens. On your next game, try to serve better and get a higher score!

"I feel that there shall come a time in the near future when the entire world will be inundated with peace and this world of ours will become a oneness-world-family-home." -Sri Chinmoy, Lifting up the world with a oneness-heart, Agni Press, 1988

—description from the designer
mechanics: Events, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Voting, Worker Placement

name: Turnover Chess
description:
Based on Othello’s turning pieces ability and moves based on Chess moves, with only three different pieces, an external and internal ring and a main button, arrangement turns it simple and complex at same time.

It is a game about take and turnover pieces between 2 players.
First player to perform checkmate at all enemy Castles wins the match. In other words, first player to take all opponent Castles, wins the match.

Pieces are double-sided in white and black. When player overlaps a piece that fits each other, it is not removed from the board; in other words, it is not a take, but rather, a turnover. In this case, pieces must be flipped to match color.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Square Grid, Static Capture, Tile Placement

name: Hide-and-seek game
description:
"In you
Alpha and Omega
Sleeplessly play
Hide-and-seek."
- Sri Chinmoy, Pope John Paul II: God’s Heart-Prize winner, Agni Press, 2002

Hide-and-seek is a thematic game where players who are hiding will then close their eyes, while the player who has "it" is searching.

Searching is done by calling out loud the number of "it"'s current position. Hiding players who happen to be next to it have to revel themselves as shown. Players who think that "it" might be far away can at anytime decide to come out and run.

Then a deck-building race to the safe spot ensues, with cards such as "leapfrog" (over an opponent) and "dash" (double move) and "climb" (double climbing this round. Some of the cards built into the deck and also be used while hiding, such as "distraction", "mommy is coming" and "loose barking dog". Players get points after each round, using them to get better cards for their deck.

It is meant for both children and adults, and plays very much like an actual hide-and-seek outdoor game, but indoors.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hidden Movement, Race, Real-Time, Semi-Cooperative Game, Track Movement

name: Dice Fortress
description:
Your liege! The strange shaking is magic! Our kingdom has been teleported and now we are face to face with other kingdoms...and their armies. We must CHARGE THEIR FORTRESSES, for your enemies will surely attack.

This battle may begin with 3 kingdoms (players) but recommended for 5+. The more the chaos! Ahem. The objective is to eliminate all others and emerge victorious by destroying other kingdoms’ defense points, hence destroying their Fortress.

This is achieved by rolling magic dice against players defensive points that have a 1-6 value on them. If Attacking Player dice matches that of Defending Player’s Defense Points then the attack was successful. If not, then it was unsuccessful. If a player’s defense points are destroyed, that player is out the game.


Adults can play this game with adult beverages. (Drinking Game) -> Much more “immersive”


—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Deduction, Dice, Fantasy, Medieval, Party Game, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Bribery, Die Icon Resolution, Finale Ending, Player Elimination, Sudden Death Ending, Traitor Game

name: Bar Brawl
description:
RULES
You're minding your own business but a fight breaks out, so you take cover, but the bar brawl grows and you get pulled in, evading some punches, but with little else to do, you fight back! Start by rolling one die for target number 1 (Take Cover), which is a 2 die roll target. If you hit the 2 put a 1 in the box, if you stop without hitting the 2 give yourself a -1 for each number off, so if you stayed with a 4, you would give yourself a -2 in the box. Do the same for the other sections respecting the ascending order of play and their target number. For every roll of 1 0r 6 tic the box accordingly and roll again, later subtracting or adding based on results. A 6 represents a great fight move, a 1 represents getting hit. You're given 6 rerolls due to your bar fighting experience, tic them off as you use them. In the end, calculate your total number. Will you come out unscathed? Or bruised with a broken limb? Or will you get knocked out? A negative result means you got knocked out, a zero means you barely made it, any positive number means you defended yourself well and did some damage, the higher the number the better!

—description from the designer

name: Godwrath
description:
In this game players start with a certain number of health points and a deck of cards. The goal is to reduce the health points of opponent players to zero by playing various cards that have different characteristics and effects. Players have the ability to create unique decks by combining the many variations that every card in the game comes with.

This game takes place in a world with 8 realities on a verge of another cataclysmic war.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Math, Wargame
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Moving Multiple Units, Player Elimination, Trading

name: Mein Panzer: WWII Secret Weapons Databook
description:
Within the pages of the World War II Secret Weapons Data Book you'll find stats for over 500 vehicles, over 600 aircraft, and nearly 60 missiles. Each entry represents a piece of equipment that was never made, at least not beyond a prototype. Drawing board tanks, secret weapons, and even a few fakes tossed in for fun.

Mein Panzer is a flexible and expandable 1:1 rule system for recreated 20th and 21st Century combined arms ground warfare from World War One up through the today. Designed for use with miniature scales from 1/285th up to 15mm, it is based around our innovative Drop-In game system. Players from novice to veteran will find it easy to customize the game to their own gaming style.

This supplement is designed to expand the World War II Data Book, although that publication is not required to make use of the stats herein. A copy of the Mein Panzer Core Rule System is needed to fully utilize the contents of this publication.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Nineveh: Tug-of-War
description:
Nineveh: Tug-of-War is a series of 6 card battles in which each player plays 3 cards each. The higher blue or red total wins!

Nineveh: Tug-of-War is based on true historical events. After the death of the Assyrian King Ashurbanipal in 631BC, a series of civil wars ensued between his sons, Prince Ashuretli and Prince Sinshar, in a struggle for control of the throne. As a top general representing a Prince, the chaos has created your path into power. In this battle of Tug of War, you must defeat your rival to end the civil war as your prince assumes the throne in Nineveh and rules the Assyrian Empire.

In this civil war, you will lead both Assyrian forces (red cards) and foreign forces (blue cards) in your attempt to gain control of the empire. Each player alternates playing offense and defense and can only defeat a city during an offensive attack to gain a victory point. On defense, you will defend 3 cities sympathetic to your cause, giving you an advantage by getting to pick either red or blue forces to defend with and by also adding reinforcements to bolster your defense. Lose these 3 cities and you lose the civil war.

The mixed loyalties in this civil war have caused great mistrust between your Assyrian forces (red cards) and your foreign forces (blue cards), causing you to form 2 different armies. Your Assyrian force has little will to fight rival Assyrian forces. Your foreign forces also have little will to fight rival foreign forces. So, when you decide to defend a city with either red or blue cards, your opponent must attack with the opposite colored force.

Do you have the military expertise necessary to defeat your opponent? Are you savvy enough to trap your opponent into wasting resources and to capitalize on their mistakes, or will you be defeated in this civil war?

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Educational, Math, Print & Play
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Memory, Move Through Deck, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Trick-taking, Tug of War

name: Expansionist
description:
Expansionist is a board game of land and event tiles set in a fictitious medieval world. As the leader of your people you head the push across the mountains to newly discovered, uninhabited, fertile lands. Once there you must lay down your claim and build your settlements. But other communities are flooding through and you must race to secure the best chance for your people. If you become the most advanced and therefore the most settled, then you win the game!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Events, Hexagon Grid, Pieces as Map, Tile Placement

name: City of Glass
description:
In this fast-paced worker placement and resource management game, you'll play as one of the best craftsman in the Kingdom contending for the Noble position of "Royal Jeweler".

You will need to be smart, fast & tactical if you want to beat the competition!


Send your workers to bid on chosen custom jewelry contracts.
Collect raw materials (Gems, Ore, Pearls) to use when making jewelry so you can fulfill your chosen contracts. Fulfilling a contract will gain you experience.
Use your experience to attract and befriend Noble's who want to use you for heirloom pieces and who will spread the word about you to their friends, which will earn you the much coveted "Fame".
Build up enough "Fame" to take home the prize and become the "Royal Jeweler"!



Game Setup#
Each player choose a color and collect the 3 worker meeples of that color, then take a work station card and place it in front of them.
Place the raw material card within reach of all players. Place all gems in their spots.
Shuffle the Noble cards and place a number equal to 1 plus the number of players to form the top row of the "board".
Shuffle the Contract cards, cut the deck in half and flip one side, then shuffle again and deal out 3 contracts face up in rows below each Noble to complete the "board".
Begin (Use your chosen method for deciding who takes the first turn).


Steps of each turn
Place/Move Workers - to bid on contracts. In this step you will send each of you available workers to bid on a specific contract. If you have no available workers, you may move 1 worker from an uncontested contract and reassign it to any other contract. (Uncontested means that your worker is the only worker bidding on that contract. If another player has placed a worker on any contract that your worker is bidding on, it becomes "contested" and neither worker can move until one of the players fulfills the contract)

Gather Raw Materials - Roll the 3 dice and either collect those 3 raw materials, or sacrifice one of the 3 dice and re-roll the remaining 2 dice. Then either collect those 2 raw materials or sacrifice 1 dice and re-roll the remaining 1 dice and collect the raw material from the result. (This indicates you going deeper into the bazaar in search of the perfect gemstone, but often you won't find it and you will never get the best deal)
Place all raw materials onto your work station in the appropriate space

The Main Step - During the Main step of your turn you will choose from 1 of 4 potential actions. (Limited to a single action per turn)


Complete a contract - If you have the required raw materials on your work station, you may choose to complete one of the contracts that your worker has bid on. Once you complete a contract, you will take it and place it under the lower part of your workstation so that only the "Experience" section remains showing (See Action Shot). Then return any workers that were bidding on the contract back to their owners and replace the contract by dealing one from the "Contract" deck.
Befriend a Noble - If you have collected enough "Experience" to befriend a Noble, you may do so. Do so by taking the Noble that you want to befriend and placing it beneath the top portion of your work station so that only the gold star "Fame" symbol is showing (See Action Shot). Then replace that Noble with one from the top of the "Nobles" deck. If the Noble you befriend adds enough "Fame" for you to win the game, you win as soon as you befriend him/her and the game ends. (Shuffle up and play again)
Bribe a Noble - For the low cost of twice the "Fame" rating of a Noble (Payable using any gems or gold from your stockpile), you can bribe them to leave the board and be replaced with the top Noble from the deck. This tactic comes in very handy if, for instance, you see that your opponent is going to win or close to being able to befriend a Noble that may turn the game to their advantage. Also good to help clear Nobles that aren't a good fit for the current "board".
Pass - Occasionally there is nothing that you can do with your current worker placement or workstation stockpile. When that happens, you can simply pass and end your turn.


Winning the game
Solo Mode - Playing this game solo is a race against the clock! You will play "Easy, Normal or Hard mode" by trying to reach 3,4 or 5 stars of "Fame" faster than the creator's best score AND before the 12 turn clock ends and you lose the game outright! Keep track of your personal best scores using the space allotted in the back of the rule book.

Normal Mode (2-6 Players) - When playing with other people, the goal is to become the most famous jeweler before they do. The objective will be to reach a level of "Fame" equal to 1 plus the number of players. **EX.**3 players is 1+3=4 stars of "Fame" to win. The first person to reach the "Fame" amount required wins immediately after befriending the Noble whose "Fame" rating puts them over the top!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Bribery, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Worker Placement

name: Ferrum et Gloria: Regole per Scontri tra Gladiatori â Basate sul motore di Song of Blades
description:
Ferrum et Gloria is fast play rule for gladiator combat.
Players can play a single gladiator or a gladiators school.
It includes a mini-campaign and rules cover calling to the crowd, effects of fatigue, wounds, many types of attacks...

Ferrum et Gloria è un veloce regolamento per scontri tra gladiatori. Ogni figura rappresenta un combattente con uno specifico repertorio di mosse a seconda del suo addestramento e armamento. Le regole sono basate sulle più recenti ricerche storiche.

Ogni giocatore controlla un singolo gladiatore o un’intera scuola di gladiatori. Un sistema di dadi colorati registra le ferite di ogni combattente.

Ferrum et Gloria contiene regole per:
12 classi gladiatorie;
Scontro tra scuole (mini-campagna);
Tecniche di scherma, opposizione e lotta;
Appello alla folla;
Vari tipi di risultati di combattimento, che consentono di sbilanciare, ferire, disarmare, allontanare o intrappolare in reti;
Simulazione della stanchezza e dell'effetto delle ferite;
Diverse velocità di movimento basate su armamento e stanchezza;
Duelli o combattimenti tra più avversari.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Vossa ExcelÃªncia: ExpansÃ£o Nova Era
description:
The world is no longer the same, Your Excellency. Gone are the days when only money and the use of the public machine guaranteed re-election. With social media becoming popular, the old politics and power owners are being threatened by a bunch of kids and outsiders. The competition has become much tougher, more unpredictable, and any slip will be forever registered on the network. Get ready for an entirely different political game. Are you afraid, noble colleague? It's the New Age!

"Nova Era" brings the game "Your Excellency" to the Digital Age. The New Era of information is here! This expansion adds the Internet to the political game.

Adds 60 new cards:


6 new Politician cards
6 new Party cards (5 of them "ideological" parties)
12 parliamentary cards
1 rules booklet
6 new Electorate cards
3 new Event cards
21 new Internet cards
24 "Like" tokens
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Simulation, Take That

name: Domhan Rhapsodie
description:
To win, you must use a deck of 50 cards and play them strategically to win the 5 crystal shards of the opponent, one for each direct attack, once per turn.

As Guardian of the Veil, your mission is to obliterate your opponent with the help of warriors that come from all the Worlds that coexist on both sides of the Veil ... Do you have what it takes to conquer your enemies? This is Domhan Rhapsodie!

(Text by publisher)
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Science Fiction

name: The Depressing Game
description:
The Depressing Game is a social deduction game, where players take on the role of high school students who have to deal with depression on a daily basis

This game was designed by the students of Nanakuli High School, located on the west coast of O'ahu, Hawaii.

While understanding the serious of the topic, this card game is light and humorous, and uses satire to explore the sensitive subject.

Gameplay summary:

You are high school students interacting on campus. The happy players are attempting to find out who is the depressed player and bring them around to the realm of sunshine. The depressed player is attempting to infect the other players with a contagion of woe.

A the beginning of the game platers are dealt a hidden role.


If you are secretly playing a Happy Role (weirdo) the last round must be won by a Happy Card.
If you are secretly playing the Depressed Role (I feel for you) the last round must be won by a Depressing Card DR the last round ends in a tie.


On a turn:

Each player selects 1 card from their hand and places it face down ... (thinking about rainbows)
All players then say "HAPPY!" and reveal their cards simultaneously.
A player wins the round and furthers their secret agenda by having the highest numeric value of all cards played. Tied numbers cancel each other out.


The player who plays the highest number wins the round. All tied numbers cancel out and count as zero.

The winner of the round selects 1 action (A or B)

a)Take a card from the Tableau of Emotions (cards in the center of the table). Now take a card from your hand and place that card face up in the Tableau of Emotions.

b)Take a card from the Tableau of Emotions(cards in the center of the table). Now take a random card from another player's hand and place that card face up in the Tableau of Emotions.

The winner will gather all the cards just played. place them together face-down in a "Discard pile" and place that pile aside. Place all played cards in the Discard pile from now on. No players may look at the discarded cards during the game.

Continue playing cards round after round until each player is down to their last card. This is the round that counts for the game.

All players play their last card face down. Before flipping over their last card, all players reveal their Hidden Role.

Players flip over their last cards following the same rules. Except the winning card's type (Happy or Depressed) determines the winner.

—description from the designer

name: Longships: The Wrath of the Vikings â Raids and Battles in the Ninth Century
description:
These rules use a lot of new mechanisms. Each player has about 6 units, In a fight a unit would typically shieldwall, issue challenges, advance to contact whilst sending in line breakers. The fight might break the shield walls kill the men etc...

This is a historical set, which requires the player to play historically rather than giving the players what they like and then writing rules around that.

—description from the publisher

name: Burglar
description:
Burglar is a whole new twist on family board games.

It's a game involving skill, chance, memory and tactics as you hunt for loot and get the chance to block opponents from reaching their own target items or escaping undetected.

The game board and tiles have the simple elegance of 1920s sophistication and it's one of those games that's simple to learn but different every time you play.

It's a family friendly game that lasts around 30 minutes which gets more devious every time as you learn tactics to frustrate opponents and use your best negotiating skills to gang up on players.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Memory, Physical Removal, Resource to Move, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Take That, Variable Set-up

name: Carrot Bunny Den
description:
Carrot Bunny Den is a competitive little card game to share among friends (ages 18+). It is played by 3 to 10 players and games last about 15 minutes. It is very quick to learn and triggers good bursts of laughter. The graphical direction may surprise you but it's just like the gameplay, it looks cute but it's hard!

In Carrot Bunny Den, nature goes crazy and it's up to us to fix it. Each player starts with 3 cards representing combinations of the words "carrot", "rabbit" and " den" and a decadent vision of our poor nature. During the game, the players exchange words by pointing at each other and saying one of these three words. But beware, each word has an associated rule! One must not make mistakes when speaking and remain attentive to the words spoken. Indeed, when a spoken combination corresponds to one of your cards, you can put it down!

It's a game of memory and quick decision making. Players must choose the words they say skillfully and quickly, according to their hand. They choose who they give the floor to based on what they understand of other people's play. They have to adapt constantly to hope to put down every card. The first player to put down all his hand wins the round and the game is played in three winning rounds. Nature needs you! Ready for the challenge?

—description from the designer
categories: Mature / Adult, Memory, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Push Your Luck, Score-and-Reset Game, Turn Order: Random

name: Cosmology
description:
Your time has come.

You are a celestial being of nearly unlimited power and obsession and, after eons of waiting, you have finally been called to purpose. A universal eruption has occurred, sending cosmic matter barreling across the void and giving you the chance to create beautiful order from raging chaos.

When finished, you will have formed a new galaxy, built according to your own flawless design. But you are not alone. Others have also heard this call of the cosmos and arrived to claim the event for their own destinies.

As the universe watches, you must gather interstellar material to craft and shape the perfect galaxy - one composed of star systems that not only satisfy your own ethereal compulsions, but will attract the primordial forces necessary to cultivate life for millennia to come.

When the stardust settles, only one creation will be worthy of remembrance - will it be yours?

In Cosmology, you and other players compete to draw and place tiles of planetoids, moons, and comets in your own empty voids to create a galaxy of significance, igniting suns to build star systems of color patterns that will attract primordial forces. But you must also fulfill your own private compulsion objectives, which may influence (and limit) your building potential.

—description from the publisher

name: Crypto Tycoon Card Game
description:
The world's first crypto-themed card game that offers players an exciting volatile ride that gets solved in under 15 minutes.

With exciting strategic gameplay, even when you think you're about to win or lose, your or another player can turn the game around out of nothing.

Stunning illustrations and a fresh new game concept make Crypto Tycoon a family-friendly card game that's easy to play but challenging to win.

—description from the publisher

name: Venture
description: In Venture, you take control of one of six companies, and you play against other players in a financial race to be the first one to expand. But watch out! The stock market is going up and down all the time. Manage and invest your income wisely turn by turn and take the number one spot as Leading company!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Educational, Industry / Manufacturing, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Die Icon Resolution, Events, Income, Investment, Modular Board

name: Command Decision: Test of Battle â Operation Market Garden
description:
An overview history of the Market Garden campaign, from inception to completion, following each airborne division: the 101st around Eindhoven, the 82nd around Nijmegen, and the British 1st Airborne around Arnhem.

10 historical battles presented as game battles -covering the entire operation, from the initial breakout by XXX Corps (September 17th, 1944) to the bitter end, after the British toehold at Arnhem Bridge had been eliminated, and the operation had been stalled on the Island.

After the Normandy landings, over 25 major airborne operations were planned by the Allied high command and cancelled for one reason or another. Finally, on September 10th, 1944, Field Marshall Montgomery met with Dwight Eisenhower at Melsbroek airfield outside of Brussels. At this meeting, Montgomery won approval for an ambitious plan to allow the Allies to drive from Belgium through Holland and then cross the Rhine River into Germany - an operation that called for three airborne divisions to be landed in stages over three days miles behind enemy lines - code name: Market Garden.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Potion School
description:
You are a student at a magical school with a penchant for potions. Use your skills to earn the best grade possible by the end of the semester, or sabotage your classmates so they can't get ahead of you...

The goal of the game is to have as many points as you can get by the end of the game; each potion has a point value. Some dark market cards also grant points. Extra copies of potions do not grant points - so make sure you have a variety of potions in your hand at the end! Every 10 gold coins you own at the end also count as 1 point towards your final score.

If the “Curse” card is revealed from the dark market, you must follow it’s instructions, regardless of any choice you would otherwise make.

—description from the designer

name: Buy Sell Swindle
description:
Property speculation is big business in New Victoria - but do you have what it takes to dominate the market and snap up the coveted Emerald Estate?

Buy Sell Swindle is a compelling real estate game where sharks and slimeballs rule. Where you act first and ask for council approval later.

Watch as prices reach dizzying heights and devastating lows in this unpredictable market, where savvy and strategic investors can capitalise on government elections, criminal activity or even celebrity visits.

Bring your cold hard cash and leave your scruples at the door!

—description from the designer

name: Jacobite 1: History, Background Colour & Three Scenarios for Miniatures â A Volley, Bayonet & Glory Supplement
description:
This first volume details the history and background colour of the ’45. Included is a section on gaming the ’45 using Volley & Bayonet as well as the Government and Jacobite armies in an historical context.

There are then three historical scenarios including maps and orders of battle.
First up is Prestonpans, followed by Falkirk and finally Culloden.
Because of the size of these battles these scenarios are provided at a reduced figure scale.

—description from designer
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Jacobite 2: Campaigns, Scenarios, & Information for Miniatures â A Volley, Bayonet & Glory Supplement
description:
The second volume continues the the revolt with no less than eight Volley & Bayonet scenarios.
Starting with the small historical battles at Clifton and Inverurie and followed by six hypothetical battles including: * Corieyairack Pass;

Hexham;
Stone;
Finchley Common;
Second Battle of Killiecrankie Pass &
Fochabers.


Finally the campaign rules for the ’45 are defined as well as two campaign maps allowing the entire rebellion to be refought.
Because of the size of these battles these scenarios are provided at a reduced figure scale.

- Description from Designer
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Madagascar: Battle For The Fruits!
description:
Madagascar is a simple strategy and battle game for two players starting in the print and play world, each player controls a group of lemurs (Black or White) in the game board and do the best strategy to dominate the jungle, they must reach the enemy checkpoints to get fruits and achieve the target number to win the game and turn you into the dominant subspecies.

—description from the publisher

name: Damn Joker!
description:
Damn Joker! is a drawing game that uses a common deck, paper and pen. The objective of the game is to score suits in certain combinations to earn victory points.

—description from the designer

Damn Joker! é um jogo de desenhar que utiliza um baralho comum, papel e caneta. O objetivo do jogo é marcar naipes em determinadas combinações para ganhar pontos de vitória.

—description from the designer (Portuguese)

name: Crystal Crusade
description:
Crystal Crusade is a turn-based strategy game where players take control of one of five distinct fantasy nations. Players will mine crystals and use those crystals to; purchase new workers, build additional buildings in the surrounding zones, and promote workers into military units that will be used for combat. The map in Crystal Crusade is a 11x11 squared tiled board and is filled with Crystal Mines, Watch Towers, Treasure Chests, and Neutral Creatures. Players will work to control key areas of the map to gather victory points and deny the opponent resources.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Income, Moving Multiple Units, Square Grid, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Go Play In Traffic
description:
Bike messengers have been part of the urban landscape since the 1890s. Overworked and underpaid, dodging cars, buses, and whatever else the street throws at you, it's a job that tests your nerves as much as your physical skills.

Go Play in Traffic puts you in the saddle of a rookie bike messenger on your first day on the job. You'll need to avoid moving obstacles, route yourself through the streets, and know how to keep your cool under pressure.

Based on more than 20 years of experience as a bike messenger and a lifetime of a game player, Go Play in Traffic is a fast paced game for 2 - 4 players.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Events, Income, Modular Board, Movement Points, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Set-up

name: Michel Vaillant auf schneller Piste
description:
Compeletely different gameplay from Les 12000 tours minute: Michel Vaillant.
Each player has 4 cars and 20 acceleration chips. On your turn, roll the die and advance one of your cars on the racing course. You can invest one (2) of your chips to double (triple) the result. But beware: Orange spaces only allow to double the result, red spaces forbid to change the die at all. According to the order crossing the finish line, players get points. Winner is the player who got the most points with all his 4 cars. In a variant, 2 cars on the same space block all other cars behind them.

Michel Vaillant : à fond sur la piste !
2 à 4 joueurs
Gameplay complètement différent du jeu Les 12000 tours minute : Michel Vaillant.
Chaque joueur a 4 Voitures et 20 Jetons d'Accélération.
À votre Tour, lancez le Dé et avancez 1 de vos Voitures sur le parcours.
Vous pouvez investir 1 (ou 2) de vos Jetons pour Doubler (ou Tripler) le résultat. Mais attention : les Cases Oranges ne permettent que de Doubler le résultat, les Cases Rouges interdisent carrément de modifier le Dé. Les joueurs obtiennent des Points selon l'ordre franchissant la Ligne d'Arrivée. Le gagnant est le joueur qui a obtenu le plus de Points avec ses 4 Voitures.
En variante, 2 Voitures sur la même Case bloquent toutes les autres Voitures derrière elles.

name: North Korea Is Best Korea
description:
North Korea is Best Korea is a medium-weight strategy eurogame in which players portray prominent Generals in the Great Leader's regime.

During the game, players will be improving the country's logistical, industrial, propaganda and defense infrastructure, as well as undertaking special and secret projects and dealing with unexpected events and the actions of the Imperialists enemy. All those actions will earn the player the Great Leader's favor, which having the most of, is by itself the game's sole victory condition. But the Great Leader's favor can also be spent to obtain resources, so the players must carefully measure when and how much to bank on that political capital.

The game board depicts North Korea and is divided by geographical regions, One distinctive mechanism of the game is the elaborate use of shared resources within the country, meaning that, in a turn, a player must activate a whole region, paying the activation cost of all buildings there, regardless of which player they belong to. The player may also use the power and railway networks, built by any player, to pay those costs, and that would result in them gaining the favor of the Great Leader.
The international aspect is also an involved semi-cooperative system of several intertwined elements, ranging from smuggling arms and workers to other rogue countries, buildings defenses against Imperialist's air attacks, up to the dreaded nuclear project. This military aspect is equally important as the economic one, since it often carries punishing results and a number of losing conditions.

With its abstracted mechanisms and the graphical use of the actual idealistic aesthetic of the North Korean regime's propaganda, the game manages to remain suitable for younger audiences. Adults, nonetheless, will recognize in the bizarre cartoony card images the sharp contrast with the known realities of the country.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Network and Route Building, Semi-Cooperative Game, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Chronicles of Marlis
description:
Welcome to the Chronicles of Marlis. In this first chapter, the game takes place in Marlis, an unknown world where three kingdoms fight to permeate their dreams and ideologies. In the Chronicles of Marlis, you choose one of three distinct countries: The Kingdom of Korin, The Debran Empire or The Dominion of Aturas. Utilizing the power and wisdom of these three cultures, create your own strategies to defeat your opponent.

Utilizing a 40 card pre-built or constructed deck, unleash the fury of your favorite country over your enemy until you destroy his or her command center. You will achieve your objective with the help of powerful creatures, enigmas, relics, effects, and buildings. In addition, you will have the support of tribes inhabiting the world of Marlis, reinforcing your armies in order to achieve victory.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Command Cards, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Alliances 1914
description:
It's July 1914 and the great European powers are divided into two alliances. Which one will come to dominate Europe?

In this game, the players are divided into two teams (Russians, French, British vs Germans, Austro-Hungarians, Ottomans). For your team to be victorious, you need to keep a tactical advantage while keeping your economy afloat.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Champions of Kreya
description:
Champions of Kreya is a fantasy card game featuring deep strategy and endless replayability. Two players fight against each other using a squad of champions to become the rulers of Zarakzar.

In the beginning of the game, each player picks three champions for their squad. The base game features 10 unique champions, each with their own playstyle, strengths and weaknesses which change the way you play your squad.

Your deck will dynamically build based on your picked champions providing a unique game experience every time the game is played. A fixed set of skills for each champion takes a way the process of having to build a deck and allows anyone to get into the game quick.

Champions of Kreya features quick and dynamic games for in between while still requiring strategy to win the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck Construction, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Take That

name: Gettysburg Soldiers: American Civil War Miniature Rules
description:
Gettysburg Soldiers gaming rulebook for the ACW
Designed to recreate historical battles or create new ones.
The game has special provisions to simulate the element of surprise, the ebb and flow of momentum, and the fog of battle.

Basing is flexible and compatible with most other rulesets.

The Gettysburg Soldiers rules use Infantry Regiments, Cavalry Regiments and Artillery Batteries as the basic units of battle. Each player in a game assumes the role of a General or commander, and directs the actions of the various troops on the tabletop battlefield. Players will decide when and were to maneuver their troops to aggressively take the battle to the enemy and when to react defensively if troops under their command retreat or rout. Victory or defeat is determined by winning the objectives of a game scenario, inflicting more causalities, and controlling portions of the battlefield.

Scales:
figures: 10mm-15mm-25mm
1 mini = 50 men
1 cannon model = 1 arty battery
1" = 25 yd
categories: American Civil War, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Re-Chord: The Rolling Bones Promo Card
description:
Promo originally available through 2019 Promo Paradise Kickstarter.

During set up, shuffle this promo into the Song Card Deck.

Flavor Text: The Rolling Bones: You can't always hit what you want.

Card Text: Chords E-D-A

Value: 14 Fame

Automa: Wylde/Discard 1 Chord Card/Red

name: The Battle of Crotona, 204 BC
description:
SPQR Battle scenario in C3i #24 (2010)

The battle of Crotona: The End of the Second Punic War in Italy, 204 BC

name: Archer & Prophet Roles: The Armoury Bible Game
description:
This expansion features 2 new player roles, the Archer and Prophet allowing The Armoury Bible Game to become a 4 player game (excluding the Game Master).

Combining this expansion with The Armoury Bible Game would allow for a 5 player experience (Including the Game Master).

The Archer & Prophet expansion also includes a larger box to hold your old cards along side the new cards. Such cards include:


Archer role and armour cards
Prophet role and armour cards
Attack, defence and utility cards to expand your current game for the Archer and Prophet
More Boss cards to accommodate the Archer and Prophet
Health Point cards for the Archer and Prophet
Player turn cards - these cards explain what players must do each turn and what roles go first
20 Quest cards - these are tasks that players much achieve after they play The Armoury Bible Game. Game Masters can use them to encourage players to continue their Bible learning for in-game rewards.


—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Memory, Religious
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Memory, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Trading

name: Monopoly: Scouts
description:
World Organization of the Scouting Movement themed version of Monopoly.

Two much-loved brands have joined together to create Scout Monopoly. Featuring some of our most iconic Scout locations from Gilwell Park to Kandersteg International Scout Centre.

You’ll start at the beginning (the first property is Brownsea Island, of course) before heading onto Humshaugh the site of the first official Scout camp. Then it’s onto London’s Olympia where the First World Scout Jamboree took place, before a whistle stop tour of our Scout Adventure Centres. The stations are now our nation headquarters. The utilities are Scout Store and Unity Insurance Services. Houses and hotels are now called tents and marquees and Community Chest and Chance are now ‘"Skills for Life" and "Be Prepared…" It’s the same, but different!

The aim of the game is still to collect colour groups and collecting rent from other players. You’ll want to avoid landing on "camp fees" and "termly fees" and picking up cards that say things like "Your minibus has failed its MOT. Pay M50…"
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement, Trading

name: The Oil Must Flow
description:
In a not so distant future, Earth's Oil reserves run out. Using inferior energy sources, humanity takes to the stars in search of something comparable to the black gold. After some time, planet EX-/Z96 is found, and the long range scanners indicate that it contains tremendous reserves of Oil. The search is over, and the scramble begins - the Oil must flow.

The Oil Must Flow is a re-implementation of Heiko Günther's award-winning Dune: The Dice Game. Set in the Peak Oil universe, The Oil Must Flow builds on its forefather's mechanics, streamlining them and offering new gameplay options.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Dice, Fighting, Negotiation, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Alliances, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Negotiation, Variable Player Powers

name: Canvas Falcons
description:
Canvas Falcons

Triplane: Air to Air Combat in World War One 1914-1918
Legion Condor: Air to Air Combat in Spain and China 1936-1939

This game is designed to be a good simulation of air to air combat; however it is also a role playing game of sorts. Each player controls a single aircraft. The aircraft are "flown" using 3 wheeled trolleys or stands to emulate the real flight characteristics of the airplane. The purpose of this game is to simulate air to air combat from the pilot's viewpoint. This game is designed so that the player merely 'flies' the combat aircraft. There are no rules mandating stupidity, bad play, or bad flying, that is left up to the talents of the gamer.

Scale:
Time Scale: One turn = 5 seconds
Ground Scale: 25mm = 5 meters or 1:200
one Movement point is thus per hour 14.4 KM/H or 8.9 MPH

Played since ~1974 but not published until much later.

- Description (extract) from the introduction
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Impulse Movement, Measurement Movement, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Three Dimensional Movement

name: The Haunting of Indigo House
description:
For nearly a century, the ominous shadow of Bleak Lily has clouded the public’s opinions of Indigo House, turning it into a paranormal hotspot frequented by all manner of supernatural enthusiasts. A local ghost story rooted in bits of truth, the tale of Bleak Lily is actually the tragic story of Lily Abernethy, one of the estate’s original owners who took to haunting the house after a suspicious and untimely demise. In the years after Lily’s passing, numerous people have died on the grounds of Indigo House, and although there is never anything to prove that the ghost of Lily Abernethy is to blame, people still whisper that the bloodshed is her handiwork. The Van Burens bought Indigo House from the Abernethy family around the turn of the 20th century and have done their best to shake off the curse of Bleak Lily. However, the rumors started up again when the matriarch of the family, Hilda Van Buren, was found dead in her bed. Was Mrs. Van Buren’s death from natural causes? Did Bleak Lily claim another casualty? Or is there something else sinister at work?

Difficulty Level: 7.5/10

name: Standover: More for Me
description:
Standover is a card game for 2 to 6 players with a bidding (vying ) mechanism.

You are the leader of a criminal gang. You compete to control busineses that you draw income from. But the bids you make are paid to your competitors, so the dynamic tension is in how much you are prepared to pay to control something, knowing that you are actually paying off your enemies for it. At your disposal are hitmen, femme fatales and soldiers. And the ultimate prize: to be the Don and skim everyone else's score.

An easy entry multi-player game that involves bidding, but not gambling.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Economic, Mafia, Print & Play
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Closed Economy Auction, Income, Investment, Ownership, Turn Order: Auction
